title: Article 2  No Title
Nixon Back in White House
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) President Nixon returned to Othe White House today after spending the Memorial Day weekend at Camp David near Thurmont, Md. He made the trip by helicopter.

title: Market Place:
description: The trend of the nineteen seventies has been the sub ject of a great deal of specu lationbut not in the market sense. That kind of long look ahead should be tempered and thoughtfulnot the sort of thing that leads to hot tips.

title: Winds Fail at Cow Bay
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 31  Only three classes beat the 7 o'clock deadline to day in the windup of the holi day threerace competition of the Cow Bay area, Yacht Rac ing Association of Long Island Sound.

title: 6 Negro Wacs Fight Ouster in a Dispute At Fort Meade, Md.
description: Six Negro Wacs assigned to Fort Meade, Md., will fight any effort to have them dis charged following a racial conflict at the big Army base on May 17, their lawyer said last night.

title: PETER MOSELE, LED STEEL WORKERS UNIT
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., May 31 Peter Mosele, who retired in 1953 as director of what was then the United Steel Workers' DiStrict 2, embracing New York City and northern New Jersey, died yesterday at his home here, He was 86 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: College Honors Hatcher
description: WEST POINT, Miss., May 31 (AP)The predominantly black Mary Holmes College has awarded an honorary Doctor of Humane Letters degree to Richard G. Hatcher, black Mayor of Gary, Ind. The degree was awarded yesterday for Mr. Hatcher's long service to the cause of the Negro and his fight for racial justice and for special service to the college.

title: Nicklaus's 72 Is Target For National Golf Day
description: ST. LOUIS, May 31 (AP) Jack Nicklaus shot a 36, 3672 and Donna Caponi 34, 3973 to set men's and women's National Golf Day standards today at Marson Country Club.

title: Mitsubishi Name Change
description: The Mitsubishi Corporation becomes today the formal name of Japan's widely diversified Mitsubishi Shoji Kaisha, Ltd., which has been known also as the Mitsubishi Trading Com pany, Ltd.

title: Federal Role in Arts: Possibilities and Problems
description: When President Nixon last week set his Administration's new policy to find fresh ways in which Government depart ments and agencies could assist and be assisted by the arts and artists, he did not spell out the numerous pos sibilities in such an approach. Nor did he suggest some of the problems.

title: Israelis See a Revived Role for Russians
description: JERUSALEM, May 31  Is raeli diplomats concluded to day that the Soviet Union had won its way back into the diplomatic maneuvering be tween Israel and the Arab states after nearly a year dur ing which it appeared to have been relegated to a backseat role.

title: U.S. Shifts 5 Said to Be Accused by Taipei of Aiding Dissidents
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 31  The United States has trans ferred four or more military men and a junior officer of the Central Intelligence Agency from Taiwan in the last month, reportedly after Chinese Na tionalist officials accused them of assisting native Taiwanese in plotting antiGovernment activ ities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Los Angeles, Now the In Art Scene
description: LOS ANGELESSo far as the American art scene is concerned, Los Angeles is now more or less established as the country's most impor tant second city. San Fran cisco may be a pleasanter place to live, Chicago may have a better museum, and Cambridge, Mass., may boast more stringent critical minds, but Los Angeles is where the artists areespecially young artists.

title: Advertising:
description: With the Congress and the people showing increasing interest in national health in surance, the American Medi cal Association is about to mount an advertising cam paign to win a few hearts and minds.

title: Harlem Brass Ensemble Plays at King Memorial
description: The New Breed Brass En semble showed up at the Central Park Mall yesterday afternoon to play the third annual Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Concert, and so did the rain. But when Karl Hampton Porter, the con ductor, tried to cancel the concert, a crowd of several hundred people, many of them huddled under umbrel las, would not hear of it. So, for an hour and a half, the brass group, drawn from the Harlem Philharmonic, per formed for the hardy audi ence, sometimes with Mr. Porter himself sheltered un der an umbrella.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Economic Analysis
description: Two blows in rapid suc cession were dealt yester day to the hopes of the Nixon Administration for slowing the pace of inflation, at least in the primarymetals industries.

title: Ukraine Planning Six Science Centers
description: MOSCOW, May 31The So viet Union has been pressing forward with a sweeping reor ganization of its network of scientific institutions in an at tempt to focus basic research more effectively on regional needs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MISS RUDD RIDES 2 CLASS WINNERS
description: DEVON, Pa., May 31Terry Rudd, a striking blonde from Gwynedd Valley, Pa., rode the winners of two classes today at the Devon horse show, but her performance was hardly a surprise to the spectators.

title: Queen's Request for More Funds Stirs Controversy in Britain
description: LONDON, May 31For the first time in years, the royal family is involved in popular controversy. The reason is moneythe recent request made by Queen Elizabeth II to Parliament for an increase in her annual grant of $1,140,000.

title: Poverty in Uniform
description: The Senate has opted for a $1billion military pay rise that goes farbut not far enoughto eliminate the national disgrace of armed services in which, as one Army financial officer has put it, poverty ... is a way of life.

title: FOUR MILERS BEAT 4 MINUTES IN RACE
description: LEICESTER, England, May 31 (UPI)Walter Wilkinson led three other runners through the fourminute barrier today when he recorded the world's third fastest time of the season in winning the mile at the Inter County Track and Field Cham pionships.

title: Student Matinees Planned
description: Two special matinees for students only will be given on June 9 and 12 by Eugene O'Neill's drama, Long Day's Journey Into night, at the Promenade Theater, Broadway and 76th Street. Performances will start at 1 P.M. The com pany will be headed by John Beal, Carol Teitel, Donald Gan try and Dan Hamilton.

title: Apparel Buyers Cutting Orders
description: Hal W. Leonhardt did not seem to think it was a para dox. The tall, strapping presi dent of the GanoDowns stores in Denver said that he was both cautious on his buy ing policy and optimistic on sales this fall.

title: GREYHOUND BEST OF 1,613 ENTRIES
description: Full of action in going through his paces in the finale, Ch. Argus of Greywitch, a 4 yearold blue brindle greyhound owned by Dr. Elsie S. Neustadt of West Hanover, Mass., was named best in show at the Queensboro Kennel Club's all breed event yesterday.

title: Article 3  No Title
Froehling and Ashe Reach French Net Quarterfinals
description: PARIS, May 31Two Amer icans gained the quarterfinals today in the French open ten nis championships, a tourna ment that isn't what it used to be.

title: Paper Struck for 6th Day
description: NEWARK, May 31 (AP)A strike by the North Jersey Newspaper Guild against The Evening News here continued today with no signs of a settle ment and no negotiations scheduled. The walkout began last Wednesday, and on Thurs day the newspaper suspended publication because sympathy walkouts by craft unions, the newspaper said, made produc tion impossible.

title: Murder and Manslaughter Rose 7.1% in City in 1970
description: The number of murder and manslaughter cases in New York City rose to 1,117 last year, an increase of 7.1 per cent over 1969, according to a Police Department study released yes terday. The rate, 14.2 per hundred thousand population, placed New York ninth among the 10 largest cities in the country.

title: New U.S. Policy Speeds Liquor Law Enforcement
description: Whitney North Seymour Jr., United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, yesterday announced new pro cedures to expedite the cases of persons who substitute cheap or watered down liquor in bars and restaurants here.

title: Mexico Beats Canada, 32
description: MEXICO CITY, May 31 (Reu ters)Mexico beat Canada, 32, in the second round of the American Zone Davis Cup ten nis series today and will meet New Zealand next. In the de ciding match Joaquin Loyo Mayo defeated John Sharpe, 46, 75, 61, 61.

title: Fittipaldi Drives Lotus To Formula 2 Victory
description: LONDON, May 31 (AP)  Emerson Fittipaldi, the 24year old Grand Prix driver from Brazil, won the International Formula 2 auto race at the Crystal Palace today.

title: Ceausescu Goes to Peking
description: VIENNA, May 31 (UPI) President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania left for Peking today at the head of a Communist party and Government delega tion that will visit China, North Korea, North Vietnam and Mongolia, the official Rumanian press agency said.

title: Legal Aid Society to Train Ombudsmen to Serve Inmates of City's Prisons
description: The Legal Aid Society an nounced yesterday that it would begin training ombudsmen for the city's nine prisons next month.

title: POLICEMAN SLAYS SUSPECT IN ROBBERY
description: One of three young men allegedly robbing a couple on Morningside Heights was shot and killed by a policeman last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Audie Murphy, War Hero, Killed in Plane Crash
description: ROANOKE, Va., May 31 Audie Murphy, the nation's mostdecorated hero of World War II, and five other men were found dead today in the wreckage of their light plane near the summit of a craggy, heavily wooded mountain 12 miles northwest of here.

title: RESERVE FACING ROLE IN EXPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 Prospects are growing that Con gress this year will enact a law requiring for the first time the extension of credit by the Federal Reserve System to a specific sector of the economy.

title: TWO MORE ADVANCE TO CHESS SEMIFINALS
description: Two more berths were filled yesterday in the semifinals of the competition to determine a challenger for the world chess title now held by Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union. The Asso ciated Press reported that Vik tor Korchnoi of the Soviet Union had defeated a country man, Yefim Geller, in their quarterfinal match in Moscow, and Bent Larsen of Denmark had eliminated Wolfgang Uhl mann of East Germany in the Canary Islands.

title: On the Waging Of Peace
description: To the historically trained ear, the most ominous drums of war have al ways been those pounded in the name of peace.

title: 20,000 WALK OUT AT WESTERN UNION
description: Two unions representing 20,000 employes struck West ern Union today, halting the ac ceptance and delivery of domes tic telegrams, overseas cables and money orders across the country, the company said.

title: Yanks Top A's, 53
description: A threerun homer by John Ellis in the first game and a basesfull strikeout by the same muscular young man in the second game provided the dramatic highlights of a split doubleheader at Yankee Sta dium yesterday.

title: Cary, ExHead of S.E.C., To Help Plan House Study
description: WASHINGTON, May 31William L. Cary, former chair man of the Securities and Exchange Commission, has agreed to help plan the broad study of the securities industry that is to be done by a subcommit tee of the House Commerce Committee.

title: Teamster Chief to Be Tried Despite Requests for Delay
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 31 (AP) Government prosecutors have indicated that they plan to bring Edward Gardy Partin, Baton Rouge teamster union chief, to trial on Friday as scheduled, despite pleas to de lay the trial to allow him to file a deposition in the James R. Hoffa case.

title: 201 Pounds of Heroin Seized By Customs in Puerto Rico
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) The Bureau of Customs re ported today the seizure of 201 pounds of pure heroin, worth $30,300,000 at estimated street prices, in San Juan, Puerto Rico. There were two arrests.

title: Cobble Hill Democrats Undeterred by Blast
description: The Independent Neighbor hood Democrats in the Cobble Hill section of Brooklyn annouced yesterday that they would hold their inaugural party next Saturday night despite a bomb ex plosion that blew the win dows out of its storefront headquarters early Sunday morning.

title: Books of The Times
description: In his latest novel, Ruby Red, William Price Fox has tried to do for Nashville what Balzac did for France. Nashville, as you may know, is the Country and Western music capital of America and the world, and a recording center that now rivals New York City in output. Sooner or later, everyone within 50,000 kilowatts of the Grand Ole Opry show who strums gui tar and yearns to be more than carhop or truckdriver heads for Nashville. And Mr. Fox, with his sharp eye for the honkytonk scene and his good ear for Southern rural dialogue, has gotten it all down: the hick town girls dropping peanuts into their bottles of Dr. Pepper; the farmers standing in line for Saturday night's show at the Grand Ole Opry in their undershirts (with laundered outer shirts tucked under their arms, to be put on once the show begins); the songwriters sucking tired tunes from burnedout brains; the whole tawdry, pearl buttoned scene. Why, if Mr. Fox knows any detail that might tell you just a bit more about Nashville and environs, he'll work it in whether it belongs to his story or not.

title: Mays Beats Mets, 21, in 11th;
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 31 Willie Mays beat the Mets with his bat, glove, arm and legs to day as the New Yorkers got their first look at the wonder team of 1971, the San Francisco Giants.

title: The Challenge of Waste
description: Endowed with the riches of this virgin continent, Americans have always been a wasteful people. But the attitudethere's plenty more where that came from no longer corresponds to the hard reality. From electric energy to ocean beaches, from clean air to green space, everything is now in short supply.

title: Bengali Cholera Grows; India Asks World Aid
description: CALCUTTA, India, May 31 Indian health authorities made an urgent appeal today for international assist ance as Government doctors announced that an uncon trollable epidemic of cholera had broken out among the millions of Bengali refugees who have crossed into India from East Pakistan.

title: Explosion in Ulster Village
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 31 (UPI)  An explosion damaged village offices today at Castlederg, County Tyrone, the police said. A youth stand ing near the singlestory build ing was shaken but unhurt.

title: Thurmond and 2 Elderly Women In Dispute Over Land Purchase
description: BARNWELL, S. C., May 31  Senator Strom Thurmond has offered to sell back to two elderly sisters 160 acres of land his wife purchased from them for less than $5,000 two years ago.

title: GREEN BOOK GETS THE GREEN LIGHT
description: The Green Book, the official city directory whose publica tion Mayor Lindsay halted last month as an economy measure, will probably be published late this summer, Milton Musicus, the Municipal Services Admin istration, said yesterday.

title: MOLLOY TRACKMEN WIN C.H.S.A.A. TITLE
description: In third place with four events remaining, Archbishop Molloy of Queens finished with a string of 18 points to take the team title yesterday in the 43d annual Catholic High Schools Athletic Association track and field championships at Downing Stadium, Randalls Island.

title: Mac Dowell Colony Bequeathed $10,000 Windfall
description: The MacDowell Colony, the 400acre retreat for artists in Peterborough, N.H., will be the recipient of an unusual windfalla bequest from a librarian that could add up to more than $10,000.

title: Donal Sullivan, 60, Headed Newspaper Guild in '4041
description: BOSTON, May 31Donal M. Sullivan, president of the Amer ican Newspaper Guild in 1940 41, died yesterday in the Veter ans Administration Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived in Brighton.

title: Shop Talk
description: When Gloria Vanderbilt's book on collage appeared late last fall, the author found that a lot of other people were interested in putting bits and pieces together to make a decorative whole. And from that it was easy to think there might be a market for collage kits. Hallmark Cards, Inc., not only agreed with Miss Vanderbilt but asked her to design a number of other items such as jig saw puzzles, rec ipe files, gift wrapping paper, scrapbooks, cal endars, post cards, memoran dum pads and address books. Although the artist, in private life Mrs. Wyatt Cooper, is winding up her work, only the Christmas cards are to be offered to customers this year. But that is Hallmark's doing, not hers.

title: June N. Omenn, Brian L. Strunk Marry in Jersey
description: WEST ORANGE, N.J., May 31 Miss June Natalie Omenn, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Edward Omenn of Short Hills, was married here this evening to Brian Lippman Strunk, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Strunk of Coates ville, Pa. Rabbi Eli Pilchick performed the ceremony at Mayfair Farms.

title: LAZARD FRERES SETS REALESTATE TRUST
description: Lazard Freres & Co. an nounced over the weekend the creation of Corporate Property Investors, a realestate invest ment trust. The new company will issue 2.6 million shares of common stock at $25 a share, which have been placed priv ately.

title: J. J. KENNY TELLS OF ADVICE TO FLEE
description: NEWARK, May 31John J. Kenny, former Hudson County Democratic chairman, testified today that a former Hudson County Prosecutor had urged him to flee to Canada to avoid a possible indictment on charges of conspiracy, extor tion and violation of public trust.

title: ITALY REASSERTS GOLD PRICE STAND
description: ROME, May 31  Guido Carli, governor of the Bank of Italy and one of Europe's top monetary experts, today recon firmed Italy's opposition to pro posals for raising the official price of gold, and called for curbs on the Eurodollar mar ket.

title: Washington Notes
description: WASHINGTON, May 31  President Nixon's basic speech for political occasions seems to be taking shape on this theme: Peace soon, then prosperity.

title: Litton Reports Contract
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., May 31 (UPI)  Litton Industries, Inc., has reported that its data systems division has been awarded an $11million addon to an existing preproduction contract by the Grumman Aerospace Corporation. The contract covers advanced com puters for the Navy's Grum man E2C Hawkeye early warn ing system.

title: DIVIDE AND RULE WINS COAST RACE
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 31 (AP)Laf fit Pincay brought his New Zealandbred horse, Divide and Rule, out of the middle of the pack and went on to win the $81,400 Lakeside Handicap as the favorite at Hollywood Park today.

title: G.A.O. Charges Mine Bureau Is Lenient on Safety
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 The United States Bureau of Mines was accused in a report released today of failing to en force strictly the 18monthold Federal law designed to reduce injury and death in the na tion's coal mines.

title: Kilo of Heroin Found
description: Two radio patrolmen respond ing to a report of a taxicab driver being robbed last night, chased a suspect into a Harlem tenement where, the police said, they found a kilo of heroin valued at $1million, and half a pound of cocaine. The patrol men arrested James Foulks, 19 years old and Ronnie Lee, 30, at the tenement, 308 West 121st Street.

title: Worst Drought in 12 Years Ends in Brazil's Northeast
description: BRASILIA, Brazil, May 31 (AP)The Brazilian Govern ment said today that the North east region's worst drought in 12 years had ended. The Gov ernment had paid $67 million in relief money and had created makework projects for nearly 500,000 jobless, the announce ment added.

title: 2 Turks Continue to Hold Girl; Army Brings In Sharpshooters
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, May 31 (AP)  The Turkish Army brought sharpshooters and po lice dogs today to the house where a 14yearold girl was being held hostage by two youths sought in connection with the kidnapping and slay ing of an Israeli diplomat.

title: Overseas Growth Pushed by G.& W.
description: The formation of a new inter national operating group and plans to become a fullfledged multinational corporation in the next five years were announced yesterday by Gulf and Western Industries, Inc.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 1, 1971

title: Notes on People
description: Senator George McGovern's newest recruit in his fast growing campaign to win the Democratic Presidential nomi nation is Pierre Salinger, who will join the McGovern camp this week.

title: Racial Attitudes in Suburbs Reflect the Total Society
description: William P. Benjamin is some thing of an expert on merion bluegrass, Canadian hemlock trees, sales on electric hedge clippers and places to launch a 16foot power boat.

title: Judith Elaine Bing Wed to Lawyer
description: WAYLAND, Mass., May 31 The marriage of Miss Jud ith Elaine Bing to Edward Charles Marschner, a lawyer with the New York firm of Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton, took place here this afternoon.

title: Unemployment Casts Drab Shadow Over Cape Breton
description: GLACE BAY, Nova Scotia, May 2IThree of the younger members of this tired coal mining town stood at the cor ner of Commercial and Main Streets one recent evening and exchanged news.

title: A. C. Moore, Football Coach At U. of Chattanooga, Dies
description: CHATTANOOGA, May 31 (UPI)A. C. (Scrappy) Moore, head football coach at the Uni versity of Chattanooga from 1931 until 1967, died yesterday after an apparent heart attack. He was 68 years old.

title: Race to the Red Planet
description: The three rocketsone American and two Soviet now speeding toward Mars represent the best type international competition. Their rivalry centers about the pursuit of knowledge, with the honors going to that nation whose instruments send back the most important data on the red planet that is one of earth's nearest space neighbors. In the Mars race to date, this country leads by a wide margin because of the brilliant feats by Mariners 4, 6 and 7. In the 1960's the pictures and other data acquired by these pioneering vehicles completely revo lutionized scientists' views of the Martian terrain and environment. But much more remains to be learned.

title: French Village Mayor a Suicide; Ibis Good Turn Took Lives of 13
description: PARIS, May 31The Mayor of a Norman village who wanted to do somebody a good turn and wound up with 13 deaths on his conscience committed suicide today.

title: New Fund Aims to Aid Widows Of City's Policemen and Firemen
description: Twenty widows of policemen and firemen killed here in the line of duty gathered in Man hattan yesterday with their 53 children to announce the for mation of a foundation aimed at helping them.

title: Advertising:
description: The sixyearold Cadwell/ Davis agency has been dis solved and Franchellie Cad well, the tall young woman who was its president has moved over to Compton ad vertising to head an inde pendent division called Cad well Compton.

title: World Trade Talks Are Urged by Stans
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) Secretary of Commerce Mau rice H. Stans suggested today a worldwide conference be con vened on trade to establish new rules governing business be tween nations. He said the Nixon Administration was de termined to end what it con siders discrimination against American goods and invest ments.

title: Marcel Dupre, Master Organist And Improviser, Is Dead at 85
description: PARIS, May, 31Marcel Du pro, the internationally known grand master of French organ ists, died here last night in sub urban Meudon at the age of 85.

title: Seoul Reports Planes Sank North Korean Patrol Boat
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Tues day, June 1  South Korean Air Force fighters sank a North Korean patrol boat early today after a threehour chase and battle off the southwestern coast, the Defense Ministry an nounced.

title: U.S. and Canada Complete Pact on Forest Fire Control
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) The United States and Can ada put into effect today an agreement to facilitate forest fire fighting between Alaska and Canada's Yukon territory.

title: Fax Sails Fury to Second Shields Class Victory in 3 Weekend Races
description: RYE, N. Y., May 31 A. Shawhan Fox sailing the Shields Class sloop Fury, won today for the second time in three Yacht Racing Association championship regattas in the close of the threeday holiday weekend competition on Long Island. Sound, sponsored by the American Yacht Club.

title: Mrs. Mitchell Predicts President's Reelection
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI)Mrs. John N. Mitchell said today that there was no doubt about it: Pres ident Nixon will run for re election and he will win.

title: COLGATE TESTING INSURANCE PLAN
description: A new method of alumni sup port is being tried out by Colgate University  partner ship with more than 50 mem bers thus far in the current graduating class in $5,000 life insurance policies, with the university as beneficiary.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The only Velzquez worth $5 million is the Aqueduct jockey. At least we can get some money by betting him.

title: Gibson Put on Disabled List
description: ST. LOUIS, May 31 (UPI) The St. Louis Cardinals placed Bob Gibson on the 21day dis abled list today. The 35year old pitcher tore a thigh muscle in his right leg while batting in the third inning of the Car dinals' game with the Atlanta Braves on Saturday.

title: Southerly Triumphs
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., May 31 Dale Shane's Southerly beat eight Ensigns over ?? course in the Sea?? Club's racing on Harbor today.

title: Proposal for Heroin Experiment Brings Community Protest
description: Leaders of community and antinarcotics groups in Harlem and the Bronx expressed angry opposition yesterday to a pro posed city experiment that would give maintenance doses of heroin to selected addicts in a rehabilitation program.

title: Bridge: Dionisi and Asber Triumph In Goldman Open Pairs Here
description: Tony Dionisi of New York City and Joe Asber of Beth lehem, Pa., won the Goldman Open Pairs in the Eastern Regional tournament at the New York Hilton Hotel in the foursession event that ended early Monday morning. They beat out Tom and Estee Grif fin of New York City by nearly a full board.

title: OBSERVER;... When You Grow Up?
description: WASHINGTON, May 31It used to be that, if you were a child, everybody you met asked you what you wanted to be when you grew up. Adults were especially fond of this question, which seemed silly of them at the time.

title: TESTS ON BIG ALLIS CALLED A SUCCESS
description: Successful tests on Big Allis the millionkilowatt electric generator in Ravenswood, Queens, idled for 10 months have been run during the week end with loads as high as 600, 000 kilowatts, the Consolidated Edison Company said yesterday.

title: KENTUCKY CHICKEN REPORTS A DEFICIT
description: The Kentucky Fried Chicken Corporation had a loss of $2, 471,002 in the six months end ed March 31, it was announced yesterday in Louisville, Ky.

title: Net Title to Mt. Lakes
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 31 Mountain Lakes High School defeated Westfield, 91 and Christian Brothers Academy of Lincroft by the same score to capture the New Jersey Inter scholastic Athletic Association tennis championship today.

title: U.S. FAILS TO HALT UNSAFETIRE SALE
description: WASHINGTON, May 31A stiff new Federal labeling regulation has failed to break up a thriving black market in unsafe automobile tires.

title: South Africa's Leader Offers Friendship to Black Countries
description: CAPETOWN, May 31Prime Minister John Vorster offered South Africa's friendship today to black Africa and promised to work for improved relations.

title: Box Scores of Major League Games
Braves Purchase Versalles
description: ATLANTA, May 31 (AP)  The Atlanta Braves announced today they had purchased Zoilo Versalles from Union Laguna of the Mexican League. He will replace Clete Boyer, a third baseman, on the roster.

title: Lindsay Urges New Talks By State and City on Taxes
description: Mayor Lindsay said yester day that it was not too late for the city and state to work to gether on real solutions of their differences over the city's proposed tax package.

title: Nixon News Conference On Radio, TV Tonight
description: The following New York television stations will carry President Nixon's news con ference live tonight at 8:30 P.M.: WCBSTV (Chan nel 2), WNBCTV (Channel 4), WABCTV (Channel 7) and WNYCTV (Channel 31). WPIXTV (Channel 11) and WNETTV (Channel 13) will rebroadcast the press con ference at 11 P.M.

title: AMERICAN WOUNDED IN PNOMPENH BLASTS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tues day, June 1 (Reuters)Terrorist explosions badly damaged two buildings housing United States personnel in central pnompenh early today, wounding one of the servicemen.

title: Campbell Ousted in British Amateur
description: CARNOUSTIE, Scotland, May 31 (AP)  Bill Campbell and 15 other Americans were elimi nated today in the first round of the British Amateur golf championship tournament.

title: L. I. Diver's Body Is Found
description: WANTAGH, L. I., May 31 (UPI)The body of a scuba diver missing in the waters of Hempstead Bay since May 21, was recovered Last night, the Nassau County Police said to day. They identified the body as that of Kenneth Douglas, 18 years old, of 2442 Hudson Street, East Meadow, L. I. The body was found in Flat Creek, near the Wantagh State Park way.

title: A.C.L.U. Notifying Protesters
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) The American Civil Liberties Union undertook the chore to day of notifying 2,400 defend ants arrested in antiwar demon strations here early this month that the Government has dropped charges against them. The District of Columbia cor poration counsel's office said the charges were dropped be cause it did not have enough information to prosecute.

title: The Talk of City Hall
description: What does Mayor Lindsay say to the city's newest Democratic county chairman? And who else is talking to the chairman and why?

title: William G. Haynes Authority On Fire Hazards, Dies at 72
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., May 31 William G. Hayne, who re tired in 1964 as superintendant of the Bureau of Fire Preven tion of the New York Board of Fire Underwriters, died yester day at his home, 13 Brook Bridge Road. He was 72 years old.

title: Wells Fargo Sets Branch
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 31 (Reuters)  The Wells Fargo Bank has filed an application with the Federal Reserve Board for a branch that would work closely with Wells Fargo's pro posed Miami Bank, Wells Fargo InterAmerican Bank, to de velop business with Latin America.

title: The Outer City: Negroes Find Few Tangible Gains
description: EAST CLEVELAND, Ohio A small, growing number of black families is increasingly able to penetrate the new Outer Cities of America, the swelling bands of suburbs that ring the stagnating inner cities.

title: Boultee's Bonito Victor
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 31 Recovering from a recall for starting too early, Arthur H. Boultbee, using a borrowed til ler, sailed Bonito into the lead before the first mark of a seven mile course and led the Luders 16 fleet the rest of the way on Long Isand Sound today in the season's seventh Yacht Racing Association championship re gatta, conducted by Riverside Yacht Club.

title: ENEMY REPORTED TO CAPTURE SNOUL
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 31  North Vietnamese troops reportedly drove a South Vietnamese task force today from the Cambodian town of Snoul, which United States troops captured more than a year ago.

title: Mary Cartwright Bride of J. D. Smith
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., May 31In the Helen Hills Hills Chapel at Smith Col lege this morning Miss Mary Elizabeth Cartwright was married to Jeffrey Davis Smith by the Rev. Russell Mase, a Presbyterian min ister.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: EVERY WEEK, more than 26,000 jobs are advertised in The New York Times. See the Employment Columns today.Advt.

title: 123 ARTISTS GIVEN CULTURAL GRANTS
description: A citysponsored cultural foundation has distributed $240,000 in state money to 123 people engaged in artistic ac tivities.

title: Two Patrolmen in Harlem Shot At by Car Strippers
description: Two patrolmen investigating a carstripping report were fired on by one of a group of men surprised by the officers while dismantling an auto at 8 East 110th Street in Harlem early yesterday.

title: Cambodians Willing To Discuss Peace With North Vietnam
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 31 (Reuters)The Cambodian head of state, Cheng Heng, said today that his Government was willing to open discussions to end the war in Cambodia if the Vietcong and North Vietnamese withdrew all their troops.

title: All but 13 of 570 P.O.W.'s Refuse to Return to Hanoi
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 31Only 13 of the 570 disabled prisoners offered re patriation have agreed to re turn to North Vietnam, officials said tonight.

title: ALUMINUM PACTS PROVIDE 31% RAISE; PRICES WILL GO UP
description: The United Steelworkers of America announced agreement yesterday on new threeyear contracts with four major aluminum companies that gives 32,000 workers pay rises total ing about 31 per cent over that period.

title: Rear Adm. Klavdy Shevelev, Czarist Officer, Dies at 89
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 31 (UPI)  Rear Adm. Klavdy V. Shevelev, a Czarist officer, died in Sonoma Friday of a heart ailment. He was 89 years old.

title: 7 NEGRO POLICEMEN DISMISSED IN GEORGIA
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., May 31 (AP)Seven Negro policemen were discharged from the Co lumbus force today after picket ing police headquarter over al leged discrimination and ripping American flag shoulder patches off their uniforms.

title: 2 From U.S. Among 5 Dead In Dutch Train Collision
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, May 31 (Reuters)Two young Americans were identi fied today among at least five persons killed when a Dutch local train collided with an in ternational express at a signal light near here last night.

title: LOUISIANA'S APPEAL TO SUE LIFE DENIED
description: BATON ROUGE, La., May 31 (AP)A state court of appeals ruled today that the state had no right to sue Life magazine for damages for its article al leging Mafia influence in state government.

title: Spacecraft Passes Its First Day of 5Month Trip
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 31 (UPI)  Mariner 9 streaked toward Mars today in its race with two big Russian unmanned spacecraft to explore the red planet first and hunt for evi dence that life exists there.

title: Alberta Oil Output Off
description: CALGARY, Alberta, May 31 (Canadian Press)  Crude oil production in Alberta averaged an estimated 798,019 barrels a day during the week ended May 24, the Alberta Oil and Gas Conservation Board report ed today. Production in the previous week averaged 799, 600 barrels a day. Daily pro duction in May was expected to average 801,748 barrels, compared with 700,107 barrels in May, 1970.

title: Booksellers Hold a Preview of Wares
description: BOSTON, May 31The book publishing industry in the United States, generally regarded as the world's most dynamic and diverse, though not necessarily the most se lective, has opened the covers on its big fall and winter sea son.

title: Boy Lost in Mountains Safe
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., May 31 (AP)Volunteer searchers found 3yearold Chris Dodson safe yesterday after he had been missing overnight from a holiday outing in the Manzano Mountains southeast of here.

title: Student Fare Introduced by Sabena and Pan Am
description: The world's airlines are at it again in the annual trans Atlantic battle of the skeds and the nonskeds.

title: Elaine Eskesen Married to Consultant
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., May 31 Miss Elaine Chatilion Eske sen was married here this afternoon to Robert Lewis Schuldenfrei. Rabbi Sidney Nathenson performed the ceremony at the home of the bridegroom's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William H. Schuld enfrei.

title: Wife Accused of Murder
description: NEW CASSEL, L. I., May 31 (AP)Mrs. James Smalls, 41 years old, was arrested here today and charged with fatally shooting her husband as he re turned home, the police said. Mr. Smalls was shot with a 22caliber handgun.

title: Alone Against the Enemy
description: On Jan. 26, 1945, an Ameri can infantry company fighting in the huge Colmar pocket in eastern France was besieged by six tanks and waves of German infantry. The babyfaced sec ond lieutenant in charge of Company B, 15th Infantry Regiment, Third Division, or dered his outnumbered men to withdraw to the cover of a near by wood. The lieutenant, Audie Murphy, remained and gave fire directions to his artillery on a field telephone.

title: Spontaneity Unrivaled
description: Mr. Dupr, who made more than a dozen concert tours in the United States, won fame for his original improvisations, in which he was regarded as unrivaled for spontaneity and excellence of contrapuntal, fu gal and formal development. In fact, many of his organ com positions started as improvisa tions.

title: Article 5  No Title
Ailing but Hopeful Winsted, Conn, Marks Its Survival
description: WINSTED, Conn., May 31 As this little mill town in the foothills of the Berkshires eased into a round of bicen tennial celebration events, some residents wondered just what there was to celebrate.For many, the answer was simply survival.

title: CZECH PARTY SAYS CRISIS HAS ENDED
description: PRAGUE, May 31 (AP)The Czechoslovak Communist party made public today the final resolution of its 14th congress, which said that the long crisis had been overcome, tive Czech oslovakia was locked ?? the Soviet bloc again, but that the struggle against ?? and Western influence must be continued.

title: Snowdons in Minor Accident
description: HANDCROSS, England, May 31 (Reuters)  Princess Mar garet, the sister of Queen Eliza beth her husband Lord Snow don and their two children were involved in a minor auto collision on a private road near this tiny south England village today. No one was hurt in the accident, which the police said occurred when Lord Snowdon reversed his car accidentally, striking another car.

title: P.O.W.'S AN ISSUE IN KOREA WAR, TOO
description: The refusal of more than 500 North Vietnamese prisoners of war to go home to the North sounded a faint but familiar echo: this same issue of repa triation halted negotiations to ward an armistice in the Korean War for months in 1952 and 1953.

title: Article 6  No Title
Dare We Scorn the Visionaries?
description: It Is hard for us to gain perspective on our own time. We tend to look back and glorify the past as an age of achievement or miracles. Likewise the future seems to promise all our dreams. But the truth is that our time is now and that this age is at least as significant as any that has come before it in any area we can imagine: knowl edge, production, achievement or de struction, hate or violence.

title: Andean Nations Seeking Strength in Unity
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 31 Economic giantsBrazil, Mexi co and Argentinaare stirring in Latin America. To face them together and to avoid becoming economic satellites separately, five nations in the west of South America are trying eco nomic integration within an authoritarian regional plan.

title: Rainy and Chilly Weather Keeps Holiday Traffic at a Minimum
description: Thousands of the New York ers who defied poor weather reports and got away for the first Congressionally legislated Monday Memorial Weekend, threw in the soggy towel and came home to the city early yesterday.

title: Cheap Lodging Scarce as Big Influx Nears
description: LONDON, May 31European countries, anxious over their lack of inexpensive hotels, are awaiting a record influx of vis itors under age 30.

title: Oil Find Is Reported
description: HOUSTON, May 31 (UPI) The Humble Oil and Refining Company has announced an indicated gas discovery in the Gulf of Mexico off the Louisi ana coast in Eugene Island Block 295. Humble and the Pennzoil Company paid $15 million to the Federal Govern ment for the rights to the tract in December. The discovery well was drilled to a depth of 9,820 feet.

title: Soviet Craft on Way
description: MOSCOW, May 31 (UPI) Two unmanned Soviet space stations, chased by America's Mariner 9, sped toward Mars today in a race for a close look at that planet.

title: Washington High: From riot to Hope
description: George Washington High School, a battered institution at 193d Street and Audubon Avenue in upper Manhattan, began the 197071 school year in a state approaching anarchy and In n pervasive climate of fear. It nears the end of the year on a high note of hope.

title: ISRAELI PROGRAM LURES AMERICANS
description: A total of 7,761 persons, more than d90 per cent of them high school and college students, will participate in workstudy programs this summer in Israel.

title: U.S. Airliner Held In Cuba for 3d Day; No Details on Talks
description: HAVANA, May 31 (Reuters) Under the watchful eyes of plainclothes policemen, the 59 passengers and nine crew mem bers of a hijacked Pan Ameri can Boeing 707 airliner spent their third day in Cuba today.

title: Proposal Rejected in Paris
description: PARIS, May 31 (Reuters) Representatives of the North Vietnamese and Vietcong dele gations to the peace talks re jected Mr. Cheng Heng's pro posal today as nonsense and expressed their support for the ousted Cambodian leader, Prince Norodom Sihanouk.

title: Defense Flash Takes Hour To Complete, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI)  The Pentagon's multibillion dollar Defense Communications System takes 69 minutes to complete a flash message in a crisis because of poor man agement, according to a Con gressional report.

title: HEELER STRESSES SPEED ON TAX CUT
description: Walter W. Heller, former economic adviser to Presidents Johnson and Kennedy, advo cated yesterday a speeding up of tax cuts to stimulate the economy and reduce unemploy ment by enlarging the alloca tion of revenue to poverty cities.

title: JAMES YOUNG, 70, HEADED SHIP LINE
description: LITTLE FALLS, N. J., May 31  James B. Young, who retired last year as chairman of the board of Barber Steamship ??ines after more than a half century with the company, died last night in St. Michael's Hospi tal, Newark. He was 70 years old and lived here.

title: TARGET DATE SET FOR A SUGAR BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 31  The House Agriculture Com mittee has set Wednesday as the target date for wrapping up a new sugar bill. Although the committee is not expected to make any radical departure from the present basic law, which protects producers with a price higher than that in world markets, it still has some thorny problems to solve.

title: Sparkling Aida Opens June Festival at the Met
description: With scarcely a moment to take a breath after returning from its sixweek spring tour Saturday, the Metropolitan Op era began its twoweek June Festival last night at its Lincoln Center home with a crackling Aida.

title: PROXMIRE SCORES LATIN BANK COST
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 Senator William Proxmire charged today that the Inter American Development Bank spent exorbitant sums in connection with its last two annual meetings in Uruguay and Peru.

title: Laotian Suggests Peace Talks
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 31 (AP)Premier Souvanna Pho uma has proposed the start of peace negotiations with the proCommunist Pathet Lao without delay.

title: Tunex Wins Metropolitan by a Nose
description: Tunex of the Hobeau Farm, the wrong horse in the stable's entry, won the $121, 600 Metropolitan Mile at Bel mont Park yesterday.

title: U. S. Releases 4 Cubans
description: KEY WEST, Fla., May 31 (Reuters)Four Cuban fisher men seized off the Florida coast last week were released today, but four others remained jailed on charges of fishing illegally in United States waters.

title: Low Marks for Albany
description: The State Legislature, looking for an outlet for its frus trations, found a perfect target in education. At a time of great fiscal pressures, Albany did nothing to alleviate the budgetary crisis of public schools, colleges and uni versities. Instead, it diverted attention from its real re sponsibilities by meddling with the management and even the content of education.

title: LSD IN CIDER SENDS 1,000 FANS ON TRIP
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 31 (UPI)About 1,000 young peo ple attending a rock concert by the Greatful Dead and other groups took an unexpected trip last night when their ap ple cider turned out to be spiked with LSD.

title: Farmers Kill Marijuana
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) Farmers have responded en thusiastically to a new program whereby they are paid by the Government for eradicating wild marijuana, an Agriculture Department official said today. The pilot program started two weeks ago in some areas and one week ago in others among 11 counties in 10 states, mostly in the Middle West.

title: Marble Folly
description: Near the foot of Capitol Hill there squats a huge, ugly, vulgar structure. It is the newest of three office buildings for the members and staff of the House of Representa tives and is named for the late Speaker Sam Rayburn. The Rayburn Building, so badly designed that it would make Thomas Jefferson weep and so costly that it would make any taxpayer despair, was opened only a halfdozen years ago.

title: LAST OF ISLANDERS LEAVING IN PROTEST
description: FILICUDI, Italy, May 31 (AP)  Filicudi's doctor and telephone operator packed to day to follow the rest of the residents of this tiny island in protest against the exiling here of 15 reputed Mafia leaders.

title: G.I. Unit in Britain Assails Vietnam War
description: LONDON, May 31A thou sand United States servicemen stationed in Britain announced their opposition to the Vietnam war today. It was the Iargest antiwar protest among Ameri can military personnel sta tioned here.

title: Alan Rosenthal, Engineer, Weds Diane Rothman
description: Miss Diane Lynn Rothman and Alan Steven Rosenthal were married here yesterday afternoon in the Stephen Wise Free Synagogue by Rabbi Edward E. Klein, who was assisted by Rabbi James Perman.

title: Screen: Dawn of Judo Opens at Bijou
description: As an educational tool, Dawn of Judo, the Japanese period adventure in color which came to the Bijou yes terday, deserves kudos, not a karate chop, for illustrating (with the considerable help of English subtitles) that judo had its troubles before mak ing it in the Nipponese ag gressive and defensive arts. As a movie, however, the growing pains are still evi dent, aggravated by a con glomeration of blackand white heroes and villains, wild handtohand bouts and a subsidiary romance that could only charm devout wor shippers of judo and Japanese legend.

title: Paper Says Mrs. Meir Met Russians Secretly
description: STOCKHOLM, Tuesday, June 1 (AP)The Swedish news paper Dagens Nyheter said today that Premier Golda Meir of Israel met secretly with two Soviet officials in Finland over the weekend.

title: Article 1  No Title
Stars Pick Cougars' Peeples
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., May 31 (AP)The Utah Stars have chosen George Peeples from the Carolina Cougars in partial pay ment for the draft rights to Jim McDaniels. Utah had picked the Western Kentucky star first in the American Bas ketball Association draft, but Carolina signed him.

title: Jordan Says Guerrillas Seek To Sabotage Nation's Economy
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. May 31 The Jordanian Government said today that Palestinian guerrillas were engaged in a program of sabotage in an attempt to un dermine Jordan's economy and provoke the army.

title: Memorial Day at A rling ton: Our Only Son
description: The Talk of Arlington

title: Vatican Unit Weighs Issue Of Conscientious Objection
description: ROME, May 31The Ponti fical Justice and Peace Com mission raised the question to day of establishing an interna tional statute on conscientious objection.

title: Bond Yields Show Drop In Week Despite Outlook
description: Looking at the headlines late last week, many credit market analysts concluded that it was difficult to make a case for a continuation of the bright new trend toward lower interest rates.

title: Pullout Is Not Seen as Threat to G.I.'s in Field
description: SAIGON, Scuti, Vietnam, May 31The 70 per cent reduction in the number of American combat troops in Vietnam has left major United States bases and supply depots more vul nerable to attack but has not yet increased the danger to the ground troops still in the field, according to a survey of Amer ican field commanders.

title: Business Construction Up Sharply in Quarter
description: Construction contracts for business facilities during the first quarter showed a sub stantial improvement over the previous quarter, the F. W. Dodge division of the Mc GrawHill Information Sys tems Company, reported yes terday. The index is a new indicator developed by the division.

title: Most City Food Stores To Start Unit Pricing
description: Unit pricing, described by Bess Myerson, the city Con sumer Affairs Commissioner, as a major victory for the consumer, goes into effect in most food stores in the city today.

title: ELLIOT V. WALTER OF MACY'S IS DEAD
description: MANHASSET, L.I., May 31 Elliot V. Walter, former chair man of the board of Macy's New York, who had been ac tive in charities of many de nominations, died yesterday in St. Francis Hospital, Roslyn, after a brief illness. He lived at 6 Strickland Place here.

title: Raytheon Gets Navy Order
description: LEXINGTON, Mass., May 31 (UPI)The Raytheon Corpora tion has obtained a $7million Navy order for shipboard radar equipment used in testing mis siles and satellites.

title: VOCAL ARTS GROUP SINGS DELECTABLY
description: The New York Vocal Arts Ensemble gave a delectable concert at the New York Cul tural Center Sunday night that proved that good taste can be equally good light entertain ment.

title: Miss Barbara Lynn Filenbaum Bride of Donald K. Piermont Jr.
description: Miss Barbara Lynn Filen baum and Donald Kenneth Piermont Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon at the St. RegisSheraton. Rabbi Martin Freedman performed the ceremony.

title: Next Pension Checks Will Include Increase
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP)First checks reflecting the 10 per cent increase in Social Security benefits au thorized under legislation en acted in March will reach beneficiaries on Thursday, the Social Security Adminis tration announced today.

title: A Definitive StudyFrom A to Vof Cheese
description: PARISGen. de Gaulle once said no one could gov ern a country like France where they had 365 different cheeses. Le Grand Charles actually underestimated France: It has more than 400 cheeses, according to a new encyclopedia on the subject. And that figure neglects the fact that one kind, goat cheese, comes in several hun dred varieties, and another, Camembert, in about 2,000.

title: Memorial Day Observed Traditionally and by Protests on War
description: Memorial Day. 1971. was ob served across the country yes terday in ceremonies that underscored division over the war in Vietnam and the 45,000 American combat deaths it has produced.

title: Bold Reasoning Triumphs in $134,400 Jersey Derby
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J. May 31 While waiting for a show down with Canoncro II, Bold Reasoning proved he was more than a sprinter today by captur ing the $134,400 Jersey Derby and remained unbeaten in seven starts.

title: Witness Held in Coast Killings; Sheriff May End Body Search
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., May 31 (UPI)  The authorities dis closed today the arrest of a material witness in the slay ings of 23 men and said they hoped the end was near in their search for more bodies.

title: Few Mourn Yuba City's Faceless Men
description: MARYSVILLE, Calif., May 31  Nobody much missed the faceless men who disap peared from Lower D. And nobody much mourns them now as their hacked up bodies are dug from the soft loam of peach orchards in the outskirts of Yuba City across the Feather River from here.

title: Fiji Joins I.M.F., World Bank
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (Reu tersFiji has become a mem ber of the International Mone tary Fund and the World Bank. This raised the I.M.F.'s mem bership to 118 countries and the World Bank's membership to 116 countries. Fiji's quota in the fund has been set at $13million and its capital sub scription to the World Bank at $11.1million.

title: LANDLORDS SLATE RENT CURB TALKS
description: A major property owners' group here will hold a mass meeting of landlords next Tues day at which it will urge mod eration in rent increases in apartments removed from rent control and stabilization under new state legislation.

title: Troop Strength in Vietnam Reduced by U.S. to 255,700
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam May 31 (AP)  The United States command announced to day that American troop strength in Vietnam was re duced another 3,600 men last week, bringing the total to 255,700. It is the lowest level in more than five years.

title: The Happy Marriage: Alive and Well in '71
description: I've been married eighteen years

title: JOB PLAN HELPFUL TO PUERTO RICANS
description: Federal labor experts are re porting signs of benefits for Puerto Ricans here in jobtrain ing programs although they re main the most deprived of all workers in major poverty neighborhoods.

title: Con Ed Names Trustee to Board
description: The Consolidated Edison Company has elected Mrs. Marian Sulzberger Heiskell to its board of trustees, there by increasing the member ship to 15, it was announced yesterday by Charles F. Luce, chairman.

title: Article 4  No Title
Whitney Sets Indonesia Deal
description: TULSA, Okla., May 31 (UPI) Whitney Oil and Gas Corpo ration reports that it has ac quired a 45 per cent working interest in a 600square mile area in Indonesia. The com pany said its agreement with Pertamina, the state oil com pany, was the first of its kind. Whitney said $7.2million had been apportioned for explora tion in the area.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WHO is Garry Heltermam and why is he saying those terrible things about me?

title: People's Verdict in BedfordStuyvesant Killing Due Tomorrow
description: Twentytwo black clergymen and community leaders, acting as jurors in a People's Tri bunal, are scheduled to return a verdict tomorrow in the kill ing on May 17 of a Bedford Stuyvesant man by the police.

title: Roundup:
description: Jim Bunning, in his 17th major league season, moved into second place on the ca reer strikeout list yesterday as the Phillies defeated the Padres, 31, at San Diego.

title: Chief Geologist Named
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) Appointment of Dr. Vincent E. McKelvey as chief geologist to head the Geologic Division of the Geological Survey was announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SEVERINSEN SHOW IN A NEW EDITION
description: It was just a year ago that Doc Severinsen, the flamboy ant leader of the orchestra on television's Tonight show, made his debut at the Persian Room of the Plaza Hotel with an 11piece orchestra called the Now Generation Brass and an assortment of singers and dancers, the Brothers and Sis ters. He put on a fastmoving show that blended his trumpet virtuosity, his modest singing talents and his engaging per sonality in a razzledazzle pre sentation.

title: Public Assistance Aid Paid To 14.2 Million in February
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) More Americans than ever received public assistance maintenance payments in Feb ruary, although the amount of money paid out was not pro portionately higher, the De partment of Health, Education and Welfare reported today.

title: Buried Money Found
description: DALLAS, May 31 (AP)  Dallas County sheriff's officers reported today discovery of $47,400 in gold certificates. They had been buried, possibly for 35 years. The owner is unknown. The money, stuffed into a glass jar, was found by a workman digging a sewer ditch. Gold certificates were recalled by the Government in the nineteenthirties.

title: Roundup:
description: Larry Dierker owns an old pair of baseball shoes that most players would throw away.

title: Article 8  No Title
Sadat Joins in Burning of Recordings Made Secretly in Police Surveillance
description: CAIRO, May 31President Anwar elSadat took part to day in a public burning of secret reports and tape record ings of telephone conversations made by the security police and other agencies involved in surveillance over the Egyptian people.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Sandy Koufax came to me just before he was to interview Vida Blue, said Dick Williams, the Oakland manager and onetime Koufax teammate on the Dodgers. Whom does he remind you of? he asked me. The guy I'm talking to, I said. Naturally enough, Sandy blushed.

title: Clean Air and Autos: Industry Is Troubled by Antitrust Rules
description: News Analysis

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 31If the Government becomes a lawbreaker, it breeds contempt for law, the U.S. Third Circuit Court of Appeals point ed out the other day. And in a re sounding understatement it continued: To declare that the Government may commit crimes in order to secure the conviction of a criminal may well bring unfortunate retribution.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: FOURTH MUSQUACOOK LAKE, Me.After flying to ward the setting sun for half an hour from Presque Isle, Phil Walters set our single engine float plane gently down on this forestencircled lake in northern Maine.

title: Pakistan Eases Censorship
description: KARACHI, May 31The Gov ernment said today that it had decided to lift immediately censorship on all news dis patches for abroad. Censorship was imposed by President Agha Mohaminad Yahya Khan on March 26 after he had ordered a military crackdown on dissi dents in East Pakistan. Censor ship within the country will ap parently continue.

title: Markets Are Closed
description: Stock markets and commodity exchanges in this country, along with banks, most businesses and Government offices, were closed yesterday in observance of Me morial Day. In Europe numer ous exchanges and business houses also were closed in ob servance of Whitmonday.

title: Gaydos of New York Killed In Crash at British Track
description: LEICESTER, England, May 31 (UPI)An American racing driver, Leigh Gaydos, was killed today when his Merlyn car crashed during a Formula Ford race at Mallory Park track in Leicestershire.

title: McGill Praises Campus For TroubleFree Year
description: It has been a good year at Columbia, the university's president, Dr. William J. Mc gill, said three times in his com mencement address yesterday.

title: Cuba Silent in Hijacking
description: HAVANA, June 1 (Reuters) The Cuban Government today was silent concerning the hi jacked jetliner, and the official newspaper Granma made no mention of either the plane or its 69 passengers and crew members.

title: Policeman and Brother Indicted in Extortion Bid
description: A New York City patrolman and his brother, a special offi cer with the State Narcotic Ad diction Control Commission, were indicted yesterday on charges of attempting to extort $650 from a patron of an after hours club by threatening to arrest him on a drug charge.

title: LOCKHEED SENDS DATA TO PATMAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation responded today to a request for more information about its plans and prospects from Representative Wright Patman, chairman of the House Banking Committee.

title: Sony, in Tokyo, Is Planning Series of Executive Changes
description: The Sony Corporation in To kyo announced yesterday that it is planning a series of execu tive changes at its annual meet ing June 29. The electronics company said that Masaru Ibuka, now president, would be named chairman, and Akio Morita would advance from ex ecutive vice president to presi dent. Both men are cofounders.

title: Milan Soccer Head Quits
description: MILAN, Italy, June 1 (AP) Prance Carraro resigned today as president of the Milan Soc cer Club and Nereo Rocco, the coach of the team, said he might leave Milan because of Carraro's resignation.

title: Denial by Mrs. Meir
description: OSLO, Norway, June 1  Premier Meir denied today that she had met Soviet offi cials during her visit last week to the northern Finnish town of Rovaniemi. Mrs. Meir, who arrived here today on her first official visit to Norway, told Labor members of the Storting that reports of such a meet ing were untrue.

title: Soviet to Join in Building Of a French Oil Refinery
description: PARIS, June 1 (UPI) France and the Soviet Union will build an oil refinery, Finance Minister Valry Gis card d'Estaing said today.

title: In Indonesian Election Drive, The Opposition Backs Regime
description: SEMARANG, Indonesia, May 29The rainy season is ebbing in central Java and the banana trees, mangoes, sugar cane, co conut palms, rice shoots and misty slopes of dormant vol canos assault the eye with a dozen spectacular shades of green.

title: Warning! It May Not Work
description: It remains to be seen what the very highprofile wedding cake now in preparation for Tricia Nixon's wedding will taste like. But by the evi dence of the recipe adapted for home use handed out by the White House yesterday, there may have to be some last  minute revisions  per haps executed plainstakingly on yellow legal paper like drafts of Tricia's father's speeches  if the wedding guests are going to have any thing remotely resembling cake to eat.

title: Two Virginia Banks Plan To Form Holding Company
description: The Virginia National Bank, a $1.1billion institution based in Norfolk, is to form a holding company in conjunction with he $110million ColonialAmeri can National Bank of Roanoke, it was announced by the two concerns.

title: MINNESOTA G.I. WINS A STAY OF WAR DUTY
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 1A 20 yearold Minnesota soldier re ceived a brief respite from Viet nam duty today when Federal District Judge Earl Larson de layed a hearing on his conten tion that his orders were illegal because war had not been de clared.

title: Hermann Segall, ExChief Of Waltham Watch Concern
description: Hermann Segall, president from 1956 to I961 of Waltham, International, S.A., of Geneva, a distributor of watches, died of a heart attack on Saturday in Geneva, where he made his home. He was 62 years old.

title: Japanese Reserves Reach $6.9Billion, Third in the World
description: TOKYO, June 1Japan's for eignexchange reserves reached $6.9billion at the end of May, the Finance Ministry announced yesterday. Japan's reserves are now third largest in the world, outranked only by those of West Germany (about $19bil lion) and the United States $14billion).

title: 5 U.S. WOMEN GAIN IN ENGLISH TENNIS
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 1 (AP)American womenad vanced in five of their six first round matches today in the Northern lawn tennis tourna ment.

title: Army Studies Charges Of Killing of 24 Civilians
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)  The Army said today it was investigating charges that United States airborne troops killed 24 to 40 Vietnamese women and children on a beach near Bongson in Sep tember, 1968.

title: JOHN W. DALY
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June 1 John W. Daly, who retired in 1958 as chief engineer of the New York City Transit Author ity, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital after a long illness. He was 82 years old and lived at 1111 Midland Avenue.

title: Owner Is Ready to Accept Bid, Win or Lose
description: Rumors that Canonero II had already been sold for amounts up to $4million were squelched yesterday morning by Pedro Baptista, the owner of the frisky Venezuelan colt who will be seeking a Triple Crown sweep on Belmont Stakes Day Saturday.

title: Trial of 13 Black Panthers Is Started in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, June 1 (UPI) Thirteen Black Panther party members, including the former deputy defense minister, Elmer Pratt, went on trial today on charges that included conspir acy to murder Los Angeles police officers.

title: Shattuck Meeting Delayed
description: The Shattuck Denn Mining Company said yesterday that its annual meeting, scheduled to reconvene today, had been further adjourned until next Wednesday pending certifica tion of a vote taken May 19 in Wilmington. Del., on a slate of directors. A dissident group backed by Willard La Morte, former president, has been try ing to unseat management.

title: JOHN MUNDY DIES; MET OPERA AIDE
description: John Mundy, former orches tral manager of the Metropoli tan Opera Company, died Sat urday in Santa Margherita, It aly. He was 85 years old.

title: Nixon, Drugs and the War
description: In his news conference last night, President Nixon said it was important to keep the problem of drug addiction among American troops in Vietnam in perspective. His Administration, he said, was concentrating on getting at the sources of drugs in the world, that it was going to prosecute the drug pushers, treat the drug addicts and try to inform the American public on the general problem of drug ad diction.

title: An Appraisal
description: The roaring success en joyed by Andrew Wyeth and his son Jamie infuriates a coteri of American artists and critics who, while they may be at one another's throats on other subjects unite to bay like a pack of frustrated wolves without coming with in snapping distance of the Wyeths' heels. At the same time, Andrew Wyeth can boast the en thusiastic allegi ance of a larger public than has ever before pledged fealty to an Ameri can artist, with Jamie com ing up strong as heir appar ent to a dynastic crown first worn by his grandfather, N. C. Wyeth, the illustrator of adventure classics.

title: RANDALL BARTON
description: GRANADA, Spain, June 1 (AP)Randall Barton, produc tion manager of Phoenix (Ariz.) Newspapers, Inc., died today of bronchial pneumonia. He was 55 years old and was the son of the late advertising man and United States Repre sentative, Bruce Barton.

title: Nixon Aide, 2 in Congress Talk of a Compromise
description: WASHINGTON, June 1  A key official of the Nixon Ad ministration and two leading Congressional Republicans in dicated today that they were willing to compromise in the interests of obtaining enact ment, this year, of some form of revenue sharing.

title: Miami Weather Again Dry; Public Urged to Save Water
description: MIAMI, June 1 (UPI)Dry weather has returned to Miami, and, according to the National Weather Service, that means more of South Florida's worst drought in history.

title: 2,000 Rail Cars Ordered
description: The Southern Railway an nounced yesterday it had placed orders for 2,000 new freight cars costing about $33 million. Of the total, 1,400 are standard 70ton general pur pose box cars to be built by Pullman Standard, a division of Pullman, Inc. The remaining 600 will be 100ton opentop hoppers, to be built by the Greenville Steel Car Company at Greenville, Pa.

title: Eurodollar Rates Climb As Central Banks Move
description: PARIS, June 1The cost of borrowing dollars from the $50 billion reservoir outside the United States rose sharply to day as monetary authorities pulled off a squeeze play against those who sold the dollar short in the recent cur rency crisis.

title: SchoolStudy Contract May Go To ExSuperintendent Donovan
description: Chancellor Harvey B. Scrib ner has recommended, despite some admitted misgivings, that the Board of Education award a $96,000 contract to a concern headed by former Superinten dent of Schools Bernard E. Donovan for an evaluation of the city's More Effective Schools program.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Ceausescu Gets Big Peking Welcome
description: PEKING, June 1  Premier Chou Enlai welcomed President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania to China on a state visit today and praised Rumania for op posing bigpower chauvinism, an allusion to the policies of the Soviet Union.

title: Soviet Defense Ministry Warns On LetUp During Arms Talks
description: MOSCOW, June 1  The So viet Defense Ministry news paper warned today that only by maintaining a powerful mili tary force could the Soviet Union insure continued peace. It specifically cautioned against any slackening in military de velopment while efforts were made to reach armscontrol accords with the West.

title: AGNEW DEPLORES MEDIA PARANOIA
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 Vice President Agnew said to day that attempts to portray the Government as anxious to control or suppress the news media in the United States can only backfire, compounding the credibility problem faced by journalists.

title: Antiwar Veterans Are Labeled Irresponsible by Rival Group
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 Representatives of a new group called Vietnam Veterans for Just Peace said today that they were angered and dismayed by the irresponsible protests of a relative handful of antiwar veterans in the capital last April.

title: JERSEY EXTENDS BAN ON DUMPING
description: TRENTON, June 1A strin gent law that requires most of New Jersey's sewage sludge and industrial wastes to be dumped 100 miles out into the Atlantic Ocean was signed to day by Gov. William T. Cahill.

title: After Year Terry's Jazz Band Resumes Its Weekly Sessions
description: Clark Terry's 17piece jazz band, which has been inactive for almost a year, reassembled Monday night at the Half Note, at Spring and Hudson Streets, for the first of a series of Mon day night appearances there that will be a continuation of the weekly sessions the band held for two years at the Club Baron in Harlem.

title: BUS SAFETY BELTS SOUGHT BY BOARD
description: The National Transportation Safety Board urged the Federal Highway Administration yes terday for the third time to require installation of seat belts or other restraining de vices for passengers on inter state buses.

title: DOW IS UP BY 5.84 IN SLOW TRADING
description: The stock market, which a spent the month of May in fairly steady decline, opened June with a bounce yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:On May 20 at hearings before the Senate Subcommittee on the Environ ment, Roger C. Herdman, M.D., of the New York State Department of Health reported on the case of Mrs. N.Y.

title: SUMMIT MEETING ON TAN PACKAGE CALLED UNLIKELY
description: ALBANY, June 1  Another summit meeting between Gov ernor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay over the Mayor's pro posed New York City tax pack age is highly unlikely, Rocke feller administration sources reported today.

title: Advertising:
description: Schaefer's one  beer  to have campaign, which many advertising professionals con sider the best in the beer business, is finishing its 10th year and still going strong.

title: The Proceedings In the U.I. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Argentine Town Is Raided
description: SANTA FE, Argentina, June 1 (UPI)Fifteen armed guer rillas attacked and took over the town of San Jeronimo in the northeast today, robbing a bank of $50,000 and taking 30 weapons from the police. The guerrillas fled with a policeman as hostage.

title: Labor Council Opens A NewVoter Drive Focusing on Youth
description: A voterregistration drive aimed particularly at 18to21 yearolds was started yesterday by the New York City Central Labor Council at a meeting in the Commodore Hotel.

title: Israel Sentences 9 Palestinians
description: GAZA, June 1 (Reuters)An Israeli military court in this oc cupied city today imposed pris on sentences ranging from 20 years to life on nine officials of the Popular Front for the Lib eration of Palestine.

title: Man in the News
description: He took 12 credits a semes ter until this spring, when he took 16. He had time for symphonies. Time for his family. And time, as well, once each week, to fly to Hawaii and back, as a full time pilot for a major airline. And he acts as if there's nothing to it. It's been thor oughly pleasura ble, he says. I did it because I wanted to. There's one in every class, and in this year's class at Colum bia University's School of General Studies, the one is Charles Norman Eggert.

title: INJUNCTION RIGHT WIDENED BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Supreme Court gave?? judges broad ?? to issue antistrike ?? against railroad and?? unions that fail to make ?? reasonable effort to?? disputes before going on ??.

title: Russian Lifts a Record
description: MOSCOW, June 1 (Reuters) Alexander Kolotkov of the Soviet Union set a world weightlifting record in the middleweight division today when he pressed 359.35 pounds.

title: PRESIDENT GIVES HIGHEST PRIORITY TO DRUG PROBLEM
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 President Nixon pledged to night to undertake a na tional offensive to counter the problem of drug addiction among young Americans, in cluding servicemen who have become addicted while in South Vietnam.

title: Bengal Is the Spark
description: Tariq Ali, a Pakistani radical who has been active in British leftwing student circles, turned up recently in Calcutta, where he was reported encouraging secessionist tendencies in both West Bengal and East Pakistan with the aim of promoting a united socialist Bengal.

title: Agnew to Attend Seoul Fete
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (Reu ters)Vice President Agnew is to represent the United States July 1 in Seoul at the inaguration of Chung Hee Park for another term as President of South Korea, the White House said today.

title: Parisians Fighting a Plan to Demolish Les Halles
description: PARIS, June 1A new pro test has arisen over official plans to tear down the great iron umbrellas of Les Halles this summer to make way for a subway station.

title: A.B.C. President in Hospital
description: Leonard H. Goldenson, presi dent of the American Broad casting Company, suffered a mild coronary occlusion early Saturday morning at Columbia Presblyterian Medical Center, where he was undergoing a medical checkup. His condition was described as good yester day by his physcian, Dr. Dana Atchley.

title: Plea for Miss Bacon
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 1 (UPI)Attorneys for Miss Ba con asked the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit to overturn her con tempt of court sentence in Seattle for refusing to answer questions about the bombing of the United States Capitol.

title: BROTHER OF PREMIER IS OUSTED IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 1Informed sources said tonight that Tran Thien Khoi, brother of Premier Tran Thien Khiem, had been removed as chief of the National Customs Investigation Division.

title: Washington Notes
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 The White House has come up with its own black caucus to counteract the 13 black Democrats in the House of Representatives who arc pro fessing unhappiness with President Nixon's commit ments to civil rights and the poor. Whether the development of the coun tercaucus was spontaneous or by White House de sign is hazy, but the group's first undertaking is clear: to bring pressure on the National Broadcasting Company into giving three Negro officials from the Nixon Administra tion equal time on the Meet the Press program.

title: High Court Upsets AntiLoitering Law In a 54 Decision
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Supreme Court ruled 5 to today that cities cannot make it a crime for small groups of citizens to loiter in an annoy ing manner in public places.

title: Printing Merger Ruled Illegal
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI) In another ruling, the Su preme Court held unanimously today that the 1955 merger of the nation's two largest printers of Sunday comic strips was il legal.

title: 11 Colombian Ministers Quit To Make Reshuffle Possible
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Tune 1 (Reuters) Eleven ministers almost the entire Colombian Cabinet, resigned tonight in an apparent move to enable Presi dent Misael Pastrana Borreso to carry out a reshuffle and settle differences within his coalition Government.

title: Nixon Signs Law to Allow Change in Bearer Securities
description: WASHINGTON. June 1 (AP) President Nixon signed today a bill authorizing the Secretary of the Treasury to replace for their owners lost or stolen United Slates bearer securities prior to their maturity. The present law permits replace ment only at or after maturity.

title: Merchant Marine Subsidy
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) President Nixon signed to clay a bill authorizing an addi tional $80million for merchant marine operating subsidies.

title: The Gifts At Shower For Tricia
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI)Not all the guests gave practical kitchenware at Tricia Nixon's wedding shower today. There was a filmy white negligee with white feathers from an old family friend and a white and gold French telephone from Martha Mitchell.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Thank you for your recent editorial questioning Governor Rockefeller's plan to expand Stewart Air Field into a fourth major passenger jetport for metropolitan New York.

title: LONDON SET TO OPEN 2,000BED CAMP SITE
description: LONDON, June 1 A vast camping site for 2,000 tourists will open in three weeks in West London to cope with the record influx of young visitors expected here.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WHO is Harry Hellerman and why is he saying those terrible things about me?Advt.

title: JERSEY TRIAL TOED ABOUT KICKBACKS
description: NEWARK, June 1A New York construction company vice president told a Federal jury today he had paid kick backs to public officials in Jersey City and Hudson Coun ty to do business.

title: MAY SALES ROSE AT RETAIL STORES
description: Despite rain and cool weath cr, business was brisk last month at major New York de partment stores. Sales volume rose nine per cent in downtown stores and went ahead by 12 per cent in their suburban branches in the area.

title: Year Later, Peru Still Battles Quake Damage
description: YUNGAY, Peru, May 31 One year after the worst earthquake in Peru's history, more than 20,000 families are still living in provisional shelters in the disaster area, and many communities are still digging out.

title: Wadkins Is Victor in Golf; Hyndman, Chapman Lose
description: CARNOUSTIE, Scotland, June 1 (AP)Lanny Wadkins, the 21yearold United States Ama teur champion, established himself as a strong contender for the British Amateur golf championship today with a re sounding triumph while several older countrymen were elim inated.

title: Museum of Modern Art Slates 40 American Musical Movies
description: A retrospective series of 40 pioneer American musical films, termed the first of its kind, will start a sevenweek engagement on June 17 at the Museum of Modern Art. Included in the collection, titled The Roots of the American Musical Film, 1927 1932, are 20 features that have not been shown pub licly in 40 years.

title: Reinhold Niebuhr Is Dead; Protestant Theologian, 78
description: The Rev. Reinhold Niebuhr, the Protestant theologian who had wide influence in the worlds of religion and politics, died last evening at his sum mer home in Stockbridge, Mass., after a long illness. He was 78 years old.

title: PENSION REJECTED BY A STATE PANEL
