description: ALBANY, June 1  A fact finding panel has rejected a proposal by a state Civil Serv ice union that would make its retirement benefits similar to those recently negotiated be tween New York City and Dis trict Council 37, the union rep resenting the bulk of city em ployes.

title: Theater: Charlie Brown
description: You're a Good Man, Char lie Brown opened way off Broadway on St. Marks Place in 1967, and became a sur prise hita surprise even though the musical's basis was Charles M. Schulz's phenomenally popular Pea nuts comic strip.

title: Graduates Hail and Hiss Ramsey Clark
description: Ramsey Clark told graduat ing students and their parents at Brooklyn College yesterday that things aren't working well in America any more ... and human attitudes and insti tutions have to change.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW ADVANCES
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday in quiet trading.

title: Heroin Plan Scored Anew
description: Graham S. Finney, head of the city's Addiction Services Agency, has sent a confidential memorandum to Mayor Lind say expressing strong reserva tions about a proposal to ad minister heroin doses to se lected addicts as part of a re search program in rehabilita tion.

title: Boy, 11, Killed in Fire In a Bronx Apartment
description: An 11yearold was killed in a fire in a Bronx apartment building early this morning.

title: JOHN RAYMOND RAFTER
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., June 1 John Raymond Rafter, a lawyer specializing in customs law, died at his home here today of a heart ailment. He was 86 years old and lived at 65 Dur ham Road.

title: ROBERT P. SMITH
description: LONDON, June 1 (Reuters) Robert P. Smith, chairman of Burmah Oil Company, died at his home near here yesterday. He was 68 years old.

title: KENYATTA WARNS AGAINST PLOTTERS
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, June 1 President Jomo Kenyatta said today that Kenya could not al low her stability and progress to be destroyed by a few mis guided people with foreign ideas about changing the law ful elected Government of the people.

title: Defiant Avowal of Zionism by Jewish Nurse Is Described in Soviet Account of Trial of Four in Riga
description: MOSCOW, June 1I am a Zionist! a young Soviet Jew ish woman defiantly told a Riga court last week, accord ing to an official account of the case that reached Moscow today.

title: Construction Spending Shows Rise
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (Reuters)Total new con struction spending rose 2.3 per cent, or $2.3billion in April to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $104.5billion. This reversed March's $400 million downward revised rate of $102.2billion, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Mrs. Robb to Do 2 Reports On Miss Nixon's Wedding
description: Linda Bird Johnson Robb, oldest daughter of former Pres ident Johnson, will be a special guest on the Columbia Broad casting System's news cover age of the June 12 nuptials of Tricia Nixon and Edward Cox.

title: Extra Penny Is Taxing to City Shoppers
description: It was grumble, grumble, grumble plus an occasional rumbling curse as New York ers began paying the in creased sales tax yesterday, an extra penny on the dollar.

title: Morehouse Is Told to Reject Slogans Based on Blackness
description: ATLANTA, June 1 (UPI)  Negro college graduates should reject slogans based on black ness alone and shun Back to Africa movements, tricky handshakes and Muslin names in seeking careers, said John Aker, former Sierra Leone dele gate to the United Nations, in a commencement address at Morehouse College today.

title: Harness Track Group Cites OTB for Drop at Yonkers
description: ALBANY, June 1 (AP)  Off track betting is cutting into Yonkers Raceway attendance and resulting in a loss of $102, 780 a week in parimutuel rev enue to the state, the harness tracks council said today.

title: Franklin Simon and Korvette Heads Resign
description: It was a day for resignations in some topexecutive circles yesterday.

title: JOHN J. M'NAMARA
description: John J. McNamara, a real estate operator in Suffolk Coun ty for the last two decades, died at his home in St. James, L.I., on Saturday. He was 68 years. old.

title: COPPER FUTURES SHOW A DECLINE
description: Copper future prices drop ped yesterday on the Corn piodity Exchange (Comex) here in moderate trading.

title: Miles Graduates a White
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., June 1 (UPI)  Jill Louise Jensen of Troy, Ohio, who said she feared being the first to do some thing, has become the first white person to be graduated from predominantly Negro Miles College. Miss Jensen, who majored in sociology, was one of 143 students who received bachelor degrees yesterday dur ing commencement exercises at Miles.

title: Dance: Danish Ballet Offers a Rarity
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, June 1The 23d Royal Dan ish Ballet Festival in Copen hagen is presenting many works of interest but one is a supreme novelty that is now just 100 years old and has not been seen for more than two decades, August Bour nonville's The Life Guards on Amager Point. This is a Bournonville gem, rare, old fashioned, and, above all charming. Of all romantic choreographers, Bournonville had the most delicacy and the most feeling for places and people.

title: The Wedding Cake: White House Chef Explains Mrs. Nixon's Recipe
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)Tricia Nixon's wedding cake will be a White House extraganza, six tiers high, towering more than 6 feet tall and weighing more than 350 pounds.

title: N.Y.U. CITES JACQUES AS ATHLETE OF YEAR
description: Mike Jacques, New York University's first allAmerica wrestler, was honored last night as the school's outstand ing athlete for the 197071 sea son. He was also the first ath lete of his sport to receive the Alumni Trophy, which was pre sented to him at N.Y,U.'s ath letic awards dinner at the Uni versity Heights campus in the Bronx.

title: 2 Youths Tell of Their Discussions With Girl in Bombing Inquiry
description: DETROIT, June 1Two radi cals, subpoenaed to appear be fore a Federal grand jury here on Thursday, have described in interviews their encounters with Leslie Bacon, who has been jailed for refusing to an swer questions before a Fed eral grand jury in Seattle that is investigating the bombing of the United States Capitol.

title: PRICES ADVANCE IN BOND MARKETS
description: Corporate bond prices climbed yesterday as the re covery that began a week ago continued intact. Yet the ad vance wasn't robust enough to prevent a $160millitin offering of Sperry Rand debentures scheduled tomorrow from being cut to $100million.

title: Fund to Aid Theatergoers
description: A fund to buy summer thea ter tickets for distribution to persons who cannot afford them has been established by the Council of Stock Theaters and George Barrie, president of Faberg. Each sponsor already has contributed $2,500 to the fund to be known as The Straw hat Circuit Fund.

title: Jersey Woman Dies at 100
description: BERKELEY HEIGHTS, N. J., June 1Mrs. Edith A. Kilpat rick, who reached her 100th birthday on March 16, died on Sunday in her home at 912 Mountain Avenue. She was the widow of John A. Kilpat rick, a private detective. Sur viving are 3 daughters, Ruth, Mrs. Constance E. Tilson and Mrs. Edith Williams; 7 grand children and 11 greatgrand children.

title: A Drug Lesson From the Japanese Book
description: The action that the physi cians and pharmacists in Hunt ington, L. I., took yesterday to restrict the use of ampheta mines reflects what Americans are now learning about this form of drug abusea lesson that the Japanese learned about 25 years ago.

title: Tufts Adds Minority Aides
description: MEDFORD, Mass., June 1 (AP)Tufts University reported today that it had added 35 mi nority group workers and 26 women to the university staff since Jan. 1. The gains followed student protests alleging a lack of minority workers on campus construction projects.

title: Haiti: A Cri de Coeur
description: It has been the Mephisto Dance for about fourteen years. The ceaseless dance of death upon the misfortune of the Haitian people. Dance of blood, dance of fire.

title: LAVERNE HANOVER DRAWS NO. 1 POST
description: YONKERS, June 1It was 10:15 A.M., time to make the post position draw for Friday night's $100,000 Martin Tanan baum International Pace at Yonkers Raceway. Pete Ava lone, the presiding judge, shuf fled the eligibility papers like a Las Vegas dealer and Car mine Abbatiello, appearing more like a Mississippi river boat gambler than a topflight driver, shook the dice in the leather pill box.

title: Bill Creating Adirondacks Unit Stalled by Upstate Opposition
description: ALBANY, June 1Governor Rockefeller's proposed legisla tion creating a state agency to oversee the development of the sixmillionacre Adirondack Park may be dead for this session because of the opposi7 tion of upstate legislators, ap parently stirred by pressure from land developers.

title: Couple Slain in New Jersey; Hunt On for Shotgun Killer
description: MONTVILLE, N. J., June 1 (AP)A manhunt began throughout northern New Jer sey today for a man suspected in the shotgun deaths of a young couple, the police said.

title: A Busing Plan for 45,000 In Nashville Filed by H. E. W.
description: NASHVILLE, June 1 (AP) A Federal integration plan for Nashville that would require busing almost half the school system's 95,000 pupils was filed today in United States District Court.

title: CYAMOME, $16.40, MONMOUTH VICTOR IN TRACK OPENING
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., June a Monmouth Park opened un der sunny skies but with an unseasonable chill today.

title: Roundup: Pirate Pitching Is Hot
description: All's right in Pittsburgh. The hot Pirate pitching staff hasn't allowed a run in 30 innings, Willie Stargell leads the National League in hom ers, Roberto Clemente is bat ing over .300, the bench is producing and Dock Ellis is winning and talking to news men again.

title: Notes on People
description: Hoping to be the first pilot to fly over the North Pole from Equator to Equator in a light plane, Sheila Scott flew off from London yester day in her Piper Aztec, first stop Nairobi.

title: TALK WITH SOVIET DENIED BY ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, June 1  Is raeli spokesmen formally de nied today reports from Scan dinavia that Premier Golda Meir had met secretly with high So viet officials, during a private weekend visit to a remote hunt ing lodge in Finnish Lapland, less than 100 miles from the Soviet border.

title: Hilliard Jury Selection
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 1 (UPI) Jury selection for the trial of David Hilliard, Black Panther chief of staff, on charges of attempted murder got under way today after Judge William J. Hayes refused a defense mo tion to disqualify the prose cutor. A preliminary jury of eight whites, three blacks and a Chinese was seated. But chal lenges could later change its composition.

title: HUSSEIN ACCUSED BY PALESTINIANS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 1 Palestinian commandos today accused the Government of King Hussein of setting the stage for another civil war in Jordan, and called on all Arab governments to intervene to stop the new slaying of our people.

title: 30,052 See Blue Defeat Yanks On SixHitter at Stadium, 52
description: The welladvertised appear ance of Vida Blue at Yankee Stadium last night produced two imposing results: a crowd of 30,052 and a 52 victory for the Oakland Athletics, the 11th completegame victory of the season for the exciting left hander.

title: GearMaking Machinery To Be Shipped to Soviet
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., June 1 (AP)Gleason Works, a manu facturer of gearmaking ma chinery, said today it had been granted export licenses to ship $22.5million in equipment to the Soviet Union.

title: In Belfast, Joblessness And a Poisonous Mood
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land, May 30The men stay in bed until 2 P.M. because it saves the cost of a meal.

title: Market Place: Trusts' Results Held Appalling
description: His name is Jesse L. Liver more Jr. He's the son of the late plunger, the Massachu setts farm boy who made and lost several fortunes over a celebrated career in Wall Street.

title: Big Stores Start Unit Pricing, but Few Buyers Notice
description: After a twoyear battle be tween the Department of Consumer Affairs and mem bers of the food industry, unit pricing went into effect in all the city's large supermar kets yesterday.

title: Gold Mining Aid Urged
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI) Two California Congressmen joined today in introducing leg islation intended to revive the nation's gold mining industry with the help of Federal subsi dies. Representatives Harold T. Johnson, Democrat, and Don H. Clausen, Republican, would set up a Gold Mines Assistance Commission to handle payments to the industry.

title: An Appraisal
description: CHADDS FORD, Pa., June 1Nine new paintings by Andrew Wyeth, never before seen in public, will help open a new museum, converted at a cost of a million dollars from a centuryold grist mill.

title: Revolutionary Committees Insure Discipline in China
description: PEKING, June 1At Peking's heavy electric machinery plant, Wei Chingshen, the 50yearold chairman of the Revolutionary Committee that runs the big factory, listened patiently as a young woman worker criticized his record.

title: CREDITORS REBUFFED ON NOTE FROM I.O.S.
description: Creditors of the King Re sources Company tried to col lect $8million on a note due yesterday from Investors Over seas Services, Ltd., but were re buffed at both the Bank of New York and the First Jersey Na tional Bank in Jersey City.

title: MEROLA CHARGES EDITING OF DATA
description: The Lindsay administration was accused yesterday of cen sorship and editing of raw budget data sought by the City Council for its use in try ing to pare the budget.

title: BIG BOARD STUDIES STOCK OWNERSHIP
description: The New York Stock Ex change disclosed yesterday that more than half the population of the United States holds stock indirectly through insurance companies and other financial institutions.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The natives are getting restless and the rumbles discontent keep growing louder. Clete Boyer of the Atlanta Braves lashed out at management with such uncompromis ing vigor and venom that he talked his way off the ball club. Alex Johnson of the California Angels, the angry young man who won the American League batting championship last year, went from the generality of being at war with the world to the specifics of going to war against team, teammates, manager, management, everyone. He wants out.

title: Nassau St. Mall Called Success
description: The city's deputy trans portation administrator yes terday adjudged the five block pedestrian mall in the financial district a total suc cess and said that another block there might be closed to midday traffic.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The letter by Steven Schreiber (May 24) represents an intriguing kind of thinking about income taxes. To avoid New York tax increases for the more numerous middleincome workers, he makes two proposals:

title: Do We Need the States?
description: LONDON  With characteristic in sight, de Tocqueville claimed that he had never been more struck by the good sense and practical judgment of the American people than in the man ner in which they elude the numberless difficulties resulting from their Fed eral Constitution.

title: Gardiner Symonds of Tenneco Is Dead
description: HOUSTON, June 1 (AP) Gardiner Symonds, chairman of the board of Tenneco, Inc., died of a heart ailment today in Methodist Hospital. His age was 67.

title: Bengali Refugees Fleeing CholeraInfected Camps
description: CALCUTTA, India, June 1 The number of cholera deaths in the refugee camps near the IndianPakistani border rose during the night to an official total of 900, and today thous ands of Bengalis began to flee camps in the Nadia district.

title: Marine's Plea Rejected In 5 Slayings in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)The Supreme Court re jected today an appeal by a young marine convicted of slaying five Vietnamese civil ians near Hue in 1968.

title: Bridge: 106 Squads Are Compening In Final Major Local Event
description: Play began last night in the Reisinger Knockout TeamofFour, with 106 squads competing in the most important New York team championship of the year. The Reisinger is the final regular event in the Eastern States Regional tour nament, which began last Friday at the New York Hil ton Hotel, but there will be two special onesession charity events next Sunday open to all players.

title: METS BEAT GIANTS ON 3RUN 2D, 54; MAYS HITS NO. 640
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 1 The New York Mets held Willie Mays to a walk, single and home run tonight as they defeated the San Francisco Giants, 54, and ended the Giants winning streak at five games.

title: Russian Prelate Urges Removal of the Curses on the Old Believers
description: MOSCOW, June 1A lead ing Russian Orthodox prelate has called for the removal of the church's 300yearold curses on the Old Believers, the Rus sians who refused to accept changes in Orthodox ritual and formed a major dissident group. There are believed to be sev eral million of them here.

title: A.T.&T. Sets 8% Yield On New Preferred Issue
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company set a $4 dividend rate on Its offering of 27.5 million convertible pre ferred shares to shareowners through subscription rights. This would be a yield of per cent or somewhat higher than the minimum of 7.75 per cent that had been reported unofficially last week.

title: SteelRiveted Pattern
description: Two things seem sure about all the 1971 negotiations between the United Steelworkers of America and employ ers in the four major sectors of the basic metals indus triessteel, copper, aluminum and cans.

title: POLICEMAN STABBED; YOUTH IS CHARGED
description: A patrolman was stabbed last night as he and his partner sought to break up what the police described as a gang fight that pitted blacks and Puerto Ricans against each other in the southeast Bronx.

title: C.C.N.Y. Graduates Hear Mrs. King
description: Mrs. Martin Luther King Jr., the widow of the civil rights leader, told graduates at the City College commencement ex ercises last night that they had become significant politi cal actors with amazing power to influence the course of so cieties all over the world.

title: U.S. Suits in South Charge Bias Against Black Teachers
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) The Justice Department moved today against school districts in Virginia and North Carolina that the department said had discriminated against black teachers during the process of desegregation.

title: Entries for Nathan Award
description: Entries for the 13th annual George Jean Nathan Award for drama criticism, a $4,500 prize, will close Sept. 15, it was an nounced by Manufacturers Han over Trust, administrator of the Nathan trust. Entry forms may be obtained from Manufacturers Hanover Trust, 350 Park Ave nue.

title: The Wrong Lesson
description: Teachers and school administrators have good reason to be concerned over the potential impact of threatened budget cuts on the schools. The fiscal meataxe is poised both against their own jobs and working conditions as well as against their pupils' education. Clearly, then, the city's educators have every reasonprofessional and personalto make the most emphatic appeals to Albany and to gather as much support for their battle among New Yorkers in general and parents in particular.

title: Hearing Refused in Bank Case
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (Reu ters)The Supreme Court re fused today to hear the appeal of a small bank in the state of Washington challenging the authority of state officials to set reserve requirements for state banks that were not members of the Federal Re serve System.

title: Wedding Held for Ann Thompson
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., June 1In the Helen Hills Chapel at Smith College here this afternoon. Miss Otis Ann Thompson, who was graduated from Smith on Sunday, became the bride of Jeffrey Horn, an instructor in Smith's French department. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. David W. Con nor, Roman Catholic chaplain at Cornell University and Rabbi A. Bruce Goldman, Jewish chaplain at Columbia University.

title: MASSIMO CAMPIGLI, PAINTED THE YOUNG
description: ST. TROPEZ, France, June 1 (UPI)Massimo Campigli, the painter, died after a heart at tack at his villa here Monday. He was 76 years old.

title: But Is It Fresh Meat? New Labeling to Tell
description: The city's Consumer Af fairs Department said today that effective July 4 all meat, fish and poultry sold in the city must be labeled as frozen, thawed or refrozen.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: NICOSIA, CyprusThere is some reason to hope Israel and Egypt will manage to arrange an interim settle ment this summer, pulling back Israeli troops and opening the Suez Canal, but there is no reason to hope such a first stage will soon be followed by formal peace.

title: Rock Band Sends Off Festival at Trinity Church
description: White and yellow helium balloons danced from the gates of Trinity Church at Broadway and Wall Street yesterday as a rock band in the churchyard blasted a sendoff to Trinity's third an nual festival.

title: MAINE STUDY CITES TIMBERLAND TAXES
description: PORTLAND, Me., June 1 Maine's timberlands have been underassessed for many years and, as a result, the state has been deprived of millions of dollars in revenue, a student group investigating the pulp and paper industry charged here today.

title: WITNESS IN SLAYING AGREES TO CUSTODY
description: The Brooklyn teenager being held as a material witness in the slaying of two policemen yesterday withdrew his plea for a writ of habeas corpus, after the police agreed to move him from Civil Jail, where he has been held in lieu of $50,000 bail, to an unnamed hotel or motel in Manhattan.

title: Reynolds Struck in Phoenix
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., June 1 (AP) More than 1,200 employees of Reynolds Metals Company's Phoenix plant went on strike over local issues today despite the national contract agree ment between Reynolds and the steelworkers.

title: Merger News
description: The North American Rockwell Corporation announced yester day that it would take control of the Collins Radio Company with its investment of $35 million in the company.

title: Crash Certain to Lead to Changes
description: About Motor Sports

title: Spending Plans for '71 Are Cut by Industry
description: WASHINGTON. June 1 United States industry has re vised downward somewhat its earlier announced plans for in vestment in plant and equip ment this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Queens Soldier Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Pfc. Alberto A. Ramirez of the Army, from Corona, Queens, had been killed in ??tion in Southeast Asia.

title: Saigon Denies Rout by Enemy at Snoul
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, June 2The South Vietnamese task force that withdrew from the eastern Cambodian town of Snout on Monday is still inside Cam bodia, a Saigon spokesman said yesterday.

title: DIGGING SUSPENDED IN COAST SLAYINGS
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., June 1 (UPI)Sheriff's deputies stop ped digging today along the banks of the Feather River, where they had excavated the bodies of 23 slain farm work ers in the last week, but kept looking for more grave sites.

title: Staff of N.E.A. Strikes, Assailing Bargaining Tone
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) Staff workers today struck the 1.1millionmember Nation al Education Association in a contract dispute over wages, vacations and job security.

title: Philadelphia's Palace Closes for Final Time
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 1 (UPI)  The Palace Theater, which once housed the book ing office for Al Jolson, Marie Dressler and Eddie Cantor, closed yesterday for the last time.

title: NOTE DATE MISSED BY PENN CENTRAL;$50Million Swiss Franc Debt Matured June 1
description: The Penn Central Company, the holding company that was the parent of the railroad until it went into bankruptcy, failed yesterday to meet the June 1 maturity of $50,250,000 of Swiss franc notes, which it had expected to be able to refund into 15year obligations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Outer City: Uneasiness Over Future
description: This is the fourth of five articles by correspondents of The New York Times on the growth, complexities and atti tudes of suburban America.

title: TV: Some Interludes for the Restless DialTwister
description: A holiday weekend at the shore. Rain. The television set. The little box does pro vide occasional compensa tions, even if only in reruns of movies with deliciously insipid plots. There is some thing atrociously comforting in watching Night and Day for the 17th time, in marvel ing at tall, handsome Cary Grant playing the diminutive Cole Porter and at Alexis Smith doing her familiar com mercial for the Good Woman.

title: Cubans May Release Hijacked Jet Today
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) The Pan American World Airways jetliner detained in Cuba for four days is expected to be allowed to continue its flight to Miami tomorrow.

title: Random House Gets Carey Prize, As the Publisher of Picasso 347
description: BOSTON, June 1Random House tonight received the CareyThomas Award for crea tive publishing in 1970 for its Picasso 3.17, a hook of Pablo Picasso's erotic drowings which sold less than 3,000 of the 10, 000 copies in print.

title: Cambodians Report Battles
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 1 (AP)  Cambodian troops guarding the eastern ap proaches to Pnompenh reported today they had killed about 200 North Vietnamese or Viet cong attackers in allday bat tles in the marshes on the eastern bank of the Mekong River about 5 miles from the capital. The current fighting is for tiny patches of high ground that are above areas that are expected to be flooded soon by monsoon rains.

title: Offtrack Betting Starts Today on Stakes
description: To the surprise of nobody, Canonero II will be the early 65 favorite when offtrack betting on the Belmont Stakes opens here today at noon.

title: U. S. Comments on Pullout
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) Jerry W.Freidham, the Pen tagon spokesman, said today that the South Vietnamese had intended to withdraw some main combat units from Cam bodia with the onset of the rainy season. The withdrawal, he said, appears from here to be orderly and according to their plan.

title: SALEM CAPTURES JUMPER LAURELS
description: DEVON, Pa., June 1Salem, a mount who changed careers late in life, demonstrated to night that at the age of 13 he still could jump with the best of them.

title: HENRY D. COHEN, 95, WAS ACTIVE ZIONIST
description: Henry D. Cohen, a delegate to the 1910 Zionist convention in Pittsburgh, died Monday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 95 years old and lived at 201 West 16th Street.

title: TRUDEAU'S LIBERALS LOSE A HOUSE SEAT
description: OTTAWA, June 1The Lib eral party of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau lost one of House of Commons seat in four federal byelections yester day.

title: Hartford Is Deadlocked on Budget
description: HARTFORD, June 1With only eight days remaining be fore mandatory adjournment of the Connecticut General As sembly, neither a state budget nor a tax program has been agreed upon by the Republican Governor and the Democratic controlled legislature.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BOSTON, June 1 (AP)  A Federal district judge dismissed today a suit by Massachusetts. challenging the constitutional ity of the Indochina war, reject ing contentions that the Presi dent has usurped the warmak ing powers of Congress.

title: Philippine Leaders, Wary of Peking, Rule Out Hasty Approaches to China
description: MANILA, June 1Leaders of the Philippines regard Commu nist China's apparent new open ness toward the nonCommunist world with suspicion and are determined to make no hasty approaches toward Peking.

title: Envoys Guests of Thieu At Army Fete in Forest
description: FIRE BASE HOABINH, South Vietnam, June 1 With monsoon rains batter ing the palm leaves atop the dining hall of this fire base, President Nguyen Van Thieu, the American Establishment and diplomats gathered here this afternoon for an anniver sary luncheon  South Viet nam's 21st Infantry Division was 12 years old.

title: Vote on Housing Tribunal Issue Likely in Legislature This Week
description: A decision on whether hous ing violations will continue to be handled in the courts or be transferred to an administra tive tribunal within the City Housing and Development Ad ministration is expected to be made by the Legislature this week.

title: Executive Changes
description: The General Telephone & Electronics Corporation announced yesterday the election of Merle W. Kremer as president of GTE Sylvania, Inc., a subsidiary, effective July 1. Mr. Kremer presently is a senior vice president of GTE Sylvania with overall responsibility for the company's lighting products group. He will succeed Garlan Morse, who has decided to take early retirement after 35 years service. With sales of $816million in 1970, GTE Sylvania is the largest manufacturing subsidiary of the corpo ration. Mr. Kremer joined GTE Sylvania in 1955 and was appointed vice presi dent and general manager of the company's parts division three years later. He became a senior vice president in 1962 and was elected to his present position in 1969. Mr. Morse has been president since 1969.

title: The Anatomy of Lobbying Effort
description: ALBANY, June 1  Of the more than 15,000 bills that have been introduced since the State Legislature opened in January, very few managed to set off the avalanche of lobby ing caused by Assembly No. 7989A.

title: Charles Scofield, Salesman And Schenley Labor Aide
description: Charles Scofield, a sales ex ecutive for Schenley Industries who was widely known in the liquor industry, died on Monday at the Bayonne, N. J., Hospital after a brief illness. He was 71 years old and lived at 101 West 36th Street, Bayonne.

title: Traveling Mayors Hear of Seattle Woes
description: Seattle, June 1Mayor Lind say of New York led his travel ing troupe of mayoral lobbyists today to this citydescribed by its mayor, Wes Uhlman, as the unemployment capital of the United States.to build up support for Federal legisla tion that would give money to cities hiring unemployed workers.

title: 2 Sign for Simon Comedy
description: Peter Falk and Lee Grant have been signed to costar in Neil Simon's new comedy, The. Prisoner of Second Avenue, which will open Nov. 11 at the Eugene O'Neill Theater. Mike Nichols will direct.

title: Madagascar Plot Charged
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar, June 1 (AgenceFrancePress) President Phili bert Tsiranana said here tonight tha tthe Sec ond Vice President, Andr Resampa, was under detention. Earlier today the President an nounced that he had dismissed Mr. Resampa and accused him of connivance in a plot backed by an unidentified im perialist power.

title: MAYDAY ARRESTS UPHELD BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, June 1In the sharpest news conference exchange since he assumed of fice, President Nixon praised tonight the behavior of District of Columbia police during the recent Mayday antiwar pro tests and said charges that con stitutional rights had been vio lated by the mass arrests were an exaggeration.

title: DELAY SEEN IN START IN U.S.CHINA TRADING
description: HONG KONG, June 1A leading Britishbusinessman said today that it would take time for the establishment of trade relations between the United States and China.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE CONSENT OF THE GOVERNED and Other Deceits. By Arthur Kroch. 309 pages. Little, Brown. $8.95.

title: Mrs. Abzug Opens Drive for 51st State
description: Representative Bella S. Ab zug, charging that New York City was in bondage to the state government in Albany, announced yesterday a cam paign to make the city the 51st state.

title: Western Electric's Move to New jersey Reported Firm
description: READINGTON TOWNSHIP, N. J. Despite a continued reluctance on the part of the Western Electric Company to comment, it now appears that the company plans to move a large portion of its corpo rate headquarters from New York City's financial district to a 440acre rolling, grassy tract here in the historic hunt country.

title: Mrs. Priest's Son Killed
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June (UPI)Roy Priest, 29yearold son of State Treasurer Ivy Baker Priest, and Robert Rose, 25, of Sacramento were killed and three other persons were injured yesterday in the colli sion of two speedboats on Steamboat Slough about 20 miles south of here. Mr. Priest was public affairs officer for the State General Services De partment. Mrs. Priest is a for mer United States Treasurer.

title: GEORGE KNEASS DIES; LONGTIME BANKER
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 1 George Bryan Kneass, who re tired in 1962 as senior vice president of the Philadelphia National Bank, died of a heart attack in his sleep today. He was in his early seventies and lived on Waverly Road in sub urban Gladywne.

title: McGovern Has Surgery
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP) Senator George S. McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, was resting comfortably after surgery today at Georgetown University Hospital to correct a minor hernia, his office said.

title: Owner Is Ready to Accept Bid, Win or Lose
description: Rumors that Canonero II had already been sold for amounts up to $4million were squelched yesterday morning by Pedro Baptista, the owner of the frisky Venezuelan colt who will be seeking a Triple Crown sweep on Belmont Stakes Day Saturday.

title: Ali, Ellis to Fight July 26 At the Houston Astrodome
description: Muhammad Ali, the former heavyweight champion of the world, and Jimmy Ellis, the former World Boxing Associa tion champion, will meet in a closed  circuit television fight in the Houston Astrodome July 26.

title: ROUSE PLAN LOSES ROUND TO LIBRARY
description: WASHINGTON, June 1  Speaker of the House Carl Albert lost a round today in his attempt to halt work on a new $90million Library of Congress building.

title: NADER FORMS UNIT TO SEEK DONATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 Ralph Nader announced today that he had set up a nonprofit corporation, Public Citizen, Inc., to raise funds for his vari ous consumer action and re search projects.

title: Economic Analysis
description: June marks the first anni versary of the bottoming out of the worst stock market plunge since the Depression. And, ac cording to Prof. Solomon Fabri cant of the National Bureau of Economic Research, we are now six months past the bottoming out of the 196970 recession. But is the recovery already running out of gas? The setback of the stock market in the last couple of weeks has reflect ed worries about the international monetary situ ations, about tighter credit and rising interest rates and about the danger of a secondary re cession.

title: Ampex Corp. Reduces Prices
description: The Ampex Corporation an nounced yesterday that it had reduced disc drive and tape drive prices to continue to provide customers with a price advantage over similar products manufactured by the Interna tional Business Machines Cor poration. Last week I.B.M. an nounced a price reduction on its equipment.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Curb Called First in U.S.
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., June 1 More than half of the licensed physicians and pharmacists in the Town of Huntington have agreed voluntarily to stop pre scribing and dispensing am phetamines except in two medically required instances.

title: Argentine Banks Resume ForeignMoney Activities
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 1 (UPI) Argentine banks have re sumed foreignmoney transac tions for the first time since last Thursday, when the Gov ernment ordered them closed following speculation that the peso would be devalued.

title: PENTAGON WEIGHS CUTBACK ON PLANE
description: WASHINGTON. June 1 Pop Pentagon officials are con sidering major changes in a contract for the development and production of a new Navy swingwing fighter, the F14, said to he beset by cost and technical problems.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 Supreme Court took the fol lowing actions today.

title: U.S. Aids Stewart Air Field
description: The Federal Department of Transportation said yesterday that it had given the Metro politan Transportation Author ity $192,629 to help pay for the preparation of a master plan for Stewart Air Field near New burgh, N. Y. Governor Rocke feller has announced plans to convert the former Air Force base into a major commercial jetport over the next decade.

title: Declines in Bond Interest Rates Forecast by Donaldson, Lufkin
description: Interest rates on longterm bonds are at or near their peaks at the present time, and should decline substantially by the end of the year, the investment firm of Donaldson, Lufkin and Jen rette predicted yesterday.

title: Copter Crash Kills 7
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, June 2 (AP)The United States com mand reported today the loss of two more Army helicopters and said one had crashed 24 miles northwest of Saigon, killing seven Americans aboard. It was one of the largest losses of life in a helicopter crash in recent months.

title: GULYAS CONQUERS RICHEY IN 4 SETS
description: PARIS, June 1He is the, George Blanda of tennis, the Pancho Gonzales of Eastern Europe, and today Istvan Gul yas, forever 39, knocked Cliff Richey out of the French open tennis tournament.

title: Barnard's New Alumnae Yell What They Now Want Out of Life
description: Barnard, '71. It was a class that en dured the most agonizing years of student discontent and the awakening women's liberation movementand was profoundly touched by both.

title: Coordinator Is Named For G.I. Drug Program
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)  Everett G. Hopson, a retired Air Force colonel, was named by the Defense De partment today to coordinate its policies and programs for curbing drug abuse in the armed forces. Roger T. Kel ley, Assistant Secretary of De fense for Manpower and Re serve Affairs, who appointed Mr. Hopson, is expected to announce a program later this week for better identify ing and treating G.I. drug ad dicts returning from Vietnam.

title: Hasidic Group Marks Its 100th Year
description: A onenight conference of ultraOrthodox Hasidic Jews of the Satmar movementa group named for the Austro. Hungarian town in which it was formedheld a 100th an niversary meeting in Brook lyn yesterday.

title: Black Academy of Letters Establishes Annual Awards
description: The establishment of annual awards for black authors was announced yesterday by the Black Academy of Arts and Letters, an organization com posed of 50 black artists and scholars.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: EVERY WEEK, more than 26,000 Jobs are advertised in The New York Times. See the Employment. Columns today.Advt.

title: Ribicoff Urges Broader Benefits in Administration Welfare Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, who tried unsuccessfully last year to help the Nixon Ad. ministration's welfare bill through the Senate, came out today for an extensive liberal ization that would add billions of dollars to this year's meas ure.

title: Advertising:
description: Just six days after an nouncing its split with N. W. Ayer & Son, the Alberto Culver Company has lost its other major agency, J. Walter Thompson.

title: Pop Festival to Begin June 24
description: The 1971 Schaefer Music Festival, which offers New Yorkers the top names in jazz, rock, blue and pop music for the nominal prices of $1 and $2, will get under way at the Wollman Rink in Central Park June 24.

title: Albany's Unfinished Business
description: When the State Legislature resumes its session today following the Memorial Day recess, it will confront a sizable amount of unfinished business. Much of it concerns the City of New York: its budget, the admin istration of its rent control and housing code enforce ment programs, the conduct of its elections.

title: Paying the I.L.O. Debt
description: President Nixon in his news conference last night put himself unequivocally on the side of ending the disgrace ful default of United States payments to the International Labor Organization. Unfortunately, however, he coupled his plea for Congressional action with a warning that continued American support for the I.L.O. would go down the drain if the world labor agency did not mend its ways in greater conformity with the complaints of George Meany.

title: KRETCHMER GIVES. SPEECH AT HUNTER
description: Jerome Kretchmer, the city's Environmental Protection Ad ministrator, called on the 136th graduating class of Hunter Col lege yesterday not to abandon hope for social change because the efforts of the youth cul ture or the counter culture in the nineteensixties had not yet brought such reforms.

title: White House Displeased By Aluminum Increases
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The White House described Presi dent Nixon today as disap pointed by yesterday's wage and price increases in the alu minum industry and cautioned the steel industry not to follow the pattern set by the alumi num companies.

title: Two Ukrainians Bow in a Concert Here
description: The doubledebut concert is not, unfortunately, rare enough; the equation most often encountered at these hybrid affairs is: Nothing multiplied by two equals nothing. So, it came as a dou bly pleasing shock on Mon day night at Carnegie Hall to be introduced to two impor tant artists, both overdue to be heard here. Dmytro Hnat iuk and Oleh Kryssa.

title: MasseyFerguson Earnings Fell During Quarter and Six Months
description: A continuing strike of MasseyFerguson, Ltd., plants in the United States that began March 22 primarily was respon sible for the sharp decline in earnings for the second quar ter and the half year ended April 30, A. A. Thornbrough, president of the company, dis closed yesterday.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: Following is a transcript of Presi dent Nixon's news conference in Washington last night, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Fire Destroys Queens Plant
description: A threealarm fire last night destroyed a vacan former rug cleaning plant at 1438 33d Ave nue in Astoria, Queens. One fireman suffered a minor injury.

title: Perseverance Promised
description: PARIS, June 1 (AP)  Lock heed will keep trying to get its Tristar program operating even if Congress does not ap prove a loan guarantee, the company's president, A. C. Kotchian, said today. He was interviewed at the Paris Inter national Air Show.

title: Oil Spill Hot Line Due
description: BOSTON, June 1 (AP)  The Coast Guard said today that it would step up its work against offshore oil spills with the help of a new citizen telephone hot line and a laser device that can tell where an oil spill is located and what kind it is.

title: U.S. OPPOSES SUIT ON WELFARE COSTS
description: The Federal Government moved yesterday to dismiss Mayor Lindsay's suit to have mandated welfare costs de clared unconstitutional.

title: French Newsmen Protest Alleged Beating by Police
description: PARIS, June 2  Relations between the French police and newspapermen here, never very friendly, have sunk to a new low as a result of the charges that a journalist was beaten Saturday.

title: The Outer City: Growth Turning Into a Menace
description: SANTA ANA, Calif. Growth, the snowballing, leap frogging growth that for so long held out to the suburbs the promise of an endlessly prosperous future, has sud denly developed into a shad, ow across that future.

title: Time as a Park's Foe
description: The State Legislature now seems determined to drag its session on into next week, thus nudging New York City's budget deadline under the law requiring the City Council and Board of Estimate to act on the Mayor's proposed budget by next Tuesday. About all that can be said for this Albany delay is that it makes available time for the consideration of other things. It does, for example, give Governor Rockefeller a few more days which to win support for an Adirondack Park agency, project that has assumed extra urgency in recent weeks.

title: Russians Berate the U.S. On Recent Mideast Moves
description: MOSCOW, June 2  The Soviet Union today sharply criticized recent efforts by the United States to promote a Middle East settlement and to improve relations with Egypt.

title: Freed Turkish Girl Is Feted
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, June 2 (Reuters)  Sibel Erkan, the 14yearold girl who was res cued yesterday after being held by terrorists for 50 hours, was released from the hospital to day. She then attended a lunch eon in her honor at the head quarters of her father's army unit, where she met and thanked the officers and men who helped rescue her.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The public should be alerted to op pose a bill pending in the State Legisla ture that would change the method of apportioning delegates elected at the primary to party judicial district con ventions.

title: PETER BARON, BEGAN FLANNEL BAG FIRM
description: Peter Baron, founder and president emeritus of the Accu rate Flannel Bag Company, died on Tuesday at St. Joseph's Hos pital, Far Rockaway, Queens. He was 79 years old and lived in Far Rockaway and North Miami Beach, Fla.

title: For Greek Democracy
description: Distinguished citizens of nine NATO countries have organized what they call the EuropeanAtlantic Action Committee on Greece in an effort to help end the mili tary dictatorship and restore democracy in the land of its birth. Their initiative could not have come at a better time.

title: Bronx College Graduates Urged to Aid Communities
description: In a 10minute address that was interrupted six times by applause and cries of Right on!? Dr. Edyth J. Gaines, pio neer in African and AfroAmeri can studies here, urged graduating students at the Bronx Community College yes terday to place their educa tion and technical skills at the disposal of their communities. Your diplomas will open doors and give you options that were not yours before, Dr. Gaines said, adding:

title: A PETITION IS FILED AGAINST SHEFFIELD
description: Three major creditors yester day filed a petition in Federal Court in New York to force the Sheffield Watch Corpora tion into a state of bankruptcy.

title: F.T.C. CHALLENGES BORDENA. & P. PACT
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion challenged today on com petitive grounds a 1965 milk supply agreement between Bor den, Inc., and Chicago stores of the Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, Inc.

title: Court Limits State Inquiry Of Abortion Agencies Here
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice ruled yesterday that the records and books of four com mercial abortion referral agen cies subpoenaed by the State Attorney General should not contain the names and addresses of women who sought or ob tained abortions through their services.

title: Fanny May Sets Special Auction To Cut Overhang of Mortgages
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 The Federal National Mortgage Association announced today a special auction next week aimed at reducing or eliminat ing the overhang of mortgages in the hands of mortgage bank ers that has been acting as a depressant on market prices.

title: 2 Seoul Colleges Halt Classes
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June (Reuters)  The two largest colleges of Seoul National Uni versity suspended classes in definitely today after riot policemen fired dozens of tear gas shells in a twohour battle with stonethrowing protesters. The immediate grievance of the protesters was the arrest of nine students earlier this year.

title: New Peking Envoy Presents His Credentials in Prague
description: PRAGUE, June 2 (Reuters) China has completed one phase of its efforts to restore, its relations with Eastern Eu rope by appointing a new am bassador to Czechoslovakia.

title: A $5BILLION PLAN TO PROVIDE JOBS IS V0IED BY llOSE
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  Democrats pushed through the House today their own pro gram of public service jobs for the unemployed, dealing Presi dent Nixon's special revenue sharing plans a severe blow.

title: ROCKEFELLER TURNS TO KEY DEMOCRATS IN TAX DEADLOCK
description: ALBANY, June 2Trying to break an impasse over the pro posed tax package for New York City, Governor Rockefel ler made his first overtures to day to Democratic legislative leaders in what could be an ef fort to put together a biparti san coalition to approve $450 million in city tax authoriza tions.

title: Yanks Halt Siebert Streak, 61;
description: For the second time in three days, the New York Yankees ended a distinguished pitcher's winning streak when they de feated Sonny Siebert and the Boston Red Sox, 61, at Yankee Stadium yesterday.

title: Bridge: Top 11 Players Draw Byes In 2d Round of Reisinger
description: There were no major up sets in the firstround of the Reisinger knockout team championships that ended yesterday morning at the New York Hilton. The four player event, the feature of the Eastern Regionals, will move into the round of 32 tonight, but no upsets were possible in the second round last night since the top 11 teams drew byes.

title: Cholera Deaths Reported
description: KRISIINAGAR, India, June 2 (Reuters)More than 1,000 East Pakistani refugees have died from cholera in the last six days in the Nadia District of West Bengal state, district of ficials said today.

title: 4 Here Accused of Making Fake Jobless Claims
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn announced yesterday the arrest of four men charged with cheating the State Division of Employment out of more than $250,000 in fraudulent claims over a five year period.

title: Bronx Landlady, 63, Found Dead in Rooming House
description: A 63yearold woman, who was partowner of a Bronx rooming house, was found dead yesterday in the rooming house with a bullet wound of the body, a rope around her neck and a pillow over her head.

title: Ballots Are Being Counted In Teachers Union Vote
description: The Honest Ballot Associa tion yesterday began counting ballots in the United Federa tion of Teachers' current elec tion for officers, executive board members and delegates to the convention of the Ameri can Federation of Teachers.

title: Criticize Yves Saint Laurentand It Hurts His Mother
description: PARIS  Mrs. Lucienne Saint Laurent, mother of the designer, Yves Saint Laurent, says she felt the fashion crit ics were too harsh on her son's winter showing and that their reaction saddened her. But these days she's been feeling a lot better.

title: Columbia Seeks New Cabinet
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 2 (AP)  President Misael Pas trana Borrero set to work to form a new cabinet today with political groups friendly to his administration. All his minis ters except one resigned last night. The crisis was a result of a division in the National Front, a coalition of the Liberal and Conservative parties that has been ruling Colombia since 1958.

title: NICODEMUS WINS WITH CHAPOT UP
description: DEVON, Pa., June 2Mrs. L. B. Cobb's Nicodemus won the preliminary jumper class at the Devon horse show to day, and most of the riders in the event asked:

title: Jack Fields Dead at 63; ExTextile Manufacturer
description: Jack H. Fields, a former tex tile manufacturer and a leader in Jewish activities in this city, died Tuesday at Kingsbridge Veterans Hospital, the Bronx, after a long illness. He was 63 years old and lived in the Beacon Hotel, Broadway at 75th Street.

title: Soviet to Aid Bolivia on Oil
description: MOSCOW, June 2 (Reuters) The Soviet Union has agreed to give Bolivia financial and technical aid in oil prospecting, it was announced here today.

title: Bomb Threat Stops Tappan Zee Traffic
description: NYACK, N. Y., June 2  Traffic was backed up for more than six miles on both sides of the Hudson River this evening when the Tappan Zee Bridge was closed for a little more than an hour be cause of a bomb threat. The call was made to a toll booth shortly after 6 o'clock.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Pan Amer ican and Sabena cut the cost of air plane tickets to Europe the other day, but only for students.

title: The Great Cake Controversy
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) If you're wondering whether that wedding cake is going to pan out for Tricia Nixon and Edward Finch Cox, you'll just have to wait until June 12. The White House reversed itself to day and said the recipe would not be tested again in advance.

title: Mayor Continues His Attack on Albany
description: Mayor Lindsay said yester day that Albany was provoking massive public outrage here be cause it made a travesty of the city's calamitous finan cial plight.

title: Fear Is Steady Companion Of Many Harlem Residents
description: There have been times when Mrs. Pauline Withers, a mother of five who lives in one of the worst crime areas in the city, has been so afraid walking home after dark that she has talked to herself.

title: WARCRIMES FIGURE DESCRIBES THREAT
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) Lieut. Col. Anthony B. Her bert said today that a military investigator had tried unsuc cessfully to stop him from fil ing warcrimes charges by threatening to accuse him of assault in an alleged massacre of civilians at Bongson, South Vietnam.

title: Volpe Favors Concorde Visit
description: PARIS, June 2 (AP)John A. Volpe, the United States Secre tary of Transportation, said to day he would do everything possible to get authorization for the BritishFrench Concorde to make a demonstration flight to New York.

title: Why Infallibility?
description: TUBINGEN, West GermanyEven theologians are not born martyrs. Why then should one have written a book he knew would bring him more un pleasantness than gratification?

title: Relative of Bilbo Seeks A Negro Running Mate
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 2  Robert D. Ladner, a relative of Theodore G. Bilbo, an anti  Negro politician of the nineteenthirties and forties, announced today his candi dacy for Governor and said he had asked Charles Evers, a Negro, to run for Lieutenant Governor on his ticket.

title: Clark Opposes Big Prisons
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP)  Former Attorney General Ramsey Clark said today that prisons with more than 100 in mates should be closed. The very size of large prisons, he said, dehumanizes them. Tes tifying before a House Judiciary subcommittee, he called for a broad range of correction re forms.

title: Stamps Used for Change in Indian Coin Shortage
description: NEW DELHI, June 2  in India these days, anyone who volunteers his thoughts for a penny may wind up getting a post card instead.

title: SAIGON ASSEMBLY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, June 3The lower house of the South Vietnamese National Assembly today passed a controversial bill on presi dential election rules that could leave President Nguyen Van Thieu with no serious chal lenger in the election next October.

title: PRICES ON AMEX UP IN ACTIVE DAY
description: The American Stock Ex change posted its best gain in twoandahalf months yester day as the list advanced in steppedup trading.

title: Market Place: Investment Fees For Small Man
description: Leonard M. Heine Jr. is a husky  voiced investment manager in his middle 40's who Made more than $100, 000 a year for many years before he came to the con clusion that the little guy wasn't getting a fair shake in Wall Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Air Photography Used
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., June 2 (UPI)A light plane equipped with infrared photographic equipment made several passes today over the peach orchards where the 23 victims had been found.

title: JERSEY REFORMER NAMED IN PAYOFF
description: NEWARK, June 2An auto mobile dealer told the Federal Court jury in the Jersey City corruption trial today that he had paid a kickback 10 years ago to the man now leading the city's reform movement.

title: Bettors Pour It on Canonero
description: Offtrack support for Can onero II in the Belmont Stakes was so heavy here yesterday that special $50 win tickets may have to be printed.

title: Allied Chemical Raises Prices on Nylon Fibers for Floor Coverings
description: The Allied Chemical Corpo ration announced yesterday that it had raised prices on all nylon staple fibers for floor coverings, effectively immedi ately.

title: New Rule on Judge Urged
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., Democra of Virginia, proposed today a consitutional amend ment to require Senate recon firmation of all Federal judges every eight years, He charged that too many of them had assumed powers reserved to other branches of Government.

title: HUSSEIN ADAMANT AGAINST FEDAYEEN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 2 King Hussein of Jordan today ordered his Government to be firm with the Palestinian com mandos, whom he accused of seeking power rather than the liberation of Arab territory oc cupied by the Israelis.

title: HOUSE PANEL COOL TO FUND SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  The Nixon Administration, in the person of Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally Jr., formally presented its general revenuesharing program to Congress today and ran into criticism from every point on the political compass.

title: Dennison Declines to Run Again for Suffolk Executive
description: CENTEREACH, L. I., June 21 Suffolk County Executive H. Lee Dennison announced today that he would not seek reelec tion to a fourth fouryear term as the county's top elected of ficial.

title: Personality, Off Form, Retired From Racing
description: Personality, the 3yearold champion in 1970 who has been far off form this year, was retired from racing yes terday.

title: Annulment Procedure to Change
description: ROME, June 2 (UPI)Vatican sources said today that Pope Paul would allow local Roman Catholic courts around the world greater freedom to nul lify Catholic marriages.

title: BOOK BAN IS EASED BY QUEENS BOARD
description: District School Board 25 in Flushing, Queens, voted last night to adopt a compromise proposal modifying its ban on the book Down These Mean Streets from student libraries.

title: Dr. Silverman Bride Of Dr. Samuel Siris
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., June 2  Dr. Ethel Martha Silverman and Dr. Samuel Gidding Sins were married here today at Congregation Emanuel by Rabbi Aaron Blumenthal.

title: Bill for Jury Duty at Age 18 Introduced by 3 Senators
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) Legislation to lower the age for Federal jury duty from 21 to 18 was introduced in Con gress today.

title: Russians Go to a Lecture And Speak Their Minds
description: MOSCOW, June 2A ques tion period after a lecture this afternoon provided an oppor tunity to hear ordinary Soviet citizens speak their minds on problems of the day.

title: U.S. Looking at Service Contracts Here
description: An investigation of compa nies in this area that sell future services on a contractual ba sis, such as correspondence schools, computertraining pro grams and health clubs, was announced here yesterday by the Federal Trade Commission.

title: Nixon Talks to Scouts
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) President Nixon told 2,000 Explorer Scouts today not to lose faith in their country. There are things wrong, he said, but, in changing what's wrong, don't destroy what is right. The senior Boy Scouts, holding their annual Presi dent's Congress in Washington, toured the White House at the invitation of the President.

title: GULF & WESTERN STEPS UP PROFITS
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., increased earnings in the third fiscal quarter by 20.8 per cent and 8.5 pr cent for the nine months ended April 30 over the corresponding periods a year ago, according to figures issued yesterday by the diversified industrial com pany. The results were ex ceeded only by the second highest earnings in 1967 and the record posted in the 1968 periods.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  Assistant Secretary of the Treasury Murray L. Weidenbaum, a principal architect of President Nixon's revenuesharing plan, says the Administration now is openminded about the details of the program. This bid for a compromise was echoed by other Republican spokesmen, but it is not yet clear how far they will be willing to go.

title: A Witness Fails to Identify Suspect in Capital Slaying
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) A Government witness picked out a policewoman, not Heidi Ann Fletcher, in a lineup held today to determine the identifi cation of a young woman who may have participated in a holdup that ended with a po liceman shot to death, The Washington Post reported.

title: Cab Fleets Weigh CreditCard Plan And Group Riding
description: The city's ailing taxi industry is studying proposals for group riding, the use of credit cards and assignment of special theater district dispatchers as part of a plan to recoup losses and win new riders.

title: Train Hits Woman in Bronx
description: An elderly unidentified wom an was struck by a Hudson Division Penn Central train at about 5:35 P.M. yesterday just south of the Mount St. Vincent station in the Bronx. A railroad spokesman said that the woman had been lying on the tracks. The woman was taken to Ford ham Hospital where her condi tion was described as highly critical.

title: Notes on People
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner and his wife were divorced yesterday. Mrs. Bar bara Cavanagh Wagner ob tained an uncontested degree on grounds of abandonment. Terms of a financial settle ment were not made public.

title: Dr. Rolla E. Dyer, ExDirector Of Institutes of Health, Is Dead
description: ATLANTA, June 2 (AP)Dr. Rolla E. Dyer, an expert on dis eases who served for many years as director of the Nation al Institutes of Health, died to day. He was 84 years old.

title: Would Welcome Soviet Ties
description: OSLO, Norway, June 2 (Reu ters)  Mrs. Meir said at a news conference here before returning home today that Is rael would welcome renewal of diplomatic ties with the Soviet Union. Relations were broken off by Moscow during the Arab Israeli war in 1967.

title: Albany Backs U.S. Amendment Lowering the Voting Age to 18
description: ALBANY, June 2.  Both houses of the Legislature voted swiftly and overwhelmingly today to ratify the proposed amendment to the United States Constitution lowering the vot ing age from 21 to 18.

title: Melnyk Advances at Carnoustie But Wadkins Is Upset, 3 and 2
description: CARNOUSTIE, Scotland, June 2 (AP)Steve Melnyk, a 24 yearold former United States Amateur titleholder, scored an 8and6 victory over Andy Wightman of Scotland today in the third round of the British Amateur golf championship.

title: NEW LAW LOOMS ON BRANCH BANKS
description: The long battle for statewide branch banking in New York should end this week. Informed observers of the Legislature in Albany said yesterday that a key political compromise which was worked out in be hindthescenes negotiations over the long holiday week endcould well clear the way for favorable action by the As sembly tomorrow and thereaf ter by the Senate.

title: Murphy Not Invited to Talks on Police Slayings
description: WASHINGTON, June 2New York City's Police Commis sioner, Patrick V. Murphy, said today that he had not been in vited to a White House meet ing scheduled for tomorrow on killings of policemen.

title: BANK BANDITS HERE FLEE WITH $170,000
description: Three young gunmen and the driver of a getaway car escaped with $170,000 in currency yes terday after holding up the Baisley Park branch of the Na tional Bank of North America, at 152.80 Rockaway Boulevard, in the Springfield section of Queens.

title: Museums Are Urged to Widen Scope
description: DENVER, June 2R. Buck minster Fuller, the archi tect, engineer, mathemati cian, poet, dreamer and downtoearth tinkerer, had a message today for the na tion's museums: Help save the human species from over specialization, or else.

title: CONNECTICUT FETE STIRS ARGUMENTS
description: MOODUS, Conn., June 2 The Connecticut House of Rep resentatives was having one of its most hectic days of the 1971 session in Hartford today, with mandatory adjournment seven days away.

title: Gaku Troupe Offers 3 Becalmed Dances In Riverside Series
description: Painters study a single sub ject under a variety of aspects routinely but successive ballets closely following that method are a relative rarity. Richard Gain has enterprisingly choreo graphed a fascinating group of duets titled Becalmed I, II, HI, the last of which was shown for the first time Tues day evening by the Sophie Maslow/Gaku dance companies at the theater of Riverside Church.

title: West Germany Rebuffs Poland on the Future of Radio Free Europe, Hints Station Will Stay in Munich
description: WARSAW, June 2West Germany has told Poland that Radio Free Europe's broadcast ing license has been renewed automatically until July, 1972.

title: Books of The Times
description: HESS. The Man and His Mission. By J. Bernard Hutton. Introduction by Airey Neave. 262 pages. Illustrated. Macmillan. $6.95.

title: Dancing to Glenn Miller
description: When Harry James's or chestra appeared last month at Barney Google's, the one time rathskeller on East 86th Street, he played a concert sessionthat is, no dancing and there was some moan ing that there was, apparent ly no place in New York where as celebrated a dance band as Mr. James's could be heard in its proper setting, in front of a floor full of dancers. But now, it turns out, there is such a place. And, ironically, it is next door to Barney Googles  another former rathskeller, the Lorelei, 223 East 86th Street.

title: Personal Finance
description: In June parents and other relatives of teenagers think about summer jobs for the children and graduation gifts. There are tax advantages worth remembering in both categories.

title: A Changing L. I. Is Opposed to Change
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., JUNE 2 The sign HEMPSTEAD PLAZA, advertising a new sixstory apartment develop ment, was hammered into place six months ago on the corner of a vacant lot in Hempstead Village. Within a week, the de veloper, Samuel J. Lefrak, had letters from 700 families want ing to know how to rent one of the $150 to $350 a month apartments.

title: Judge Criticizes DoGooders As Harmful to Judicial System
description: State Supreme Court Justice Michael Kern lashed out at dogooders yesterday, naming specifically Kingman Brewster Jr., the president of Yale Uni versity, as he sentenced a con victed murderer to serve 25 years to life in prison.

title: No Light on Mayday
description: President Nixon did little in his news conference remarks on the arrest and prosecution of the Mayday demonstrators in Washington to clarify the difficult issues in that controversy.

title: AJAX, AMSTERDAM, WINS SOCCER CUP
description: WEMBLEY, England, June 2 (Reuters)Ajax of Amsterdam, the Netherlands, playing fast, attacking soccer, scored a 2.0 victory over Panathinaikos of Athens, Greece, with a goal in each half of the European Cup final tonight.

title: BREW TOPS SANOK IN GOLF PLAYOFF
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., June 2 Bill Brew, assistant athletic di rector at Quinnipiac College in Hamden, Conn., won the 33d annual Hochster invitation tournament by beating Chet Sanok on the second hole of a suddendeath playoff at the Quaker Ridge Golf Club today.

title: A.T. &T. to Move Some Offices Out of City to Jersey Property
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company disclosed yesterday that it was planning to move part of its general office in Manhattan to a rural, wealthy area in Bernards Township, N. J.

title: Rail Strike Is Blocked
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 2 (UPI) United States District Judge Daniel H. Huyett issued today a temporary injunction against a threatened strike of the Penn Central Railroad in a dis pute over the cancellation of free train passes for employes using Amtrak facilities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times
description: Sweetfaced, sadfaced Jimmy Ellis was always made smaller than life by Muhammad Ali's patronizing ways: This here's my sparring partner, Jimmy Ellis. After I get through with the heavyweight title, I might give it to him. Ellis would nod and smile and it was very easy to believe, for a very long time, that he was just another homeboy in the champ's train. After all, they went back to a day when 13yearold Cassius Clay, swim trunks and raggedy tennis shoes under one arm, looked over 15year old Jimmy Ellis in boxing shoes and asked him if he was fighting that night in Louisville's amateur show called Tomorrow's Champions. Ellis said he was and they walked to the arena together. Ah, drama! They were slated to meet that night! But Clay was 165 pounds, Ellis 149, and the bout was canceled. They did meet twice, however, as amateurs: Clay, heavier and more experienced, according to Ellis, won the first one; and Ellis, according to Ellis, easily won the second. Yesterday, in the Wooden Indian Room of the Americana; Ali said that Ellis ain't no home boy, he's an adversary, and a promoter soberly called their July 26 bout at the Astrodome the inevitable fight.

title: Stage: The Justice Box
description: The President of France has been assassinated and execution has been reinsti tuted. But the public execu tioner, Frechette, alias Mon sieur de Paris, has retired into bourgeois anonymity. The mysterious Le Dix, an opportunistic government op erative, enters Frechette's house carrying... The Jus lice Box (the title of the play that opened last night at Theater De Lys). which con tains the blade of the guillo tine.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WHO Is Barry Hellerman and why is he saying those terrible things about me?Advt.

title: Girl, 16, Man, 22, Found Dead From Drugs on Hospital Steps
description: A 16yearold girl whose older brother died of a heroin overdose several weeks ago was found dead early yesterday on the steps of a Queens hospi tal, her head in the lap of dead male companion. Both, the police said, had apparently died of overdoses of narcotics.

title: Germany Tightens Marks;
description: BONN, June 2West Ger many's central bank, anxious to reduce the inflationary ef fect of speculative foreign funds transferred to this coun try, decided today to increase by 15 per cent the commercial banks' reserve requirements on domestic liabilities.

title: FROEHLING BEATS ASHE IN FIVE SETS, GAINS SEMIFINALS
description: PARIS, June 2Frank Froeh ling, who was unable to get past the qualifying round in some tournaments last summer after ending a fiveyear retirement, upset Arthur Ashe in the quar terfinals of the French open tennis championships today.

title: Chess: Fischer Makes Exit Laughing In His Match With Taimanov
description: Baseball players call them laughers. A team will go out and score, say, eight runs in the first inning, and coast on in from there, looking like nine supermen playing sand lot kids. Also, they will have incredible luck: Everything they hit will fall in, and everything the other guys hit will be right at somebody. But on another day, they will be on the receiving end of the same kind of game.

title: Water Funds Sought
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) The Department of the Army has proposed a $2.3billion package of water resource proj ects for the 13state Appala chian region. One of the chief recommendations is to appro priate $16.7million to the Corps of Engineers to stop acid mine drainage in the Clarion River Basin in Pennsylvania.

title: Dollar Eases in Trading
description: BONN, June 2 (UPI)  The Bundesbank's offer to sell dol lars had little effect on money markets today.

title: Trading Pace Brisk In Preferred Stock And A.T.&T. Rights
description: Trading yesterday was brisk, as expected, in both the new preferred shares and subscrip tion rights of American Tele phone and Telegraph. Both were traded on a whenissued basis.

title: Con Ed's Big Allis, Under Repair Since Last July, Is Back in Service
description: Big Allis, Consolidated Edi son's millionkilowatt electric generator at Ravenswood, Queens, went back into service officially at 8 A. M. yesterday after a shutdown for repairs since last July 21.

title: Chinese Welfare Plan Seeks to Assure Minimum Living Standard
description: PEKING, June 2The Chi nese Government has put into effect a welfare system de signed to assure every family a minimum standard of living.

title: Deputy Waves Grenade
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 2The lower house of the Na tional Assembly was thrown into turmoil tonight when an antiGovernment deputy pulled a hand grenade from his pocket and threatened to blow himself up. He was protesting what the opposition viewed as an effort to push through a provision limiting the number of presiden tial candidates.

title: Nixon to Fly to Tulsa
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) The White House said today that President Nixon would fly to Tulsa, Okla., Saturday to take part in the dedication of the Arkansas River navigation. The project, authorized by Con gress in 1946, provides a navi gation channel from the Missis sippi River to Catoosa, Okla., 15 miles east of Tulsa.

title: Vietcong Announce Truce
description: HONG KONG, Thursday, June 3, (Reuters)The Vietcong com mand has ordered its forces to observe a 24hour ceasefire for the transfer of prisoners of war tomorrow, the Vietcong's, press agency reported today.

title: Allied Plant and U.S. Called Lax on Safety
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  Officials of the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union today accused the Labor De partment and the Allied Chemi cal Corporation of tolerating occupational hazards that a union medical consultant con tended had brought symptoms of chemical poisoning to scores of workers.

title: U.S. JUDGE DISMISSES 3 KENT STATE SUITS
description: CLEVELAND, June 2 (AP) United States District Judge James C. Connell dismissed to day suits amounting to at least $11million filed by parents of three Kent State University students slain in a May 4, 1970, campus disturbance.

title: New President Named by RCA
description: Three major corporations named senior officers and an nounced other executivesuite changes yesterday. The princi pal appointments were the fol lowing:

title: Senators Vote to Extend Program for Delinquents
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) A Senate subcommittee ap proved today a bill to extend for one year beyond June 30 a program of Federal grants to aid in the prevention and control of juvenile delinquency.

title: Arthur Morse, Author and Journalist, Dies at 50
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 2 (Reuters)Arthur D. Morse, executive director of the Inter national Broadcast Institute, was killed last night when the car in which he and three per sons were riding plunged into Lake Bled in northwest Yugo slavia. Mr. Morse was 50 years old.

title: Calley: A View From Saigon
description: SAIGON, South VietnamIt should be noted that the horrible massacre at Mylai was first brought to light by the Americans themselves. It was de nounced by American G.I.'s back from Vietnam and it was brought before American and world public opinion by the American press. Without them, the Vietnameseit is shameful and pain ful for us to admit it, with our poor means of communication and our re stricted free presswould never know of the Mylai massacre.

title: U.S. Used Billions of Leaflets in Indochina War
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 2The United States Army has printed during the Vietnam war 6,245,200,000 propaganda leaflets for air drops in Indochina.

title: NEW GROUP SEEKS TO KEEP BUSINESS
description: An organization of promi nent businessmen announced the start of a campaign yester day aimed at keeping major corporations from leaving New York City.

title: ALICE FARRINGTON
description: BALDWIN, L.I., June 2Miss Alice V. Farrington, secretary of the American Cocker Spaniel Club from 1950 to 1968, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital, Freeport. She was 88 years old and lived at 1750 Rockville Drive.

title: S.E.C. Aide Urges Shifts On Insurers' Mutual Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI) An examiner for the Securi ties and Exchange Commission has recommended that insur ance companies be given more flexibility in marketing the shares of mutual funds they un derwrite.

title: Nixon Said to Favor San Diego in '72
description: Campaign Notes

title: Advertising:
description: The odds are that before long hemorrhoid remedy commercials, absent for a de cade, will be back on tele vision.

title: Britain's Reserves Surge
description: LONDON, June 2  The Treasury reported today an other high in Britain's once denuded official monetary re serves. However, the inflow of funds has slackened from the pace of recent months. It was the eighth consecutive monthly gain.

title: Leslie Bacon Bail Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 2 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Cir cuit today gave the Govern ment until the end of the week to answer Leslie Bacon's re quest for bail. Miss Bacon is being held in Seattle on con tempt of court charges for re fusing to answer questions about the bombing of the United States Capitol March 1.

title: Voice FireAlarm Boxes Getting Test in Brooklyn
description: A dozen new firealarm boxes, which require the per son turning in an alarm to speak into the box instead of pulling a lever, have been in stalled in Central Brooklyn.

title: Fighting Reported at Pagoda
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, June 3 (Reuters) United States air strikes were called in yesterday as Government troops fought Vietcong forces near here for control of positions considered ideal for rocket attacks on the capital, military officials said.

title: HOUSE PANEL VOTES SUGAR ALLOTMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP) The House Agriculture Com mittee voted today to allot 62 per cent of United States sugar consumption to domestic pro ducers for the next three years.

title: Salinger Says Interloper Sat In At a Top Secret Meeting in '61
description: BOSTON, June 2A Seattle businessman inadvertently crashed a top secret White House meeting at the height of the Berlin crisis of 1961, Pierre Salinger, who was Pres ident Kennedy's press secretary, said today.

title: Syrian Christians' Protest On Jerusalem Circulated
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 2A protest from the leaders of eight Christian de nominations in Syria against the activities of the Israeli au thorities in Jerusalem was cir culated to all United Nations members by Secretary General Thant today at the request of the Syrian representative, George J. Tomeh.

title: Studebaker and Susquehanna In Pan American Sulphur Pact
description: Merger News

title: Senate Rules Committee Rejects a Move by G.O.P. to Raise Campaign Spending
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The Senate Rules Committee defeat ed today a Republican attempt to increase by 40 Der cent the proposed ceiling on radio and television spending for national and Congressional candidates in the 1972 campaign.

title: PENNSY WILL SELL 23 VALUABLE SITES IN MIDMANHATTAN
description: The trustees of the bankrupt Penn Central Transportation Company announced yesterday that they were offering for sale 23 parcels of land and several buildings in the heart of mid town Manhattan. This could re sult in the largest realestate deal by a single owner.
