description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 5Woody Greenberg won Etchells22 honors and Duke Dayton and Ward Codet were the winning Shields Class skip pers as tardy winds finally sent 51 Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound yachts through their paces today.

title: The Last Word: The Pulitzer NonPrize for Fiction
description: Grousing at the National Book Awards rose this year to a hubbuba sign that in spite of stumblebum procedures, some hilarious nominations and a general confusion of purpose, the N.B.A.'s at least arouse interest enough to be considered a scandal. Yet everybody slept right through the following news item, a few weeks later:

title: Local Team of 7 Women To Play in Griscom Golf
description: The Women's Metropolitan Golf Association is sending team of seven to play in the Griscom Cup matches on Fri day at the Brae Burn County Country Club, Newton, Mass.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  When First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. was judged guilty of participating in war crimes, a broad element of the public hooted at the justice of an army that brought lieu tenants to the dock but wouldn't treat a general that way.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Whereas I admire John Brooks's bravery in remount ing his motorassisted bi cycle after a nasty spill (Memoirs of a Bourgeois Hell's Angel in Bermuda, Travel section, May 16), he might want some suggestions for his next visit. After my bike accident, the desk clerk at my hotel had no interest in my brushburn or the broken blood vessel where my knee hit a stone wall. Therefore, I did not know that swimming with a brush burn was not recommended. I dabbed on the ointment that had been dispensed earlier by the apothecary in Sandy's Cay and headed for the water. The wound stung quite a bit at first, but the mar velous Bermuda water (both surf and cglorinateed pool) has very healing effects  if not on the wounded knee, then certainly on the wound ed psyche. At any rate, my knee bears no lingering scars.

title: Gardens
description: BETTER known in France than here is chervil (Anthriscus cerefolium), a small, pretty annual herb with rather lightgreen lacy leaves and tiny white flowers. Chervil's taste is very gooda subtle blend of pars ley, fennel or anise, and (so some think) tarragon.

title: AFGHANS' LEADER QUITS IN A DISPUTE
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, May 30 The Government of this re mote central Asian kingdom is in the throes of what passes in Afghanistan for a crisis.

title: Bear Killed to Save Man Who Put Arm Into Cage
description: A polar bear at the Central Park Zoo was shot dead by a policeman yesterday after the animal sank his teeth into the arm of a man who had reached into his cage.

title: Express Buses Called Success
description: The Transit Authority's ex press bus service from Man hattan's Upper East Side to Wall Street, now two months old, appears to be a big suc cess.

title: Elish Spurns Use of Gadgets for Disposal
description: For the last several years New York City's Sanitation Commissioners have tended to look to some future technology when they were asked how the city's mounting garbage prob lem was going to be solved.

title: So You Thought Ash Trays Were for Ashes and Hubcaps for Cars?
description: And now comes Ellen Liman, a liber ated decorator whose doyourownthing interiors are clearly going to give some people a case of the pip. She advocates dog leashes as window shade pulls, night stands made of orange crates and plastic laundry baskets as chandeliers.

title: FLORIDA BASKING IN SUNSHINE LAW
description: MIAMI, June 5Florida has finally begun to bask in the Sunshine Law, said one law yer here this week with satis faction.

title: Half Century Off the Curb
description: Newcomers to Wall Street are sure to hear oldtimers in the securities business refer to a trading market called the Curb and some it takes awhile to dis cover what they mean.

title: Patti Hogan, Dibley Win English Tennis Finals
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 5 (AP)  Patti Hogan won the women's title in the Northern grasscourt tennis tournament today by beating a fellow Californian, Kris Kemmer, 62, 36, 63.

title: HenleyonLake George Proves a Huge Success
description: BOLTON LANDING, N. Y. June 5The first rowing re gatta on Lake George this cen tury was held today. Lining the 2,000meter course was a color ful flotilla of about 200 boats, including the vintage Adiron dack ferry, the Mohican.

title: Napoles Regains Title He Loaned Out
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 5Billy Backus, Carmen Basilio's nephew, has his un cle's courage, if not his pugilistic skills. With Basilio in his corner, Backus was stopped for the first time in his career last night and shorn of the world welter weight title he had held only six months.

title: The Picasso Who'd Rather Be Called Just Paloma
description: She says she can't imagine being anyone else, and she wouldn't want to be. But the daughter of Pablo Picasso ad mits that sometimes the price is high.

title: Evidence Seen Growing in Police Shooting Here
description: The police evidence linking Richard Moore and Eddie Jo sephs, two of the 22 original defendants in the Black Pan ther conspiracy case here, to the machinegunning last month of two policemen on Riverside Drive probably will be presented to a grand jury this week.

title: China's 700 Million Are on the Way
description: PEKINGThe most important ques tion in China today is whether the Cultural Revolution, begun in 1966, motivated by the ideology and teach ings of Mao Tsetung, can deal effec tively with the political, economic and social problems of more than 700, 000,000 people in the world's most populous nation.

title: Barbara Berger Bride
description: OSSINING, N. Y., June 6 Miss Barbara Ann Berger and Dennis Arnold Davison were married here this afternoon. Dr. Matthew Spetter of the Ethical Culture Society in Riverdale the Bronx per formed the ceremony at the Hudson Hills Golf Club. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Ida Berger of Yonkers and Morey Berger of New York. Her husband's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Davi son of Hillsdale, N. J.

title: ROBERT P. BAYARD
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., June 6  Robert P. Bayard, former first vice president of the engineering firm of John son, Drake & Piper Company, died yesterday in Mercy Hospi tal. He was 76 years old and lived at 28 Amherst Court.

title: 3 Debuts Mark Tosca At Met's June Festival
description: The miniseason of two weeks of performances now being given by the Metropoli tan Opera is being called a June Festival, and on Satur day afternoon there was a genuine festival feeling in the big theater at Lincoln Center. Two major artists were mak ing their debuts with the company, and one taking over a role for the first time.

title: Study Indicates Practice Could Also Be Helpful for Other Nations
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Cer tainly for Canada, and possibly for other countries, a floating exchange rate for the nation's currency is the best way to avoid the problems of a world dominated by the United States dollar, a new study found to day.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, June 6  The following is a list loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Chilean Visits Pyongyang
description: HONG KONG, June 6 (Reu ters)A delgation of the So cialist party of Chile lead by the party secretary, Carlos Altamirano Orrego, flew into Pyongyang today for a visit at the invitation of North Korea's ruling Workers party, the North Korean Central News Agency reported.

title: Patman Says Some Banks Manipulate the Calendar
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) Representative Wright Pat man. Democrat of Texas, said this weekend that banks through calendar manipulation collect interest overcharges he estimated at $150million a year.

title: Goodwin to Be First Pick
description: CHICAGO, June 6 (AP)The Chicago White Sox, who have the No. 1 selection in the major league draft Tuesday, have an nounced that they would select Danny Kay Goodwin of Peoria, Ill., Central High School. Good win, 17 years old, is a 6foot2 inch, 195pound catcher.

title: Export Drive
description: A governmental offensive to stimulate exports, now under Administration study, could help strengthen the dollar if properly carried out. Peter G. Peterson, Presi dent Nixon's new assistant for international economic affairs, is right in arguing that the best way to spur exports abroad is to speed lagging technology and industrial growth at home. But this response to pay ments imbalances is unlikely by itself to reverse the present dollar outflow. If implemented incautiously, the export drive could even boomerang badly.

title: VIETNAM VETERANS PLAN AN INCURSION
description: ST. LOUIS, June 6 (UPI)  The Vietnam Veterans Against the War announced today plans for a limited incursion of Vietnam veterans into middle America for July 35 at Kan sas City, Mo.

title: Alexandria Mentschikoff Married
description: CHICAGO, June 6Miss Alexandria Mentschikoff and Joseph William Levedahl were married here this afternoon in the Russian Orthodox Church of SS Peter and Paul. The ceremony was performed by the Revs. Peter and Nicos Samkoff.

title: MURPHY SAYS F.B.I. BIDES CRIME DATA
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy criticized the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation yesterday for what he described as its exclusive monopoly on information concerning crime.

title: Danger Overhead
description: Two recent accidents involving construction derricks show that the battle for better enforcement of construc tion safety rules has been far from won. In the first of these mishaps, at 42d Street and Sixth Avenue, one worker was killed. In the second, only miraculously good luck prevented catastrophe when a seventon der rick with a tenton load of steel crashed from a height of eighteen stories into Second Avenue at 47th Street.

title: Italian Islanders Claim Victory
description: LIPARI ISLAND, Italy, June 6  The people of Filicudi Island rejoiced here tonight at news that the Italian Govern ment had agreed to remove the 15 reputed mafia leaders it had exiled to Filicudi.

title: LOCKHEED HEARINGS SET TO OPEN TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (Reu ters)Congress begins hearings tomorrow on whether the Gov ernment should step in to rescue the Lockheed Aircraft Corpora tion's multimilliondollar Tristar airbus project.

title: Takeshi A kasaka Dead at 70; A Steelmaker and Shipbuilder
description: TOKYO, June 6Takeshi Akasaka, president since 1963 of Nippon Kokan, leading ship builders and steelmakers, died of stomach cancer today in Keio Hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: 2,383 Have a Gaelic Time at Feis Here
description: Under contentious skies that threatened misfortune but did not deliver it, 2,383 young peo ple of Gaelic persuasion gath ered at Lehman College in the Bronx yesterday to compete in 179 contests of dancing, music and declamation.

title: Theater: Charlie Was Here Arrives
description: Dennis Turner's Charlie Was Here and Now He's Gone, which opened last night at the Eastside Play house, is a very unserious melodrama about a very seri ous subjectdrug addiction and drug pushing. It also has three execptionally well pro jected performances from Joe Morton, Rosalind Cash and Robert Guillaume in the lead ing roles.

title: SHINTO CONFLICT RENEWED IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, June 6  A high court ruling that Shinto cere monies sponsored by public bodies violate the constitu tional ban on state religions has reawakened controversy about Shintoism and about public attitudes toward reli gion in this country.

title: MRS. LILA B. HASSID, YIDDISH TRANSLATOR
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 6 Mrs. Lila B. Hassid, wife of Prof. William Z. Hassid, died here today after a long illness. Her husband is professor emeri tus of biochemistry at the Uni versity of California here. She was 76 years old.

title: Miss Lynne Dominick Wed to Drew C. Arena
description: DENVER, June 6  Miss Lynne B. Dominick, daugh ter of Senator and Mrs. Peter H. Dominick, was married here this afternoon to Drew C. Arena, a secondyear law student at the University of Colorado, who is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew T. Arena of Totowa, N. J.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 7, 1971

title: David Rockefeller Jr. Named
description: David Rockefeller Jr. has been elected president of the Rocke feller Family Fund by the board of trustees of the philanthropic foundation. He succeeds his father, who continues to serve on the board. A statement from the fund also announced other new officers: Mrs. Lionel R. Coste of New York, first vice president, and William J. Straw bridge Jr. of White Plains, N.Y., second vice president. The new president lives in Cambridge, Mass., and is development co ordinator of the Boston Sym phony Orchestra.

title: N.B.C. Promotes Walworth
description: The promotion of Theodore H. Walworth Jr. to president of the five National Broad casting Company television stations was announced here yesterday. Mr. Walworth has been vice president and gen eral manager of WNBCTV since 1961. He succeeds Ray mond W. Welpott, who is re tiring. The change will take effect July 1.

title: A Long Float for German and Dutch Currencies Seen Aiding Dollar
description: PARIS, June 6A Chase Manhattan Bank economist be lieves that the longer the West German mark and the Dutch giulder are left to float, the more entrenched the dollar will become as the currency in which the two countries do business together.

title: McCloskey Begins to Organize for Primary Campaign in New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N. H., June 6 Paul N. McCloskey Jr., the Re publican Representative who for several months now has been challenging his party and his President on the Vietnam war, started organization building in New Hampshire this weekend, and for some people here it seemed that history was repeating itself.

title: JAMES P. GREENWOOD
description: James P. Greenwood, a tour nament bridge player, died Saturday night of a heart at tack suffered as he was entering the Grand Baldwin (L.I.) Bridge Club. He was 60 years old and lived at 3214 Parsons Boule vard, Flushing, Queens.

title: Miss Meredith Kays Married To Peter Lauck Wellington
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., June 6 Miss Meredith Kays, a Wellesley graduate who plans to become a lawyer, was mar ried here this afternoon to Peter Lauck Wellington, an AndoverHarvard man who wants to be a policeman.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 116 Stricken at Wedding
description: LUDLOW, Mass., June 6 (AP) More than 116 members of a wedding party were treated at five greater Springfield hospi tals last night for food poison ing. Hospital officials said at least 72 persons had been af fected seriously enough to be admitted. The police said they were uncertain as to what had caused the attacks.

title: U.S. Industry Takes a New Look at India
description: There is a revival of inter est among American com panies in putting their in vestment dollars into India.

title: Mexico Takes 21 Cup Lead
description: MEXICO CITY, June 6 (AP) Mexico took a 21 lead over New Zealand today in the final of the Davis Cup North Ameri can Zone as Marcello Lara and Luis Garcia defeated Onny Parum and Geoffrey Simpson, 36, 62, 1210, 62, in doubles.

title: India, Seeking to Dent Poverty, Revamps Planning
description: NEW DELHI, June 6Five year planning is a dry and aca demic phrase for describing India's efforts to make a dent in the poverty that stultifies hundreds of millions of her peo pleand Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has decided that the plans themselves have been dry and academic and must be over hauled.

title: Violence Flares in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 6 (UPI)A series of bomb explosions injured at least eight persons in Belfast last night and early today, and Roman Catholic rioters clashed with British troops. One of the bombs blew out the front of a police station on Roden Street, in a Catholic area.

title: Columbia to Build Its Controversial Gym on Campus
description: Columbia University has found a site for the new gym nasium it has been seeking amid many tribulations since the turn of the century. It will be on campus, connecting with the old gym, and extending west to Broadway, south of 120th Street.

title: GettheGenerals
description: PINE BLUFF, Ark.One of the re percussions of the Calley trial is a move to GettheGenerals. Why punish a young lieutenant and let the brass go free?

title: New York, New York Set
description: New York, New York, an evening of poetry and prose directed by Paul Shyre, will be presented at Alice Tully Hall June 19 at 8:30 P.M. in place of the Joy Boutilier Dance Company, whose performance was canceled because of pro duction difficulties. Stephen El liott and Mine MacMahon will appear with Mr. Shyre.

title: Chess:
description: The Jamaica High School chess team, with a fine 18 5 gamepoint score, was the winner in the senior division of the annual team tourna ment of the New York In terscholastic High School Chess League, held here in March and April. Abraham Lincoln High School of Brook lyn was second, scoring 168, and there was a triple tie for third at 15.9  Sheepshead Bay and Erasmus Hall, both of Brooklyn, and Bronx High School of Science.

title: Miss Brown's 4:41.3 Snaps Mile Record Set Saturday
description: TACOMA, Wash., June 6 (AP)Doris Brown set an American record for the mile run today when she won the event in 4 minutes 41.3 seconds in the Northwest Women's Amateur Athletic Union track and field championships.

title: Kodes Wins French Open Tennis Title
description: PARIS, June 6  Jan Kodes, who is about as well known at Forest Hills as Willie Mays is in Prague, won his second straight men's title at the $95,000 French open tennis champion ships today. Evonne Goola going, a 19yearold partabo rigine, won the women's title.

title: Tom's Team Leads in Finals Bridge: Of Reisinger Tourney Here
description: The team of Merle Tom, Bob Ewen, Steve Goldstein, Jay Wendt and Fred Dossen bach, all of New York City, and Frank Mela of Great Neck, L. I., took a lead of 18 international match points into the second half of the Reisinger knockout team of four finals at the New York Hilton Hotel yesterday. Their oponents were Hal Fein of Eastchester, N. Y.; B. Jay Becker, Michael Becker, and Ralph Chafetz, all of New York City, and Andrew Bern stein of Knoxville, Tenn.

title: Seminar Honors CancerVirus Pioneer
description: WASHINGTON, June 6One of the pioneers in studying the link between viruses and cancer will he honored tomorrow in Barcelona while scientists throughout the world are mov ing rapidly toward vindication of his onceunpopular views.

title: Saigon Reports 83 of Foe Slain; Clashes Continue Near Border
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. June 6Sharp clashes between United States and South Viet namese forces and North Viet namese regulars continued to day around a Government base high above the main road be tween Khesanh and Quangtri, with a predawn enemy attack in which 83 Norh Vietnamese soldiers were killed, according to Government reports.

title: BRIDGE TOLL BILLS BEATEN IN ALBANY; FARE HELD PERILED
description: ALBANY. June 6The State Senate killed a bill today that would have permitted the New York City Board of Estimate to impose 23cent tolls on the four East River bridges.

title: Pact on City Taxes Hits An Instant Snag in Albany
description: ALBANY, Tune 6Legisla tive leaders ran into a snae today over a proposed New York City realestate tax in crease in their attempt to line up a bipartisan majority in the Legislature for a $525million city tax package.

title: Prisoner Hangs Self in Cell In Rikers Youth Shelter
description: A 22yearold man described by the Department of Correc tion as a drug addict hanged himself in his cell last night in the Adolescent Remand Shelter on Rikers Island, au thorities there said. The depart ment said he had been carried on its records as a 19year old youth with a false name as a nonaddict.

title: Ross, Van Nostrand Gain 3d Round of State Tennis
description: Steve Ross of Brooklyn, seeded second, and King Van Nostrand of Bay Shore, L.I., third, gained the third round of the New York State men's tennis championship yesterday at the North Shore Tennis and Racquets Club in Bayside, Queens.

title: Nuremberg: The Rebirth of a City
description: Arts Abroad

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Sheriff (sic) of New York to Retire
description: After nearly three decades on the job, John Joseph Mc Closkey will retire at the end of the month as the Sheriff of New York City, some thing of an expert on jokes about sixguns and horses and Whar's the posse for min'?

title: Article 5  No Title
William M. Ryan of A.S.P.C.A. Dead
description: William Michael Ryan, Spe cial Agent. No, 1 of the Amer ican Society for the Preven tion of Cruelty to Animals, died Saturday night in Columbus Hospital after a long illness, He was 78 years old and lived at 647 East 14th Street.

title: Article 6  No Title
Glitter Yields to Bitter in Hollywood Slump
description: HOLLYWOOD  Norman Stevans is a bit of old Holly wood. Since 1943 he has per formed in perhaps 2,000 movies (he has lost count) and maybe 1,500 television shows. He owns a house in fashionable Hollywood Hills. And his wardrobe, which he considers essential, com prises 35 suits, including three dinner jackets, a cut away and a set of tails.

title: Taiwan Reversing Stand on Textiles
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, June 6 (Reu ters)  Nationalist China has agreed in principle to sign a bilateral agreement with the United States on the export of Inoncotton textiles to the United States, informed sources said today.

title: Paris Mother's Day Protest
description: PARIS, June 6 (Reuters) About 250 women waved pans and dishes during a women's liberation demonstration today Mother's Day in France. The group shouted free contracep tion and abortion and double work, low pay, as it marched. A spokesman said they were protesting Mother's Day, as mask for the exploitation of women within the family.

title: DE LURY WARNS OF A WIDE STRIKE
description: John J. De Lury, president of the Uniformed Sanitation men's Association, warned yes erday that a general strike might be staged by public em ployes if mass layoffs resulted from an inadequate legislative tax package for the city.

title: Guerrillas Kill 2 in Gaza
description: TEL AVIV, June 6 (UPI) Arab guerrillas in the Israeli occupied Gaza Strip carried out two grenade attacks and shot two Arab men to death today in the second day of violence marking the anniversary of the 1967 Middle East war. The men apparently were suspected of having collaborated with the Israeli occupation authorities.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Soviet Blast Registered
description: STOCKHOLM, June 6 (AP) An underground explosion in the Semipalatinsk area of the Soviet Union was registered to day by the seismological insti tute at Uppsala University.

title: Mills Says He's Failed To Halt '72 Backers
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkan sas, said today that he had tried and failed to halt a move to gain for him the Democratic nomination for President. Nevertheless, he said, there's no way he could imagine the party nominating him.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Effort to Open Suez Canal Regains Momentum
description: CAIRO, June 6Efforts by the United States for an Israeli pullback from the Suez Canal and reopening of the waterway have regained momentum in the last few days after an interlude of frustration arising from con flicting EgyptianIsraeli condi tions.

title: Zender Defeats Spears On 2d Hole of Playoff
description: JOHNSTOWN, Pa., June 6 (AP)Bob Zender, a Chicago stockbroker, sank a 12foot putt on the second hole of a suddendeath playoff today to beat Rick Spears of Port Jervis, N.Y., and win the Sun nehanna golf tournament of amateur champions.

title: Legs Diamond Wins Jumpoff in Derby At Hollandia Show
description: ST. JAMES, L. I., June 6  Frank Andrea's Legs Diamond, the only one of the three horses in the jumpoff to score a Olean round, won the Hol landia Farm's jumping derby today.

title: New Wings for 1984
description: WASHINGTONWithout mention ing Southeast Asia, the Middle East or any of the other swords'points around the world, President Nixon declared the other day that Americans could look forward to a full generation of peace.

title: 20 Indians Seized In Treaty Protest At Mt. Rushmore
description: HILL CITY, S. D., June 61 (AP)National park rangers arrested a group of Indians who set up camp atop Mount Rush more National Memorial today to press demands that the Fed eral Government honor a cen turyold land treaty.

title: Fred Steinmark Dies
description: Freddie Steinmark, the de fensive back whose left leg was removed because of can cer six days after he and his University of Texas team mates had won the 1969 na tional football championship, died last night in Houston. He was 22 years old. Details on Page 36.

title: LOW $23MILLION ASKED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, June 6The chair men of the Legislature's two finance committees announced today a supplemental budget of $23.6million for the 197172 fiscal year, the lowest amount sought in seven years.

title: Zappa's Musicians Rock Through Epic Of Stylized Traveler
description: There is no good way of tell ing what the Mothers of Inven tion are up to. What Frank Zappa, the leader, has in mind at any particular time is inde terminate. The Los Angeles based rock group played Satur day and yesterday at the Fill more East and, rather than try an interpretation, I decided to make a list.

title: Muncey Takes Hydro Race 2d Time in Row
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Bill Muncey of Seattle, driving an unlimited hydroplane that had never raced until yesterday, won the President's Cup today for the second year in a row.

title: Personal Finance
description: Congress is taking a close look at revolutionary consum er legislation designed to pro vide meaningful Federal in come tax deductions in two major areas: college tuition expenses and automobile in surance premiums.

title: Oil Search Is Planned for Atlantic Shelf
description: COMMACK, L. I., June 6 A consortium of 33 oil com panies will be probing the At lantic shelf region for three months this summer seeking the sedimentary rock forma tions that may indicate hidden oil and gas deposits.

title: PUBLIC LAW FIRM VOTED ON CAMPUS
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 6 Students at the University of California here have voted to tax themselves to support a public interest law firm that will handle cases involving pol lution, consumer rights and civil liberties.

title: RYUN PLACES 10TH IN RILE ON COAST
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 5 (AP) Arne Kvalheim of Norway caught Steve Prefontaine of Oregon on the final curve and outsprinted him to win the mile in 3 minutes 56.4 seconds at the third annual Twilight track and field meet tonight at the University of Oregon.

title: M. I.T. Alumnus And Sally Lew Are Wed Here
description: Miss Sally Lew was mar ried here yesterday afternoon to RenHsin Charles Tsiang in the Fifth Avenue Presby terian Church Chapel. The Rev. Kenneth O. Jones per formed the ceremony.

title: G.I. GETS 3 YEARS IN DEATH OF MAJOR
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Monday, June 7 (AP)A 25 yearold Army enlisted man was sentenced today to three years imprisonment and a dis honorable discharge for killing one of his officers and trying to kill another.

title: Japan Demands End of Tests
description: TOKYO, June 6 (Reuters) Japan today renewed her de mand for immediate suspension of French nuclear tests at Mururoa in the Pacific. Tsutomu Wada, Director of the Foreign Ministry's Information Bureau, said, The testing is much re gretted from a humanitarian point of view and when nuclear disarmament is sought by vari ous nations

title: Judith I. Segal Has Nuptials
description: EAST NORWICH, L. I., Jan. 6Miss Judith Ida Segal was married here this eve ning to Albert Joseph Togut. Rabbi Jerome Davidson per formed the ceremony at the Pine Hollow Country Club.

title: 9 Lost as Soviet Tanker Hits a French Warship
description: PARIS, June 6 (AP)The Soviet tanker Busharov col lided with the French escort vessel Surcouf in the Medi terranean early today, slic ing the Surcouf in half, the French Naval Ministry re ported.

title: Mariner 9 Cruising Along
description: PASADENA, Calif., June 6 (UPI)  Mariner 9 cruised through space today toward an orbit around Mars and neared the outer reaches of the earth's gravitational pull. All systems are functioning correctly, said a spokesman for Jet Propulsion Laboratories, which is monitor ing the sixmonth flight. It's in the cruise mode, in which nothing happens, it just keeps going.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bergus and Rogers Confer
description: PARIS, June 6Mr. Bergus conferred with Secretary Rogers here this afternoon. He de clined to comment other than to say that he would meet the Secretary again tomorrow.

title: Polls vs. Pols: '72 Guessing Game
description: News Analysis

title: MRS. BERNARD SANDLER
description: Mrs. Bertha Sandler, widow of Bernard H. Sandler, a New York lawyer, died Saturday at the Lynwood Nursing Home here after a long illness. She was 85 years old and formerly lived at 40 West 7th Street.

title: Morgan Sets Swiss Venture
description: The Morgan Guaranty Inter national Banking Corporation announced over the weekend that it is forming an investment advisory company in Geneva, Switzerland to be called Morgan Guaranty Investment Services. The concern would offer ad visory services to individuals and institutions outside the United States.

title: DR. MEYER GROLLMAN
description: Dr. Meyer Grollman, a re tired surgeon, died yesterday in Brooklyn Jewish Hospital and Medical Center, with which he had been associated for many years. He was 80 years old and lived at 827 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn.

title: Levitt Says Cost of Mall Will Exceed $1.5Billion
description: ALBANY. June 6  In the, first major audit of the South Mall project here, the state's Controller. Arthur Lev itt, charged today that the project was extravagant, inef ficient and consistently off schedule.

title: Premier's Remarks Reported
description: ROME, June 6Premier Colombo spoke of the Govern ment's plans for the reputed mafiosi on Filicudi in an elec tioncampaign speech in Palermo.

title: Mrs. Ainslee Dinwiddie Wed To Alexander Grannis on Sloop
description: Mrs. Ainslie Dinwiddie and Alexander Banks Grannis were married yesterday after noon aboard the Clearwater, a 76foot reproduction of a 19thcentury sloop.

title: Mayor Calls Political Path Open
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., June 6  Mayor Lindsay departed today from his previous cate gorical denials that he would switch parties and run for President.

title: Kennedys Visit Graves
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) Mrs. Robert F. Kennedy made an early morning visit today to the grave of her husband on the third anniversary of his assassination. She was accom panied to Arlington National Cemetery by other members of the Kennedy family, including six of her 11 children and Caroline Kennedy, daughter of the late President. They also visited the John F. Kennedy grave.

title: German Shepherd Is Selected Best in Delaware County Show
At 9:20 A.M. Class Dined on Paella
description: HARTSDALE, N.Y.  It was only 9:20 in the morn ing, but the seven boys were really digging into the pael la, shrimp and crab poulette, and turkeyasparagus casse role.

title: JOSEPH MASON, 52, OF DRUG CONCERN
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., June 6 Joseph R. Mason, president of Sandoz Pharmaceuticals, died yesterday in the Morris town Memorial Hospital after la brief illness. He was 52 years old and lived on Douglas Road in New Vernon.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Shame in the Fields
description: At the heart of the misery of America's migrant farm workers is public unwillingness to face the very ex istence of this national shame. The subhuman conditions under which these forgotten armies labor and live, and the special cruelty these conditions inflict on hundreds of thousands of children, are remote from the view of urban America. No one likes to confront such atrocities, particularly when they are so easy to overlook.

title: Deaths
Antipollution Overseas Stirs Fears in Business
description: Antipollution efforts are progressing, with varied suc cess, in a great part of the world, but this development is also beginning to cause anxieties for business in many countries.

title: Fire in New Mexico
description: JEMEZ SPRINGS, N.M., June 6 (Reuters)An undetermined number of summer homes were destroyed in this northern New Mexico town today when a fire that had burned through 4,000 acres of timberland es caped from containment lines set up by firefighters. Families had been asked to leave the area and there were no reports of injuries.

title: Caso Is Seeking to Repeal Or Counter Commuter Tax
description: Ralph G. Caso, the Nassau County Executive, declared yes terday that he would seek either the repeal of New York City's commuter tax or the en actment of a reciprocal tax on city commuters to suburban jobs if the Legislature allowed the city to raise the tax this year.

title: DRUGS REPORTED TIED TO VIETNAM PULLOUT
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)  Representative Robert H. Steele, Republican of Connecti cut, said today that the high rate of heroin addiction among United States servicemen in Vietnam had prompted the Nix on Administration to seek a stepup in its rate of troop withdrawals.

title: 5 Turkish Leftists Captured
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, June 6 (AP)  Five leftist guerrillas were captured by the police and militiamen in eastern Tur key today, authorities reported.

title: Bond Men Expect Rates to Fall More
description: All parts of the credit market last week rallied for the second week in a row, and everyone wants to know the unknowable: Will interest rates continue to decline?

title: 59,348 Watch Yanks Defeat Royals, 52;
description: Lured by free Little League bats and the opportunity to see the greatest Kansas City Royals team ever assembled in some proportion or other baseball's largest crowd of the season, 59,348, turned out at Yankee Stadium yesterday and watched the Yankees post an efficient 52 victory.

title: For a Better New York
description: After all the toplevel buck passing among municipal, state and Federal politicians over solutions to New York city's monumental problems, it is refreshing to find scores of the city's most prominent businessmen moving along in support of an independent program aimed at maintaining New York's supremacy as a headquarters for industry and finance.

title: Scott Beats Peter Fishbach On Tiebreaker in L.I. Final
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 6 Gene Scott of New York recovered from within one point of defeat today to beat Peter Fishbach of Great Neck, 6.4, 46, 76, in the final of the Long Island men's champion ship at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Refueling Tanker Spills Oil Into Bay at Portland, Me.
description: PORTLAND, Maine, June 6 (AP)  Oil estimated at 420 to 630 gallons spilled into Casco Bay from a Norwegian tanker taking on fuel today because somebody wasn't tending to business, the Coast Guard said.

title: House Panel Investigating Safety Charge in Jet Crash
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) An allegation that a defect in a hydraulic line blamed for the crash of the Navy's first F14 jetfighter had been found be fore the crash is being investi ated by the House Armed Services Committee.

title: After Wellesley, Women's Liberation
description: WELLESLEY, Mass.Five years ago, said 26yearold Mrs. Avis Dimond Miller, shaking her head in disbelief, nothing was happening on campus. Zero. We weren't even sure what pot was.

title: Levine, 1970 Champion, Gains in OneWall Handball
description: Mark Levine of the Union Temple of Brooklyn, the de fending champion, led eight players into the quarterfinal round of the national Amateur Athletic Union onewall hand ball tournament yesterday with a 210, 219 victory over Sorrel Feldman of the Brownsville Handball Club at the Brighton Beach Baths in Brooklyn.

title: Indianan Fights Pollution
description: The Environmental Defense Fund office in New York re ceived a letter from a young man in Bloomington, Ind., an nouncing that he had decided to sell his automobile and do nate the proceeds to the fund. A check for $850 was enclosed. The antipollution organization saluted the young man by vot ing him a lifetime member.

title: Van Heflin Is in Hospital; Had Heart Attack in Pool
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 6 (AP) Van Heflin, the stage and screen actor, was taken to a hospital in critical condition today after suffering a heart attack while swimming.

title: Saito's, the Shoeless Restaurant On 52d St., Destroyed by Fire
description: A threealarm fire during the early morning yesterday de stroyed a threestory midtown building that housed one of the city's most popular Japa nese eating places, Saito's Res taurant.

title: Music From Italy Opens Tully Sampler Series
description: The 1971 edition of the Tully Hall Sampler series presented by Lincoln Center opened Saturday night with a concert of Italian music played by the Master Vir tuosi of New York under the direction of Gene Forrell. The event was presented un der the patronage of Vieri Traxler, the consul general of Italy.

title: Mulligan Beats Lundquist
description: STOCKHOLM, June 6 (AP) Martin Mulligan beat JanErik Lundquist, 60, 67, 62, 63, in the final of the Saltsjoe baden tennis tournament today.

title: Long Beach Bridal For Alice Pasternak
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., June 6Miss Alice Pasternak was married here today in the East End Synagogue to Dr. Gerald S. Weinstein, son of Mrs. Jack Weinstein of Law rence and the late Dr. Wein stein. Rabbi Amos W. Miller performed the ceremony.

title: Article 2  No Title
Leslie Ann Pickering Wed to John Francis
description: Miss Leslie Ann Pickering, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John H. Pickering of Wash ington, and John Gregory Francis, son of Mr. and Mrs. John A. Francis of Fair Oaks, Calif., were married yester day in the chapel of Nuffield College in Oxford, England.

title: India Appeals in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, June 6 (Reuters) India's Foreign Minister, Swa ran Singh, arrived here today, his first stop on a sixnation tour to tell the world that India cannot cope with the influx of four million East Pakistanis fleeing across her borders.

title: STEEL MILLS CUT HEDGE ESTIMATE
description: PITTSBURGH, June 6Steel producers were trimming their estimates of inventory building last week. With July orders continuing to lag, producers were lopping as much as two million tons off projections of the strike hedge accumulation by Aug. 1.

title: Strike at the Garden By Utility Workers Cancels All Events
description: A strike by utility workers at Madison Square Garden yes terday caused the cancellation of sports and entertainment events there and forced New York University to move its commencement exercises set for this morning to Radio City Music Hall.

title: PassFail College Grades Gaining Favor
description: As the school year draws to a close on college and univer sity campuses, there is mount ing evidence that perhaps as many as threequarters of the nation's 3,000 institutions of higher learning have turned to the simple pass or fail method of grading as a flexible, though limited, alternative to the tradi tional A through F marks.

title: ALLISON TRIUMPHS IN MASONDIXON 500
description: DOVER, Del., June 6 (AP) Bobby Allison drove his 1970 Ford flat out for 500 miles to day and won the NASCAR MasonDixon 500 at Dover Downs International Speedway with an average lap spbed of 123.119 miles per houra rec ord for a onemile track.

title: Chou, With Ceausescu, Takes Trip to Nanking
description: PEKING, June 6 (Agence FrancePresse)President Ni colae Ceausescu of Rumania, accompanied by Premier Chou Enlai, left Peking yesterday for an official visit to Nanking and Shanghai.

title: Jewish Seminary Honors McGill, Levitt and Others
description: The Jewish Theological Semi nary of America, which belongs to the Conservative branch of Judaism, graduated 91 students, including 13 who were or dained, at its annual exercises yesterday at the Park Avenue Synagogue.

title: Running Tide and Troon Win In 2Day New York Y.C. Sail
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., June 6 Jakob Isbrandtsen's 60foot sloop, Running Tide, and Ken drick R. Wilson Jr.'s Whitby 45, Troon, were the corrected time winners of 16mile races on Long Island Sound today when the New York Yacht Club ended its 117th annual regatta, a twoday event, in a sixknot eastsoutheast breeze that fad ed, then returned.

title: Israel Bars 3 Identified by Interpol as Criminals
description: TEL AVIV, June 6Israel has barred entry to three Jewish tourists said by Interpol to be engaged in organized crime, it was disclosed today. The In terior Ministry identified them as Jacob Marcus, 38 years old, a Canadian national, and Ben jamin Sigelbaum, 67, and Ber nard Rose, 50, United States citizens.

title: JOURNALISM CENTER GRANTS 18 AWARDS
60 Cholera Deaths Reported in the Calcutta Area
description: CALCUTTA, India, June 6 The cholera epidemic among Pakistani refugees in West Ben gal now threatens to spread to this city of six million people. At least 60 refugees are re ported to have died of the dis ease in the city or its outskirts in the last two days.

title: MISS WHITWORTH WINS BY 6 SHOTS
description: BALTIMORE, June 6 (AP) Kathy Whitworth carded a 71, her third subpar round of the tournament today and won the $25,000 Lady Carling open by six strokes. She finished with a 54hole total of 210.

title: Roundup: Blue Beats Senators and McLain, 81, Raising His Record to 122
description: Vida Blue, the 21yearold lefthander with the most sensational lowhit, high strikeout mark since Johnny (Double NoHit) Vander Meer came up with the Cincinnati Reds in 1938, continued his amazing pitching yesterday by defeating the Washington Senators, 81, on a fourhitter for the Oakland Athletics.

title: BlackWhite Struggle in Africa: No One Is Winning
description: LUSAKA, Zambia  There are some who believe that the struggle for black rights in southern Africa will someday erupt into the nightmare of a fullscale bloody race war.

title: Peking Aiming Research At China's Special Needs
description: While research on the Chi nese mainland is probably con tributing little to basic scien tific knowledge, it seems to be providing Communist China with a technology particularly applicable to developing coun tries.

title: DICKINSON VICTOR IN GOLF PLAYOFF, BEATING NICKLAUS
description: ATLANTA, June 6Gardner Dickinson, a 43yearold golfing perfectionist, beat Jack Nick laus today on the first hole of a suddendeath playoff in the Atlanta Golf Classic. The finish came when Nicklaus three putted a bogie 5 at the Atlanta Country Club as Dickinson recorded a regulation 4.

title: Adm. Noorer Is Guest At Franco Victory Day
description: MADRID, June 6 (UPI) Spain displayed her growing military strength today in a Victory Day parade attended by the Chairman of the United States Joint Chiefs of Staff, Adm. Thomas H. Moorer.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Walter Blum's valet, cackling as he wiped the jockey's hoots, said, Waal, I guess them Guadalupes can go home now. The valet, Dick Mead, wrinkled and gray, allowed as he was happy that Blum had won The Belmont, but not exactly hysterical. After all, he also takes care of the equipment of John Rotz. who won last year, Larry Adams, and Robyn Smith, the female jockey, which makes him the subject of complex jokes and gives him a chance to tell newcomers, Before they give me the job they steriled me.

title: Article 7  No Title
U.S. Marketing at Air Show In Paris Said to Set Record
description: PARIS, June 6 (AP)  The sales results of the American marketing effort at the Paris air show reached record levels this year, American spokesmen said.

title: Two Senators Assail U.S. on Laos War
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Sen ator Stuart Symington said to day that instead of the $52mil lion publicly acknowledged by the Administration, the United States was spending hundreds of millions of dollars in a clandestine war in northern Laos.

title: Somalian Regime Asserts It Crushed a Coup Attempt
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, June 6 (AP)  The Somali Revolu tionary Council announced to day that it had crushed a plot to assassinate all government leaders, start a civil war in this East African country and rein state capitalism.

title: More Table Tennis Tourneys
description: The promoter of the Vander bilt international table tennis tournament, which starts at the Vanderbilt Club here next Sun day, said yesterday that other tournaments had been lined up for the visiting foreign teams at Oklahoma City, Minneapolis, Chicago, Cleveland and Miami or Orlando, Fla. Teams from Sweden, Hungary, Japan Yugo slavia and the United States will compete in the Vanderbilt event.

title: ROBERT D. VEGHTE Jr.
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N. J., June 6 Robert Debow Veghte Jr., president of the Debow Com pany of Newark and a director of the Wilkata Folding Box Company, died yesterday, ap parently of a heart attack. He was 49 years old and lived on Chapin Road here.

title: Army's 4Goal 4th Period Tops Navy in Lacrosse, 74
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 6 (AP)Army, led by Buck Walker's three goals, scored four times in the final period today for a 74 victory over Navy in the final lacrosse game for both schools in 1971.

title: SOVIET SPACESHIP ENTERS NEW ORBIT
description: MOSCOW, June 6The So viet spacecraft Soyuz 11, launched this morning with three men aboard, corrected its orbit during the day in appar ent preparation for a rendez vous with the scientific station Salyut.

title: RHEFFIC TRIUMPHS IN $366,830 RACE
description: PARIS, June 6  The re nowned French trainer, Fran cois Mathet, saddled his fourth French Derby winner in six years today as Mrs. Francois Dupre's bay colt, Rheffic, cap tured the 130th running of the Chantilly Classic.

title: Tremor Shakes Honshu
description: TOKYO, June 6 (AP)A weak earthquake today shook southeastern Honshu, Japan's largest island, the Central Me terological Agency reported. There were no reports of dam age or casualties.

title: Use of MultiEthnic Textbooks Grows
description: WASHINGTON, June 6  Black, brown, red and yellow faces are rapidly surrounding the white faces of Dick and Jane, the wo textbook young sters who introduced reading to generations of Americans.

title: FLOURNOY MILLER, 84, OLDTIME COMEDIAN
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 6 (AP) Flournoy Miller, half of one of show business' first black comedy teams, Miller and Lyles, died today at a convalescent home. He was 84 years old.

title: White House Chef Bakes That Cake
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)  Tricia Nixon's 350 pound, 6foothigh wedding cake has been baked and only lacks the frosting.

title: Saigon's Electoral Law
description: News Analysis

title: Ethics Panel Clears Legislator In Use of Assembly Stationery
description: ALBANY, June 6  The As sembly Ethics and Guidance Committee declared today that, a Brooklyn legislator who had applied for jobs in private in dustry on Assembly stationery had exercised poor judgment but had not violated the Leg islative Code of Ethics.

title: Hill People Support Poverty Program
description: ATLANTA, June 5  A bus load of mountain people went home to eastern Kentucky to day, its occupants hoping they had persuaded the Office of Economic Opportunity not to terminate their milliondollar ayear poverty program.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Fol lowing are the votes of delega tions from New York, New Jer sey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yes terday.

title: EDWARD ANDRADE,83, A BRITISH PHYSICIST
description: LONDON, June 6 (AP) Prof. Edward Neville da Costa Andrade, a physicist who was known for his work on the viscosity of liquids, died today in a nursing home here today. He was 83 years old.

title: Gina Popovic Bride Of Michael G. Thonis
description: DE WITT, N. Y., June 6 Miss Gina Popovic, daughter of Nenad D. Popovic, a pro fessor at the Maxwell Grad uate School of Citizenship at Syracuse University, and Mrs. Popovic, was married here this afternoon to Michael George Thonis, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Thonis of Townsend, Mass.

title: FRED STEINMARK, FORMER BACK, DIES
description: HOUSTON, June 6 (UPI) Freddie Steinmark, a defensive back on the 1969 national champion Texas Longhorn foot ball team who became a na tional symbol of courage and determination in his battle against cancer, died today at 11 P.M. He was 22 years old.

title: Goldwater Calls Campaign By McCloskey Insignificant
description: MOUNT FREEDOM, N. J., June 6 (AP)  Senator Barry Goldwater, Republican of Ari zona, dismissed the Presidential drive of Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr. as insignificant today.

title: VOLGA GERMANS STILL DISPERSED
description: MOSCOW, June 6  The So viet Union appears reluctant to publicize the geographical dis persal of its Volga Germans despite political rehabilitation of them seven years ago.

title: Article 4  No Title
The McGovern Program
description: Senator George McGovern, the first declared candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination, has set forth a radical and ambitious program for reordering the nation's priorities.

title: New Law Seen Aiding War on Gambling Rings
description: New tools of law enforce ment have increased prosecu tions aimed at the gambling operations of organized crime across the nation, according to Federal and local lawenforce ment officials.

title: U.S. Wants a World Body For Averting Trade Wars
description: PARIS, June 6Secretary of State William P. Rogers ar rived here today with a plan to set up a highlevel in ternational coordinating group charged with keeping world economic conditions from de teriorating into a trade war.

title: ROMAN CHELMINSKI, CHEMICAL ENGINEER
description: STAMFORD, June 6Roman Chelminski, chemical engineer and designer of plants for the recovery of uranium ores and the production of phosphoric acid, died Friday in Stamford Hospital after a long illness. He was 68 years old and lived at 33 Long Close Road.

title: Advertising: Hancock Account Won By Rosenfeld Agency
description: If you've been thinking of Rosenfeld, Sirowitz & Law son as just another one of those pesky boutiques you'd better stop.

title: Miss Jeanine Stewart Miller Bride of Richard T. Abrahams
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., June 6 Miss Jeanine Stewart Mil ler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Duncan Miller, was married here this afternoon to Richard Terry Abrahams, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sol Abra hams of St. Petersburg, Fla. The Rev. William E. Brown Jr. performed the ceremony in the First Presbyterian Church.

title: BuildingTrades Pay Up 10.8% Here
description: Wage scale increases for New York City's unionized building tradesmen averaged 68 cents an hour, or 10.8 per cent, be tween April, 1970, and April, 1971, Herbert Bienstock, re gional director of the United States Department of Labor's Bureau of Labor Statistics, re ported yesterday.

title: '72 Democratic Bloodpath Forecast by G.O.P. Weekly
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI) A Republican National Com mittee publication pointed with glee to signs today that the II Democrats appeared headed to ward partysplitting rows over the choice of a Presidential nominee for 1972.

title: KATHY RIGBY TAKES GYMNASTICS CROWN
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 6 (AP) A California schoolgirl swept the women's events and the captain of the Swiss national team capitalized on a steady performance as they took the overall titles in the World Cup gymnastics championships last night.

title: Delay in Training Hurt Canonero, Trainer Says
description: Juan Arias, the trainer of Canonero H, said yesterday that the defeated favorite in Satur day's Belmont Stakes, won by Peter Kissel's Pass Catcher, came out of the race in good shape.

title: BRITISH ECONOMY TERMED GLOOMY
description: LONDON, June 6  A picture of almost unrelieved gloom for Britain's economic prospects was painted this week by the National Intitute of Economic end Social Research. The insti tute is Britain's major private agency specializing in short term forecasts.

title: Japan's Woman Jockey Injured in Racing Spill
description: MORIOKA, Japan, June 6 (AP)Japan's only woman jockey suffered a brain hemorrhage in a fall from her mount today.

title: Many House Democrats Critical of New Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 During a major floor fight this spring, Representative John Conyers Jr., a Michigan Demo crat, glanced around the cham ber, then rose to his feet.

title: Assembly Vote Fails to Overturn Veto on Oyster BayRye Bridge
description: ALBANY, June 6  A rare attempt to override a Gover nor's veto failed tonight in the Assembly but touched off bitter protests and angry confronta tions on the floor over the tactics of Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea.

title: AL UNSER VICTOR IN REX MAYS 150
description: MILWAUKEE, June 6  Al Unser, the hottest property in the United States Auto Club, makes it look so easy that the crowds are getting restive, pep pering him with a few good natured boos here and there.

title: Village Proposes a School Linked to Need, Not Tradition
description: Community leaders of Greenwich Village decided last evening, after three days of intensive community ef fort, that they wanted the Village's old school, Public School 3, to be redesigned into a school without walls, free of traditional educa tional restraints, run by a community governing board and containing a variety of activities hitherto regarded as being outside of normal school curriculum.

title: Copters Sink 11 Sampans
description: SAIGON, Monday, June 7 (Reuters) United States heli copters attacked two flotillas of Vietcong sampans at the mouth of the Mekong River yesterday, sinking 11 sampans and killing 22 Vietcong, a United States spokesman said.

title: Burtis's Yacht Is Victor In Sea Cliff Sailing Race
description: SEA CLIFF, LI, June 6 Alan Burtis's Guaohero beat Rolf Carlsen's Sweetness for Star Class honors as the Sea Cliff Yacht Club managed to complete one of its scheduled two weekend sails on Hemp stead Harbor today.

title: Dodgers Beat Mets, 43, Before 48,227
description: LOS ANGELES, June 6The Los Angeles Dodgers made it two straight over the New York Mets today with a 43 victory that dropped the Mets into third place in the National League's East.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE BOOK. OF DANIEL. By E. L. Doctorow. 303 pages. Random House. $6.95.

title: SYNDROME FOUND IN RETURNED G.I.'S
description: FORT BENNING, Ga. Stogdill, came the voice over the loudspeaker, time to play pool.

title: Article 8  No Title
Tactics Disputed in Fight to Win Release of P.O.W.'s
description: WASHINGTON, June 6For two years, the Nixon Admin istration has been running a campaign of publicity, and per ?? to marshal American and world opinion behind it on the issue of American prison ers of war in Indochina.

title: Honduran Leader Installed
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, June 6 (AP) Raman Ernesto Cruz, inaugurated as President of Honduras today, pledged con tinued appeals to international organizations until the border conflict with El Salvador is set tled in his country's favor. 7

title: Sonya Franeta Married
description: Miss Sonja Helen Franeta, a student at New York Uni versity, and Thomas Marshall Miller Jr., an assistant pro fessor of physics there, were married yesterday afternoon in St. Nicholas of Tolentine Roman Catholic Church in the Bronx. The Rev. Charles Laferty performed the cere mony. Mr. and Mrs. Konstan tin Franeta of the Bronx and Mr. and Mrs. Miller of Col lege Park, Ga., are the par ents of the couple.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: NEW WEEKLY BIOGRAPHICAL SERVICE. The New York Times Biographical Edi tion. Profiles of today's newsmakers in a looseleaf edition. Write: The New York Times, Library Services. Box FP480. 229 West 43d St., New York, N.Y. 10036.Advt.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The 3 Astronauts on Space Ferry Georgi T. Vladislav N. Viktor I. Dobrovolsky Volkov Patsayev
description: Men in the News

title: UTILITY INDUSTRY HAILS NIXON EVE
description: CLEVELAND, June 6The electric utility industry believes President Nixon's new energy program, announced Friday, is a step in the right direction.

title: Article 3  No Title
White House Report on Children Urges Unit to Push TV Reforms
description: The final report of the White House Conference on Children, which was presented to Presi dent Nixon early last week, contains in its 24 parts a scath ing indictment of commercial television that has already drawn the fire of the National Association of Broadcasters.

title: Audie Murphy Rites Today
description: ARLINGTON, Va., June 6 (UPI)  Audie Murphy, the country's most decorated hero in World War II, who died in an airplane crash last weekend, will be buried tomorrow with full military honors at Arling ton National Cemetery. The holder of the Medal of Honor and 23 other United States dec orations died with five other men when their plane crashed near Roanoke.

title: Article 1  No Title
Cox to Start Job Here Today and Get A Honeymoon Leave
description: Patricia Nixon's fiance, Ed ward Ridley Finch Cox, is scheduled to show up for his summer job at 10 o'clock this morning in a busy law office on Foley Square.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, June 6Imagine the en tire population of New Jersey, seven million people, fleeing the state and taking refuge in New York City and the counties nearby. That thought gives some idea of the dimensions of what is happening now in East Pakis tanexcept that the refugees are much poorer and the area of India into which they are fleeing is infinitely more desperate than New York.

title: TV: Nuremberg's Relevance to the Vietnam War
description: Several years ago Bertrand Russell was one of the key organizers of an international tribunal to consider the ques tion of whether the United States was committing war crimes in Indochina. The gen eral reaotion was that Lord Russell was at best a senile fool, at worst a propagandis tic tool of Hanoi. That was several years ago.

title: Albany Aide, Citing Decontrol, Vows to Help Harassed Tenants
description: State Housing Commissioner Charles J. Urstadt said yester day that Governor Rockefeller asked me to be merciless and I will be against any landlord harassing tenants to get apart ments vacated so as to free them from rent controls here.

title: Advertising:
description: How does the business look to you right now? Well to Robert E. Healy of Inter republic in New York and Philip H. Schaff Jr, of Leo Burnett, Chicago it looks flatthat is little change from last year.

title: METHADONE USE GROWS ON COAST
description: SAN DIEGO, June 6  A police squad car patrolling San Diego's Mission Beach section one night recently arrested a longhaired youth from Balti more in the act of burglarizing a television store to support his $50aday heroin habit.

title: Payment for Garand
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Jan. 7 (AP)Representative Edward P. Boland, Democrat of Massa chusetts, said today he planned to reintroduce a bill in Con gress seeking payment to the inventor of the M1 rifle. The inventor is 83yearold John Garand of Springfield.

title: Pirates Outsiug Cubs, 116;
description: CHICAGO, June 7 (UPI) Homers by Willie Stargell, Al Oliver and Bob Robertson helped carry the Pittsburgh Pi rates to an 116 triumph over the Chicago Cubs today.

title: Reserve Appears to Slow Growth in Money Supply
description: The Federal Reserve appeared to move yesterday to slow down the rate of growth in the nation's supply of money. The central bank, acting the day before its policy setting Open Market Commit tee is scheduled to meet in Washington, sold Treasury bills for cash, driving rates on longerterm bills up as much as 27/100ths of a percentage point.

title: South Africa to Ease Penalties for Passbook Infractions by Blacks
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, June 7  The Govern ment announced today that it would ease penalties imposed on Africans who broke regula tions designed to control their movement within South Africa.

title: Advertising:
description: James R. Heekin Jr., presi dent and chief executive offi cer of TinkerPritchard Wood Associates since last fall, has handed in his resignation.

title: OBSERVER
description: In June book reviewers come at us with long lists of books for summer reading. Suggestions for Summer Reading. That is how they usually headline these mysterious lists. A man accepts his list without enthusiasm. Summer reading? What is the uni fying principle behind this inscrutable list?

title: Miss Shapiro Jersey Bride
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., June 7Miss Nancy Ruth Shapiro and Alan Levine, graduates of the University of Pennsyl vania, were married this eve ning at the Short Hills. Rabbi Moshe V. Goldblum and Rab bi Gershon B. Chertoff per formed the ceremony, and Cantor Morris Schorr assisted.

title: MUSKIE ASKS DRIVE ON HEROIN TRAFFIC
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Strategies for saving America's cities are pointless if they do not contain an allout attack on heroin traffic, Senator Ed mund S. Muskie said today.

title: Garland Back in Town For Jazz Piano Date
description: One of the great jazz piano stylists, Red Garland, is back in New York after an absence of eight years. Mr. Garland was the pianist in Miles Davis's group in the late nineteenfifties, later led his own trio and in 1963 re turned to his home in Dallas to stay.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: It appears clear, after read ing a thorough and disheart ening report in the May issue of Audubon magazine on the increasing contamination of the world's waters by oil and oil products, that our energy should be directed toward de veloping and enforcing tech niques and regulations de signed to prevent such pollu tion rather than searching for more sophisticated ways of dealing with it after it has occurred.

title: N.H.L. Acts to Deter Players From Leaving Bench to Brawl
description: MONTREAL, June 7 (AP)  The National Hockey League acted today to impose stiffer penalties on players who leave the penalty box or the player bench to join brawls on the ice.

title: Foster Perjury Trial On; Links to Eboli Are Cited
description: NEWARK, June 7 (AP) Nightclub comedian Phil Foster went on trial in Federal Court today on charges that he per jured himself during a Federal tax investigation of reputed un derworld czar Thomas (Tommy Ryan) Eboli.

title: $2,000 Increase in Lulus Approved by Legislature
description: ALBANY, June 7Members of the Legislature voted them selves a $2,000 increase in ex pense allowance tonight and also approved a supplemental state budget that would vir tually assure at least an addi tional $5,000 allowance to each Republican Senator and a mini mum of $3,500 extra to each Democratic Senator.

title: WATER POLLUTION IN TEXAS STUDIED
description: HOUSTON, June 7A com mittee of the Federal Environ mental Protection Agency be gan hearings here today to consider the plight of oiltaint ed and metalpoisoned oysters in Galveston Bay, the largest estuary in Texas.

title: Stockholder Suit Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) The Supreme Court today denied a hearing to three Gen eral Motors Corporation stock holders seeking damages for claimed overcharges to G.M. on automotive fabrics and finishes sold to the motor company by E. I. du Pont Nemours & Co.

title: HEARING REFUSED ON ZEISS BRANDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The East German Zeiss com pany lost in the Supreme Court today a nineyear legal battle over the use in this country of the Zeiss trademark on cameras and other optical equipment.

title: United Cerebral Palsy Picks Medical Director
description: Dr. Leon Sternfeld has been appointed medical di rector of the United Cerebral Palsy Association, Inc., and director of its research and educational foundation.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION FELL 4.4% IN WEEK
description: Production of steel in the week ended Saturday dropped 4.4 per cent from the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yester day. The decline was largely because of the shorter work week because of Memorial Day.

title: French Town's Liberators Convene in Orange, Mass.
description: ORANGE, Mass., June 7 Orange, they say, is much like a small town in France called SainteMreEglise.

title: AvantGarde Music Irritating to Critics in London
description: LONDON, June 7For al most a week there has been contemporary music in Lon don, under circumstances predictable to anybody with any acquaintance with the musical avantgarde.

title: Victims in Airliner Crash on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 7 [AP]Following is a list of crewmen and passengers on a DC9 airliner that collided with a military jet yesterday and crashed near Los Angeles, kill ing all 49 persons aboard:

title: Surprise Monets Bedazzle Parisians
description: PARIS, June 7  The world's most comprehensive collection of paintings by Claude Monet, worth many millions of dollars in the opin ion of experts, opened here to the public today. One critic called it the greatest art event of the year.

title: HARRY H. CLARK, A PROFESSOR, 69
description: MADISON, Wis., June 7 Prof. Harry Hayden Clark, member of the English depart ment at the University of Wis consin for 43 years, died here yesterday after a short illness. He was widely known as a teacher, scholar and editor in the field of American litera ture. His age was 69.

title: Convicted Brooklyn Slayer Sentenced to 3 Life Terms
description: George Lewis, who was de scribed by Justice Michael Kern as a deadly, dangerous man, was sentenced yesterday in Brooklyn Supreme court to three consecutive terms of 25 years to life for the murders of three men last year.

title: Rogers Vows to Aid Free Trade but Warns Others to Act Fairly
description: PARIS, June 7  Secretary of State William P. Rogers to day pledged the Administra tion's determination to main tain and expand a liberal and nondiscriminatory world trade system. But he warned that other nations must do their part by accepting their inter national obligations and apply ing the rules of trade fairly.

title: The Cost of No New Tolls
description: It is a measure of the hostility and distrust between Democrats and Republicans at Albany, between suburban and urban representatives, between innerborough and outerborough representatives from New York City that bills providing funds to help defray the costs of operating the city's subways failed to win passage in the Legislature.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WHO is Harry Kellerman and why is he saying those terrible things about me?Advt.

title: Layer, Sharp After Rest, Crushes Stolle, 61, 62
description: BRISTOL, England, June 7 (UPI)  Rod Laver, looking sharp after a threeweek rest at his California home, needed just 37 minutes to beat fellow Australian, Fred Stolle, 61, 62, In the first round of the $48,000 Wills open tennis tournament today.

title: PENNSY WIDENS LOSS ESTIMATE
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 7 The Penn Central Transporta tion Company now estimates it will operate this year at a $240 million net loss, on a fully ac crued basis, making provision in its accounts for interest, taxes and other fixed charges that it is not now meeting. This is $52million greater than the trustees had estimated ear lier this year. The 1970 net loss was about $425million.

title: CASTRO SAYS POET WASN'T TORTURED
description: MIAMI, June 7 (AP)Pre mier Fidel Castro has denied allegations made by 60 foreign leftist intellectuals that his re gime has tortured Heberto Pa dilla, who won the Govern ment's 1968 poetry prize, to ob tain a confession of counter revolutionary crimes.

title: Soviet Space Station Spurs Shuttle Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The orbiting of the Soviet Union's huge new space station has giv en an unexpected boost to backers of the American space shuttle, the multibillion  dollar gleam in the eye of the space agency and the aerospace in dustry.

title: Thais Arrest 3 Newsmen: Charge Aide Was Insulted
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 7 (Reuters)  Three of Bang kok's leading journalists have been arrested on charges of in sulting Foreign Minister ?? Khoman, a police spokes?? said today.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Equity Corporation has elected Robert W. Halliday as chairman replacing Jakob Isbrandtsen, who will remain a director. The company also pro moted James W. Hart to senior vice president and chief operating officer; Paul M. Montrone to senior vice president and chief financial officer and Rich ard N. Daniel to vice president operations. Mr. Hal liday is also chairman of the Allied Equities Corpo ration, a major Equity Corporation shareholder, and of U.S. Natural Resources, Inc..

title: POLAND ENDS CURB ON WRITER'S WORKS
description: WARSAW, June 7An an thology of works dating to 1918 by Antoni Slonimski, whose writing was banned here in 1968 during an antiZionist campaign, is being made avail able by a Polish publishing house.

title: 2 Mets Ailing
description: Although neither Tommie Agee nor Cleon Jones may play tonight because of in juries, the 13game home stand that begins for the New York Mets at Shea Sta dium presents a golden op portunity to make hay in the standings and in the gate re ceipts.

title: BACHE REPORTS RECORD PROFITS
description: Bache & Co., Inc., reported yesterday that its profit for the three months ended April 30 constituted a record for any quarter, and was a sharp con trast to the company's loss in the comparable period in 1970.

title: France Tells Australians She Tries to Limit Fallout
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, June 7, (Reuters)The French Am bassador to Australia said to day that France was doing her utmost to limit pollution from nuclear tests in the Pacific.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Headstart: The Torment of ABC's
description: On January 1 I became director of the Addie Mae Collins Headstart on Fifth Avenue and 127th Street. On Mardh 29 I resigned.

title: What Mothers Will Wear for Bridal
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  The White House released to day sketches of the dresses Mrs. Richard M. Nixon and Mrs. Howard Ellis Cox will wear Saturday at the Rose Garden wedding of Tricia Nixon and Edward Finch Cox.

title: Lindsay Ponders Plan to Call National Guard in Bridge Crisis
description: The possibility developed yes terday that the National Guard might be called out to restore normal traffic flow to bridges and highways disrupted by a strike action that Mayor Lind say called immoral, illegal, outrageous and offensive to the public interest.

title: Urges Senators to Pass Loan Move
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally Jr. disclosed today that the Government had taken some new steps aimed at mak ing sure taxpayers did not lose any money even if the Lock heed Aircraft Corporation went bankrupt after receiving Gov ernmentguaranteed loans.

title: Cox Talks of Job, No Wedding
description: Edward Finch Cox, the bridegroom of the year, re luctantly held a press confer ence yesterday and talked about that wedding cake, his new $60aweek summer job, the law, his career as a Nader's Raider, and the archi tecture of the United States Courthouse here.

title: Bill Protects Newsmen
description: BOSTON, June 7 (AP)The Massachusetts Senate gave final approval today to a bill to protect the confidentiality or newsmens' sources. Under the bill, which now goes to the House, testimony could be re quired only to permit a crim inal prosecution for the com mission of a specific felony or to prevent a threat to human life.

title: The Philosophy of a Unionist
description: The labor movement in this country was built by the hopes, the courage, the strength and ideals of outs who wanted in.

title: Court Declines to Rule On Rail Strike Decision
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The Supreme Court de clined today to review a rul ing that permits the United Transportation Union to call selective strikes against indi vidual railroads.

title: 2,700 AT CORNELL RECEIVE DEGREES
description: ITHACA, N. Y., June 7 (AP) Colleges and universities have changed for the better internally in recent years of turbulence but have suffered a loss of public confidence, Dr. Dale R. Corson, president of Cornell University told his school's graduating class today.

title: Gotbaum Warns City Of Broader Walkout
description: Hundreds of thousands of motorists were trapped in mas sive traffic jams on the hot test day of the year yester day when municipal workers opened drawbridges in the city and abandoned trucks on major highways.

title: Boston's MarketIts Traditions Endure
description: BOSTONIn the name of urban re development, Manhattan's Washington Market has been relocated at Hunt's Point in the Bronx; Les Halles removed from Paris to a 500acre site five miles outside the city limits en route to Orly Airport, and London's ancient, colorful and congested Covent Garden is soon to be moved, too.

title: Memphis Integration Case Remanded to Lower Court
description: CINCINNATI, June 7 (AP) Three Federal judges ordered a case remanded to the United States District Court in Mem phis today for adoption of a new plan of desegregation of the city's public school system.

title: Labor Dept. Aide Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The White House announced today the resignation of Jerome M. Rosow, Assistant Secretary of Labor for Policy Evaluation and Research. Mr. Rosow, the first person to hold the posi tion, will leave July 25 to re turn to private business. He was nominated in February, 1969. The announcement said no successor had been chosen.

title: TV: Morning Talk Show Makes Debut on Channel 9
description: There's a new talk show in town. All right, everybody moan together before we ven ture into the details. Good.

title: Moorer Lauds Spaniards
description: MADRID, June 7 (UPI) Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, chair man of the United States Joint Chiefs of Staff, praised the Spanish Armed Forces today for their good discipline and high morale. The admiral, here on an official threeday visit, attended a parade marking the 32d anniversary of the end of the Spanish civil war.

title: Miners Assail Black Lung Benefits Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  About 100 disabled Appalach ian coal miners and miners' widows came here today to warn that much of the East's supply of fuel for the produc tior of electric power may be interrupted by strikes this sum mer unless action is taken on their complaints.

title: FIVE SPURN INQUIRY INTO BANK BOMBING
description: Five men and women sub poenaed to appear before a federal grand jury here today in connection with an alleged plot to firebomb a Manhattan branch of the First National City Bank said yesterday that they would not cooperate with the grand jury, and that they were filing suit in Federal Dis trict Court to stay the pro ceeding.

title: Screen: Okamoto's Red Lion Opens
description: Although Red Lion, the Japanese film that opened yesterday at the Bijou Cine ma, was directed by Kihachi Okamoto, who also collabo rated on the screenplay, suspect the film's real auteur to be Toshiro Mifune, who not only produced the movie but also stars in itin a role so fat that it's positively pregnant.

title: Broadway Director Says Policeman Assaulted Him
description: Alan Schneider was on his way to an appointment with his eye doctor in New Jersey that morning, walking across town to the bus terminal be cause he had plenty of time and it was a pleasantly warm day.

title: GROVER C. RICHARDS, INDUSTRIALIST, DIES
description: SOUTH PORTLAND, Me., June 7Grover C. Richards, an industrialist and philanthropist who donated a total of $2.6 million to hospitals in Portland and Attleboro, Mass., died at his home yesterday. He was 84 years old.

title: If Salt and Pepper Don't Quite Suffice
description: Food Talk

title: TRADE OF E.F.T.A. GAINED IN QUARTER
description: GENEVA, June 7  Trade among the nine nations of the European Free Trade Associa tion continued to grow during the first quarter at a faster pace than their total commerce, the association announced to day.

title: Only 5 Countries Involved In Big U.S. Gold Dealings
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The United States had sizable gold transactions with only five countries in the first quarter of this yearthree sales and two purchasesthe Treasury dis closed today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JUSTICES BROADEN LIBEL PROTECTION
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 A sharply divided Supreme Court broadened today the con stitutional protection of the press against libel suits by pri vate individuals.

title: Will Get License Today
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 UPI)  Tricia Nixon and Ed ward Finch Cox will get their marriage license tomorrow but presumably will send someone to pick it upas they did to make the license application.

title: All Well With Mariner 9
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (Reu ters)  The Mariner 9 space probe has settled down for a 161day trip to Mars and is per forming flawlessly, the Nation al Aeronautics and Space Ad ministration said today.

title: Pentagon Reports Chinese Are Building Big Submarine
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)  Communist China may be building its first nuclearpow ered submarine, the Pentagon said today.

title: Police Struggle to Unravel Massive Traffic Jams
description: Every available policeman was pressed into service yes terday in an attempt to miti gate the effect of one of the worst traffic tieups in the city's history.

title: Gorman Wins at Beckenham
description: BECKENHAM, England, June 7 (AP)Tom Gorman of Seattle and Jim McManus of Berkeley, Calif., won firstround matches today in the Kent tennis tourna ment, a warmup for Wimbledon two weeks away.

title: Hydrants Turned On in Slums Causing Water Pressure to Dip
description: Sharp drops in water pres sure were reported yesterday afternoon in Harlem and in the Brownsville and BedfordStuy vesant areas of Brooklyn as residents, Including schoolchil dren, opened scores of hydrants on the hottest day of the year.

title: Four Die as Fire Destroys A Couple's Home in Queens
description: A couple, their nephew and 7yearold grandson died yester day when a flash fire de stroyed a Queens home.

title: Bail Set for Miss Bacon
description: SEATTLE, June 7 (UPI) Federal Magistrate Alan Froe lich set bail of $10,000 today for Miss Leslie Bacon, an anti war activist, on a charge of conspiracy to bomb a New York City bank. But the 19 yearold girl of Atherton, Calif., will still be held in lieu of $100,000 bail on a contempt charge for having refused to testify before a Federal grand jury here concerning the March 1 bombing of the nation's Capitol.

title: Connecticut Assembly Passes Lottery and Offtrack Betting Bill
