description: HARTFORD, Tuesday, June 8 The Connecticut House of Representatives yesterday passed legislation permitting a lottery and parimutuel and off track betting. The vote was 140 to 31.

title: U.S. EFFORT URGED ON A NEW REACTOR
description: CLEVELAND, June 7  The president of the Westinghouse Electric Corporation's power systems operation called on the Nixon Administration to step up its efforts in developing a fast breed nuclear reactor.

title: Pension Measure Killed In Reaction by Brydges
description: ALBANY, June 7  Senate Majority Leader Earl W. Brydges reacted to the strike of New York City employes to day by killing the pension bill sought by the employes' unions.

title: MINNEAPOLIS RACE FOCUSES ON MAYOR
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 7  Mayor Charles S. Stenvig, a Minneapolis burglary detective who unsettled this city's polit ical regulars two years ago by winning election as a lawand order independent, will seek a second term tomorrow.

title: DISTRICTING CHANGE HELD UP IN VIRGINIA
description: RICHMOND, June 7 (AP) Virginia legislators shelved to day a plan to draft a new reap portionment law.

title: DR. WILLIAM COLLENS, EXPERT ON DIABETES
description: Dr. William S. Collens, a specialist in metabolic diseases, died yesterday in Maimonides Hospital, Brooklyn, with which he had been associated for many years, after a short ill ness. He was 74 years old and lived at 123 Eighth Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Troop Strength In Vietnam Cat by 4,800
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 7 (AP)The United States command reported to day that American troop strength in South Vietnam had been reduced by 4,800 men last week. It also an nounced that six Marine Corps units totaling 1,240 men would return soon to the United States.

title: AIR CRASH KILLS 28 IN CONNECTICUT
description: NEW HAVEN, June 7Twen tyeight persons were killed when an Allegheny Airlines passenger airliner crashed through three vacant beach cottages and into a swampy field this morning as it at tempted to land at TweedNew Haven Airport.

title: Argentina Devalues Peso For 3d Time in 2 Months
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 7 Another of Argentina's sched uled monthly devaluations made the peso today worth 5 per cent less than its official exchange value two months ago.

title: Alcoa Raises Prices On Conductor Items
description: The Aluminum Company of America said yesterday that it had raised prices by six per cent on aluminum overhead electrical conductor, effective immediately.

title: Mexico Wins Cap Tennis From New Zealand, 3.2
description: MEXICO CITY, June 7 (UPI)  Joaquin LoyoMayo defeated New Zealand's Jeff Simpson, 63, 63, 62, in the final match to give Mexico a 32 victory in the North American Zone Davis Cup tennis competition today.

title: Brother of Hanoi Official Explains Why He Defected to the South
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 7The twin brother of a diplomat in North Vietnam disclosed today why he had de fected to the Saigon Govern ment after nine years in the National Liberation Front in South Vietnam.

title: Dennis Burns Is Awarded Princeton's Roper Trophy
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 7 Dennis J. Burns of Levittown, L. I., a linebacker and captain of Princeton University's 1970 football team, was awarded today the William Winston Roper Trophy, the highest ath letic honor conferred by Prince ton.

title: A.E.C. Urges Curbs for Power Plant Radiation
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Atomic Energy Commission proposed today stringent new limits on the permissible radi ation exposure for the public from the operation of nuclear power plants.

title: Hanoi Says U.S. Bombarded North Repeatedly in May
description: HONG KONG, June 7 (Reu ters)Hanoi today charged the United States with having con ducted recurrent bombard ment against the southern most part of North Vietnam in May.

title: High Paris Police Aide Ousted After Leftist Riot
description: PARIS, June 7A high police official was removed from his post today after the department found itself in the novel posi tion of being attacked for not being tough enough.

title: Copper Futures Register an Advance
description: Copperfutures prices, which had been steadily dropping lately, bounded back yesterday in moderately heavy trading on no particularly bullish news.

title: Milan Youths Fight Police
description: MILAN, Italy, June 7 (Reut ers)Leftwing university stu dents hurled gasoline bombs and stones in a battle here today with the police, who re taliated with tear gas.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The one major difficulty confronting any expansion ball club that desires to promote an OldTimers game is a lack of oldtimers to exploit. The carpetbaggers are better off because they can dust off heroes from the city they left behind and show them off in the city to which they moved. The Mets are even more advantageously situated. As out ofwedlock offspring of Giants and Dodgers they are able to claim any National Leaguer with a New York back ground as qualifying as a Met oldtimer.

title: For Bridge Operator: Fear, Frustration and Boredom
description: I didn't dare go out. It's bad enough when I have to raise the bridge on a normal morning. You should hear the abuse then. This morning? No sir. I wouldn't go out and talk to those drivers for nothing.

title: 1871 RIGHTS LAW REVIVED BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Ku Klux Klan law of 1871 was given new life today by the Supreme Court, which held unanimously that persons can sue in Federal court for dam ages against individuals who conspire to deprive them of their civil rights.

title: Briton to Visit China
description: LONDON, June 7 (Reuters) A former British Minister of Technology, Anthony Wedg wood Benn, will visit China in September for talks on closer cooperation between the two nations. Mr. Benn, who is Vice Chairman of the Opposition La bor party, and his American born wife, Caroline, have been invited by the Chinese Insti tute of Foreign Affairs in Pe king.

title: List of Bridges Affected by City Strike
description: Following is a list of the 27 drawbridges affected by yesterday's strike (asterisks denote bridges that were later reopened):

title: Albany's School Failure
description: The Legislature has increased by 50 per cent the state's subsidy of nonpublic schoolsat the very moment when children in public school systems face serious curtailment of services. It has brushed aside the State Constitution, which explicitly prohibits such sup port of churchrelated schools as is spelled out in the legislation's perpupil aid formula. The lawmakers thus have followed a politicsbeforeprinciples scenario which has set the tone for the current session. The fact that they have acted with the advice and consent of the Gov ernor and the majority of the Board of Regents illustrates the floundering nature of leadership in Albany.

title: BURLINGTON CLOSING 3 SOUTHERN PLANTS
description: Burlington Industries, Inc., the nation's largest textile producer, is closing three plants producing, a substantial portion of its woolen goods, it was announced yesterday by Harry S. Stern Jr., president of the worsteds division. Plants employing 1,200 will be shut down at Drakes Branch and Brookneal, Va., and at Lexing ton, N. C.

title: FRED O. CLARK
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., June 7 Fred O. Clark, retired president of John G. Simmonds & Co., re cently dissolved oilinsurance underwriters, died at his home here today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 72 years old.

title: AURELIO FORESAW MUNICIPAL STRIKE
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio said in Albany last Saturday afternoon that he fully anticipated a municipal employe strike yesterday morn ing, and pinpointed the targets the city's water supply, roads and drawbridges.

title: Pension Frustration Led to Talk of a CommuterTargeted Strike a Month Ago
description: Leaders of unions represent ing municipal workers, bridge operators and housing employ es, increasingly frustrated by the Legislature's failure to ap prove their pension plans, began to talk of a selective but crippling strike more than a month ago.

title: New Hampshire Girls May Still Marry at 13
description: CONCORD, N. H., June 7 The third attempt in six years to increase the state's mini mum marriage age from 13 years to 16 for females and from 14 to 17 for males was defeated Monday, 13 to 10, by the state Senate.

title: Coast Radio Station May Lose License
description: A hearing examiner for the Federal Communications Com mission has recommended that a radio station in Puyallup, Wash., be deprived of its broad cast license for violations of the agency's fairness doctrine, which requires stations to pro vide balanced discussion of controversial issues.

title: J. I. RADALE DEAD; ORGANIC FARMER
description: J. I. Rodale, Whose enthusi asm for organic farming (avoid ing chemical fertilizers) brought him fame and fortune in recent years through his magazines and books, died yesterday after being stricken while taping an interview for the Dick Cavett Show on WABCTV. He was 72 years old and lived in Em maus, Pa.

title: 3 Soviet Spacemen Board Workshop After Docking
description: MOSCOW, June 7Three Soviet astronauts maneuvered their ferry craft Soyuz 11 today to a rendezvous and dock ing with the space station Salyut and then boarded the station's spacious crew quar ters to inaugurate the first manned scientific workshop in orbit around the earth.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ATLANTA, June 7 (AP) Hoyt Wilhelm, Atlanta's 47 yearold knuckleball reliever who has been on the disabled list this season, was activated by the Braves prior to tonight's game with the St. Louis Cardi nals. The Braves placed Mike McQueen on the 21day dis abled list. McQueen strained his left elbow yesterday.

title: Audie Murphy Buried With Military Rites at Arlington
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)Audie Murphy, who won every medal the Army gives for gallantry, was buried under two oak trees at Arlington National Ceme tery today. President Nixon said his heroics symbolized the bravery of all American fighting men.

title: Melnyk Skips U. S. Open
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., June 7 (UPI)Steve Melnyk, who won the British Amateur golf title, is back home and says he has had enough golf for a while.

title: EDWARD CORBETT, PAINTER, 61, DIES
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass., June 7  Edward Corbett, a painter of landscapes and ab stractions of unusual expres siveness, died yesterday after a sudden illness at his sum mer home here. He was, 51 years old and lived also in Washington.

title: LIGHTWEIGHT CREW TO RACE HEAVIES
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 7 Harvard's undefeated light weight crew will make collegi ate rowing history late this month when it races against the finest heavyweight crews in the country in the PanAmerican Games trials.

title: IRAQ ANNOUNCES OIL PRICE ACCORD
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 7 Iraq and the foreign oil com panies operating there conclud ed a priding agreement tonight.

title: Chairman of Adelphi U. Board Is Named as Acting President
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., June 7 Randall P. McIntyre, chair man of the board of trustees of Adelphi University since Oc tober, 1970, and vice president of McIntyre Aviation, Inc. of Ronkonkoma, L. I., has been named acting president of the university, effective June 15.

title: Fire Threatens 50 Homes
description: JEMEZ SPRINGS, N. M., June 7 (UPI)A forest fire threat ened 50 summer homes and forced campers in Santa Fe Na tional Forest to pack up and flee today. Gov. Bruce King said he would call out the Na tional Guard if the threeday old fire jumped firelines and burned into state timberland. Aerial photography showed that 6.900 acres of pine had already been destroyed.

title: Budget for I. L. O. Submitted on Basis That U.S. Will Pay
description: GENEVA, June 7C. Wilfred Jenks, Director General of the International Labor Organiza tion, today submitted to the agency's annual conference a budget of $71,503,000 for 197273.

title: C.N.R. Orders Rail Cars
description: MONTREAL, June 7 (UP) Canadian National Railways said today it had ordered new railway equipment valued at more than $15million.

title: Ronan Says Transit Fare Is Certain to Rise on Jan. 1
description: Dr. William S. Ronan, chair man of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, said yesterday that the collapse in Albany on Sunday of a legis lative package to provide new subsidies for transit operations would mandate substantial in creases in the city transit fare Jan. 1.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEARRIOT OCCURS AT YONKERS TRACK
description: YONKERS, June 7Several hundred fans among the 17,799 present for the $25,000 final of the Pandora Pacing Series at Yonkers Raceway tonight de layed the start of that onemile test for 15 minutes with a nearriot that was quelled by the appearance of a halfdozen city police cars from Yonkers.

title: BIES'S 135 EARNS U.S. OPEN BERTH
description: Don Bies, a touring pro from Seattle, carded a 68, 67135 yesterday to lead the nation's qualifiers bidding for berths in the United States Open golf championship to be held June 1720.

title: Judge in Mylai Case Denies Request for Secret Data
description: FORT MEADE, Md., June 7 (UPI)A military judge re fused today to subpoena the secret records of a House hear ing into the Mylai slayings for use at the trial of Col. Oran K. Henderson, who is accused of failure to fully report the inci dent.

title: Pakistan Recalls Bills Of 500 and 100 Rupees
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June 7The Pakistani Govern ment removed from circula tion today part of the nation's currency in an effort to check the economic effects of looting from banks in East Pakistan.

title: AMEX PRICES CUT BY PROFIT TAKING
description: The American Stock Ex change ended lower yesterday in slow trading after profit tak ing erased most of the earlier gains.

title: Bid to Move Death Trial Is Dropped in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, June 7Pros ecutors in the trial of Arthur F. Turco Jr., a New York law yer who faces charges of con piracy to murder, today with drew their request to move the trial out of Baltimore.

title: POLICE FAIL TO FIND MURDERHOLDUP LINK
description: The police have been unsuc cessful in their attempt to link two members of the Black Pan ther party who were captured in a holdup last Saturday to the murder of two policemen in Harlem on May 21, a po lice source said yesterday.

title: JACKLIN HEEDING A DEATH THREAT
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 7 (AP)Tony Jacklin of England, who was threatened with death if he played in the Ulster open golf championship this month, has pulled out of the tournament.

title: Sugar Plum for South Africa
description: The United States officially condemns apartheid and enforces a United Nations arms embargo against South Africaand then hands South Africa an annual present of $4.8 million in the form of a sugar subsidy. This foreign aidthe General Accounting Office called that in 1969to a highly advanced country with booming economy, a country that practices a virulent brand of racial discrimination, is only one of many dis graceful effects of the Sugar Act.

title: Sant' Alfio Villagers Watch Etna's Lava Grind Toward Homes
description: SANT ALFIO, Italy, June. 7 A 200yardwide river of lava from Mount Etna pushed to within two and a half miles of this village today, wiping out crops and crushing at least one peasant Cottage.

title: Kennecott Assails F.T.C. on Its Order To Cut Peabody Tie
description: Merger News

title: Lafayette Names Coach
description: PLATTEVILLE, Wis., June 7 (AP)Tom Davis, 32 years old, former basketball star at Platte ville State University, has been named basketball coach at Lafayette College. Davis suc ceeds Hal Wissel, recently named coach at Fordham Uni versity.

title: AMEX PLAQUE MARKS 50TH YEAR INDOORS
description: The American Stock Ex change unveiled a sidewalk plaque yesterday commemorat ing its 50 years as an indoor securities market.

title: Bridge: Fein's Team Rallies to Win Ressinger Knockout Laurels
description: In a rallying finish, the team headed by Hal Hein of Eastchester, N.Y. won the Reisinger knockout team of four, the final event in the Eastern States Regional Tournament. In a matoh that ended early yesterday morning at the New York Hilton, Fein's squad beat a team headed by Merle Tom of New York City by 53 Inter national Match Points.

title: Order Barring False Ads Signed by General Foods
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) The General Foods Corpora tion, the nation's largest food processor, has signed a Federal Trade Commission order barring false nutritional claims in the advertising of any of its prod ucts, it was announced today.

title: City Strike Leader Victor Harry Gotbaum
description: Man in the News

title: F.D.A. SPECIFIES RULES ON PRESCRIBED DRUGS
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) The Food and Drug Admin istration ruled today that labels and advertisements for pre scription drugs must include adverse conclusions reached by Government  sponsored scien tific panels. But the agency exempted nonprescription medi cines from the requirement, saying it would deal with them later.

title: Dorati Extends Term With Capital Symphony
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Antal Dorati has agreed to extend his contract as music director of the National Sym phony Orchestra through the 197374 season.

title: J. B. Stryker Weds Miss Dooley
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., June 7Miss Catherine Ma rie Dooley and James Burke Stryker were married here this afternoon in the chapel of the College of New Ro chelle.

title: Cards Top Braves, 76, in 10th Inning
description: ATLANTA, June 7 (UPI) Matty Alou, hit by a pitched ball on a controversial call, stole second and then scored on Ted Simmons's single with none out in the 10th inning to night to give the St. Louis Cardinals a 76 victory over the Atlanta Braves.

title: Appeal Planned in Fund Case
description: The Fidelity Management and Research Company said yester day that it would appeal to the Supreme Court a decision hand ed down Friday by a Federal Appeals Court in Boston hold ing it guilty of misconduct in not attempting to recapture some brokerage commissions for the benefit of shareholders in mutual funds under its spon sorship.

title: U.N. Aide in Pakistan
description: GENEVA, June 7  Prince Sadruddin Khan, the United Na tions High Commissioner for Refugees, arrived in Pakistan yesterday to discuss possible arrangements for the return of the East Pakistani refugees who fled to India, his office announced today.

title: Extra Feature at Music Hall: N.Y.U. Graduation
description: Radio City Music Hall, bet ter known for its highkicking Rockettes and its movies, was filled yesterday by rows of mortarboards and purple aca demic gowns and the strains of Bach and Handel.

title: Body Found in Lake
description: LAKE RONKONKOMA, L. I., June 7 (UPI)A young Bronx man who disappeared yester day while scuba diving with friends was found drowned in Lake Ronkonkoma this morning. The body of Jose Diaz Jr, 23 years old, of 1120 Wyatt Street Bronx, was found in 30 feet of water 75 yards off the Brook haven Town Beach. It was dis covered by Robert Conway of Rocky Point, L. I., a skin diver.

title: Group Says It Caused Blast During Lisbon NATO Talks
description: LISBON, June 7The mili tant Portuguese opposition movement Armed Revolutionary Action said today that it was responsible for recent acts of sabotage in Lisbon that coin cided with the meeting here of the North Atlantic Treaty Or ganization's Ministerial Coun cil.

title: Gains Reported by Big 4 in Berlin Talks
description: BERLIN, June 7  The am bassadors of the United States, Britain, France and the Soviet Union reported today that they had made encouraging prog ress at their talks on the status of Berlin.

title: Kay Medford, Rooney Win Annual Straw Hat Award
description: The second annual Straw Hat Awards honoring excellence in the American summer theater during 1970 were presented yesterday at the Faberge Town House, 5 West 54th Street.

title: Bond Set in Indian Protest
description: RAPID CITY, S. D., June 7 (UPI)Six members of a group of Indians arrested after walk across the stone sculp tured faces of four Presidents on Mount Rushmore National Memorial were each held today under $500 bond.

title: West Germans Unveil a Train Designed to Run at 350 M.P.H.
description: BONN, June 1 The proto type of a new electromagnetic train that may one day con nect major West German cities at a speed of 350 mile an hour has been unveiled in Munich.

title: DANCES OFFERED BY CLARK CENTER
description: The Clark Center for the Performing Arts presented its 1971 New Choreographers Concert Sunday evening, in cluding works by seven chore ographers. Technically the pro gram was made a fiasco by being and illtimed. Clark Center's heart is in the right place, but for some time now it has not been sufficiently organized to present performers adequately. Its midtown loca tion makes it an advantageous place to visit, but its disorgani zation makes it of questionable worth to the dancers and choreographers.

title: U.S. Defends Support of Thai Troops in Laos
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The State Department said today that the financial and material support that the United States was providing Thal volun teers fighting in Laos on be half of the Laotian Government was fully consistent with all pertinent legislation.

title: Aircraft Company's Quarter Net Up
description: The troubled Lockheed Air craft Corporation yesterday an nounced a profit of $8.3million, or 73 cents a share, for the quarter ended March 28.

title: Pensions vs. Public
description: The outrageous strike by unionized municipal employes that made a shambles of traffic yesterday, endangered lives, jeopardized the water supply and threw a spread ing paralysis over other city services demonstrates how completely New York City has become prisoner of its pampered civil service unions.

title: Key Pension Provisions
description: Following are the major pension provisionsand their statusof New York City's employes and of some workers in private industry:

title: Second Rad Day for Avila: Out of Money in 2 Races
description: Normalcy returned to Bel mont Park yesterday.

title: High Court Grants Hearing On Jailing of Father Groppi
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The Supreme Court granted a hearing today to the Rev. James E. Groppi, the militant civil rights priest who had been ordered to jail for contempt by the Wisconsin State Assembly in 1969.

title: Space Communication Parley Urged to Revise Channels
description: GENEVA, June 7A world conference, called by the International Telecommunica cation Union to serve channels for communication with space satellites, opened today in the Geneva convention ball.

title: High Court Eases Doctrine On AtLarge Voting Areas
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Supreme Court ruled 5 to 3 today that states are not required to carve out separate legislative districts for urban Negroes merely because the election of legislators at large from a metropolitan area gives innercity blacks little representation.

title: LOUIS WARMFLASH, APPAREL DESIGNER
description: SPRINGFIELD, N. J., June 7 Louis Warmflash, a leader in apparel design for more than 50 years, died today in St. Barnabas Medical Center, Liv ingston. He was 72 years old and lived at 42C Forest Drive.

title: Maharam Awards Given For Theater Designs
description: Winners of the 197071 Joseph Maharani Foundation awards for scene and cos tume designs were an nounced yesterday, at the luncheon meeting of the Drama Desk, the association of New York theater writers, at Sardi's Belasco Room.

title: ELLEN QUICK
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., June 7 Miss Ellen Quick of 150 Elm Street, formerly for many years head of the stenographic de partment of Price, Waterhouse & Co., a New York City ac counting firm, died today at the Alexian Brothers Hospital. Her age was 81. She retired in 1952.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: June 7, 1971

title: Fire Prevention Week Set
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) President Nixon, calling at tention today to the 12,000 peo ple who die in fires each year, proclaimed the week of Oct. 3 as Fire Prevention Week. The President said fires continue to bring tragedy and, property losses exceeding $2billion to the nation despite technological advances.

title: Nader Organizing Doctors To Monitor the Profession
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N. J., June 7 (AP)  Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said today that he was organizing a group of medical doctors who will monitor the medical profession the way his lawyer groups have dealt with onsumers problems.

title: Bodies of General and Wife Found in Wreckage of Small Plane in California
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7  A retired Air Force general and his wife were found dead today in the wreckage of their light plane in a rugged mountain area 60 miles northwest of Los Angeles.

title: Installment Customers Tell Hearing of Bilkings
description: A BedfordStuyvesant wom an said she was forced to continue payments on a $900 usedicar that broke down three weeks after she bought it.

title: Publishers Fear Lower Standards
description: BOSTONA national book store chain executive's con tention that the American public is overwhelmingly un interested in books, oblivious to literary reviews and must be lured into stores by the kind of garish displays used by supermarkets and gas sta tions has stirred widespread debate. It has also prompted some selfexamination by book publishers who are try ing to maintain high literary slandards.

title: Refugees and Cholera Increase in India
description: CALCUTTA, India, June 7 (Reuters)The number of East ??stani refugees flooding into India reportedly neared five million today. Cholera in epi demic proportions threatened this squalid capital of West Bengal state.

title: Foe of War Killed
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., June 7 (AP)One of the early leaders of the campus antiwar move ment, Prof. Arnold Kaufman, was among the 50 persons killed.

title: U.S. Airman Knocks Out Foe
description: TOKYO, June 7 (AP) George Carter, Japan's middle weight champion and a United States airman from Chicago, knocked out a lightheavy weight, Dynamite Takigawa, in the third round of a scheduled 10round nontitle fight tonight. Each fighter weighed 161 45 pounds.

title: City Wins Court Approval To Subpoena by Bullhorn
description: The city won permission yesterday to serve a subpoena in an unusual way.

title: Brooklyn Officer Dies in Wart
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Warrant Officer Jerry Foy of Brooklyn, of the Army, had been killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: Mary Elizabeth Banta Is Dead; Long a Missionary in Chinatown
description: Mary Elizabeth Banta, a Lu theran missionary who was known as the mother of China town because of her service there, died Thursday at the Wartburg Lutheran Home for the Aging in Brooklyn. She was 96 years old.

title: 7% Rate Is Set
description: The nation's largest bank, the San Franciscobased Bank of America, announced yesterday effective immediatelyan in crease to 7, per cent from 7 per cent in its minimum charge on homemortgage loans.

title: PLANE WRECKAGE IN SMALL PIECES
description: DUARTE, Calif., June 7 (UPI)An Air West DC9 jet liner disintegrated so complete ly after colliding with an F4 Phantom jet and crashing into a mountain that no sizable portion may ever be found, a Federal investigator said to day.

title: City Team Reoccupies a Bridge And Figures Out How It Works
description: The city invaded and reoccu pied its first blocked bridge last night at 8 o'clock.

title: Food Stamp Offices to Close
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 7 (AP) The Department of Agricul ture says it will close four Pennsylvania food stamp offices and reorganize three others in a consolidation move. The of fices in Bethlehem, Couders port, New Castle, and Norris town will be closed. The offices in Clearfield, Uniontown and Williamsport will become sat ellites.

title: Kermit Fischer, 65, founder Of Instrumentation Concern
description: WARMVIINSTER, Pa., June 7 Kermit Fischer, founder and chairman of Fischer & Porter Co., manufacturer of instru mentation systems, died yester day of an apparent heart attack in Antwerp, Belgium. He was 65 years old and lived in Furlong.

title: Tanker Owner Sued by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 7, (Reuters)The Justice Depart ment filed suit today against the owner of the Norwegian tanker Tiberius, which alleged ly spilled approximately 550 gallons of oil yesterday into Casco Bay at South Portand, Me.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 8, 1971

title: How to Shrink Housekeeping Chores
description: Nobody Said You Had to Eat Off the Floor is actually a book on housekeeping, but by the time you've giggled your way through the first twothirds of it, you won't even mind.

title: Slow Motion on Strike Penalties
description: Evasion seems to have replaced resolution in the city administration's approach to the mandatory penalties state law requires against participants in last January's wildcat police strike.

title: Yanks Get Walton;
description: Danny Walton, a right handed hitting outfielder who usually hits the long ball or strikes out, became a New York Yankee yesterday in a trade with the Milwaukee Brewers.

title: A U.S. COMPANY GETS CANCER TEST RIGHTS
description: The Hadassah Medical Or ganization announced yester day that it had reached an agreement in principle with an American pharmaceutical com pany for the company's acqui sition of rights to a cancer di agnostic test developed in Is rael.

title: I.B.M. Introduces Programs
description: The International Business Machines Corporation an nounced yesterday two com puter programs designed to im prove the flow of stocktrans action information between a brokerage firm's branches and the major exchange.

title: FOUR FARM BILLS SIGNED BY CAHILL
description: TRENTON, June 7 Four measures aimed at improving the lot of migratory farm work ers in New Jersey were signed into law today, by Gov. Wil liam T. Cahill.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Supreme court took the following actions today:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MULHERN WINS TWICE AT MET COLLEGE NET
description: Pat Mulhern of Iona scored two victories to reach the quar terfinals of the Metropolitan college tennis championships yesterday at the West Side Ten nis Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Minicomputer Is Designed
description: Modular Computer Systems introduced yesterday a new minicomputer designed for real time measurement, control and communications applications. The new machine, called the Modcom I, is programcompat ible with the other computers produced by the Fort Lauder dale, Fla. based company.

title: Milwaukee Train Derailed
description: MILWAUKEE, June 7 (AP) A twocar Milwaukee Road commuter train was derailed today, injuring between 20 and 25 persons. The cars were re ported to have flipped on their sides.

title: ClayCourt Challenge
description: Defying dismal pastper formance charts and eyeing an uncertain future, the United States has decided to defend the Davis Cup on clay courts this year in Charlotte, N.C.

title: Broker's Cook Found Slain
description: A 50yearold cook, employed in the townhouse of a Wall Street broker, was found slain yesterday in his rom in the five story building at 237 East 61st Street between Second and Third Avenues. The man, ten tatively identified as Lucio Cavalcanti, worked for John L. Loeb Jr., a member of the brokerage firm of Loeb Rhoades, of 42 Wall Street. He was ap parently stabbed, the police said.

title: Motorists Get Advice On Overheated Cars
description: For motorists whose frus trations in the city's traffic jams are augmented by an overheated car, the American Automobile Association has some advice: Put the car in neutral and race the motor.

title: Notes on People
description: Aubrey M. Daniel 3d, the Army prosecutor of Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. who criticized President Nixon for having injected himself into the case, will join the Wash ington law firm of Edward Bennett Williams this sum mer.

title: Britain and Market Clear Major Hurdle
description: LUXEMBOURG, June 7Ne gotiations on the terms of Brit ish membership in the Euro pean Economic Community took a major step forward to day with agreement on a broadly worded British com mitment to reduce the world role of the pound sterling.

title: List of Victims Near New Haven
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) An incomplete list of the vic tims aboard the Allegheny Air lines turbojet that crashed today in East Haven, Conn.:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Unit Pricing in Stores Spreading Rapidly Across U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  It's called ComparABuy in Chicago, ValuPrice in Boston, Un I Price In Los Angeles, ChekMate in Denver. Valu Chek in Phoenix and TruPrice in Burlington, Iowa.

title: JAVITS BLESSES M'CLOSKEY'S BID
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Senator Jacob K. Javits gave his blessing today to Represent ative Paul N. McCloskey's challenge to President Nixon but said he was personally not yet prepared to sub scribe to such political of forts.

title: First Steel in Sears Building
description: CHICAGO, June 7 (AP)The first steel was set in place to day in Sears Tower, which eventually will be the world's tallest building. After the 25 by15foot section was installed, the first nut was tightened by Gordon M. Metcalf, chairman of Sears, Roebuck & Co., and Arthur M. Wood, president.

title: 76ers Sign No. 6 Draft Pick
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 7 (UPI) Jake Jones of Assumption College in Worcester, Mass., has signed a contract with the Philadelphia 76ers. Jones, a na tive of Neptune, N. J., and the 76ers' sixth draft choice, aver aged 18.3 points a game last season.

title: U.S. OFFICER HEED FOR WAR PROTEST
description: LONDON, June 7An Air Force officer, placed under re striction on the eve of his de parture for the United States and discharge, said today he expected to face a courtmartial for taking part in a protest against the Vietnam war.

title: Advertising:
description: The idea of unselling the Indochina war through a massive advertising barrage, which was only a seed in the mind of a Yale student this winter, has almost come to flower.

title: B52 Raids Reported on Bunkers South of DMZ
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, June 8 (AP)Four waves of B52's reportedly struck at enemy positions in northernmost South Vietnam yesterday in a move to counter a continuing: enemy threat there.

title: LAWMAKERS SEEK SHOWDOWN TODAY ON CITY TAX PACT
description: ALBANY, June 7As the Legislature again put off ad journment for another day, Governor Rockefeller and leg islative leaders prepared today to submit a $525million New York City tax package to rank andfile legislators of both parties tomorrow for a test of sentiment and a possible final vote.

title: IN THE NATION
description: DURHAM, N. C., June 7Humanity is above all nations, reads an inscrip tion carved on a stone bench at Duke University. That is an idea to which the nations generally pay more lip service than homage but it received unusual tribute at the university's commencement exercises today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: T.W.A. Loss Is Reduced In First 4 Months of '71
description: Trans World Airlines, Inc., reduced its loss for the first four months of this year to $41.2million compared with a deficit of $45.3million in the 1970 period, C. E. Meyer Jr., senior vice presidentfinance, told a news conference at the Union League Club yesterday.

title: Judge Suspends Jersey Trial As Kenny Suffers New Ailment
description: NEWARK, June 7The trial of nine present or former Jersey City, Hudson County or state officials and political leaders on corruption charges in Federal Court here was sus pended today because of the reported serious illness of the principal defendant, John V. Kenny.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MANILA, June 7 (UPI)  President Ferdinand E. ?? said at a news conferer?? day that he had conside?? ing libel suits over ?? Manila newspapers had ?? about him but decided ?? it because as President ?? the goatI get kicked ??.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Books of The Times
description: A PEEP INTO THE TWENTIETH CENTURY. By Christopher Davis. 200 pages. Harper and Row. $5.95.

title: ROMNEY REFUSES MORTGAGE SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Secretary of Housing and Ur ban Development George Rom ney announced today that he would not revise upward the 7 per cent interestrate ceiling on Governmentbacked mort gages on the ground that un derlying credit conditions did not warrant such an action.

title: Ceylon Insurgents Warned In Massive Leaflet Campaign
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, June 7 Government planes dropped 200,000 leaflets over Ceylon's forests today calling on the in surgents to surrender within the next three days. The leaf lets warned that those who did not use this last opportunity to surrender would face de struction. Leaflets have also been distributed in towns and villages inhabited by the insur gents.

title: Scientologists and F.D.A. Clash in Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The eightyear legal battle between the Food and Drug Administra tion and the Church of Scien tology moved into the Federal District Court here today with the Government arguing that counseling methods used by the church constituted a sub stantial public hazard.

title: Export to Soviet Approved
description: FRASER, Mich., June 7 (AP) The Cross Company, a sub urban Detroit maker of manu facturing systems, announced today that it had received Gov ernment approval to export $31million worth of Transfer Matic automated machine tools to the Soviet Union. Approval of the sale is part of a recently announced Government policy to allow freer export of high technology goods to Communist nations.

title: Assembly Backs Control Of Adirondack Park Land
description: ALBANY, June 7The As sembly tonight approved a bill proposed by Governor Rocke feller creating a state agency to oversee the development and use of private and public lands in the sixmillionacre Adirondack Park.

title: Court Declines Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) The Supreme Court declined today to hear an appeal from the owners of radio station WNJR in Newark, who were denied license renewal by the Federal Communications Com mission.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Yields on United States Treas ury bills rose in the Govern ment's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: At a U.S. Air Base, Yellow AlertAnd Boredom
description: PHUCAT, South Vietnam, June 2It was a week of high threat at the most mod ern United States Air Force base in South Vietnam, which looks like a chunk of suburban Southern California. High threat means possible attack.

title: DOW INDEX POSTS 6TH GAIN IN ROW
description: Weakness in International Business Machines and other leading glamour issues featured a stock market that, on the whole, kept to a fairly even keel yesterday.

title: Rutgers Board Election
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 7 (AP)William J. Gaskill, president of a New York pub licrelation concern, was elected chairman of the board of trust ees of Rutgers University at its annual meeting here today. Also elected were Mrs. Kathe rine Elkus White, a former ambassador to Denmark, to succeed Dr. Irwin W. Sizer as a trustee member of the uni versity's 11member board of governors. United States Dis trict Court Judge Frederick B. Lacey and Leo Nover were elected alumni trustees.

title: Casey Hints Active Role In Environment for S.E.C.
description: William J. Casey, the new chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, indicat ed yesterday that the S.E.C. would begin to play an active role in the relationship be tween American corporations and the environment.

title: Florida and Texas Droughts
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI) The nation's grain belt ap parently has enough water for the time being, a weather sur vey indicated today, but the Everglades and the Southwest remain parched. Less than half the normal rainfall has fallen in southern Florida in the past year in what is the state's worst drought. About three fourth of Texas was reported in severe to extreme ??ought.

title: G.I.'s Accuse Britons of Bias
description: ALCONBURY, England, June 7 (Reuters)Britain's Race Re lations Board will investigate a charge of racial discrimina tion lodged by black United States servicemen against two trailer camps here.

title: F.A.O. Appeals for Aid
description: ROME, June 7The Director General of the Food and Agri culture Organization appealed today for additional assistance to relieve the very serious humanitarian problem raised by the recent civil strife in East Pakistan.

title: Market Place: A Players Join  A Merger Game
description: There are a couple of new players in the Wall Street game: Let's merge Schen ley into Glen Alden.

title: Hanoi Reported Pushing Supply Effort, Repairing Laos Route to West of Trail
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  North Vietnam has begun an unexpected effort to step up the flow of war materiel through southern Laos during the current rainy season, ac cording to senior American military analysts.

title: Singapore Leader in Helsinki to Explain Policies at Press Parley
description: HELSINKI, Finland, June 7 Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew of Singapore, who has been widely accused of aiming to tame or throttle the press in his island republic, arrived in Hel sinki today to defend his ac tions before newspaper editors and executives from around the world.

title: Gen. Joseph O. Mauborgne Dies; Chief Signal Officer of the Army
description: ATLANTA, June 7  Maj. Gen. Joseph O. Mauborgne, U.S.A., retired, died Saturday in a nursing home near here after a long illness. He was 90 years old.

title: BritishSoviet Troop Talks
description: LONDON, June 7 (AP)Brit ain and the Soviet Union will hold highlevel talks this week on EastWest troop reductions, British officials announced to day.

title: Lawsuit Discloses A City Investigation Of Parking Bureau
description: The city's Parking Violations Bureau, less than a year old, has come under the scrutiny of the City's Department of In vestigation.

title: RESERVE UNIT VOTED TO MAINTAIN POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (Reu ters)The Open Market Com mittee of the Federal Reserve System voted unanimously at its March meeting to maintain prevailing moneymarket con ditions while accommodating any downward movements in longterm rates.

title: Congo University Students Told to Report for Army
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, June 7 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Congolese radio network today broadcast repeated in structions to Lovanium Univer sity students to report to the campus for conscription into the army.

title: Dance: For Clifford, Word Is Panache
description: Whatever it is that is panache, the New York City Ballet's young dancer and choreographer, John Clifford, has it in trumps. To see him dancing at the New York State Theater in Stars and Stripes for the first time on Sunday night, you just know that if that word panache had not existed, we would there and then have had to invent it.

title: G.I.'s Accuse Britons of Bias
description: ALCONBURY, England, June 7 (Reuters)Britain's Race Re lations Board will investigate a charge of racial discrimina tion lodged by black United States servicemen against two trailer camps here.

title: Debut Parties Continue, but It's a Tiny June
description: The June debutante sea son?

title: SENATE VOTES RISE IN G. I. PAY OF $2.7BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, June 8In a stunning reversal, the Senate approved today a $2.7billion increase in pay for all the mili tary services.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Draft Charge Denied
description: CHICAGO, June 8 (UPI) Herbert Muhammad Jr., 21 years old, a grandson of the Black Muslim leader Elijah Muhammad, pleaded not guilty today to charges of refusing to be drafted.

title: SPEED IS STRESSED ON LOCKHEED AID
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally Jr. disclosed to day that the British Govern ment could cancel its agree ment to supply RollsRoyce engines for the new Lockheed Tristar airbus if Congress did not act by Aug. 8 to provide financial assistance to the Lock heed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Pakistanis Jam Banks to Turn in Recalled Currency
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June Pakistani citizens, close to panic, tried to crowd into banks today to turn in huge amounts of paper currency sud denly without value as the re suit of a Government decree last night.

title: Administration Supports Child Development Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  After weeks of sharp internal controversy, the Nixon Admin istration declared limited sup port today for Congressionally initiated proposals to establish a Federally funded national child development program.

title: Manufacturers See Gains; Retail Sales Rose in April
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP)  Manufacturers expect their sales to increase modestly in the period from April through September, the Commerce De partment said today.

title: YANKEES WIN, 30, FOR STOTTLEMYRE
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., June 8 With Mel Stottlemyre con tinuing his strong pitching and Danny Cater erupting from his seasonlong hitting doldrums, the Yankees successfully started their 13game road trip tonight by defeating the California Angels, 30.

title: ENEMY ATTACKS NEAR PNOMPENR
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Wednesday, June 9 (Reuters) North Vietnamese troops struck hard at Government forces yesterday in a new attempt to seize the marshy eastern ap proaches to Pnompenh.

title: Advertising:
description: Philadelphia's five major department stores, sorely troubled by the soaring cost of shoplifting, which in their city comes to $150million annually, are going to try to do something about it through advertising.

title: Article 7  No Title
NEWCOMBE UPSET BY PILIC, 98, 64
description: BRISTOL, England. June 8 (UPI)Nikki Pilic of Yugoslavia upset topseeded John New combe of Australia, 98, 64, in the first round of the $48,000 Wills open grass tennis tourna ment today.

title: LONDON'S HOLDING OF STERLING RISES
description: LONDON, June 8The Treas ury reported today an un usually large increase in the sterling held in London oy over seas countries of the sterling area. The inflow, disclosed in a quarterly balanceofpayments statement, facilitated British repayment of big foreign loans.

title: City Is Checking Signs Of Sabotage on Bridges
description: Three separate investigations were under way last night into possible sabotage at several of the bridges closed by a strike of mridge employes early Monday.

title: Coast Golfer Leads
description: RYE, N.Y., June 8Robert Vaillancourt, a 58yearold player from Santa Barbara, Calif., shot a 2underpar 70 to day to take the lead In the 67th annual United States Seniors Golf Association championship.

title: U.S. Aides See Improved Chance for Suez Accord
description: PARIS, June 8United States officials say that a message from President Anwar elSadat of Egypt had slightly advanced the prospects for an interim agreement this year on reopen ing the Suez Canal.

title: Russians Alter the Course Of MarsBound Spacecraft
description: MOSCOW, June 8  The Soviet Union reported today that it had corrected the tra jectory of one of its two in strumented spacecraft on the way to Mars.

title: LADANIOCARSKI, 72, EXOFFICER OF BANK
description: NEW HAVEN, June 8 Valerian LadaMocarski, who retired as vice chairman of the J. Henry Schroder Banking Corporation of New York in 1964, died today in St. Raphael's Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: Tax Package's Highlights
description: ALBANY, June 8Following are highlights of the $525million New York City tax authorization package for the 197172 city fiscal year beginning July 1:

title: 12 KENYANS JAILED IN CONSPIRACY TRIAL
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, June 8 Sentences ranging from seven years to nine and a half years were imposed today on 12 Ken yans who admitted they had conspired to overthrow the Kenya Government. All plan to appeal.

title: YOUTH UNIT HEAD FOR CITY RESIGNS
description: Voicing criticism of state and Federal budget cuts, the city's Youth Service Commissioner has resigned, the Mayor's office announced yesterday.

title: Soviet Space Station
description: Soviet scientists and engineers have scored another major space first by creating the large manned orbiting station now circling the earth. Manned vehicles have orbited before this, but they have all been relatively small.

title: Chou Calls On Smaller Nations to Unite to Resist Superpowers
description: PEKING, June 8Premier Chou EnLai, warning that the danger of world war persists, called today upon small and mediumsized nations to unite and resist bullying by super powers.

title: 6 CITIES GET GRANTS FOR CHILD ADVOCACY
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare an nounced to pay a grant total ing $656,000 for demonstration projects in six cities designed to improve community service for children through a system known as Child Advocacy.

title: Sadat Backs a 6month Truce
description: CAIRO, June 8  President Sadat, during a visit to the Suez Canal front in the last two days, has reiterated willingness to reinstate a ceasefire with Israel for six months along the canal, but insisted that Egyptian troops must cross to the East ern shore as part of a plan to open the waterway.

title: Major League Box Scores
EightYear House Arrest Of Apartheid Foe Is Ended
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, June 8 (Reuters)  Mrs. Helen Joseph, an outspoken op ponent of apartheid, was re leased today from house arrest after an eightyear term.

title: Lava Flow on Mount Etna Ebbs And Scientists Predict Inactivity
description: SANT ALFIO, Italy, June 8 (UPI)A thin trickle of lava rolled harmlessly down one slope of Mount Etna today and scientists said Europe's tallest and most active volcano was becoming silent again.

title: Article 5  No Title
Joe E. Lewis Rites Attended By Many of Comic's Friends
description: Nearly half a century of mak ing people laugh was observed sedately yesterday by an over flow assemblage of family, friends and show business as sociates of Joe E. Lewis, the nightclub comedian who died here on Friday at the age of 69.

title: Moorer Confers With Franco
description: MADRID, June 2 (Reuter) Mm. Thomas H. Moorer, chair man of the United States Joint Chiefs of stoff, was granted audiences today with the spanish head of state, Gen eralissimo Francisco Franco, and his designated successor, Prince Juan Carlos of Bourbdn.

title: Civil Service Aide Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Senate confirmed today President Nixon's nomination of Jayne Baker Spain to be member of the Civil Service Commission.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Jim Bunning of the Phillies is an estimable man with nine children and more baseball strikeouts than all other pitchers but the incomparable Walter Johnson. The tall, lean and aging righthander with the whiplash delivery went zinging past the hallowed Cy Young on the career list the other day and Old Cy was such a paragon of pitching excellence that they even named a trophy after him.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Julian Bond Says Blacks to Run As Favorite Sons in Primaries
description: WASHINGTON, June  Georgia State Representative Julian Bond rejected today the idea of a black independent running for President next year and said Negroes instead would enter favorite son candi dates in several Democratic state primaries.

title: United Air Lines Campaigns to Land More Women
description: This month is ladies' month for United Air Lines and throughout the system coun ter displays are inviting sweet young things of all ages to get into United's sweepstakes.

title: Brydges Says Anarchy in City Must Be Laid, in Part, to Mayor
description: ALBANY, June 8Earl W. Brydges, the Senate Majority Leder, charged today that the Lindsay administration was at least partly responsible for the anarchy in the city.

title: PERJURY LAID TO 2 IN POLICE INQUIRY
description: The first indictments result ing from the Knapp Commis sion's 11month investigation into alleged police corruption were handed up yesterday by a Manhattan grand jury against two suspended policemen.

title: Britain and France Plan Study of Channel Tunnel
description: LONDON, June 8 (AP)  Britain and France announced plans today for the forma tion of joint companies to consider building a tunnel under the English Channel.

title: Polish Research Team Reports Early Successes in Testing Experimental Syphilis Vaccine in Rabbits
description: A Polish announcement re ported yesterday by United Press International said that a group of scientists headed by Dr. Mieczyslaw Metzger had successfully tested in rabbits an experimental vaccine against syphilis.

title: Youngsters Ignoring Appeals to Keep Hydrants Off
description: Ignoring appeals from city officials, youngsters opened several thousand street hy drants yesterday to cool off in the gushing waters, dropping water pressure drastically in many areas of the city.

title: A $2BILLION PLAN TO PROVIDE JOBS PASSED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, June 8De spite threats of a Presidential veto, the Senate approved to day a $5.5billion economic de velopment bill that includes $2billion public works program to help tide the nation over the recession.

title: Britain Displays Train With 155 M.P.H. Speed
description: DERBY, England, June 8 (AP)Britain's national rail road today displayed 155 mileanhour train that is ex pected to be ready for use in Britain in 1974.

title: A Sick Session
description: This was, in all probability, one of the most thoroughly regressive, antidemocratic, anticonsumer, antiurban boondoggling and backwardlooking sessions of the State Legislature in all history. It leaves the state far worse off than before the Legislature convened so long ago in January.

title: Dispute Over Total
description: GENEVA, June 8  R. K. Khadilakr, Indian Minister of Labor, Employment and Reha bilitation, told the International Labor Organization conference today that four million refugees from Pakistan had taken shel ter in our country.

title: Soviet Astronauts Refine Orbit To Keep Station Aloft Longer
description: MOSCOW, June 8The Three Soviet astronauts aboard the assembled SoyuzSalyut space station settled down to a daily routine today in what had the appearances of becoming a long mission.

title: Seymour Aide Warns F.T.C. on Specious Cash Sales
description: The chief of the Consumer Frauds Unit in the United States Attorney's office here warned the Federal Trade Com mission yesterday that its pro posed new law on installment buying would not have teeth unless it was changed to cover a newly widespread consumer swindle called the specious cash sale.

title: ACCORD REACHED
description: Striking municipal workers accepted a settlement formula last night and agreed to end immediately their walkout which had disrupted the city for the last two days.

title: MRS. J. DOUGLAS LAKE
description: Mrs. Maria Matilda Morel Lake, wife of Dr. J. Douglas Lake, a plastic surgeon, died yesterday of a cerebral hemor rhage in Doctors Hospital. She was 53 years old and lived at 136 East 64th Street and in Southampton, L. I.

title: Heflin Still Unconscious
description: HOLLYWOOD, June 8 (AP) Van Heflin, remained uncon scious and in critical condition today, two days after he suf fered a heart attack while swimming, a hospital spokes man said. The 60yearold actor is in the intensive care cardiac unit at Cedars of Lebanon Hos pital. He was found clinging to a ladder of an apartment house pool Sunday, his head barely above water.

title: Article 2  No Title
3Pier Fire Snarls Cars On West Side Highway
description: A fire destroyed three abandoned piers on the Hud son River between 66th and 69th Streets yesterday after noon, sending so much smoke into the air that the West Side Highway had to be closed until 10 P.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FUTURES DECLINE IN PORK BELLIES
description: Futures prices of pork bellies, from which bacon is sliced, fell yesterday in heavy trading on the Chicago Mercantile Ex change. Early in the day, prices dropped and their lower levels prompted an acceleration of the buying, causing prices to rise somewhat.

description: The burgeoning strike of mu nicipal workers drew to a close last night after a day of swift developments that raised fears among many New Yorkers and brought some solace to others.

title: 70 Honored by Boys Clubs

The legisla tors were those who have been members, advisers or board members for 925 boys clubs across the nation.

title: JOHN GIBSON, SERVED JOHNSON & JOHNSON

title: MRS. ARTHUR KATZ
description: Mrs. Celia Mendelsohn Katz, an artists' and, illustrators' rep resentative and founder of the American Artists Company, died yesterday at her home in the Dorchester Towers, Broad way and 68th Street. She was 78 years old.

White has not yet an nounced his candidacy for re election to the nonpartisan post. Other city councilors who have announced they will run Sept. 14 are John L. Saltonstall and Joseph Timilty.

title: Nothing Else to Do, Asserts Striking Sewage Worker
description: It was the first question rny Kevin asked me, said John J. Connor. What about the pollution, Dad?

title: Commission Investigates Low Exacta at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, June 8  The New York State Harness Racing Commission began an investigation today of last night's fifth race, in which a 13to1 shot beat a 9to2 chance, but the exacta payoff was only $42.60. Winning bet tors, having expected any exacta return three or four times that amount, created a disturbance.

title: White House Aide Says He Criticized Newsman
description: WASHINGTON, June 8A senior White House official acknowledged today that he had sharply criticized the coverage of the White House by Dan Rather, a correspond ent for the Columbia Broad casting System, during a breakfast meeting with one of Mr. Rather's superiors.

title: One Thing Is Certain: Chesapeake Will Win
description: CHESAPEAKE, Va., June 8 (AP)  Chesapeake. College will meet Chesapeake College in basketball Dec. 14.

title: Jazz Polish Added To Hampton Band By Veteran Talent
description: The big bands that Lionel Hampton has led for most of the last 30 years have been notable for their depth of jazz talent and the dissipation of this talent on relatively simplis tic riff arrangements. Until recently, the talent was young and not yet generally known. Nowadays, when Mr. Hampton puts a big band together, he is inclined to call in his almuni so the talent is now better known, but much of it is still given little reason to be present.

title: Navy Official Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) President Nixon accepted to day the resignation of Assistant Secretary of the Navy Charles A. Bowsher of Illinois, effecfive June 30.

description: The New York Mets had a tough time winning an easy game last night, which is just a way of saying that victories aren't as easily gained as retro spect or anticipation makes them seem.

title: Morse Memorial Tomorrow
description: A memorial service for Arthur D. Morse, the author and Journalist who died June 1 in an automobile accident in north ern Yugoslavia, will be held at noon tomorrow at the Ethical Culture Society at 2 West 64th Street. Algernon D. Black, leader of the Ethical Cultural Society, will officiate at the ser vice, which wil?l be held in the Society's Meeting House.

title: MRS. CHARLES RUSSELL
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 8  Mrs. Ethel King Russell, a mem ber of a family long prominent here and in New York, died today at her home, Berkeley House, at the age of 80. In 1928, she was married to Charles Howland Russell, who died in 1965.

description: ROME, June 8 (UPI)Piero Gherardi, the Italian scene de signer and costumer who won two Academy Awards, died last night at the age of 61.

description: Merger News

title: Article 8  No Title
2 British Soldiers Injured By 4 Gunmen in Belfast
description: BELFAST Northern Ireland, June 8  Two British soldiers were injured tonight when four gunmen stepped from a crowd and opened fire with subma chine guns in a Belfast street shortly before dark.

title: Denver Gets Peek At Its New Museum
description: DENVER  Some unkind souls have already referred to it as an Italian castle wrapped in aluminum foil, and a campy set for a production of Hamlet. But citizens are proud of their new $6million Denver Art Museum, a for tresslike structure setagainst a distant backdrop of Rocky Mountains and said to he the largest between Kansas City and the West Coast.

title: For New National Cities
description: It is no longer reasonable to say that under our federal system cities must continue only as supplicants to their states. Cities like Houston and Detroit and Philadelphia are each larger than fifteen of the 50 states. And the budget of my own city is larger than the budget of New York State.

title: Thais Mark King's Reign
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 8 (AP)With a big parade of her American military equipment today, Thailand celebrated the 25th anniversary of the reign of King Phumiphol Aduldet.

title: ARTS UNITS IN CITY ARE GIVEN $50,000
description: Six community art groups in the city's five boroughs are the beneficiaries of more than $50, 000 in grants contributed by one of the country's largest corporations.

title: WILLIAM R. WHITE
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 8 Wiliam R. White, who was run ning unopposed in the Republi can primary for Princeton town ship committeeman, died yester day of a heart attack while at tending a committee meeting. He was 50 years old and lived at 174 Dodds Lane.

title: Goheen Reminisces on the Past At Princeton's Commencement
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 8 Dr. Robert F. Goheen, presi dent of Princeton University, told graduating seniors this morning that the changes they had witnessed during their un dergraduate lives might not seem very shocking several years from now.

title: Lewis Shea, 72, Headed Connecticut National Bank
description: EASTON, Conn., June 8 Lewis A. Shea, chairman of the board of the Connecticut Na tional Bank, died yesterday at St. Joseph's Manor in Trum bull. He was 72 years old.
