title: 95 Yachts Entered in Newport Race
description: Twentyeight trophies, cups and assorted prizes await the best, near best and worst per formances by a fleet of 95 yachts entered in Saturday's Annapolis to Newport, R. I., race.

title: Legislative Wreckage
description: When Assembly Deputy Minority Leader Albert H. Blumenthal, Democrat from Manhattan, accepted the Citi zens Union award for outstanding publie service this year, he gave a progress report on the State Legislature, which was then still in session. An old chestnut summed up his Sentiments:

title: For Young Readers: The Human Condition
description: After reading this story three times (once for plot, twice for pleas ure) I have reinforced my opinion that children's books are a final lit erary refuge for romance, sentiment and extravagance. Where else, in 1971, could one read, What have you done, my dearest! Now I must leave you! Now my life on earth is over forever. Farewell, beloved, fare well! And in a faint voice she added, Be true to me. Farewell, beloved. Ah, woe is me! And she slipped out of the boat. Did she mingle with the waters of the Danube? Did she flow away with the waves? Did she sink into the darkgreen depths? None could tell. Oddly enough, the words are not ridiculous. Like the paintings of Arthur Beckham, they pull the adult reader back into a kind of fairytale racial unconscious; a world in which magic, elves and the super natural seem vaguely familiar. It may be questioned whether contem porary children still enjoy this world, but I believe that they doat least until their environment spoils it in the name of Growing Up.

title: Golar Quotes Colonial Document in Defending Forest Hills Project
description: Simeon Golar, chairman of the City Housing Authority, quoted from The Flushing Remonstrance, a Colonial docu ment on individual freedom, as he delivered a new attack last week on opponents of a pro posed 840unit lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: HURDLES RECORD SET BY TEXAS SCHOOLBOY
description: CHICAGO, June 12 (UPI) Randy Lightfoot of Plainview, Tex., set a national high school record of 13.4 seconds in the 120yard high hurdles and Mar shall Dill of Detroit won the 100 and 22yard dashes today at the AllAmerican high school track meet.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The crisis in municipal services in New York City last week points up an eco nomic problem of growing dimensions: How can we meet the problem of inflation stemming from the service industries?

title: The Vietnam Elections
description: South Vietnam's approaching elections, for the Na tional Assembly in August and the presidency in October, pose critical problems for the United States.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Having been trained in ship's nomenclature by my captain husband, I was dis tressed to read the words prow and gangplank, neither of which are words a seaman would use, in In Praise of the Sea. Otherwise I enjoyed reading this pleasant essay. My husband, the captain of a containership, tells me that prow is a word used only by writersthe proper term is bow. For gangplank, say gangway.

title: Law
description: The American system of justiceresting on the Con stitution, laws and decisions of the Supreme Courthas been based on a presumption of the innocence of the accused, with the burden of proving guilt beyond rea sonable doubt upon prose cutors and accusers. Last Week, speaking to the Na tional District Attorneys Association meeting In Wash ihgton, Attorney General John N. Mitchell wondered if perhaps the nation has not gone too far in protecting the rights of the accused. The preoccupation with fair ness for the accused, he de clared; has done violence to fairness for the accuser. Is justice served now by shack ling the prosecutor and giv ing more weapons to the de fense?

title: John Zink 3d Weds Evelyn J. Ragland
description: WINSTED, Conn., June 12 Miss Evelyn Jackson Rag land was married here this afternoon to John Henry Zink 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Zink Jr. of Baltimore. The bride is a daughter of Dr. Stuart Rag land Jr. of Colebrook and the late Mrs. Anne Jackson Rag land of Richmond.

title: Erich Segal's Identity Crisis
description: IF you look at the Book Review today you will find under the listing of paperback best sell ers: Love Story. Segal. This is go ing to be around for a long time. So why don't we all relax and get acquainted? One out of five Amer icans, says author Erich Segal, As sociate Professor of Classics at Yale, read that little book last year. One out of five! Yet Segal is suffering wounds. The New Haven student magazine, The New Journal, says he and his success have been the subject of fascina tion, amusement and scorn. One of The New Journal's editors, Yale junior Paul Goldberger, interviewed the beleaguered Segal. The results are reprinted below.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: It seemed too good to be true when I read David Salt man's description (Travel section, May 23) of how he obtained free accommoda tions in Marrakesh because he was a writerhe also said artists could get them, too. So I went to the Moroc can Mission to the United Nations and the Moroccan Tourist Office to check it out. Sure enough, they had never heard of any such thing. In fact they were incredulous. For a longtime reader of the Travel section this is a big disappointment. Certainly, being a painter myself, I would have loved to have visited Morocco at its Gov ernment's expense.

title: Architecture
description: YOU can't escape. In this city, where architec ture is an Immutable, magnificent fact, and where critic Ian Nairn can have 450 rigorously elected favorite buildings, I had hoped for a busman's holiday. When not paying professional atten tion to the British determina tion to do London in with ra tional planning, I would sim ply gorge on greatness.

title: Barbara Fox Williams Is a Bride
description: DEERFIELD, Mass., June 12Miss Barbara Fox Wil liams and Richard Henry Saunders 3d were married here this afternoon in the First Church of Deerfield. The pastor of the church, the Rev. Charles G. Titsworth 3d, performed the nondenomina tional ceremony, after which a reception was given at historic Joseph Stebbins house, which was built in 1774 and in which the par ents of the bride reside.

title: SANDY WITCH WINS IN JERSEY SHOW
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., June 12 Sandy Witch scored the first triumph of her career today when she won the regular work ing hunter championship at the West Jersey Hospital Horse Show.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: The kernel of Ned O'Gor man's complaint seems to be in this sentence: Personal witness, guilt, courage in the face of jail, contempt of one's family and friends, betrayal, all the outrageous facts of life one faces when one must stand against the times, cease meaning anything but something close to bathos when they are crashing down over one's head without art, without reticence, without style.

title: Movies
description: I HEARD some people talking recently about haw television is making us a land of sharers. Our children all know about the Cookie Monster and how to count to 10 in Sesame Street cadence. But they are separate sharers. They sit in their own houses, linked to other children only vicariously by the image flickering simultaneously on 10 million television sets.

title: 5% Rise in Cargo Rates Is Announced by I.A.T.A.
description: SINGAPORE, June 12 (AP) The International Air Transport Association announced today that its members have agreed to raise cargo rates an average of 5 per cent in most parts of the world starting Oct. 1.

title: Thomas Michaelson Weds Miss Hilton
description: In the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday afternoon, Miss Pamela Mary Hilton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Hilton of Ardsley, N. Y., and Dorset, Vt., was married to Thomas A. Michaelson, son of Mrs. Arthur Michaelson of Larch mont, N. Y., and Pompano Beach, Fla., and the late W. Michaelson.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: Ned O'Gorman's spirited essay on the Berrigans misses the point.

title: A Policeman Complains: Between gangsters and hoodlums, the Negroes and drunks, the college crowd and the crazy ones, it's a miracle more of us don't get killed
description: I have known the police sergeant who speaks here for five years. I have visited him again and again in his home and spent time with him while he does his workin Boston. In the following selections from long, tape recorded conversations I have tried hard to do justice to the range of his feelings, their ambiguity and complexity. I have wanted to learn how it goes for him in a difficult job, and he has been willing to let me knowhe is, in fact, a passionate teacher.

title: Froehling Triumphs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 12 (AP) Frank Froeh ling of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., beat Jose Edison Mandarino of Brazil, 16, 108, 63, in the Ulster grass tennis final today.

title: How L. I. Fared in Legislature
description: ALBANY, June 12How did Long Island make out in the long, stormy session of the Statist Legislature that Fi nally adjourned this week? That depends on the parti sanship of the legislator one talks to.

title: the traveler's world
description: This is the second of two articles on a tentative experiment in living the out door life.

title: BLACK POLICEMEN DISSENT ON ORDER
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12 Black policemen and police women, emerging as an activist group in the black community, declared themselves today in opposition to the law and order wing of the traditional police establishment.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: Now that the overthe counter market is steaming along nicely, dealers who spe cialize in unlisted issues are beginning to receive acquisi tion overtures from other fin ancial institutions.

title: Television
description: A GUY in Florida wrote, For God's sake, O'Connor, don't let CBS make a Com munist out of you! I was rath er touched by his concern for my psychological and philo sophical wellbeing. Carroll O'Connor's pale blue eyes sparkled as he reviewed some of the hate mail he has re ceived since he began to play Archie Bunker, the prejudice riddled hero of the All In the Family series. Physical ly he is the same bluff and beefy specimen of middle aged, lowermiddleclass Ur ban Man as the character he portrays. But the voice, caught during a lunch break, is softer and more gentle than Archie's, with occasional traces of an actor's train ing in the vowels.

title: Cigarette Purchases Decline for 4th Year
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (UPI) Marking the fourth consec utive year of decline, the Fed eral Trade Commission has reported that 198 packages of cigarettes per American adult were sold last year.

title: John Byrne Marries Jan Carleton
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June 12In the Reformed Church of Bronxville this afternoon, Miss Jan Louise Carleton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick S. Carleton, was married to John Conway Byrne, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph A. Byrne.

title: BUTYNES SCORES IN JERSEY 2MILE
description: HIGHLAND PARK, N.J., June 12With a running style strongly reminiscent of the great Emil Zatopek, Mike Butynes of Sterling powered his way to the twomile title at the New Jersey allgroup track and field championships today at Highland Park High School field.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The official documents on the origins and develop ment of America's involvement in the Vietnam war are now being quietly circulated in Washington. They have not been released or leaked by the Nixon Administration, but they are now in the hands of some Congress men and Presidential candidates, and they are now being published by The New York Times.

title: ARAB OIL GROUP PERILED BY RIFT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12 Differences between Arab countries are threatening to break up the Arab petroleum organization.

title: Miss Caponi Seeks 3d Golf Title in Row
description: The United States Golf Asso ciation, which devised a way of controlling the size of its field for the women's open this year, just made the limit. In a recent announcement, the U.S. G.A. said it would limit the field to 150 players and if more were entered, a draw would be held to reduce it to the proper number.

title: Leroy Carr Neon, lyrical intensity
description: THE blues have come back to haunt us. The time machine of elec tronic processes has been breathing new life into an impressive group of blues artists, including Robert Johnson, Son House, Bessie Smith, among whom Leroy Carr also takes his place with the newly rereleased album Blues Before Sunrise (Colum bia). As America stumbles into the seventies, there is a genuineness to this revived interest in a onceignored past, for here is an authen ticity which the culture has somehow lost, as well as the roots of unresolved com plexities of the present times.

title: JAMES J. KANE
description: RAHWAY, N. J., June 12 James J. Kane, assistant to the chairman of, Merck & Co. here, died yesterday in Doylestown (P.) Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived in New Hope, Pa.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: On our package tour of London and Paris we were given coupons worth about $7 each. In Paris we made reservations for the dinner and show at the Lido night club and turned in our cou pons (the price was three coupons each or $21) upon entering. We were seated and handed the menu, but on being informed that we were using coupons the maitre d tore the menus out of our hands and said four words, Chicken, veal or hamburg er. When we protested that we were paying as much for the dinner and show as was called for in the menu, 105 francs (about $21), he repeated, Chicken, veal or hamburger. Had we not al ready turned in our coupons, we would have left. This ex perience did not sour us on Paris or on the nice people, just on the Lido.

title: GRAEBER IS HURT IN HIS SEMIFINAL
description: BECKENHAM, England, June 12 (AP)Stan Smith of Pasa dena, Calif., won the men's final at the Kent grass tennis tournament today with a 97, 6.4, 64 victory over Premjit Lall of India.

title: Idea of Marriage Bureaus Gains in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, June 12An unexpected show of support has developed here for the idea of establishing com puterized marriage bureaus to help the millions of single Natashas find their ideal Andreis.

title: CONTRACT BALKED AT MINES BUREAU
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The United States Bureau of Mines, under criticism for al legedly lax safety enforcement, has met new controversy over a plan suggesting that careless ness by individual miners is a major cause of the coal indus try's high rate of accidental in jury and death.

title: The madeleine recaptured
description: She did what many mothers might have done in the same situation. Here was her grownup son, Marcel, chilled to the bone. Hot tea was just what he needed, tea and some of her spe cial cookies, the little madeleines. Marcel dunked one of the shellshaped cookies, which taste like sophisticated spongecake, in his tea. And then: No sooner had the warm liquid, and the crumbs with it, touched my palate, wrote Marcel Proust at the beginning of his monumental, semiautobiographical novel, Re membrance of Things Past, than a shudder ran through my whole body, and I stopped, intent upon the extraordinary changes that were taking place. He was not reacting to strychnine. The shudder was a thrill of recognition, for Marcel had suddenly remembered the same taste of tea and madeleines from years before. And with that memory came a flood of other vivid childhood recollections. Out of this accidental collision of cooky and consciousness, Proust constructed his esthetic philosophy, his celebrated theory that art is a way of conquering space and time, of achiev ing immortality through remembered tastes and smells and feelings. And now, exactly 100 years after his birth, Proust's own immortality is assured. The literary world is virtually un animous in acclaiming him as France's greatest modern writer. For cooks and mothers, how ever, there can only be one appropriate tribute: bake madeleines and serve them with tea.

title: TATE CAPTURES TWO A.A.U. JUMPS
description: Byron Dyce's diary will con tain a short entry for yesterday, but Norman Tate will have painful reminder of the Met ropolitan Amateur Athletic Un ion outdoor track and field championships at Downing Sta dium.

title: Denise Brender Leary Is Bride In Virginia of James Reston Jr.
description: HUME, Va., June 12Miss Denise Brender Leary, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. John Mil ton Leary of the Bronx, New York, was married here this afternoon to James Barrett Reston Jr., an author and son of Mr. and Mrs. Reston. The bridegroom's father is a vice president and columnist for The New York Times.

title: Kathy Whitworth Takes a 3Shot Lead With 70 for 214 in L.P.G.A. Tourney
description: SUTTON, Mass., June 12 (AP) Kathy Whitworth, playing near the top of her game and applying pressure on younger rivals, moved into a three stroke lead today in the $55,000 Eve Ladies Professional Golf Association championship.

title: FORSCH OF ASTROS BEATS BRAVES, 32
description: HOUSTON, June 12 (AP) Ken Forsch pitched a seven hitter as the Houston Astros beat the Atlanta Braves, 32, tonight.

title: Uptown
description: Subtitled The Story of Har lem's Apollo Theatre, told by the son of its cofounder and owner Frank Schiffman. Nos talgia occasionally dampens a page; but for the most part this is a good, light chronicle of black variety theater since the thirties and, incidentally, of Harlem's changing social scene.

title: Funds for Navy Yard
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Defense Department has asked Congress for $3.64mil lion for, short range improve ments at the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard. Representative Louis Wyman, Republican of New Hampshire said Tuesday that the money would be used for improvements to Drydock No. 2 and utilities.

title: Moore's Boat Wins 3d Time in a Row In Sound Racing
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 12Winds slowed the ac tion in the Yacht Racing Asso ciation of Long Island Sound competition today. But 94 boats were sent through their paces, anyway, and Jim Moore's Lutt scored its third straight victory in Resolute class competition.

title: Aldeburgh Music Festival Is Dominated by Britten
description: ALDEBURGH, England, June 12  England's most prestigious music festival takes place during most of the month of in a little Suffolk town and its inurie diate vicinity. The Aldeburgh Music Festival, guided by Benjamin Britten, is Peter Grimes country, as has been pointed out many times in the past, and it was no acci dent that Britten composed his most famous opera here. Aldeburgh and its neigh boring communities are fish ing villages that breathe older times amid ruins of ckurches and castles. The setting is beautiful, and the people are charming.

title: Dr. Nathan W. Ackerman Dies; Founded Family Institute in 60
description: Dr. Nathan W. Ackerman, the founder in 1960 of the Family Institute and its director of pro fessional programs, died yester day of a heart attack at his country home in Putnam Valley, N. Y. He was 63 years old and lived also at 124 East 84th Street.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Howard E. Kershner in his letter (May 16) sounds like the announcer I heard on Radio South Africa. He is a good student of Afrikaans; he recites very well.

title: Reagan May Have Found a Tax Shelter in Cattle Breeding Herds
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 12  For more than a month, Gov, Ronald Reagan has been the center of political contro versy after having acknowl edged that he paid no Califor nia taxes on his 1970 income.

title: Memorial Project Planned on Nazi Era
description: A group of survivors of the Hitler era are beginning a se ries of publishing and research projects designed to make the world remember and learn from that period in history.

title: Celler Assails Mitchell
description: Representative Emanuel Cel ler of Brooklyn yesterday crit icized Attorney General John N. Mitchell for upholding wire taps on dangerous radicals. The DemocraticLiberal Con gressman said that unless he is checkmated, the Attorney General woold teear our Con stitution to tatters.

title: 2d British Motorcyclist Is Killed at Race Meet
description: DOUGLAS, Isle of Man, June 12 (Reuters)Maurice Jeffrey of Britain was killed today when his motorcycle crashed on the opening lap of the 500 cubiccentimeter senior event of the Interna tional Tourist Trophy meet ing.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: An article (May 16) by Alex Kroll of Young & Rubi cam about creative advertis ing mentions sincerebutbor ing ads.

title: Photography
description: IT'S curious how photog raphers keep trying to imitate painters. During the midnineteenth cen tury, when sentimental genre and allegorical pictures were popular, photographers posed costumed models, cut up the resulting pictures and pasted them down on separately photographed backgrounds. Then they rephotographed the whole thing to produce complicated figure composi tions that lacked only color and perhaps a certain facture to be mistaken for the real thing.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: During the recent primary election campaign, the voters of Philadelphia were offered successively the advice of Ramsey Clark, of Washington, D. C., Allard Loewenstein, of New York, N. Y., Milton J. Shapp, of Marion, Pa., and Edward M. Kennedy, of Hyannisport, Mass. The voters re jected their advice and nominated me for mayor.

title: Red Barr, Coach of Swimming At Southern Methodist, Dead
description: EL PASO,lek., June 12 (UPI) Alfred (Redj Parr, Southern Methodist University's swim ming coach; died of a 'heart attack in his hotel room early today. His age was 62.

title: Greenburgh Master Plan Is Scored
description: ELMSFORD, N.Y., June 12 After almost two years of work, a proposed new master plan for future development of Green burgh came before the Town Planning Board this week at an official public hearing, and ran into a storm of criticism from more than a score of civic groups, neighborhood organiza tions and individuals.

title: 5 Favored Porsches Drop Out of Race at Le Mans,
description: LE MANS, France, Sunday, June 13The 24 Hours of Le Mans emerged in fog at the halfway point this morning and suddenly the expected Porsche sweep disappeared.

title: 13 Quit Editorial Posts At News Weekly in France
description: PARIS, June 12The chair man and the editorial board of L'Express, France's leading news weekly, have resigned be cause the chief stockholder, JeanJacques ServanSchreiber, decided to resume control. There were 13 resignations in all.

title: BOY SCOUTS SLATE EXPLORER OLYMPICS
description: The Explorer Olympics, a na tionwide competition sponsored by the Boy Scouts of America for members of the Explorer Division, will stage the largest of more than 250 regional Olympic programs June 19 in Orange County, Calif. More than 1,000 boys between 14 and 18 years of age, will com pete in 41 individual and team events.

title: ROSS, COLSON REACH STATE TENNIS FINAL
description: Steve Ross of Brooklyn and Bill Colson of Coral Gables, Fla., reached the final of the New York State men's tennis championship yesterday at the North Shore Tennis and Rac quets Club in Bayside, Queens.

title: Headliners
description: C. Northcote Parkinson, the British author and humorist, has dreamed up a series of laws that poke fun at the corporate business bureaucracy (Work expands so as to fill the timo available for its completion; Growth leads to complexity, complexity to decay). Now, it seems, he is setting out to defy some of those laws. He was in New York last week in a new roleas chairman of an inter national publishing firm devoted to books on how to suc ceed in big business.

title: Music
description: FEW things are more elusive than a fitting subject for, an opera. As for the libretto, no one has yet solved that rid dle. The least equivocal defi nition I know was given by Menotti: A good libretto is one which inspires a coin poser to write a good opera. I once read that Puccini had spent more than three years in search of a subject. Then, finally, the one he fancied was forbidden to him by the author, Ferenc Molnar, who said My play doesn't need your oboes. (The same play, however, got some oboes eventually, when it became the Broadway musical Car ousel. Dramatists take heed.)

title: Crime Rate of Women Up Sharply Over Men's
description: LOS ANGELES, June 12 Women are gaining rapidly in at least one traditional area of male supremacycrime.

title: Miss Cynthia M. Swain Married In Peoria to James Rafael Davis
description: PEORIA, Ill., June 12 Miss Cynthia Malinda Swain and James Rafael Davis were married here this eve ning in the First Baptist Church. The Rev. Alfred J. Jefferies performed the cere mony, assisted by the Rev. Edward Bush.

title: Morris Cohen, Librarian at Penn, to Head Harvard's Prestigious Law Library
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12 Morris L. Cohen, the law li brarian at the University of Pennsylvania Law School here, will move July 1 to the pin nacle of his specialized profes sion, the Harvard Law School.

title: Recordings
description: LIKE the archeologist who stays on to work the digs after the head lines about the new discovery die away, Ray mond Lewenthal continues to unearth Aiken artifacts  small and often fascinating piano pieces. In case you didn't know, Lewenthal is the Iris Love of Romantic music. And like that American who recently discovered a long sought Temple of Venus, Lew enthal leaves no stones un turned in his quest.

title: Pornography Protest Is Staged in Times Sq.
description: A thousand teenagers of the Salvation Army marched through the Times Square area yesterday in a silent demonstration against por nography.

title: NORM JOHNSTON WINS U.S.T.F.F. DECATHLON
description: WICHITA, Kan., June 12 (AP)Norm Johnston, the for mer Iowa State athlete now competing for the Husker Striders of Lincoln, Neb., won the United States Track and Field Federation decathlon to day with 7,298 points.

title: Art
description: FOR the castlel visitor to exhibi tens of new art, for the innocent reader of the art columns of the weekly news magazines, and in general, for the large public that eaves drops on the current art scene without actually following it with any serious concern  for all such innocents, must often seem that the art world, or at least that part of it engaged in the production of new and farout styles, is a virtual monolith of publicists, id eologues, bureaucrats and tastemakers laying down this or that line for any given season. The reality, of course, is something quite different. It is much more a crossfire of competing Ortho doxies than anything resembling even a temporary unanimity of opinion or presiure. The true scenario is, more oft en than not, a scenario of intellectual conflict, frequently expressed with fierce, contempt for rival points of view.

title: To THE EDITOR:
description: How moved I was by the power, insight and clarity of Ned O'Gorman's analysis and hopes.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The eighteenyearold vote raises a new voting issue.

title: Reader's Report
description: It seems to me like a per fect, perfectly joyful New York kind of thing! writes a young secretary to a married man in a kind of breadandbutter note for a one night stand. Later, after a season of naughty rendezvous, an assignation at the Frick Museum, a motel weekend in Norfolk and sundry bittersweet encounters, the girl is an attempted suicide, and her summer bachelor is left reproaching himself at her bedside, thinking of antidotes and flaws in his character.

title: Suffolk Parties to Pick County Nominees
description: BLUE POINT, L. L, June 12 About 300 of Suffolk Coun ty's top Republicans will gath er at the old Olvany estate here next Thursday to designate their party's candidates for county offices this fall.

title: GOVERNOR DRIVE OPENED BY EVERS
description: DECATUR, Miss., June 12 Charles Evers, the black Mayor of Fayette, Miss., opened his campaign for Governor today on the eighth anniversary of the murder of his brother, Medgar.

title: FAIRFIELD, MYOPIA PLAY IN 7GOAL POLO
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 12 The Fairfield County Hunt Club polo team, which lost its outdoor opener by one goal last week, will meet Myopia of Hamilton, Mass., tomorrow at 3 P.M. at the hunt club here.

title: 5 Tons of Illegal Fireworks Seized in North Bergen Raid
description: NORTH BERGEN, N. J., June 12 (UPI)A task force of New York and New Jersey policemen seized five tons of illegal fire works in a raid early today on a factory here. Two men and a woman were arrested.

title: FEDERAL PROPERTY PUT AT 435BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The House Government Operations Committee has re leased a 347page study putting the rise in United States prop erty value at $38.87billion in just two years and the value of Federal property throughout the world at $435.6billion.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTONDozens of other underdeveloped nations turn to Ja pan, the World Bank, the United Na tions or the Soviet Union for economic assistance, a distinguished black econ omist pointed out last week. The American black community might have to follow the same course, he said, because it was getting insuffi cient help from its own country to overcome its historical disadvantages.

title: Nassau Acts to Protect Buyers From Swimming Pool Frauds
description: MINEOLA, June 12, The Nassau County. Office of Consumer Affairs says it is tak ing steps to protect buyers of swimming pools from being vic timized by unscrupulous deal ers.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONSenator Stu art Symington of Missouri, who has something of the single mindedness of the bulldog mas cot of Yale, his alma mater, likes to recall how he wanted to go to Laos in 1965, only to be blocked by the American Ambassador in Vientiane. The Ambassador, it seems, did not want a Senator poking around in the clandestine war that that the United States was waging there.

title: MONTANA AROUSED BY PLAN FOR ROAD
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  The fate of an approach road to the proposed Big Sky recre ational complex in Montana is being considered by the Federal Highway Administration amid increasing opposition from con servationists.

title: 64 McNamara Report on Steps To Change the Trend of the War
description: We seek an independent nonCom munist South Vietnam. We do not re quire that it serve as a Western base or as a member of a Western Alliance. Vietnam must be free, however, to accept outside assistance as required to maintain its security. This assistance should be able to take the form not only of economic and social pressures but also police and military help to root out and control insurgent elements.

title: POLLUTION FIGHT IS WIDENED HERE
description: The Federal Government is extending Its drive on Hudson River polluters from industries on the river banks to inland plants whose toxic wastes ulti mately drain into the river.

title: Royals Beat Red Sox
description: KANSAS CITY, June 12 (AP) Chuck Harrison hit a three run double as the Kansas city Royals scored five runs in the first and went on to defeat the Boston Red Sox 70, behind Dick Drago tonight. It was the Royals fourth straight victory.

title: Movie Filmed at Nassau County Jail in East Meadow
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., June 12When 20th CenturyFox releases its new film Hot Rock, residents of East Mead ow will have a special reason to see it. Part of the movie was shot in their home town at the Nassau County Jail and the area surrounding it on Carmen Boulevard.

title: Dodgers Down Expos, 53
description: MONTREAL, June 12 (UPI) Jim Lefebvre hit a threerun homer in the first inning to night to lead the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 53 victory over the Montreal Expos.

title: Busing of Pupils Is Scored in Queens
description: Affluent areas of northeastern Queens cannot absorb all of the black public school students being bused in from southern Queens, a community planning board chairman has warned the City Planning Commission.

title: U.S.C. NINE IS VICTOR OVER SETON HALL, 51
description: OMAHA, June 12 (UPI) Southern California, the de fender, defeated Seton Hall, 51, tonight in a first round game of the College World Series after Brigham Young Univer sity ousted Mississippi State, 31, from the doubleelimina tion tourney.

title: 64 Memo by Joint Chiefs of Staff Discussing Widening of the War
description: Memorandum from Gen. Maxwell D. Taylor, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, to Secretary of Defense McNamara, Jan. 22, 1964, Vietnam and Southeast Asia.

title: Troops in Belfast Open Fire After 2 Bombs Are Thrown
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sunday, June 13 (Reuters) British troops opened fire on terrorists here early today after wo bombs were thrown at an army patrol in the city's market area.

title: To THE EDITOR:
description: The Berrigan movement is securely rooted in a tradition nearly as old as Christianity itself. From almost the be ginning of Christianity there has been an extremely im portant radical reform spirit which has had, as it is now having, a difficult time, but which has never disappeared for long. That spirit has been embodied in reformers as di verse as Simon the Stylite, St. Francis and Father Berri gan. But the conviction whith led them to actioneach in his own wayis very much the same. It is the conviction that the prophecy which fore told the end of the world and the coming of the Kingdom of God will be fulfilled. That expectation has sometimes led to a total rejection of man and his works. It has also, and often, been linked to a passionate desire to transform the world and make it perfect.

title: A survivor's Hollywood fable
description: The troubles that beset Daniel Fuchs's first novel in more than 30 years afflict his cast of Hollywood characters as well: at a spartanly posh Palm Springs desert resort they come not just singly but in pairs to bully or cajole aging film star Adele Hogue to return to the set of that multimillion picture from which she has just bolted so ir responsibly, or perhaps to ogle at her from the sidelines, all the wellfed wives and their barking executive husbands, the agents, the grifters, the hangerson, her distraught producer, her former gangster lover, his di vorced, though not estranged, wife; and, in fact, they come (or, rather, come on to her) hard and blunt, always paired with adverbs and ad jectives intended, I presume, to de pict states of their nonbeing, or half being, or being uptight to which they have all been yolked by Fuchs's vi sion but which, unfortunately, bully the life out of West of the Rockies.

title: A Meaty Whodunit: Grilling of Magret
description: LISTEN, I am a serious gourmet. I have put 15 years and thou sands of miles into it. On the Armstrong Ranch in Texas dur ing a shoot we lunched in an oak grove on quail wrapped in bacon and grilled whole over a mesquite fire. At Stalin grad (now Volgograd), supper was sol yanka soup in which floated chunks of sturgeon that had been caught in the Volga that very day, In Burgundy, in the great hall of the Chateau Clos Vougeot during the Trois Glorieuses, a wine fes tival, we dined for four hours: seven separate courses, six different wines plus a vieux mare.

title: Aretha Live at Fillmore
description: ARETHA FRANKLIN: Aretha Live at Fill more West (Atlantic.) Aretha Franklin has arrived at an almost awe some maturity. Working be fore a vibrant, responsive audience litre the one for this live recording at the Fill more West, she is very nearly the epitome of what a popu lar artist can be.

title: Ickx Lap Mark Unofficial
description: HOCKENHEIM, West Ger many, June 12 (AP)Jackie Ickx of Belgium set an un official Hockenheim lap record today of 1 minute 56.8 seconds in a Ferrari in training for to morrow's Formula 1 Jochen Rindt Memorial Race. Ickx sped round the 4.2 miles track averaging 130 miles an hour. He holds the official lap record of 2:00.5 set last year in the German Grand Prix.

title: Aleutian isle Prepares for a Nuclear Blast
description: AMCHITKA, Alaska, June 12 Atomic Energy Commission contractors are busy preparing this remote Aleutian island for Cannikin, a fivemegaton un derground thermonuclear blast scheduled for October.

title: Cost of Repairing Capitol Now Set at Only $100,000
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (UPI) The cost of repairing the March 1 bomb damage to the United States Capitol building will be about $100,000, half the original estimate, it was dis closed today.

title: C. W. Post and Adelphi Join Track Association
description: C. W. Post and Adelphi have been admitted to mem bership in the Metropolitan Intercollegiate Track and Field Association, it was an nounced yesterday by George L. Shiebler, secretarytreas urer of the association.

title: Unorthodoxy Pays Off for State MutualMost of the Time
description: When the fat cats with their fancy tax deals got the terrible news from Wapping ers Falls, N. Y., last year they could scarcely believe it.

title: PAKISTANI CHARGES MASSACRE BY ARMY
description: LONDON, Sunday, June 13 A Pakistani journalist who ac companied the West Pakistan Army when it crushed the in surrection in East Pakistan charged today that the troops had deliberately massacred the people of East Bengal.

title: Bucks to Open Camp July 15
description: MILWAUKEE, June 12 (AP) The Milwaukee Bucks an nounced today that their rookie training camp would open July 15th at Marquette University.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The Amsterdam article about wooden shoes, Tour ists Follow Where Klompen Lead (Travel section, May 23), reminded me of a little shop I visited while in the city. It may be a tourist trap, but if one is interested in buying a pair of wooden shoes, this is the place. The store is at 102104 Albert Cuypstraat and called A.W.G. Otten. It specializes in lawn pen, from the tiniest baby pair to those huge enough to fit the Jolly Green Giant.

title: INDIAN OPPOSING AID TO PAKISTAN
description: The one Indian leader with a record of having spoken out over the years for conciliation and compromise with Pakistan is now touring world capitals to ask that the Government of President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan be cut off from all forms of foreign assistance.

title: Italian Drivers Dodge Policemen as Compulsory Auto Insurance Takes Effect
description: ROME, June 12Hundreds of thousands of Italian motor ists dodged policemen today after compulsory motor vehicle ihsurance went into effect at midnight.

title: To THE EDITOR:
description: Insofar as Ned O'Gorman's article on Daniel Berrigan is a criticism of The Trial of the Catonsville Nine I agree with him. The play is a ser mon, an exhortation to ac tion; but it lacks dramatic structure and is not success ful theater.

title: HIGHLIGHTS IN THE WEEK
description: TREASURY SECRETARY CONNALLY disclosed Britain could cancel its agreement to supply Rolls Royce engines for Lockheed's airbus if Congress did not act by Oct. 8 to financially aid the troubled concern, which reported quar terly earnings of 73c a share.

title: Antiwar Rally Set For Next Weekend In Prospect Park
description: An allnight encampment, fol lowed by a peace rally, will highlight antiwar activities planned next weekend in Pros pect Park by the Coalition to Take Brooklyn Out of the War.

title: CHICAGO GETS PLAN TO MIX TEACHERS
description: CHICAGO, June 12A new plan he hopes will satisfy a Federal demand for greater in tegration of Chicago public school teachers was announced this week by School Superin tendent James F. Redmond.

title: GROUPS MAY LOSE SOME EXEMPTONS
description: ALBANY, June 12The Boy Scouts, the Young Men's Chris tian Association and many other organizations throughout the state that have been exempt from local real estate taxes may have to pay these taxes under a measure approved by the Legislature and signed into law by Governor Rockefeller.

title: The Other Auto Stocks
description: When investors think about automotive stocks, their minds are apt to go auto matically to the Big Three of the industryGeneral Mo tors, Ford and Chrysler.

title: AEOLIAN ISLES GET INFLUX OF HIPPIES
description: LIPARI ISLAND, Italy, June 7The Aeolian Islands, having weathered the arrival of 15 re puted Mafia leaders, are now having an influx of what, even the plainest peasants call those hippies.

title: AMTRAK TO RESUME WEST VIRGINIA RUNS
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The national rail passenger corpora tion, known as Amtrak, will begin daily, passenger service next September.over a 250mile route through West Virginia and Maryland.

title: U.S. TO AID JOBLESS IN L.I. SPACE FIELD
description: FARMINGDALE, LI., June 12  The United States De partment of Labor and a pro fessional engineering society joined forces this week to pro vide job assistance and place ment to unemployed engineers, scientists and aerospace profes sionals on Long Island.

title: S. E. Loebs Have Child
description: A daughter was born to Dr. and Mrs. Stephen E. Loeb of College Park., Md., on May 30 in the Georgetown University Hospital in Wash ington. The child, whose father is an assistant profes sor of accounting at the University of Maryland, is named Jennifer Robin.

title: Firmness, but Restraint
description: President Johnson was projecting an image of firmness but moderation, the study notes. In early June, he first requested and then rejected a draft from Mr. Rostow for a major policy speech on Southeast Asia that took an aggressive approach, and instead re lied on news conferences and speeches by other officials to state the official view, the account continues. In con trast to the Rostow approach, [the Pres ident's] news conference on 23 June and Secretary Rusk's speech at Williams College, 14 June, emphasized the U.S. determination to support its Southeast Asian allies, but avoided any direct chal lenge to Hanoi and Peking or any hint of intent to increase our military commitment.

title: Lynne Farwell, A Gallery Aide, Becomes Bride
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 12 Miss Lynne Watkins Farwell was married here tonight to Harold Hunter White. Jr.

title: Barbara Romaine Morrison Bride
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., June 12 Miss Barbara Romaige Morrison, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David James Mor rison, was married here this afternoon to George Bryant Wirth, son of the Rev. and Mrs. George Robert Wirth of Warminster, Pa., where the father of the bridegroom is pastor of the Neshaminy of Warwick Presbyterian Church. He is a former pastor of the Old Whaler's Chutch in Sag Harbor, L. I.

title: Braves Sign 3 Draftees
description: ATLANTA, June 12 (UPI)The Atlanta Braves today signed three of their draftees in the recent major league draft. They are Mike Beard, a left handed pitcher; Pat McKeen, a 22yearold righthanded pitch er, and Roger Williams, an out fielder.

title: The World
description: PEKING  Rumanian and Yu goslav leaders, preaching the philosophy of independent roads to Communism, paraded through Peking last week to the dismay of the Russians and the delight of the Chinese. The visits dram atized Peking's breakout from its relative isolation within the international Communist move ment.

title: Suspect Has Police Record
description: CHICAGO; June 12 (UPI) White, the accused hijacker, has an arrest record and was out on bond when the hijack occurred, the police said today.

title: HAPPEN RETAINS LONG JUMP TITLE
description: ENDICOTT, N. Y., June 12 Greg Flippen of Riverhead (L. I.) High School maintained his pattern of long jumping to day by capturing his fourth consecutive state public schools title in sunbaked Ty Cobb Stadium.

title: PROTESTERS FAIL TO HALT HOUSING
description: Despite the vehement oppo sition of middleclass home owners, the city's Housing Au thority has set a September start for construction of a 560 unit public housing project in the southwestern corner of Queens.

title: After 54 Great Books, 102 Great Ideas, nowcount them !Three Revolutions
description: This book cranks up all the neo scholastic distinguishing machines to suggest that Aristotle, were he alive today, would be writing articles for Commentary. (If so, how lucky for him he is dead.)

title: Bellport: Friction With the Lab People
description: BELLPORT, L. I., June 12 For more than a century, the only thing that ruffled this sedate coastal village of summering New York yachts men was the cooling sea breeze that swept in across the Great South Bay from Fire Island.

title: Et Al.
description: A peptalk for people with dull jobs. Stetson, a reporter on The Times, cites instance after instance of individuals escaping their humdrum existence, find ing a brighter day, glimpsing that guiding light. He inter viewed hundreds (from the famous to the unknown); and, after reading about the lives they abandoned, one suffers something on their ennui.

title: YOUTH JOBS CALLED SCARCE FOR SUMMER
description: Youths seeking jobs in the metropolitan area this summer face obstacles that may be more severe than at any time in recent years, according to Herbert Bienstock, regional di rector of the United States Department of Labor's Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Tract Offered to Minnesota
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) President Nixon has an nounced that the Government is offering Minnesota a 141acre Federal tract in Minneapolis for recreational purposes. The site, owned by the Veterans Admin istration and valued at more than $2million, has been de clared unneeded by Federal agencies. It is adjacent to the Fort Snelling State Historical Park.

title: On the Champs  Elysees: Hey, Aren't You the Girl Who Sits Across From Me in Abnormal Psych?
description: ISUPPOSE I shouldn't have been so surprised when I ran into a friend from Yale in the nave of Chartres Cathedral one morning last summer. After all, such coincidences do happen. But, then, running into the guy who rooms across the hall from mein the Paris Metro? And the next day seeing friend from high school on the Champs Elyses? The world may well be getting smaller, but I was beginning to believe I was in Times Square, not the Etoile, so familiar did so many faces seem.

title: John Carlock Weds Beverly M. Pollard
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 12Miss Beverly Mary Pol lard, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Irving Pollard, was married here today to John Gregory Carlock, son of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Car lock of Fanwood, N. J. The Rev. Arthur Leone performed the ceremony in St. Pius X Roman Catholic Church.

title: L.I. Emerald Association Elects Mackell President
description: Thomas J. Mackell, the Queens District Attorney, has been elected president of the Emerald Association of Long Island.

title: MANDATED FEE WINS STATE U. APPROVAL
description: ALBANY, June 12Students at State University colleges have voted to retain the pres ent system under which stu dents pay a mandatory fee for student activities as part of their tuition.

title: Cost of Driving an Auto Found Up$102in2 Years
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The American Automobile As sociaion's costofdriving in dex has risen to $1,550 for 1971$102 above the level in 1969.

title: L.I.R. Station Gets New Look
description: The beautification of the Kew Gardens station of the Long Island Railroad is the first proj ect in a cleanup campaign be gun by the newly normed Kew Gardens Improvement Associa tion in Queens. With money from its membership and $80 donated by commuters, the as sociation has planted trees, grass and bushes at the station.

title: To Sam Edwards he's just plain Victor
description: First it was The Naked Maja (Goya), then The Divine Mistress ((Mme. du Chatelet) and now, almost inevitably, Victor Hugo: A Tumultu ous Life. The biographer? Samuel Edwards, alas.

title: Phils Recall Vukovich
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12 (AP) The Philadelphia Phillies re called a third baseman, John Vukovich, from their Eugene, Ore., farm club in the Pacific Coast League tonight. Man ager Frank Lucchesi said Vuko vich, who will report tomorrow, would play third base for the next two weeks while Don Money is in summer Marine training.

title: Vast Review of War Took a Year
description: In June, 1967, at a time of great personal disenchantment with the Indochina war and ris ing frustration among his col leagues at the Pentagon, Secre tary of Defense Robert S. Mc Namara commissioned a major study of how and why the Unit ed States had become so deeply involved in Vietnam.

title: World Poll Finds Wide Belief in Life On Other Planets
description: Fiftythree per cent of inter national leaders in various fields believe in the existence of life on other planets, ac cording to the Gilllup Poll.

title: CLOSING OF 72D ST. BRAWS THOUSANDS
description: Something happened to 72d Street between West End and Columbus Avenues yesterday. There was no traffic.

title: Scince/Medicine
description: In a quiet, steady way, the Soviet Union has resumed its former role as a pacesetter in space exploration. This Is what it has accomplished in the last month:

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: It was fine to see someone finally question the useful ness of Father Daniel Berri gan's play, The Trial of the Catonsville Nine, in bringing about renewal in the Roman Catholic Church. Unfortu nately, Ned O'Gorman has not gone far enough in expos ing the incredible moral pre tentiousness of the play  and the fact that the author (and every critic I have read on it) has deliberately avoid ed the central question raised by the play and the actions of the Nine: that is, just how far can one's own sense of what is evil permit one to go in carrying out reme dial action?

title: Stewart Earns Pole Position In CanAm Challenge Cup Race
description: BOWMANVILLE, Ontario, June 12 Jackie Stewart will begin his first fulltime sched ule of CanAm competition to morrow by starting in the sea son opener from the pole posi tion. Denis Hulme, the defend ing champion of the series, known as the CanadianAmeri can Challenger Cup, will start from the second spot.

title: Senator's Son Weds Patricia Davant
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 12 Miss Patricia Jean Davant, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Waring Davant of Mill Neck, and Wayzata, Minn., was married here to day to Michael Parks Domi nick of Boulder, Colo., on of Senator Peter Hoyt Dominick, Republican of Colorado, and Mrs. Dominick of Washing ton and Englewood, Colo.

title: Garbage Employes Refusing Overtime In Detroit Dispute
description: DETROIT, June 12Detroit's 1,400 garbage men, in their first significant labor battle with the city, are refusing to work overtime, as tons of un collected refuse mount in al leys, and are threatening strike July 1.

title: sea Gate Is a WellPoliced Upper Bohemia
description: Sea Gate, the private res idential beach community on the western tip of Coney Island, is experiencing an in flux of young homeowners and former apartment ten ants who haire brought mo torcycles, long hair, Army fatigues and a different life style to the community.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I would like to congratu late Robert Alden on his In Praise of the Sea (Travel section, May 23), a beauti fully descriptive piece. You will understand how greatly I appreciated it when I tell you that when my wife and I sail soon on the Michel angelo it will be my 127th trans  Atlantic crossing. (I have never flown.) In 1958 I made my 100th North Atlantic voyage On the Queen Mary, which was my favorite ship of all time. The article brought back many fond mem ories because, like Mr. Al den, we have never lost our love for the sea and the magnificent ships that carry us across the ocean.

title: A'S BLUE STOPS YANKS, 134;
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 12Approximately 300 color fully and bizarrely dressed Shriners paraded around Oakland Coliseum today and helped create a festive mood for the game between the Athletics and the Yankees. As far as the Yankees were concerned, though, the afternoon had all the fun of a anging. It's not that the visitors from New York, didn't appreciate the Shriners in their costumes of red and green, blue and gold, green and yellow and orange and black. Or even the funnier looking ones in capes and desert headdresses and point ed, curledtoed gold shoes.

title: Coins
description: PIERRE deHAYE, Di rector of the Paris Mint, has announced that orders for France's 1971 Fleur de Coins specimen sets will be accepted until Sept. 30, 1971 unless the mint's quota has been reached before that date. These coins are made specially for collectors and are manufactured from se lected blanks, which are treated so as to produce a high proof brilliance.

title: The Bitter Taste Of Glory
description: When he's not hustling as Special Assistant to the Presi dent or president of the Motion Picture Association of America, Jack Valenti likes to read books about history (the Durants on Western civilization, Thomas Costain on British glory, Cather ine Drinker Bowen on early America). Out of this back ground and in the guise of amateur scholar he has writ ten nine essays on subjects he feels have special relevance to the present: Francis Bacon, Vol taire, John Randolph, the Found ing Fathers, etc. His style is brisk, his ideas superficial. There is no reason to believe he did not write this book himself.

title: A Threat to Life
description: There is the distinct possibility that if supersonic air planes fly regularly, they will rapidly deplete the ozone in the atmosphere and thereby jeopardize continued life on this planet. Ozone, which exists 10 to 30 miles above the ground, serves to isolate the thin, dry air of the stratosphere from the lower atmosphere and to absorb the sun's lethal ultraviolet rays. If ozone did not exists the ultraviolet rays would blind humans and animals, burn land plants and probably make higher forms of life on this planet impossible.

title: About Motor Sports
description: BOWMANVILLE, Ontario, June 12 Faithful CanAm fans keep psyching themselves with This year may be dif ferent. Maybe this will be the year some driverJackie Stewart, perhaps, or Jackie Oliverwill beat McLaren Motor Racing Ltd., which has won 29 of the 33 CanAm races run since the start of the 1967 season.

title: MURPHY ELECTED TO FOOTBALL JOB
description: George Murphy, former Unit ed States senator from Cali fornia and former motion pic ture actor, has been elected president of the National Foot ball Foundation. He replaces William FL Geyer, who becomes a vice chairman of the founda tion.

title: Fireflies Flown to Tokyo
description: TOKYO, June 12 (AP) About 20,000 fireflies were flown to Tokyo this week by air express from Japan's south ern islands of Kyushu and Shikoku. The lightning bugs will be released in the gardens of Chinzanso Restaurant for patrons to watch at night.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: NED O'GORMAN'S arti cle, Berrigan, the Church and the Nine, was a refreshing and Inspiring message to many of us who are groping our way through the confusions of contemporary Catholicism.

title: GIANTS BEAT METE, 51;
description: The San Francisco Giants continued to snap out of their celebrated June Swoon yes terday when they scored a 51 victory over the New York Mets, who now seem to be fading into a swoon of their own.

title: Twins Top Tigers. 5.4
description: DETROIT, June 12 (UPI) Singles by Cesar Tovar, his fourth of the game, and Rich Reese, a pinchhitter, capped a tworun rally with two out in the ninth inning today and brought the Minnesota Twins out of a fourgame losing streak with a 54 victory over the De troit Tigers.

title: Bankruptcies Increase
description: Was the Sheffield Watch Corporation, a spectacularly successful company in the nineteensixties, insolvent when its creditors forced it into a bankruptcy situation several weeks ago?

title: Calcutta Mayor Seeks To Halt Refugee Influx
description: CALCUTTA, India, June 12 (AP)The Mayor of Calcutta today demanded a cordon around the already over crowded city to prevent the further influx of refugees from East Pakistan.

title: Brandt Leaves for U.S. Visit
description: BONN, June 12 (Reuters) Chancellor Willy Brandt left Cologne by air today for a visit to the United States. He will spend the night in Jamaica and reach Washington tomor row.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: One day a news article reports a 6.25 per cent rise in steel prices. Then another tells of the reluctance of construction workers to ac cept the President's guide lines on wages.

title: Dance Troupe Plants Slippers Firmly on L.I.
description: GARDEN CITY, L. L, June 12At 1:30 P.M. Monday the pupils at the Hicksville Ele mentary School will bo treated to the 131st perform ance of the Nassau County Dance Ensemble, a troupe that has, performed before more than 100,000 elemen tary and junior high school students in the last two and a half years. It will be the troupe's last performance un til the fall.

title: Florida Banker at Bay
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  Many times, Edward Ball, the cantankerous octogenarian who is trustee for the estate of the late Alfred I duPont, has been called the most powerful man in Florida.

title: Pleasure Boat Operators Oppose Waste Standards
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  Boat owners and operators have been telling the Environmental Protection Agency that its pro posed standards to improve the quality of boat waste are too vague, too expensive, unreason able and unenforceable.

title: William Bundy Memo on Actions Available to U.S. After Tonkin
description: Excerpts from second draft of a memorandum, Next Courses of Action in Southeast Asia, by William P. Bundy, Assistant Secretary of State for Far Eastern Affairs, Aug. 11, 1964. A summary was cabled to the Pacific command and the embassies in Saigon and Vientiane on Aug. 14 with requests for comments. According to the Pentagon study, the full draft was edited in the office of Assistant Secretary of Defense John T. McNaughton. Words that were deleted at that time are shown below in double parentheses; words that were inserted at that time are shown in italics. Boldface type denotes underlining in the original document. Also, according to the McNaughton office's editing, the second paragraph, beginning We have agreed , was to be moved below, to follow the heading Phase OneMilitary Silence (through August).

title: Darien Consultant Shot on Plane Is First to Die in U. S. Hijacking
description: Howard L. Franks, the 65 yearold airline passenger killed in Chicago in Friday night's hijacking, was the first passen ger killed during the hijacking of a United States plane, the Federal Aviation Administra tion said yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Tom Wicker raises an interesting point in a recent column concern ing President Nixon's purstiit of a Vietnam policy that appears to be clearly contrary to public opinion. Mr. Wicker notes that the public official who resists political pressure and refuses to take the easy political course is honored as a statesman.

title: Dr. Meriwether, Sprinter, Wins Research Award
description: BALTIMORE, June 12 (AP) The J. D. Lane Award for excellence in clinical re search has been given to Dr. Delano Meriwether for work on leukemia. The award is for a significant contribution in original research.

title: Dance
description: ALTHOUGH I have been to Copenhagen nearly every year for the past 17 years one of the pleasures of being a dance criticit is about five years since I have managed to catch the May Ballet and Opera Festival given in Cop enhagen's Royal Theater. The season proper, which ends with this festival, starts promptly on Sept. 1, which is when I have usually man aged to catch a few perform ances of the Royal Danish Ballet, just to keep in touch and make notes.

title: The Government vs. the Eagle
description: ARLINGTON, Va.Last month, 48 bald and golden eagles were found dead in the state of Wyoming. It is virtually certain that many more eagles have died and have not yet been found in the remote Wyoming canyon country, the one place where it was hoped they might be able to make a comeback.

title: Chess
description: THE Marshall Chess Club Invita tional Rapids, probably the strongest speed tournament to take place in this country in many years, was played on Sunday, May 23d, and resulted in a well deserved victory for Grandmaster Ar thur Bisguier of Hartsdale, New York, who scored 61/411/2. International mas ter Donald Byrne of State College, Pa., was second with 5V2, and there was threeway tie for third: Marshall Club champion Andy Soltis, international master Edmar Mednis, both of New York City, and grandmaster Robert Byrne, now living in Ossining, New York, all scoring 53.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Nowhere does the state Commissioner of Housing and Urban Renewal, Charles J. Urstadt, mention in his Point of View article sup porting vacancy decontrol [May 23] that the reason for the enactment of the rent stabilization law two years ago was that in New York City landlords were increas ing rents on uncontrolled apartments in an unconscion able manner. These increases were as high as 60 and 70 per cent and possibly even more.

title: Black Roots
description: Ain't enough grandmammas in this collection to suit me. With them tales told in the kitchen over a bowl of coffee with a wedge of sweet potato pie to go nice with the sippin, when you huddle in the corner still damp from moppin to listen to Uncle Bubba or Aunt Hazel or whoever it is hold in forth bout old times and old wounds and what it was like to be comin up as a sharecropper or a jackleg preach er or whatever, or bout the time Grandaddy Cain hawked snake oil to send the kids to Tuskegee, or bout the time the twins run off to the circus and come home seasons later for Thanksgiving and everybody cried to see them so skinny, and Sister Ruth ransackin the neighborhood pantries tryin to fatten them up fore snow fall. Bout arguin blisteringly as to which remedy was the most for true, straight up, sho nuff African recipe for warts, easy birth, dropsy or what ever.

title: Draft Resolution for Congress On Actions in Southeast Asia
description: Draft Resolution on Southeast Asia, May 25, 1964, as provided in body of the Pentagon study. The major paragraphs of the resolution approved by Congress appear in the article accompanying the texts today.

title: OFFIRACK BETTING ON BELMONT CARD STARTS THIS WEEK
description: Still unable to trot smoothly, the city's Offtrack Betting Cor poration hopes to break into a run next week.

title: 26 Passengers Are Killed As Philippine Boat Capsizes
description: MANILA, Sunday, June 13 (Reuters)  Twentysix pas sengers were killed yesterday when a motor ferry capsized in Manila Bay, the Philippine navy said today.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONOf all the political and diplomatic Brah mins that dot the Washington landscapethe former Cabinet members and retired ambas sadorsnone carries a more im pressive set of credentials than Clark McAdams Clifford.

title: PHILLIES TRIUMPH OVER PADRES, 30
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12 (UPI)The Philadelphia Phillies got three unearned runs in the first inning tonight to defeat the San Diego Padres, 30, with Jim Bunning and Darrell Bran don combining to pitch the shutout. Bunning was credited with his fourth victory, having hurled seven innings.

title: John Baldwin 3d Weds Deborah Leslie Hyde
description: WESTON, Conn., June 12 Miss Deborah Leslie Hyde, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Al bert Fillmore Hyde 2d, was married here this noon to John Stiles Baldwin 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Baldwin of Coral Gables, Fla. The Rev. George Laedlein performed the ceremony in the Em manuel Episcopal Church.

title: Will the real one please stand up?
description: Do boys still read G. A. Henty? suppose not, and they are the poorer for it. Men who were boys when was a boy will thrill even today to the very namesWith Wolfe in Canada, and With Kitchener in the Sudan, and With Hornblower at Riga. Yes, most of all With Hornblower at Riga. No other book ever written (save perhaps its un justly neglected sequel With Horn blower in Nicaragua) so evokes the smell of tar and salt. In any mind vouchsafed the overpowering joy of first reading that book at an impres sionable age, the name of the great admiral Horatio Hornblower (1776 1357) was as irrevocably fixed as a flag nailed to the mast: and it was with a fierce sense of personal trage dy, transcending even the disaster to the Allied cause, that one heard of the loss of the battlecruiser H.M.S. Hornblower to Japanese torpedo planes off Malaya in December 1941.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: My husband and I have been to Europe and the West Indies several times in the past few years and we have used the tape trick for most of this time. We have a one inch strip of Red Scotch Lite on each end of all our lug gage. This Is the same mate rial used on auto bumpers and shows up very well, even in dark areas. We identify our bags easily. In case this method becomes too popular, the tape put on can vary in length, width and shape, or can be cut in an individual design.

title: GOV. WEST CANCELS 3D DEATH RULING
description: COLUMBIA, S.C., June 12 For the third time since his inauguration in January, Gov. John C. West has commuted a death sentence to life im prisonment.

title: Winder's Katrinka Triumphs in Off Soundings Club Event
description: SALT POND, Block Island, June 12The Off Soundings Club concluded its 34th annual spring race this evening with 212 yachts in six classes com pleting the 23mile course from Watch Hill, R. I. Yesterday, the fleet had raced from here to Watch Hill.

title: Cuba's Anticrime Drive To Include Identity System
description: MIAMI, June 12The Cuban Government has begun a drive against crime, according to the Havana radio.

title: Scouring Europe for the Perfect Square
description: OMETIMES when I'm traveling with my wife she'll go off to salon de coiffure or a friseur and we'll plan to meet afterwards. So as not to waste a precious minute of a visit to a strange city I choose a well known square ror our rendezvous, a place where I can wait, outdoors or in, observing architecture and people. Which square in the city do I want to spend my time in? What makes a pleas ant square? Can I providefor those travels with my wife first of alla list of the alltime greatest?

title: A Talk With George Jackson
description: The idea of interviewing George Jackson about his writ ing occurred to me last autumn when I read Soledad Brother, his remarkable and moving col lection of prison letters. Al though I had never done an author interview, I have read many and know roughly how they go: When do you do your best work? At dusk, in a Paris bistro, over a glass of Pernod. What childhood in fluences shaped your literary tastes? My parents home was a gathering place for the foremost writers of the day.

title: Old priorities never die they grow at 3.5% a year
description: Priorities is one of those unlike ly words, like ecology, that have suddenly sprouted on book jackets. The call for new priorities means simply that the Government should start spending its money on cities, rivers and poor people instead of planets, highways and the upper mid dle class. How far has the move ment gotten? How sensible are its pniposais, and what are their pros pects? Some of the answers are here, and they are not encouraging.

title: Alfred G. Vanderbilt Jr. To Wed Alison Platten
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 12 Mr. and Mrs. Donald Camp bell Platten have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alison Platten, to Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt Jr., son of Mr. Vanderbilt of Mill Neck, L. I., and Mrs. Jeanne Murray Vanderbilt of New York and a descendant of Commodore Cornelius Van derbilt.

title: Explosives Rock Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sun day, June 13 (Reuters)A large ammunition dump in a sports stadium built by China in 1968 blew up today, jolting the cap ital with a series of tremendous detonations.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Some people hold the mis taken belief that the Cape Cod clambake has, because of laws severely restricting the use of open fires in Massachusetts, been con signed to the past.

title: A milder setting and a milder Abbey
description: It's never too late to plug a good book, and Edward Abbey's Desert Solitaire: A Season in the Wilder ness, first published in 1968, has finally appeared in paperback (Simon & Schuster, $2.95). I read it in shud dering gulps, every page three or four times, just trying to slow my self down, recognizing the birth of something like a classic. That was a journal, three years compressed into one. Now comes a fine novel (actually Abbey's fourth), which is as simple and slim as a fable, haunt ing and sweet. I was afraid it might seem like a comedown from the other book, but it does not.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: The article Wanted: Bright, Motivated M.B.A.'s (May 30) illustrates a form of social cancer that in no small way is responsible for the deterioration of the social and moral fabric of the Unit ed States.

title: Grumman Seeks a New Contract
description: With the recent orbiting of the Soviet Union's new space station, attention in the American aerospace indus try has been focused on plans to build a space shuttle in the United States. And per haps nowhere is that atten tion as keen these days as at the Grumman Aerospace Corporation in Bethpage, L. I.

title: Masters Policy Change Seen as Aid to Blacks
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., June 12 In a major policy change for the Masters tournament, it was announced today that winners of major tour events would receive invitations. The practice of permitting Masters champions to select one player by ballot was eliminated, as was the point system under which eight players were se lected from the tour.

title: TO THE EDITOR:
description: Ned O'Gorman's small voice crying alone in the wil derness is not Daniel Berri gan's but his own, and high time it was heard. (That it should be heard through the pages of The New York Times ought to beget cries of Eu reka!) The fact is that to the great majority of Catholics, unafraid of being accused of paranoid orthodoxy, jail bird priests and renegade nuns, accused of kidnap plots seem better casting for the Dick Cavett Show than for the Church.

title: FIGURE IN DISPUTE KILLED IN CAROLINA
description: BALSAM GROVE, N. C., June 12 Vernon McCall, a moun taineer who was the central figure in a bizarre property dis pute with the Federal Govern ment last winter, was killed in a highway mishap here tonight. He was struck by an automobile as he and several Companions sat on the edge of the pavement of State Highway 215, a lightly traveled rural road.

title: Newyork
description: Newyork

title: New Haitian Liberal Party Names Leader in Queens
description: Max Laudun has been named chairman of the newly formed Haitian American Liberal Party Association of Queens County.

title: Miss D'Albora Bride of R. C. Frey
description: WARWICK, R. I., June 12  The Greenwood Commu nity Church, Presbyterian, was the setting here today for the marriage of Miss Frances Lee D'Albora, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. John B. D'Albora Jr., to Richard C. Frey, son of Thomas F. Frey of Paris and Mrs. Frey of Hinsdale, Ill. The Rev. Dr. Robert Peterson performed the ceremony.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The disturbing events here in Ceylon this year must have caused some apprehension in the United States. I have re ceived many letters inquiring about our safety. Let me say that life is fast returning to normal, and soon it will be possible for tourists and others to visit Ceylon again without inconvenience. Mean while, a year has passed since my letter of invitation ap peared (Travel section, May 10, 1970). [In that letter, the writer who is married with six young childrenoffered free accommodations in his home, including meals, to any American desirous of visiting Ceylon.] I wish to remind readers that the offer is still open and we are prepared to accommodate not just one person but a couple or even a small family.

title: Logistics of Fresh Air Fund Vacations Has Virtually Become YearRound Job
description: It looks simplean 8cent postcard, a green stamp, a few typewritten lines.

title: Gift Opens Cleveland Pools
description: CLEVELAND, June 12 (UPI) An anonymous Cleveland couple have donated $81,000 to the city so that thousands of people may swim this summer in pools that were to be closed. Without the gift, the pools at Edgewater Beach and White City Beach would not have been opened this season. The City Council acted swiftly to have the pools opened, award ing a contract for repairs.

title: The I b. d. is back
description: The little black dress, once the well dressed woman's uniform, is back. And its gentle ways are as endearing as they ever were. Pearls, hair ribbons and tur bans are its flashback accessories. It could be that the l.b.d. will be the dark horse of the season.

title: A Man From Main Street
description: PONTIAC, Ill.My dad said this psychology to me, Frank Lehman said the oth er day, smiling from behind the counter of his men's store here, that he'd rather have a peanut machine on the corner and have it be long to him than have the best job in America.

title: Et Al.
description: A standard Anchor anthology in its Modern Studies in Philos ophy series, designed for col lege secondary reading. This one has pieces on Sartre's philosophy, dramas, literary criticism, by Stuart Hampshire, Alisdair Macintyre, Francis Jeanson, Walter Kaufmann and others.

title: U.S. Note to Canada on Points For Envoy to Relay to Hanoi
description: United States note delivered at the Canadian Embassy in Washington, Aug. 8, 1964, for transmission to J. Blair Seaborn, Canadian member of International Control Commission.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The writer of the Fire Is land article (Travel section; May 23) did not consider The Pines as well suited to a family vacation. I not only believe it is admirably suited to a family vacation but also think of it as a family cdm munity. We have made it our particular family resort. Our children have spent every summer of their lives there and they have grown up as normal as any of their long haired, peaceloving, women liberating, gaylib syrripathiz ing, Black  Powering college peers. They love it; would not miss a vacation there; will presumably bring up their families there, and thus per petuate The Pines as their family vacation spot. Fire Is land, living is really not for everyone. Many a visitor has hardly been able to wait to escape all that nature for the mobility of his car parked back on the mainland at rather exorbitant rates. If you want an island, however, The Pines is as good as, if not better than, any other Fire Island community for a family vacation.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Arthur D. Lewis, at 52, is just two years into a new career and he is tackling it in the youthful spirit that job counselors say makes for success in a new job:

title: Jet Hijacker Held Here in $200,000 Bail
description: A 23yearold railroad clerk was held in $200,000 bail here yesterday after he hijacked a jetliner in Chicago, allegedly killed a passenger there and engaged in a shootout with crew members and a United States deputy marshal during a harrowing hounendahalf flight to New York.

title: Pacific Commander's Evaluation Of Washington's Action. Scenario
description: 2. Recent U.S. military actions in Laos and North Vietnam demonstrated our intent to move toward our objectives. Our operations and progress in Laos constitute one step along the route. Our directness and rapidity of reaction, in bombing North Vietnamese installations and deploying U.S. combat forces to Southeast Asia were others. Each step played a part. Their effect was to in terrupt the continually improving Com munist posture, catch the imagination of the Southeast Asian peoples, provide some lift to morale, however temporary, and force CHICOM/DRV assessment or reassessment of U.S. intentions. But these were only steps along the way. What we have not done and must do is make plain to Hanoi and Peiping the cost of pursuing their current objectives and impeding ours. An essential element of our military action in this course is to proceed in the development of our physical readiness posture: deploying troops, ships, aircraft, and logistic re sources in a manner which accords a maximum freedom of action. This is the thrust we should continue to pursue, one which is intended to provide more than one feasible course for considera tion as the changed and changing South east Asian situation develops. Remarks in the paragraphs which follow are sub mitted in light of this assessment and with the view that pressures against the other side once instituted should not be relaxed by any actions or lack of them which would destroy the bene fits of the rewarding steps previously taken in Laos and North Vietnam.

title: Miss Forsyth Wed To Gordon Weekly
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 12In the First United Pres byterian Church of Cam bridge today, Miss Marion Mitchell Forsyth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William H. For syth of New York, became the bride of Gordon David Weekly, son of Mr. and Mrs. George E. Weekly of Fort Walton Beach, Fla. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. Ron Miner.

title: job Agency Is Given Welfare Power
description: VENTURA, Calif., June 12 Ventura County will be the first in the state to place employ able welfare recipients under the jurisdiction of the state employment office for both job and welfare services.

title: Where Courage Rides a Wheelchair
description: Adjusting to life in a wheelchair was not so big a problem for Rosalie Hixon as it was for Reno (Tony) Levis.

title: Roberta Isaacs Is Bride Here
description: Miss Roberta Denise Isaacs and Thomas John Levien were married here last night in the Cotillion Room of the Pierre by Rabbi Robert S. Widom.

title: Hampshire College Shifting President To Board Chairman
description: BOSTON, June 12Franklin Patterson, president of Hamp shire College, relinquished his post today as head of the new experimental college, and was appointed chairman of the school's Board of Trustees. He had been president for five years, although the college opened to students only last year.

title: June's Options
description: Now is the season when anyone with a parcel of land, be it a suburban dooryard or rural acreage, has his options. He can make hay or let the grass go to seed. He can tend his lawn or garden or fields or let the weeds take over. He can lie in the shade or go fishing or do the work that should be done if he is going continue a comfortable tenancy where he is.

title: DRUGUSE FACTORS SOUGHT IN NASSAU
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 12 Two psychiatrists who reported that almost onequarter of the 3,807 junior high school stu dents in Nassau they inter viewed had had experience with narcotics will continue their study in an attempt to find out what significant pre dictive characteristics are pres ent in children who use drugs.

title: News of Dogs
description: The little Bichon Frise takes a big step on Sept. 1. On that day the breed will receive official American Kennel Club approval to compete in the miscellaneous class.
