title: Washington Post Offering Due Today at $26 a Share
description: The Washington Post Company is expected to make its first public offering of common stock this morning at a price of $26 following final negotiation with Lazard Freres & Co., the managing underwriter, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: McNaughton Draft for McNamara On Proposed Course of Action
description: 1. US aims:

title: 6 TEAMS FIGHTING FOR DINGHY TROPHY
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 14Thirteen college teams from the United States and Canada competed in the Intercollegiate Yacht Racing Asociation North American dinghy championships today at the Naval Academy. Seven districts totaling 420 sailors were represented in the opening elimination races.

title: DR. EMIL WITSCHI, BIOLOGIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Emil. Witschi, a distinguished biologist who contributed to the knowledge of reproductive physiology and of embryology, died Wednesday in New York Hospital at the age of 81. He lived at 435 East 70th Street.

title: Man Lost as Kayak Capsizes in Pacific
description: SEATTLE, June 14 (AP)James Brinton, 25 years old, has been lost at sea, the victim of what his stepfather calls an obsession to be the first to cross an ocean in a kayak.

title: SouthWest Africa Tribe Still in Stone Age
description: ONDANGUA, SouthWest Africa, June 13  Whenever the chief physician of the state hospital goes on one of his field trips westward from Oshakati, in the heart of the black reserve in the Closed northern region of SouthWest Africa, he packs an asagai, or short spear, with his instrument bag.

title: Bridge: Similar Deals in Tourney Allow Bidding Comparison
description: An interesting innovation in the 1971 world championship, played in Taipei, Taiwan, last month, was the use of similar deals in the qualifying round matches. It is thus possible to compare the bidding and play at six different tables.

title: CHIEF OF CHASE BIDS JAPAN END CONTROLS
description: LOS ANGELES, June 14 (UPI) Japan should remove her controls and restrictions on tradee, and capital movements, or revalue the yen, David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase. Manhattan Bank, said today.

title: A Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 14The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Notes on People
description: The songs were familiarI've Got You Under My Skin, I'll Never Smile Again, Angel Eyes. The singer, relaxed, pinkchecked, wearing a bow tie, reminded oldtimers of those days, years ago, when bobbysoxers swooned at his performances.

title: F.P.C. Aide Urges Approval For LiquefiedGas Import Deal
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (UPI)  A Federal Power Commission examiner recommended today an American company be approved for the first longterm, largevolume importation of liquefied natural gas (LNG).

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your June 8 editorial Albany's School Failure points up the serious situation created by the 50 per cent increase in state support to nonpublic schools in New York State. The same basic problem is also developing in New Jersey and in other states. Politicians, in an election year, are taking into consideration the voting strength of certain church groups which are now exceedingly vocal in this matter of state aid. Thus we have the beginning in this nation of a state church, with all of Its dangers to real democracy and true religion.

title: Carlos P. Garcia, ExPresident Of the Philippines, Dead at 74
description: MANILA, June 14 Carlos P. Garcia, President of the Philippines from 1957 te 1961, died of a heart attack today at his residence in Quezon City. He was 74 years old.

title: I. Introductory
description: We believe that the best available way of increasing our chance of success in Vietnam is the development and execution of a policy of sustained reprisal against North Vietnama policy in which air and naval action against the North is justified by and related to the whole Viet Cong campaign of violence and terror in the South.

title: Involving the Parents in the Schools
description: Three years ago, the educational system in the South Bronx was in a state of crisis. P.S. 51 had been closed down by an enraged citizenry, its principal was forced to resign, and local gangs seized the opportunity, to vandalize the building.

title: George Ball Memo for Johnson On A Compromise Solution
description: (1) A Losing War: The South Vietnamese are losing the war to the Viet Cong. No one can assure you that we can beat the Viet Cong or even force them to the conference table on our terms, no matter how many hundred thousand white, foreign (U.S.) troops we deploy.

title: State Issues a Report on School Unrest
description: ALBANY, June 14A legisative commission studying campus unrest recommended today that high school officials be authorized to drop from their rolls disruptive students who are 17 years or older.

title: 7 Slain in Detroit
description: DETROIT June 14Three young men and four young women suspected by the police of involvement in heroin traffic were found shot to death early this morning in a house near the area where the 1967 Detroit riot began.

title: Bankers Wary on Lockheed Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June 14The heads of the two key banks involved in financing the troubled Lockheed Aircraft Corporation said today categorically that they would not lend Lockheed any more money if repayment of the loans was not guaranteed by the Government.

title: MAYOR'S BUDGET OF $8.8BILLIONS AVOIDS LAY OFFS
JERSEY APPROVES AIRPORT RAIL LINK
description: TRENTON; June 14  The New Jersey Legislature completed today bistate approval of a measure authorizing the Port of New, York Authority to finance and build highspeed rail connections between midtown Manhattan and Kennedy International and Newark Airports.

title: India Reports Cholera Is Easing, But Refugee Problems Mount
description: CALCUTTA June 14Indian officials say that the cholera epidemic among the more than five million refugees from East Pakistan has been brought under reasonable control.

title: Grave Injustice Seen
description: BOSTON, June 14 (AP)Mr. Clancy called the court's decision a disappointment to all who believe that WHDH has been a victim of a grave injustice.

title: Marcuse as Torquemada of the Left
description: WILMETTE, Ill,Reading Marcuse since 1955 has been, of course, a protracted struggle against his prose. Until the publication of Repressive Tolerance I did not clearly perceive that he is a Torquemada of the left; nor did I see when I began to read him how defective his thought is. I'll mention some of its most glaring defects: The aprioristic disregard of empirical data; the frozen certainty about open questions; in some crucial respects, its shallowness and its incoherence. Only in two respects is Marcuse utterly lucid: in his desire to destroy our world, and in his yearning to be relieved of the tyranny of the genital in order to live in a nebulous, polymorphically anarchic dystopia.

title: Chile vs. Left Terrorism
description: President Allende has given a convincing demonstration that his leftwing Government in Chile will deal sternly with murderers and terrorists even if they belong to the revolutionary left. There is little doubt that the two brothers who died in a shootout with police Santiago and six other persons arrested afterward were responsible for the murder of former Interior Minister Edmundo Perez Zukovic, a rightwing Christian Democrat.

title: Federal Jury Questions 23 Here on Police Corruption
description: Twentythree New York policemen including some sergeants and lieutenants, yester day were questioned by a Federal grand jury investigating corrupt links between Brooklyn gamblers and the police.

title: MERGER WEIGHED BY WESTINGHOUSE
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation may acquire up to 45 per cent of the capital of Societe JeumontSchneider, the French manufacturer of heavy electrical equipment, sources close to Westinghouse said in Paris yesterday.

title: OBSERVER
description: Hearn's day began to turn dark when ho saw the headline in the morning paper that said Coming Revolution in TV, Cassettes.

title: Confusion and Suspicion
description: There was some confusion, suspicion and controversy about the President's approval of an 18,00020,000 increase in support troops, which, he explained, was meant to fill out existing units and supply needed logistic personnel.

title: Italian NeoFascists Make Gains in Regional Voting
description: ROME, Tuesday June 15The province of Rome the island of Sicily and major towns in southern Italy swung to the right yesterday with the neoFascist Italian Social Movement making important electoral gains at the expense of the dominant Christian Democrats.

title: U.S. SUES SUBURB ON HOUSING BIAS
They're Right Out of the Bottle
description: Everybody knows that parttime, to say nothing of fulltime, jobs for students are now hard to find, but what everybody doesn't know is what to do about it. Well, one way to handle the situation is to go into business for one's self. That's how Tracey Tooker, who goes to Pratt Institute, solved the problem.

title: Soccer Slated Tomorrow
description: The New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League will finally play the St. Louis Stars tomorrow night at 8 at Yankee Stadium. The game was postponed Sunday night by rain and last night by confusion among officials of both teams.

title: Roundup: Oliva's Blazing Bat Propels Twins to Victory
description: Tony Oliva, who has the highest career batting average of any active player in the American League (.311 going into the season), appears headed for his third batting championship. This time his winning percentage could be his best ever.

title: POWER CUT PLAN IS SCORED BY CITY
description: The city denounced yesterday state proposals to meet the anticipated power crisis here this summer by cutting off electricity to major build! ings on a rotating basis and to buildings under construction or substantial modification after July 1.

title: Music: A First and a Last for Solti
description: LONDON, June 14  For Georg Solti, it was a mixture of firsts and lasts. Tonight was the first performance of Tristan und Isolde that he had ever conducted at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden. It also was the last production that he will be involved with as director of the company. Mr. Solti, after 10 years, is handing the Royal Opera over to Colin Davis and Peter Hall.

title: U.S. Zionist, in Israel, Charges She Neglects Poor
description: JERUSALEM June 14A leading American Zionist Dr. Arthur Hertzberg has issued a sweeping criticism of Israel's political and religious leadershipfor what he termed apathy and insensitivity toward the existence of poverty in Israel.

title: Mansfield Urges Pullouts Phased to P.O.W Release
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 Senator Mike Mansfield the Senate majority leader proposed today that President Nixon seek an immediate ceasefire agreement in Indochina providing for tie phased and rapid withdrawal of American forces in return for the phased release of prisoners of war.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Man's impact on river ecology will be the subject of an international symposium at the Murray D. Lincoln Campus Center of the University of Massachusetts, at Amherst, Mass., on Sunday through June 23.

title: U.S. Forces Put at 247,000
description: SAIGON June 14 (Reuters)American troop strength in South Vietnam dropped below 250,000 men last week to the lowest in m otrehan five years.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR THE WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, June 14Daily index numbers and spot primary market commodity prices June 1, 1971 to June 8, 1971.

title: Johnson's Message to Taylor On the May 10 Halt in Bombing
description: I have learned from Bob McNamara that nearly all ROLLING THUNDER operations for this week can be completed by Wednesday noon, Washington time. This fact and the days of Buddha's birthday seem to me to provide an excellent opportunity for pause in air attacks which might go into next week and which I could use to good effect with world opinion.

title: Soviet Advocate of Preparedness Andrei Antonovich Grechko
description: For more than a decade Marshal Andrei A. Grechko the Soviet Defense Minster has been one of his country's chief hardline spokesmen for military strength.

title: New Company Is Formed As an Affiliate of G.E.
description: A new company, the Inter magnetics General Corporation, has been formed in Schenec tady to operate as an independent affiliate of the General Electric Company. The new company will produce, distribute tribute and sell superconductive' magnetics, materials and systems that had formerly been handled by G.E.'s superconduc. tive products operation in the upstate city.

title: DR. MAY WILSON, PEDIATRICIAN, 80
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass., June 14Dr. May G. Wilson, a former New York pediatrician and medical teacher, who devoted 50 years to research on rheumatic fever and rheumatic heart disease in children, died today. She was 80 years old and lived here.

title: Advertising:
description: Nestl, a big name in chocolate, has just introduced a new chocolate drink in New York.

title: Vietnam Archive: Study Tells How Johnson Secretly Opened Way to Ground Combat
description: President Johnson decided on April 1 1965 to use American ground troops for offensive action in South Vietnam because the Administration had discovered that its longplanned bombing of North Vietnamwhich had just begunwas not going to stave off collapse in the South, the Pentagon's study of the Vietnam war discloses, He ordered that the decision be kept secret.

title: 14 Seized at U.N. Mission
description: Fourteen persons were arrested on criminal trespass charges yesterday when a group that included rabbis and rabbinical students handcuffed themselves to an entrance of the United States Mission to the United Nations.

title: PreGala Parties Rival Gala Extravaganza on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, June 14As Hollywood's milliondollar fundraising weekend passes into history, it's a tossup whether the cluster of pregala parties or the Sunday night extravaganza in the Music Center, a benefit for the Motion Picture and Television Relief Fund, was the most notable.

title: Nixon Confers With Envoys and Top Aides on Curbing Drug Flow
description: WASHINGTON, June 14President Nixon summoned six United States ambassadors and Administration officials to the White House today to discuss ways of curbing the flow of narcotics into the United States.

title: NORMAN TOMLINSON, JERSEY PUBLISHER, 75
description: Norman B. Tomlinson Sr., chairrnon of the Board of The Morristown (N. J.) Daily Record, Inc., died Saturday in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 75 years old and also lived in Madison, N. J.

title: INDIANS TAKE OVER ANOTHER ALCATRAZ
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 14 (UPI)American Indians ousted from Alcatraz Island Friday after a 19month occupation today took over an abandoned Army missile base 15 miles away.

title: Pires Stops Burton in 7th Round Here
description: Willie Burton, a Bronx heavyweight, carried a record of 21 victories in 23 fights into the Felt Forum ring last night. His only loss since turning pro was to the huge Brazilian, Luis Faustino Pires of Sao Paulo, in Madison Square Garden in Octo, ber of 1969.

title: 3 Men in Mississippi Plead Not Guilty in Girl's Slaying
description: INDIANOLA, Miss., June 14 The three men accused of killing 18yearold Jo Etha Collier on a street in Drew, Miss., last month pleaded not guilty when they were arraigned today.

title: Antipoverty Programs Imperiled in Appalachia
description: PRESTONBURG Ky.  Attempts by Washington to give the rural poor of Appalachia a voice in antipoverty programs are being frustrated so effectively by politicians doctors merchants and other local people that some of the programs are in danger of collapse.

title: Prime Minister Wilson's Warning To Johnson on Petroleum Raids
description: I was most grateful to you for asking Bob McNamara to arrange the very full briefing about the two oil targets near Hanoi and Haiphong that Col. Rogers gave me yesterday...

title: Citizens Group for Muskie
description: CONCORD, N.H., June 14New Hampshire supporters of Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, announced today formation of a citizensl group to hack him in his hid for the Presidential nomination.

title: U.S. Judge Again Refuses To Drop Suit Against F.B.I.
description: A Federal judge today refused for the second time to dismiss a suit against J. Edgar Hoover and the Federal Bureau of Investigation seeking the surrender of documents that a leftist organization says were improperly seized.

title: U.S. Steel Sued on Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (AP) The Government filed suit today to halt a alleged water pollution by a Birmingham, Ala., plant of the United States Steel Corporation Shiro Kashiwa, head of the Justice Department's Land and Natural Resources Division, said suits would be filed soon against other polluters in the Birmingham area.

title: France With Six Types of Legal Advisers, Is Seeking Fewer
description: PARIS, June 11When Monsieur X, the French equivalent of John Doe, needs legal help, he has an embarrassment of choices. He may employ an avocat, an avoue, an agree, a conseiller juridique, a notaire or a societe fiduciaire.

title: EASTBLOC CHIEFS GATHER IN BERLIN
description: BERLIN, June 14The heads of half a dozen foreign Communist parties came to East Berlin this afternoon and were received with a combination of noisy crowds in the streets and restrained official correctness.

title: COURT STEP LIKELY
description: WASHINGTON, June 14Attorney General John N. Mitchell asked The New York Times this evening to refrain from further publication of documents drawn from a Pentagon study of the Vietnam war on the ground that such disclosures would cause irreparable injury to the defense interests of the United States.

title: LAWYER IS ON TRIAL IN BALTIMORE DEATH
description: BALTIMORE June 14Jury selection expected to take at least a week began today in Baltimore Criminal Court in the case of Arthur Turco Jr., white New York lawyer charged in connection with the 1969 torture and murder of a suspected Black Panther police informer.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It was reassuring to see that Hanson W. Baldwin's OpEd article (May 31) gave serious consideration to the question of civilian casualties in South Vietnam. For too many years it has been difficult to get this kind of attention focused on the plight of people caught in the war.

title: Vote on Corona Compromise Weighed
description: The City Council discussed yesterday the possibilities of saving the socalled Corona Compromise by a citywide referendum in November.

title: Testing Firm Charges Sale Of Defective Steel for Subs
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 14 (AP)A steeltesting company charged today that a Pennsylvania steel maker was selling defective steel plates for use in building nuclear submarines.

title: TV: Final Segment of justice in America on C.B.S.;Crime and the Courts Starts at 10 Tonight
description: Tonight at 10 o'clock the Columbia Broadcasting System's news department concludes its threepart TV examination of Justice in, America with an hourlong consideration of Crime and the Courts. The C.B.S. Reports series got off to a good start in April on the topic of courts and the poor. It sagged a bit, however, in May with an overly fragmented look at congestion in the courts.

title: AMERICAN SMELTING OFFERS PAY INCREASE
description: The Americacn Smelting and Refining Company has made the copper industry's first contract offer to the steelworkers union whose contract expires June 30 a spokesman for the company said yesterday.

title: Panel Backs Health Grants
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (AP) The Senate health subcommittee announced approval today of a $2billion, fiveyear program of grants to medical schools, and $1billionplus to increase the supply of physicians and other healthcare personnel. The principle of the new program, whose chief sponsor is Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, the subcommittee chairman, is that the Federal Government would assume onethird of the cost of medical education.

title: Black Section of Newburgh Is Cordoned Off After 2 Are Shot
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Tuesday June 15More than 25 persons were injuredtwo of them shot by a sniperas violent disorders broke out in the main Negro section of this industrial city yesterday Police roadblocks were erected on all streets leading into the black area.

title: 2 Babies Alive as 7th Of 9 Dies in Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Tuesday June 15 (Reuters)The seventh of the nine premature Brodrick babies died early today, doctors at the Royal Hospital for Women reported.

title: Korean Wins String Contest
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 The Merriweather Post Contest for violinists and cellists, sponsored by the National Symphony Orchestra, was won last night by Dong Suk Kang, a 17yearold Korean violinist who now lives in Oyster Bay, L. I. He will receive a prize of $1,500 and an appearance with the orchestra next season at Kennedy Center. Second prize of $750 went to Inez Hassman, 16, a violinist who lives in New York.

title: Great Lakes Pollution
description: LOS ANGELES, June 14 Lately there has been a growing current of comment, in Congress and elsewhere, that the nation's water pollution abatement program was moving too slowly.

title: Wages and Pensions Bulk of Budget
description: More than $5billion of the city's proposed $8.8billion budget for the city fiscal year beginning July 1 is earmarked for wages, pensions and fringe benefits for the city's 381,000 employes.

title: I.O.S., LTD., LISTS A LOSS DURING 1970
description: GENEVA, June 14  Perhaps the best single item to report about your company's past year is that it is behind us, Robert E. Slater, president of Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., commented in the concern's annual report to stockholders.

title: Ocean Field Study Planned
description: CAST1NE, Me., June 14 (AP) The National Science Foundation will finance a fourweek ocean engineering field study in Penobscot Bay by students from Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Maine Maritime Academy. The study will begin July 5.

title: Killing by White Policeman Angers Blacks in Arkansas
description: STAR CITY, Ark., June 11Like millions of his fellow Americans, Carnell Russ was behind the wheel of his family car on Memorial Day. A total of 557 accident victims died that weekend on the nation's highways. Carnell Russ died, too, but his death was no ordinary highway statistic.

title: SALYUT ASTRONAUTS AID IN EXPERIMENT
description: MOSCOW, June 14 (AP)Soviet space scientists took an unusual look at the earth today, using a manned space laboratory, a jet airliner and a biplane.

title: Memo From Rostow Advocating Ground Troops and Air Attacks
description: I leave for Lima this Saturday for the CLAP and CIES meetings. I presume that in early December some major decisions on Southeast Asia will be made. I should, therefore, like to leave with you some observations on the situation. I have already communicated theM to. Bill Bundy.

title: PRODUCERS SHIFT CHEMICAL PRICES
description: Price adjustments, mostly upward, for a number of important chemicals and related products were announced yesterday.

title: Barnes of Texas Will Run For Governor, Not Senator
description: AUSTIN, Tex., June 14 Lieut. Gov. Ben Barnes, the 133yearold Democrat who has been considered a possible senatorial candidate in 1972, announced today that he would run for Governor instead.

title: NEARER IS NAMED TO U.S. JUDGESHIP
description: WASHINGTON, June 14Edward R. Neaher, the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York since late 1969, was nominated today by President Nixon to be a Federal district judge.

title: J. STEVENS STOCK, 61, MARKET RESEARCHER
description: J. Stevens Stock, a statistician and author of many studies on market research, died apparently of a heart attack yesterday at his home, 680 West End Avenue. He was 61 years old.

title: QUICK END URGED ON $15 STOCK FEE
description: WASHINGTON, June 14Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. wants the Securities and Exchange Commission to put a prompt end to the $15 surcharge on small stock transactions and to start laying the groundwork for the ultimate termination of fixed commissions on stock orders of almost any size.

title: Dayan Cites Israeli Steps
description: TEL AVIV, June 14Defense Minister Moshe Dayan said tonight that Israel was taking steps to assure that oil tankers sailing to Elath reached their destination safely.

title: Tito Names Envoy
description: BELGRADE Yugoslavia June 14 (UPI)  President Tito named a Communist party official today as ambassador to Albania, ending years of tense relations between the two Balkan neighbors. The new envoy Tovan Pecenovic 38 years old is a member of the party's Presidium.

title: Single Banking Regulator Is Urged by Rep. Patman
description: The chairman of the House Banking and Currency Committee called today for the creation of a single, bank regulatory agency that could fix interest rates.

title: Vienna: Schubert Rediscovered in Midst of Festival
description: VIENNAA city in tune with itself is the real motto of this year's Vienna Festival. For, towering above the innumerable exquisite theatrical and artistic events, the premieres at the opera and the Theater an der Wien, the mammoth Kokoschka exhibition at the Belvedere, the visiting dance groups and the unique International Puppet Theater, one singular achievement stands out in glorious significance: the rediscovery of Schubert. This is no Schubert year by the calendar.

title: COURT SAYS CITIES MAY CLOSE POOLS TO BAR RACIAL MIX
description: WASHINGTON, June 14The Supreme Court ruled 5 to 4 today that communities may close their publicly owned recreational facilities rather than comply with court orders to desegregate them.

title: Executive Changes
description: International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation announced yesterday the election Maurice R. Valente as a senior vice president and his assignment as director of operations staffs. Mr. Valente, who will be reporting to the office of the presidentoperations, previously was a corporate vice president and group executive of the ITT DefenseSpace Group.

title: Catholics Here Restrict Pastors to 12Year Terms
description: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York has announced a new policy of setting fixed terms of six years for pastors of local parishes and restricting pastors to two consecutive terms in the same parish.

title: Rep. Hicks in Mayor's Race; Says Boston Is at Low Point
description: BOSTON, June 14 (UPI)Representative Louise Day Hicks, promising to be a Mayor who cares, announced today, her candidacy for Mayor of Boston.

title: Suit Attacks New Canaan Zoning Law
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., June 14A group of 15 blacks and Puerto Ricans today filed suit in Federal Court in Bridgeport against this affluent suburban community, charging it with racial and economic discrimination.

title: Thousands of ProBoyle Miners Strike
description: WASHINGTON, June 14Thousands of West Virginia coal miners began a protest strike today in a demonstration of support for their embattled union president, W.A. Boyle.

title: Missouri Ratifies Move For a Lower Voting Age
description: JEFFERSON CITY, Mo., June 14 (UPI)Missouri became the 33d state today to ratify the United States constitutional amendment to lower the voting age to 18.

title: AMEX PRICES FALL ON A BROAD FRONT
TOM JONES EXCELS IN GARDEN RECITAL
description: Mass hysteria is not reserved for rock concerts and soccer matches. Saturday evening, Tom Jones, the British pop singer, sang before a large crowd at Madison Square Garden. Thousands screamed, women threw their underwear on stage, despite the fact that the median age of the people in the audi, ence probably was around 35.

title: RUDY BERGMAN DIES; WCBSTV PRESS AIDE
description: Rudy Bergman, director of press information for WCBSTV, died Sunday night of a heart attack in Genoa, Italy, where he was vacationing with his wife. He was 59 years old and lived at 7272 112th Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: New Haven Road Wins Pennsy Lien In Court Decision
description: Judge Robert P. Anderson of the United States Circuit Court in New Haven has rejected the argument of the Penn Central Transportation Company's trustees that Richard Joyce Smith, trustee of the New Haven Railroad, has no more than general claim in bankruptcy against Penn Central.

title: Draft by William Bundy On Results of Policy in 65
description: This memorandum examines possible developments and problems if the US pursues the following policy with respect to South VietNam:

title: Bank Raises Prime Rate;
description: The First Pennsylvania Banking and Trust Company, Philadelphia's largest bank, increased its prime interest rate on business loans yesterday to 5 from 5 per cent, effective at once.

title: Horsemen Group Formed As Advisory Unit to OTB
description: Howard J. Samuels had some kind words for horse people and some harsh ones for computer people yesterday.

title: YALEHARVARD TEAM WINS BRITISH TRACK
description: CRYSTAL PALACE, England, June 14(AP)Harvard and Yale defeated a combined OxfordCambridge team by nine events to seven in a track and field meet today.

title: Loss of 1,000 School Jobs Is Feared
description: The president of the Board of Education said that the city, school system might have to, lay off as many as 1,000 employes as part of a projected reduction of more than 5,000 jobs anticipated under the Mayor's revised executive budget announced yesterday.

title: Miss Gonnerman Defeats Debra Scanlon, 61, 64
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 14Louise Gonnerman of River Edge, N. J., the defending champion who yesterday won the New York State title, led the way through the second round today in the Eastern women's claycourt tennis championship at Orienta Beach Club. She defeated Debra Scanlon of Wantagh, L. I., 61, 64.

title: Brogan Heads Group To Study Jersey OTB
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., June 14A committee with representatives from New Jersey's three thoroughbred tracks has been formed to study offtrack betting in the state.

title: Goldwater Says He Knew of War Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 14Senator Barry Goldwater, the Republican Presidential candidate in 1964, said today that he had known one month before the clashes in the Gulf of Tonkin that President Johnson was planning to widen the war in Vietnam.

title: Coalition Government Defeated As Iceland's Voters Swing Left
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, June 14 (UPI)  Icelandic voters swung toward the left in yesterday's general elections, and the twoparty coalition that has ruled this island nation for 12 years lost its narrow majority in Parliament.

title: Underground Nuclear Test Is Set in Nevada Tomorrow
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 14 (AP)The Atomic Energy Commission said today that it would resume underground nuclear testing Wednesday with a lowyield weapons development shot at the Nevada test site, the first United States nuclear test in half a year.

title: Basquin, New York Pianist, Wins Top Prize at Montreal
description: MONTREAL, June 14 (UPI)Peter Basquin, a 26yearold New York pianist and music professor, won top prize yesterday at the Montreal International Music Competition,

title: City Will Cut Authorized Police, Fire, and Sanitation Services Through Attrition
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that for the first time in a decade, the authorized strength of the city's uniformed police, fire and sanitation services would be cut.

title: Market Place: New Plan Tried At Commodore
description: If Daniel Katzman and his family did not own more than 55 per cent of the stock of the Commodore Corporation, he might not be presiding over the revitalization of this Omahabased mobilehome producer today.

title: F.C.C. Begins Study to Extend Rule to Campus Radio Stations
description: WASHINGTON, June 14 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission has begun to study campus radio stations with an eye to regulation over those that expand their audience coverage beyond the campus.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION DOWN 1.8% IN WEEK
Sports of The Tirnes
description: Just before the season opened, some of the more occult and prescient of the baseball experts clambered off the Cincinnati Reds bandwagon on which the vast majority of the brothers had climbed. It was almost as if they sensed that these supposed sureshot pennant winners would disintegrate in many directions. Virtually without exception, these smarties picked the Dodgers to sneak through.

title: GARDEN SIGNS PACT WITH CABLE SYSTEM
description: Madison Square Garden has granted the Columbia Cable Systems, Inc., exclusive distribution rights to 125 Garden events to cable systems in northern New Jersey and southwestern New York.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It seems as if there might be one positive aspect to the recent city employes strike which New Yorkers have been subjected to. The city now has few more answers to the commuters lament of What does New York City do for me? It seems that by using city garbage dumps and, city incinerators we have been instrumental in easing Long Island's water pollution problem, If Long Island waters get polluted, it is their problem not ours. (ii bit of suburban logic.)

title: Let The Eat Lead
description: Lead poisoning is a small thing, little horror compared to the Vietnam war, or the fact that parts of Brownsville look like Laos, or the moon.

title: New Civilian Chief of the Army Robert Frederick Froehlke
description: WASHINGTON, June 15About 40 years ago, Melvin R. Laird, Robert Frederick Froehlke and Nancy J. Barnes were in the fourth grade together at Marshfield, Wis. Melvin and Robert were chums, and Nancy was Robert's girl friend. Mr. Laird and Mr. Froehlke are still close friends as well as associates at the high levels of Government, and Nancy has become Mrs. Froehlke, mother of four. The latest phase in the relationship between the two men is that Secretary of Defense Laird has backed Mr. Froehlke, aged 4S, the Assistant Secretary for Administration, for appointment by the President as Secretary of the troubled United States Army.

title: Dock Union Head Assails Move For U.S Action in Labor Dispute
description: Thomas W. Gleason, presi dent of the International Longshoremen's Association, said yesterday he was very disturbed by the stand taken by a major group of port authorities on the possibility of a strike when the I.L.A. contract expired Sept. 30.

title: Haddon Hall By Sullivan Is Given Here
description: In a day when the lyric theater grows less and less melodic, it is a rare pleasure to become acquainted with light opera by Sir Arthur Sullivan apparently never given in New York before. It is Haddon Hall, for which the librettist is Sydney Grundy.

title: Former Employes Seek I.O.S. Proxies To Oust Chairman
description: GENEVA, June 15, (AP)Eight former Investor Overseas Services, Ltd., employes have started soliciting proxies to oust the chairman of I.O.S., Robert L. Vesco, from office at the June 30 stockholders meeting in Toronto.

title: M'NICHOLS ELECTED AS MAYOR OF DENVER
description: DENVER, June 15Mayor William H. McNichols Jr., running for his first full term in office, narrowly won election today, beating a youthful reform candidate, Dale Tooley, by nearly 2,000 votes. The vote was 62,103 to 60,274.

title: Judge, After SoulSearching, Denies Bail Plea of Miss Davis
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., June 15 Superior Court Judge Richard E. Arnason denied Angela Davis bail today but said that he would have freed the controversial black activist had it been possible under the law.

title: More Cutbacks Seen
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 (Reuters)Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat, Arkansas; said today he expects South Korea, Formosa and Hong Kong to follow Japan's example and voluntarily cut back their textile ex. ports to the United. States. by July 1. Mr. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, suggested that he once again has been working behind the scenes to bring off a series of textile pacts that he feels he must have before trade legislation can be revived in Congress.

title: Senators Back Stiff Warranties
description: WASHINGTON, June 15The Senate Commerce Committee unanimously approved today a bill to establish strict Federal standards of clarity and fairness in warranties covering all consumer products costing more than $5.

title: Film: 'Who Is Harry Kellerman . . . ?' at the Sutton:Grosbard Is Director of Gardner Work Hoffman Takes Role of a Success-Flop
description: Georgia Soloway (Dustin Hoffman) is on top of the world and about to jump offeven though, for all intents and purposes, he owns it. He is the country's most successful rock composer (64 songs in one year, not including two peace marches, a commercial and a cancer jingle). He lives in a Fifth Avenue triplex to which women feel honored to be lured, at any hour, at the last minute.His Brooklyn Jewish parents, who have the gloomy optimism of Ocean Avenue philosophers, make no unreasonable demands on him, and he has successfully unloaded a wife whom he only married because she was pregnant, and who rewarded him with two children and a companionship of the sort of frowns that would be a bit too heavy even for an Anacin commercial.He has also made the cover of Time, which may not be certified immortality, though it comes close to it in George's world. He is, nevertheless, isolated, pursued by a sense of panic, as well as by someone named Harry Kellerman who calls up Georgie's friends and tells them what a rat he is."Who Is Harry Kellerman and Why Is He Saying Those Terrible Things About Me?", directed by Ulu Grosbard and written by Herb Gardner, belongs to a species of comedy that I always associate with Broadway, even ifas sometimes happensthe locale is not in Manhattan.It is very glib, very funny in short takes and rather tedious and predictable in long ones, and it virtually kills itself trying to convince us that life at the top is even more anxious, more empty, than is life at the bottom, or at the middle. It does, indeed, sound very much like a comedy that was written by someone who has hit the top, or whatever he considers the top to be, and then suffered that form of the psychic bends that is best treated by being written about.Mr. Gardner, who hit the top, at least in Broadway terms, with "A Thousand Clowns," has a real but narrow talent for the creation of eccentric characters who define themselves by wisecracks  the self-deprecating kind ("I feel like I've just auditioned for the human race and lost the job"), the kind that pull the rug out from under the drama itself ("Pills!" shouts Georgie, who is at the point of suicide, to his psychiatrist, "I come to you in flames and you treat me for sunburn!"), and, occasionally, the best kind, which sound almost human.When Georgie's wife wants to have a scene with him, she begins by reporting she's been crying "all over the magazine section," by which ploy she manages to blame him not only for being unfaithful, but also for ruining the Sunday paper.Much like that line, which attaches (successfully) major disasters to minor ones, "Who Is Harry Kellerman . . .?" attempts (unsuccessfully) to make a breakdown into psychosis comprehensible by attaching it to a gag style better suited to the dilemmas of conventional situation comedy.The dramatization of psychosis demands a tougher treatment, a darker insight, especially of Mr. Gardner, if the narrative is to be meaningful; otherwise it becomes, like "Who Is Harry Kellerman . . . ?", a more or less descriptive drama. This is the way Georgie's breakdown looks, this is where it took place and what he said, and these are the fantasies he hadbut the only revelations of the film are the arbitrary ones of event, not the suddenly inevitable ones of emotion, with the realization that this is the way it had to be.The movie, which opened last night at the Sutton, has been rather fancily and stylishly put together by Mr. Grosbard, although I suspect much of this look comes from the look of the fancy sets and from the dozens of stylishly abrupt flashbacks that are never as revealing as they promise to be.The performances, like material, are essentially comic, and I liked everyone, especially Mr. Hoffman and Barbara Harris, as Georgie's finest one-night stand (whom Mr. Gardner has given another one of those laughing-through-her-tears speeches I can now do without), Jack Warden, as an almost murderously myopic psychiatrist, and, in smaller roles, Dom De Luise, David Burns and Rose Gregorio.If Mr. Gardner has exorcised his demons, the film is not a total loss.

title: Medina Faces Judge Today
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., June 15 (AP)  Capt. Ernest L. Medina, charged with assault and murder of 102 civilians during the Mylai raid, will go before an Army judge here tomorrow for his first pretrial hearing.

title: I.T.T. Receives Contract
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation said yesterday that its Greek and French subsidiaries have received a $28million contract for tleephone switching equipment. The contract, for equipment capable of serving 280,000 telephone lines, was awarded by OTE, the Greek telephone administration to ITT Hellas of Athens and to Le Materiel Telephonique of Paris.

title: Dr. Wendell M. Stanley Dead; Virologist Won 46 Nobel Prize
description: SALAMANCA, Spain, June 15 (UPI)Dr. Wendell M. Stanley the Nobel laureate whose pioneering work on the nature of viruses paved the way for many medical advances of recent years, died here today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 66 years old.

title: Hunter Names Arts Director
description: Gerald Freund, executive vice president of the Film Society of Lincoln Center, has been named director of the new Hunter College Arts Center, which will coordinate the artsrelated activities of the college. Dr. Freund, a former associate director for art, humanities and social sciences at the Rockefeller Founelation, was also named acting; dean of humanities.

title: Russian Art Works Put On Exhibition
description: Corning to the end wall of the terminal gallery in the Brooklyn Museum's new exhibition, Russian Art of the Revolution, you are confronted with a large blowup of a statement by El Lissitzky, one of the artists represented, declaring that no one epoch in art stands in any relationship to the following one, and in art there is no such thing as evolution.

title: Dick Stockton Gains
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., June 15 (AP)Dick Stockton of Trinity, Sandy Mayer of Stanford and Paul Gerken of Trinity won two matches each today and Advanced past the fifth round of the National Collegiate tennis championships at Notre Dame.

title: MEXICAN AIDES QUIT IN RIOT AFTERMATH
description: MEXICO CITY, June 15 (Reuters) The Mayor of Mexico City, Alfonso Martinez Domin quez, and the police chief resigned tonight in the wake of last week's bloody suppression of a leftist student demonstration here.

title: FREDERICK PALMER, ARCHITECTRESTORER
description: EAST HADDAM, Conn., June 15 Frederick C. Palmer, an architect long active in New England restoration, died yesterday in Middlesex Memorial Hospital, Middletown, after a long illness. He was 70 years old and had made his home here since 1936.

title: Public Broadcast Service Still Searching for Identity
description: Fifteen months after its creation, the Public Broadcasting Service is a successful and growing noncommercial television network in search of an identity.

title: The Endless Tragedy
description: For the first time in the history of the Republic, the Attorney General of the United States has tried to suppress documents he hasn't read about a war that hasn't been declared. This is one of the final ironies of this tragic Vietnam war, but it won't work for long.

title: ASSEMBLY IN LISBON OPENS KEY SESSION
description: LISBON, June 15The Portuguese National Assembly met in special session here today to begin work on the biggest legislative program in the country's modern history.

title: City Budget Scenario
description: The annual budget scenario for the. City of New York continues to unfold and, while there are remarkable similarities to years gone by, there are important differences also.

title: U.S. JUDGE FREES SOVIET FREIGHTER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 15 (AP)A Soviet freighter, seized by deputy United States marshals last Wednesday as security in a damage suit by Massachusetts lobster fishermen, was freed by court order today and sailed for Yokohama, Japan.

title: Patricia I. Steckler of Brandeis Married to Lawrence H. Suid
description: HARTSDALE, N. Y, June 15The marriage of Miss Patricia Jane Steckler, a student at Brandeis University, to Lawrence Howard Suid, who received a Master of Fine Arts degree in film from Brandeis this month, took place here this evening. The ceremony at the Sunningdale Country Club was performed by Ernest Sommerfeld, minister of the Unitarian Church of Harrisburg, Pa., and former leader of the Westchester Ethical Culture Society.

title: Nader Antitrust Report
description: The massive report on antitrust policy just released by Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, and his team young investigators is full of cases to beguile businessmen

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: One of the most distressing aspects of the recent negotiation between the city and the state concerning New York City's financial problem is that apparently the denizens of City Hall are proud of the clever tactics they pursued. At least so The Times of June 10 indiCated in its article concerning Edward K. Hamilton.

title: South Korean Talks Start
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 15  Negotiations for limitations on South Korean exports of manmade and wool textiles to the United States began here today amid strong resistance by local industries and labor unionists.

title: State Union Cancels Strike for 100,000
description: ALBANY, Wednesday, June 16The Civil Service Employes Association early today called off a statewide strike of more than 100,000 employes scheduled for midnight tonight.

title: Rates on Bonds Rise Again
PROCESSING OF DATA ALLOWED BANK UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 (Reuters)  Onebank holding companies will be able to engage in dataprocessing activities under an amendment to the Bank Holding Company Act, the Federal Reserve Board announced today.

title: Addiction in Vietnam Spurs Nixon and Congress to Take Drastic New Steps
description: WASHINGTON, June 15Growing evidence of widespread drug addiction among Vietnam servicemen and veterans appears to have been the chief factor that galvanized the President and Congress into action on all the nation's narcotics problems. Congress is showing eagerness to provide laws and money as the President proposes to set up new machinery to deal with the problem. President Nixon is expected to announce this week the appointment of Dr. Jerome H. Jaffe, the 37yearold head of the Illinois Drug Rehabilitation System as his adviser. Mr. Nixon is also expected to create a new, overall Federal agency to combat drug abuse, of which Dr. Jaffe may be the director.

title: U.S. May Block Contract To Import Algerian Gas
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 The White House is delaying, and may possibly block, approval for import to the United States of liquefied natural gas from Algeria under a 25year contract signed last year by a Texas corporation.

title: FRANK J. WHELAN
description: SARASOTA, Fla., June 15Frank J. Whelan, who retired in 1960 as a vice president of Worthington Pump and Machinery Corporation, died Sunday at his home here after a long illness. He was 78.

title: Mohonk's Abiding Aim: Preserve the Wilderizess
description: LAKE MOHONK, N. Y.Two Quaker brothers who own 7,500 acres of wilderness in the Shawangunk Mountains here are.. following the tenets of theirfaith by taking unusual steps to insure that no one, including themselves, will over exploit their land.

title: RYUKYU PACT BACKED BY JAPANESE CABINET
description: TOKYO, June 15The Japanese Cabinet today approved an agreement with the United States returning Okinawa and the other Ryukyu islands to Japanese rule after a quartercentury of American occupation.

title: Ecology Sells WellIf It's Convenient
description: The American consumer is concerned about pollutionbut apparently not when it comes into sharp ,conflict with price, convenience and quality.

title: Senator Jackson to Open Campaign Office in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington brought to the surface his previously covert campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination today, describing himself as pleased by offers of support from all parts of the country.

title: An Author's Appeal
description: This book cannot at the present time be published in our native land except in Samizdat [privately circulated typescript] because of censorship objections unintelligible to normal human reason and which, in addition, demand that the word God be unfailingly written without a capital letter. TO this indignity I cannot stoop.

title: MRS. JERVIS LANGDON
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., June 15Mrs. Eleanor Sayles Langdon, widow of Jervis Langdon, industrialist and civic leader, died today at Quarry Farm, the estate overlooking the city long associated with Mark Twain, who married her husband's aunt, Olivia Langdon. She was 93 years old.

title: YANKS 21 VICTORY ON MURCER HOMER ENDS ROYAL STRING
Books of The Times
description: THE SELECTED LETTERS OF LADY MARY WORTLEY MONTAGU. Edited by Robert Halsband. 310 pages. St. Martin's Press. $15.

title: First Women Elected To Board at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 15Robert F. Goheen, president of Princeton University, announced today the election of the first women to the Princeton board of trustees in the university's 225year history.

title: Premier Resigns in Iceland
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, June 15 (Reuters)Premier Johann Hafstein handed his resignation to President Kristjan Eldjarn yesterday following the defeat of his coalition Government in elections Sunday. The President asked the Premier to remain in office until a new coalition government could be formed.

title: Hulme, Stewart Feuding On CanAm Racing Trail
description: As a rule race drivers treat one another in their public utterances with about the same kind of professional courtesy that prevails among physicians, especially in holding back on disparaging remarks. There are exceptions, of course, and the current one is the relationship between Denis Hulme and Jackie Stewart. Hulme has been king of the mountain in CanAm racing since 1967, and he is less than ecstatic about all the attention (not to mention the high fees) that Stewart is getting for his entry in the 10race CanAm series.

title: LONG ISLAND TEAM WINS GOLF TROPHY
Roundup: Bryant Hurls as Giants Win
description: The San Francisco Giants found two unheralded heroes last night at a time when they needed them most.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CLIMB IN A RALLY
description: Persistent reports in trade cirlces yesterday that this year's crop of soybeans may not meet the expected demand for oil and meal caused active buying of soybeans in the afternoon.

title: I.T.T. SUES G.T.&E. FOR TRIPLE DAMAGES
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation filed a triple damage suit yesterday in Federal Court in Greensboro, N. C., against the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation and subsidiaries charging violation of antitrust law.

title: MISS CONNA ADIOS DRAWS NO. 1 POST
Gonzales and Sedgman, 43, Frisky Victors in Tennis
description: LONDON, June 15It was a day for oldsters in the London grasscourt tennis tournament at the Queen's Club today.

title: Allied Stores Gain In Sales Continues
description: The improved firstquarter sales trend at Allied Stores Corporation has continued into May and June and earnings are also reflecting an upward trend, Thomas M. Macioce, president, told shareholders yesterday.

title: Sports of The Times
description: One day last June, a couple of topranking tennis officials motored together through the English countryside to the Wimbledon tournament because they had always enjoyed each other's company. They were Ed Turville, the nonplaying captain of the American Davis Cup team, and David Reed, president of Australia's tennis federation.

title: Beame Says Lindsay Errs By $330Million in Budget
description: Controller Abraham D. Beanie contended yesterday that Mayor Lindsay had overstated expenses and underestimated revenues by a total of $330million in his proposed $8.8billion city expense budget for the fiscal year starting July 1.

title: Prison Guard Union Elects
description: Leo C. Zeferetti was elected to his second twoyear term as president of the 2,700member Correction Officers Benevolent Association, which is made up of the men and women who guard the city's prisons. Mr. Zeferetti, heading an incumbent slate, received 1,259 of 1,638 ballots cast since voting began June 5. His only opponent, Joseph Burns, received 1379.

title: 5 Americans Fined $100,000 for Sailing Into Cuban Waters
description: HAVANA, June 15 (Reuters) Five United States citizens found guilty of having illegally entered Cuban waters in two boats have been fined a total of 6100,000, the official Cuban newspaper Granama reported today.

title: The Stage
description: Daniel Berrigan's The Trial of the Catonsville Nine is the latest Off Broadway play to go on Broadway. It is now at the Lyceum Theater, and while something of the original immediacy of the setting in the Good Shepherd Church is now lost, the play has settled down well to its new Broadway environment.

title: Princess Pout Wins by 2 Lengths at Belmont
description: June McKnight's Princess Pout, showing she liked to run on grass as well as munch it, won yesterday's $20,000 Franklin Lakes Purse at rainswept Belmont Park.

title: The House and the War
description: I have been a member of the House since January 1965, and in all that time I have never once had an opportunity to vote directly on the most important issue before the countrythe Vietnam War.

title: STARS INELIGIBLE FOR N.C.A.A.TRACK
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 15 (UPI)Isaac Curtis of the University of California, who finished second to a teammate, Eddie Hart, in the National Collegiate 100yard dash last year, has been declared ineligible for this weekend's N.C.A.A. track and field championships.

title: Advertising:
description: Ketchum, MacLeod & Grove has the Totem business in the bag.

title: The U. S.Sick Man of the West
description: The United States is currently. regarded in Europe as the sick man of the West  reminiscent of the, Ottoman Empire before World War II. Why is this so and what is to be done about it? The United States is not opting for isolationism and a Fortress America. Europe is still the security, threshold of the United States.

title: Cosmos, Stars Play Tonight After Two Postponements
description: After two postponements, the New York Cosmos and the St. Louis Stars will meet at 8 o'clock tonight in a North American Soccer League game at Yankee Stadium.

title: Multiple Birth Epidemic
description: A generation ago, in 1934, the birth and survival of the Dionne quintuplets in Canada created a world sensation By contrast, the unprecedented birth of the Brodrick nonuplets in Sydney, Australia, has caused only a ripple.

title: NeoFascism in Italy?
description: The sharp upsurge of votes for the political heirs Benito Mussolini in Italy is a cause for concern but not for panic. Despite skillful exploitation of lawandorder sentiment in an Italy weary of strikes and violence, the neoFascist Italian Social Movement (M.S.I.) ended up with less than 14 per cent of the total vote in elections involving only a fifth of the voters.

title: Egyptians Reported on an Alert; Fear Reprisal in Tanker Attack
description: CAIRO, June 15The Egyptian armed forces were reported to be on full combat alert today in response to the indignant Israeli reaction to the shelling of an oil tanker bound for Israel at the entrance to the Red Sea last Friday.

title: PUBLIC WORKS BILL CLEARS CONGRESS; VETO THREATENED
description: WASHINGTON, June 15Ignoring threats of a Presidential veto, the House gave final Congressional approval today to a $5.5billion economic development bill embracing a $2billion program to create jobs for the unemployed.

title: MINISTERS CLASH AT AFRICAN TALKS
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, June 15  The meeting of the council of ministers of the Organization of African Unity began in disunity today.

title: SOLITAIRE TO OPEN IN SEPTEMBER HERE
description: Solitaire, Double Solitaire, the double bill by Robert Anderson, will be presented on Broadway Sept. 23 under the limited gross arangement by Gilbert Cates, Roy Nevins and Albert Schiff.

title: Bank of America Officer Quits in Protest
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 15 Alan K. Browne, considered by many to be the dean of the taxexempt bond business, has taken early retirement as a senior vice president of the Bank of America because of dissatisfaction with bank policy changes.

title: Riots Bring Reforms, but Many Poles Are Skeptical
description: WARSAW, June 15Major changes in economic and political patterns appear to be emerging from the violence that erupted in Poland six months ago. But the Poles are still not sure how far the changes will go.

title: Silvers Comedy to Close
description: How the Other Half Loves, the Alan Ayckbourn comedy costarring Phil Silvers and Sandy Dennis, will end its Broadway run at the Royale Theater on June 26 after 104 performances. The comedy will go on tour Sept. 20 with Mr. Silvers repeating his role.

title: Two Gunmen Get $200,000 in Jewels on East Side
description: Two gunmen made off with $200,000 worth of jewels stuffed in a pillowcase yesterday afternoon after invading the 17room East Side penthouse of Mrs. Joseph Neff, a sister of the United States Ambassador to Britain.

title: Metropolitan Museurn Will Close Mondays
description: In a move that it contends will pare its operating budget by $210,000, and better serve the public and its staff, the Metropolitan Museum will close all day on Mondays, starting June 21. It will add four extra evening hours to its Friday schedule, however, supplementing its present Tuesday evening hours, and remain open on the seven Mondays designated as holidays.

title: 5 Police Indicted in Auto Ring Charged With Stealing Autos
description: Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts announced the indictment yesterday of 17 personsincluding two police sergeants, a detective and two patrolmenin connection with an auto theft ring that allegedly stole and dismantled at least 1,000 latemodel cars.

title: Times's Vietnam Series Circulating in Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, June 15The first three installment of The New: York Times series on the Defense Department's secret study on Vietnam have been circulating in the Pentagon after having been routinely reproduced in an internal news, publication.

title: Guerrillas Report 4 Arrested
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 15  The Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine said here tonight that four of its members had been arrested in northern Yemen after attacking the Israelbound tanker last Friday.

title: Constance Warren Dead at 90; Led Sarah Lawrence 16 Years
description: OSSINING, N. Y., June 15Constance Warren, who had been president of Sarah Lawrence College, Bronxville, from 1929 to 1945, died today at. the Briar Crest Nursing Home. She was 90 years old.

title: OFFSHORE OIL AREAS OPENED TO INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, June 15The Interior Department announced today a fiveyear program for oil and gas leasing that offers the oil industry the opportunity for offshore drilling in several new areas, including the Atlantic Coast, the eastern Gulf of Mexico and the Gulf of Alaska.

title: Indian Envoy Meets Thant
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 15  Foreign Minister Swaran Singh of India conferred here today with Secretary General Thant and urged that international pressure be exerted on President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan's Government to cease what was termed political repression in East Pakistan.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Anticolonialism Committee meets at 4 P.M. Subcommittee meets at 10:30 A.M.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If the Pentagon Study of the Vietnam war is to be believedand sadly I think there is more there to believe than to disbelieveit is evident that the American people have been lied to and distrusted by their own leaders and representatives.

title: NeoFascist Gains in Italian Vote Seen as Protest Against Unrest
FordJapanese Talks Gain
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan, June 15 (Reuters) Kohei Matsuda, president of the Toyo Kokyo Company, told a news conference today that his company and the Ford Motor Company had completed about 90 per cent of their negotiations on a linkup of capital.

title: Market Place:??
description: You may not have heard of the Discount Corporation of New York and that's evidently the way the directors of this $688million company like it.

title: Saigon Says Paratroops Break 3Week Siege of Artillery Base
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 15 (Reuters)South Vietnamese paratroops reportedly broke a threeweek enemy siege of a Government artillery outpost in the Central Highlands today after capturing a huge enemy complex just outside the perimeter wire.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In your June 9 letter column; Gilbert Durand says that Jesus would; have carried a draft card because He, always obeyed the law of the land.

title: Most Incumbents Are Reelected as Nassau and Suffolk Villages Go to Polls
description: Incumbents were victorious for the most part yesterday as voters participated in local elections in 13 villages in Nassau and 17 villages in Suffolk.

title: Fanny May Results for the Week
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: No man's life, liberty or property is safe while the legislature is in session... is a quote lifted mirthlessly, not from a 1971 Times editorial but from a 105yearold New York court decision [1 Tucker 248 (N. Y. Sum 1866)]. However hoary, it is uncomfortably apt as we view the carnage left by this year's legislative sessionsighing with relief that the legislators have gone home before they could do even more damage.

title: Retired City Ferryboat Used as a Methadone Clinic
description: Every weekday, 450 former heroin addicts climb a gangway to the Gold Star Mother, a retired city ferryboat docked at Pier 1 on the Battery.

title: Levitt Delaying Transfer Of 2 Rail Lines to M. T A.
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt is holding up the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's takeover of the Hudson and Harlem divisions of the Penn Central.

title: Study Sees Large Saving If Space Shuttle Is Used
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 The space agency released today the conclusions of a economic analysis of the space shuttle program showing that about $12billion would be saved over the next 20 years if the controversial project went into operation and the space effort were maintained at the level of the last eight years.

title: PLUMADORE TROUPE DANCES AT CUBICULO
description: Paul Plumadore has more of a feeling for the striking visual configuration than the fluid internal development of a dance. When his succession of images maintains its pace the piece has a richness, as in Avalanche, but if imagination flags the parts seem like isolated incidents with little connection, as in Parenthesis Two. The program More Pieces presented by Mr. Plumadore and Company at the Cubiculo Monday evening soared and stumbled in almost equal measure.

title: CAPITAL PROGRAM VOTED IN SUFFOLK
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., June 15 The Suffolk County Legislature approved today a threeyear, $597million capital program that provides for several major land acquisitions and transportation proposals under the bicounty master plan.

title: CITY TOUGHENING FOULAIR ALERTS
description: The city announced yesterday a much tougher warning system for dangerous air pollution levels.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISWhen the ancient Greeks said multiple death is not death they meant that death's qualitative agony could be drowned in quantitative shock. The hecatomb loses poignancy compared to the single succumbing marathon victor's pain.

title: RALLY ATTEMPT FAILS IN MARKET
Park Opera Is Postponed
description: The Metropolitan Opera concert performance of Mascagni's Cavalleria Rusticana scheduled for presentation last night, at the Sheep Meadow in Central Park was canceled because of bad weather.

title: 6 Housing Bias Suits Are Filed By U.S. in South and Midwest
description: WASHINGTON, June 15The Department of Justice, which filed a housing discrimination suit yesterday against Blackjack, Mo., followed today with six smaller actions against developers, realestate agents and owners in the South and Middle West.

title: Reward for Missing Envoy
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15 (Reuters)Friends of Ambassador Geoffrey Jackson of Britain, who was kidnapped Jan. 8, have offered a $50,000 reward for information leading to his release, the Interior Ministry announced here today. The Ambassador was seized by urban guerrillas as he was on his way to the embassy in Montevideo.

title: FROEHLKE NAMED ARMY SECRETARY
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 President Nixon named Robert F. FroellIke today as Secretary of the Army to succeed Stanley R. Resor, who resigned recently to return to private life after six years in what has become one of the Government's most difficult and sensitive posts.

title: For the Furriers, Too, the Calendar Says It's the 1940's Again
description: Like just about everyone else in fashion, the furriers have discovered the nineteenforties. They're broadening shoulders, heaping silver fox on everything, using lots Persian lamb and broadtail, and finishing off the look with scarves of animal pelts, complete with beady little eyes and tiny feet.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In a recent editorial concerning the need for new Coast Guard marine traffic controls to reduce the risk of oil spills, you suggest that environmentalists, rather than invoke the emergency antisabotage authority of the 1950 Magnuson Act, should support the Administration's proposed Ports and Harbors Safety Act.

title: Chemical Prices Raised
description: The Hooker Chemical Corporation, a subsidiary of the Occidental Petroleum Corporation, announced yesterday that it would increase prices on all dry forms of carbonate of potash by 70 cents per hundredweight for bags and drums, and 50 cents per hundredweight in hulk quantities.

title: LeaseRenewal Ceilings Raised On RentStabilized Apartments
description: The Rent Guidelines Board announced yesterday new maximum rent increases, ranging from 8 per cent to 13 per cent, for 350,000 rentstabilized city apartments from July through June 30, 1972. Rentcontrolled. apartments are not affected.

title: Court Clears Swedish Film
description: The Supreme Court has granted, a request by Erwin N. Griswold, the Solcitor General, to drop the writ against the, Swedishmade film, Language of Love seized as obscene by Customs officials in 1969, it was reported by Unicorn Presentations, the distributors. Ephraim London, the lawyer representing Unicorn and the Swedish producers, agred to the dismissal procedure. The film is slated to have tits local premiere on June 30.

title: Image Is Challenged
description: WASHINGTON, June 15A leading Japanese bisinessman said today that the United States image of Japan as an exportcrazy nation is a serious distortion.

title: Hewitt Upset by Aussie
description: EASTBOURNE, England June 15 (UPI)Geoff Masters of Australia produced the first upset at the South of England grass tennis tournament today. The 20yearold ousted second. seeded Bob Hewitt of South Africa, 63, 3.6, 63.

title: The Vietnam Documents.
description: In an unprecedented example of censorship, the Attorney General of the United States has temporarily succeeded in preventing The New York Times from continuing to publish documentary and other material taken from a secret Pentagon study of the decisions affecting American participation in the Vietnam War.

title: Moscow Terms Documents Record of Official Duplicity
description: MOSCOW, June 15 (AP)The Soviet press agency Tass said today that the secret Defense Department documents published by The New York Times were a record of official duplicity.

title: Burch Plan Would Let Cable TV Systems Deliver at Least 2 OutofTown Channels to All Subscribers
description: WASHINGTON, June 15Dean Burch, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, proposed today to stimulate a gradual expansion of cable television by letting cable systems deliver at least two outoftown channels to their local subscribers.

title: 2 HELD AS LEADERS IN A NUMBERS RING
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced yesterday the arrest of two men described as playing important parts in $12millionayear numbers ring in the New York area.

title: Humphrey Expresses Surprise
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., June 15 (AP)Senator. Hubert H. Humphrey, who was President Johnson's Vice President, said today that the secret Pentagon study on Vietnam published by The New York Times was never brought to my attention.

title: Newsman Pardoned by Tito Returns to West Germany
description: BONN, June 15Hans Peter Rullmann, former Belgrade correspondent of the West German news magazine Der Spiegel who was sentenced last year to six years imprisonment by a Yugoslav Army court, returned to West Germany today one clay after his release was ordered by President Tito.

title: Bridge:; ?? ??  In Tel Aviv for Firs. Loss
description: TEL AVIV, June 15The Precision international team lost its unbeaten record during a threeday visit here, but still won two matches out of three. The visitors bowed by a 21point margin to a group of brilliant young Tel Aviv players who seem likely to make a mark on the international scene in the future, and followed with victories over the senior Tel Aviv team by 10 points and over Haifa by 41 points.

title: New's Analysis
description: Did we cry wolf? asked Thomas B. Morgan, the Mayor's press secretary. He was referring to the failure of the widely publicized massive layoffs of up to 60,000 city employes to materialize in the revised budget offered by the Mayor on Monday.

title: Forthcoming Liquidation Casts Pall Over Shipyard by the Clyde
description: CLYDEBANK, Scotland June, 16The sun was shining in. Clydebank today, but the ship yard they still call John Brown's cast a. shadow over this Glasgow industrial suburb.

title: Stocks on Amex Close Lower as Turnover Slows
House Unit Extends Laws On Reserve Bank Purchases
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 (Reuters)  The House Banking Committee today approved legislation extending for two yearsto June 30, 1973the temporary authority under which Federal Reserve banks may purchase publicdebt obligations directly from the Treasury.

title: LAVER IS SEEDED WIMBLEDON'S NO.1
Matchmaking by Computer Termed Alien to Soviet Morality by Pravda
description: MOSCOW, June 15The Soviet Communist party today came out for marriage through love and not through calculation, even electronic. It rebuked a weekly newspaper for backing a plan to establish computerized marriage bureaus to bring lonely people together.

title: BlackOwned Firm Seeks Big Board Seat
description: Two enterprising young black men and a group of major New York banks, with some cooperation by the Government, have joined in the creation of a brokerage firm that probably will become the first blackoperated member house of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: CHARLES G. BOCHERT, EXPUBLICITY MAN, 92
description: Charles G. Bochert, a former showbusiness publicity agent, died Tuesday at his home, 85 Eastern Parkway, Brobklyn. He was 92 years old.

title: Excerpts From Rogers News Conference
description: Q. Mr. Secretary, Mr. [Clark M.] Clifford's proposal was rejected by Mr. [Ronald L.] Ziegler at the White House on the grounds that it sets too precipitous a deadline that the South Vietnamese at that stage would not be in a position to defend themselves. When will the Administration think the South Vietnamese will be in such a position and, secondly, does Mr. Ziegler's answer imply the opposition of the Administration to setting a date certain in return for the release of the prisoners is a matter of timing or principle?

title: Boy, 13, Adrift 20 Days In Caribbean, Is Rescued
description: BALBOA HEIGHTS, Panama Canal Zone, June 15 (Rcuters)A 13yearold Jamaican boy has been rescued in the Caribbean after spending 20 days adrift in a small fishing boat, a West German reported today

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The bill passed by the NeW York State Legislature and signed by Governor Rockefeller providing for a cammission to investigate the Administration of New York City falls nothing short of an outrage. The powerful upstate lawmakers and the Governor have once again collaborated in slandering and persecuting the city. And the hypocrisy of it. The Governor's excuse for not granting the necessary promised state funds to the city was lack of state money, and yet he feels justified in allocating. $250,000 for this useless commission.

title: Council Urged to Sit In on Labor Talks
description: A group of City Councilmen should sit in on all major municipal labor negotiations, the head of one of the major unions of public employes said yesterday.

title: Foe Shells Near Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Wednesday, June 16 (UPI)Enemy gunners fired rockets and mortars at targets near Pnompenh last night, reaching as close as four miles from the capital's downtown section, military spokesmen said today. Two Cambodian soldiers were reported killed and 11 wounded.

title: Balanchine Ballet Set to Ad Tune Shapes Up
description: America is advertising, George Balanchine said with a shrug. Everybody wants all the time to buy and sell, everybody is materialistic. That's why they came from Europe. I don't mind that. So why not, the director of the New York City Ballet asked himself, base a Balanchine ballet on an advertising jingle?

title: G.E. HEAD ASSAILS AID TO LOCKHEED
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 (AP) The chairman of the General Electric Company said today that the British Government caused the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation's current financial plight and should assume the responsibility for saving the American aircraft maker from bankruptcy.

title: U.S. Court Orders Miss Bacon Freed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 15Leslie Bacon moved a step toward freedom today as a Federal court here ordered that she be released from jail in Seattle pending her appeal of a contemptofcourt sentence for refusing to testify before a Federal grand jury.

title: Pusey Calls Revolutionaries Deluded
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 15 in his last speech to students before retiring as president of Harvard University, Nathan M. Pusey denounced today the power hungry revolutionaries who have made the last few years so difficult for him. He termed them grievously, even malignantly, deluded.

title: 4 YOUNG MEN SOUGHT IN DETROIT SLAYINGS
description: DETROIT, June 15The Detroit police today sought four unidentified young men who were said to have been seen by neighbors fleeing from the home where four young women and three young men were found shot to death yesterday.

title: Voluntary Plan Ready
description: TOKYO, June 15The Japanese textile industry notified the Government today of the intention of implementing its plan to restrain voluntarily the export of textile products to the United States for three years beginning July 1.

title: Medal of Honor Presented To Seven at White House
description: WASHINGTON, June 15 (UPI) President Nixon conferred the Medal of Honor on seven Vietnam combat veterans at private White House ceremony today.

title: For Yuba City Suspect, Early Prosperity Ended in an Unsuccessful Plea for Welfare
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., June 15 Summer usually comes early to Yuba City. This year it didn't. The spring rains lingered late, slowing the work in the fields and orchards.

title: Boyle Quits Union Welfare Post As Strike by Miners is Widened
description: WASHINGTON, June 15W. A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers of America, bowed to a Federal court order today and quit his seat on the threemember board of trustees of the U.M.W. Welfare and Retirement Fund, Inc.

title: Urban League Appoints a New Director
description: Vernon E. Jordan Jr., who at the age of 35 has spent his adult life seeking equality for his fellow blacks, was named yesterday to succeed the late Whitney M. Young Jr. as executive director of the National Urban League.

title: Girl Jockey,17, Finishes Last of 11 in Her Debut
description: CLEVELAND, June 15 (AP)  Cheryl White, a 17 yearold recently graduated from high school, became the first black woman jockey in regular United States horse race today when she ode Ace Reward in the fifth race at Thistledown.

title: Canadian Surplus Off 16% In May Commodity Trading
description: OTTAWA, June 15 (Canadian Press)Canada had a balance of $179.8million in its favor in international commodity trade last month, down 16 per cent from the $214.7million trade surplus in May last year, the Dominion Bureau of Statistics reported today.

title: Assemblyman Says He Will Reject Extra Lulu
description: ALBANY, June 15A freshman assemblyman from Manhattan said today he would reject the extra $2,000 expense allowance the State Legislature voted for its members at the last minute in this austerity year.

title: JAMES M'DONALD, A CLOUD PHYSICIST
description: TUCSON, Ariz., June 15 (UPI) Dr. James E. McDonald, nationally knoWn University of Arizona physicist, was found dead in a desert area Sunday, an apparent suicide. He was 51 years old,

title: Stars Warn Lakers Not to Sign Sharman In Coaching Hassle
description: SALT LAKE CITY, June 15 (AP)The Utah Stars said today Bill Sharman was no longer their coach. But they also strongly indicated they did not want him coaching for the Los Angeles Lakers, either.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Says Pakistan Solution Grows Remote
description: NEW DELHI, June 15Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. said in Parliament today that the possibility of a political settlement in East Pakistan was becoming more remote every clay.

title: Rockefeller Opposes Mills Plan For Direct Federal Aid to Cities
description: WASHINGTON, June 15Governor Rockefeller told the House Ways and Means Committee today that direct Federal aid to the cities, bypassing the states, would be a disastrous start of a breakdown of the Federal system as we now know it.

title: Condors Promote Binstein
description: PITTSBURGH, June 15 (UPI) Mark Binstein, operations director of the Pittsburgh Condors of the American Basketball Association since Jan, 20, was named today general manager.

title: Bonn Revives Idea Of 6Nation Float
