description: AT many Broadway theaters, the stage door guard is a veteran of the charge up San Juan hill. The man I found at the door of the Cracker Box conformed to the general type, all of whom are known as Pops. Hoping to divert his attention from the ceiling, I said Hi, Pops. Can you tell me where Miss Malone

title: Witch, bitch, goddess, or human being?; Man's World, Woman's Place; A Study in Social Mythology. By Elizabeth Janeway. 319 pp. New York: William Morrow & Co. $8.95.
description: This is a lucid and fascinating book, a book that draws so skillfully on the best of our fragmented social science, that, as a secial scientist, it gives me renewed faith that we may in time, produce an integrated understanding of the world. With her disciplined and perceptive mind, and high standards of craftsmanship, the novelist and critic, Elizabeth Janeway, set outin those long lost days of the early 1960'sto explore the problem of why we were continuing to live with the myth that woman's place is in the home. The myth, though patently untrue in many ways, forms the basis of most private attitudes and public discussions.

title: Home Improvement
description: HANGING plants add flowers and greenery to many a terrace, patio, arbor and porch. Even hanging house plants can be moved outdoors for the summer in suitable protected places.

title: Music
description: WHAT with five major orchestras (London Philharmonic, London Symphony, Royal Philharmonic, New Philharmonia and British Broadcasting Corporation Symphony), two opera houses, two ballet companies, chamber orchestras, the everimposing Festival Hall complex, smaller auditoriums around town, visiting organizations and artists, a powerful group of active young composers, at least four Important morning newspapers with busy staffs of music criticswhat with all that, plus other goodies that constantly are turning up, London puts in a good bid to be the music capital of the world.

title: Schnauzers Are No Tiny Items in Czechoslovakia
description: PRAGUE, June 15 The first miniature schnauzer was imported into Czechoslovakia in 1962. Two years later, 39 of the bewhiskered set had been registered with the Club of Schnauzer Breeders. Last month the 800mark was passed, with 200 more awaiting confirmation.

title: Munich Wins Cup Soccer By Defeating Cologne, 21
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, June 19 (UPI)Bayern Munich won the West German soccer Federation Cup today with a 21 overtime victory over F.C. Cologne before 71,000 spectators.

title: MRS. GEORGE HAMID SR.
description: VENTNOR, N. J., June 19Mrs. Elizabeth Raab Hamid, widow of George A. Hamid Sr., owner of the Atlantic City Steel Pier, died today in her home here. Her age was 74. Mr. Hamid died last Sunday.

title: For Young Readers: illustrating fairy tales, writing folk tales
description: Alice wasn't the only one to question what use a book has without any pictures. Publishers and illustrators have discovered the old folk tales and seem determined to bring them all out in picturebook format. Librarians, who have difficulty promoting good books without any visual comeon these days, make an easy market for fairy tales published singly, with determinedly colorful, fullpage illustrations. It takes at least 10 hours of practice to learn a story for telling; it takes less than a minute to hand it out in picturebook form.

title: The Year's High Noon
description: Summer comes, with the solstice, tomorrow. We are now in the midst of the year's longest spans of daylight, though by the end of the week they will have begun shrink again toward autumn and October. A late spring made everything hurry into June, and now July is just ahead of us.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Tigers Rally to Defeat Indians, 5 to 3, on Home Runs by Cash and Rodriguez
L.I. Summer Stock Predicts Smash Biz
description: The curtain is going up with the temperature for the summer theater season on Long Island and the indications are that it will have a profitable wellattended run.

title: Bonnie Birmingham Is Married To Loyal Leavenworth, Student
description: NORWALK, Conn., June 19 Miss Elizabeth Gaillard Birmingham and Loyal Eldredge Leavenworth were married here this afternoon in the Brookside Chapel by the Rev. Donald W. Emig, minister of the United Church in Rowayton.

title: Headliners
description: In his native Atlanta, they say Vernon E. Jordan Jr. is 'a young man with an old head. The 35yearold black attorney has earned that description because of his successful dealings with both whites and blacks in a string of civilrights roles, most recently as executive director of the United Negro College Fund. He has shown flexibility and tactbut also toughness. Last week Mr. Jordan moved into one of the most influential positions in the field of racial relations: He was named executive director of the National Urban League, to succeed the late Whitney M. Young Jr. One of his objectives, Mr. Jordan said, would be to help white America to understand that democracy, justice and equality are not reserved for white folk only.

title: ALCATRAZ INDIANS VOW TO PRESS ON
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 18Out in the bay the Coast Guard boats rocked in the choppy waters and up on Alcatraz island, behind new wire fencing, armed Federal marshals stood guard.

title: Mark Capecelatro Weds Joanna Beals
description: SCARBOROUGH, N. Y., June 19Miss Joanna Jane Beals, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Diggs Beals of Briarcliff Manor, was married here this afternoon to Mark John Capecelatro, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Ettore Capecelatro of Orange, Conn., where the bridegroom's father is First Selectman and president of the Hillside Farms Company. The bride's father is retired president of Wells Fargo & Co. and a former vice president of the American Express Company.

title: Last of the Nonuplets Dies at Sydney Hospital
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Sunday June 20 (Reuters)The last of the nine Brodrick babies has died doctors at the Royal Hospital for Women said today.

title: Gar Wood Dies at 90
description: Garfield Arthur (Gar) Wood, a millionaire industrialist and powerboat racing enthusiast, died yesterday. He was 90 years old. Obituary in main news section on page 50.

title: Dinner Nets Black Caucus $250,000
description: WASHINGTON, June 19Some 2,800 persons were served a heavy dish of partisan politics, mixed with light jokes and enthusiastic fellowship, at a fundraising dinner last night for black members of the House.

title: Movies
description: SAVAGES will soon he upon us. That's the title of the latest cinematic effort of James Ivory and Ismail Merchant, the American director and Indian producer responsible for a string of movies thqt includes Shakespeare Wallah, The Householder, The Guru and Bombay Talkie.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WARWICK, R. I.None of us was glowing with vitality when we arrived at Earle Steere's Warwick Cove Marina at dawn, but two of our skippers, Albert Morin of Warwick and Fred Frederek of Cranston, R. I., were particularly blearyeyed.

title: hat Turns American Housewives Into Haggling Hyenas in Istanbul?
description: ISTANBULThe Kapall Carsi, or covered bazaar of Istanbul has the amazing capacity to make haggling hyenas out of modest American housewives and bargaining bandits out of dignified executives. I've seen it happen to them and all I can say is I'm glad their husbands and employes didn't witness it.

title: U.S. NINE TO PLAY 24 GAMES IN EAST
description: The United States baseball team for the PanAmerican Games has scheduled 24 games throughout the East before flying to Cali, Colombia, July 25.

title: BOLOGNA MEETS WEST HAM TODAY
description: West Ham United of England, with Bobby Moore and Geoff Hurst, and Bologna of Italy, with Giacomo Bulgarelli and Giuseppe Savoldi, will meet at Roosevelt Stadium In Jersey City today.

title: Patrolman Is Shot With His Own Gun; 2 Seized in Queens
description: A 22yearold policeman was seriously wounded in Long Island City, Queens, early this morning when a man he had stopped for a traffic, violation stole his gun and shot him in the back.

title: Walsh Recalls Policing New York, Yonkers Raceway
description: YONKERS, June 19During the 33 years James J. Walsh was a member of the New York City Police Department, working his way up from a rookie in 1931 to assitant chief deputy inspector, he learned to spot the bad guy a mile away.

title: College G.O.P. Names Aide
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP)  Richard Hines of Spartanburg, S.C., has been named national membership chairman of the College Republicans. Mr. Hines, 21 years old, graduated this month from the University of South Carolina.

title: FOSSE SIDELINED, BITTER AT DENEHY
description: CLEVELAND, June 19 (AP) Ray Fosse, the Cleveland Indian catcher who is expected to be sidelined a week with a hand injury suffered last night in a freeforall between the Indians and the Detroit Tigers, made no effort today to hide his bitter feelings.

title: East German Party Congress Affirms Honecker as Leader
description: BERLIN June 19The East German Communists today reelected Erich Honecker the 58year old party tactician as First Secretary. He replaced Walter Ulbricht in that top party post six weeks ago.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Soviet Engineer Is Missing In Paris, FranceSoir Says
description: PARIS, June 19 (AP)  The newspaper FranceSoir said today that a Soviet space engineer, Anatoly Fedoseyev, disappeared from his Paris hotel on June J, after the start of the Paris Air Show.

title: The Education of a Romantic in the Backwater
description: WE are an obsessively modernist people but the same time obsessive antiquarians. We collect old bottles, old cars, old movies old songs and old places in the hope of staking down our historical selves to resist the constant forward rush of a faceless and unpredictable culture. This passion for the past has influenced nothing much as our habits of tourism. As tourists, we systematically ignore the new (which is oppressive us at home and which in any case can be had anywhere) and devote much of our time to searching out every sort of remnant and ruin With a vengeance we track down historic sites marked by mere rubble a patriotic plaque museums and monuments whose likes in our home city we have never bothered visit and rural paradises in which we would never consider living.

title: COMPUTER HELPS IN HUNT FOR JOBS
description: HICKSVILLE, L. I., June 19 A computerized job placement system designed to assist Nassau and Suffolk County employers in finding workers and job applicants in obtaining employment was opened at the State Department of Labor's Employment District Office here this week.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: DEARBORN, Mich., June 19 (AP)An armorplated limousine is being handcrafted for the President in a windowless basement of a Ford Motor Company building.

title: Margaret E. Wolf, R. T. Gilbert Marry
description: STAMFORD, Conn., June 19  Miss Margaret Elizabeth Wolf and Robert Thomas Gilbert were married here this afternoon at St. Francis Episcopal Church by the Rev. Robert M. Dresser.

title: Mary Bolling Holloway Betrothed
description: SUMMIT, N. J., June 19The engagement of Miss Mary Bolling Holloway to John Barto McEntire 3d has been announced by her parents, Dr. and Mrs. Frederic Ancrum Lord Holloway of Summit and Stratton Mountain, Vt.

title: Mao's Cultural Revolutionan inside and an outside report
description: Excluded (until recently) from the China mainland for more than two decades, American Pekingologists have been pouncing on Hong Kong refugees to find out what life is like in the terra incognita of Mao Tsetung. Like young Americans in Canada, these exiles may be atypical of citizens back homebut their decisions to flee bespeak troubles in their native land.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Simons Hopes Shorter Merion Course Will Help Thwart Nicklaus Challenge
TWO FULL HOUSES HEAR CAROLE KING
description: Carole King, who recently became a performer after more than a decade as a successful songwriter, rode into New York on Friday evening on the crest of a wave of personal popularity that completely filled Carnegie Hall for the two concerts she gave there.

title: Ken Harrelson to Leave Baseball for Golf Tour
description: CLEVELAND, June 19 (UPI)Ken Harrelson will hang up his Cleveland Indians baseball uniform Monday and take a swing at the professional golf tour.

title: A's Blank Brewers, 20
Gregory Moves Into Lead In Thistle Class Qualifying
description: LAKE HOPATCONG, N.J., June 19  Thirtytwo boats competed today at the start of twoday district qualifying for the Thistle Class national championship, which takes place in Waukegan, Ill., in August.

title: ROSS, KAHN REACH JERSEY NET FINAL
description: KEARNY, N. J., June 19Steve Ross of Brooklyn and Bob Kahn of New York meet tomorrow in the final of the New Jersey State men's tennis championship at the Arlington Players Club.

title: Work on Football Hall Called 10 Months Away
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 19Former Senator George Mur phy, the National Football Foundation's new president, presented to the council today the approved plans for the Hall of Fame building. He also suggested a program for financing the hall and gave assurance that construction would be started within 10 months.

title: How to Get To the Airport For 55 Cents (In One Easy Lesson)
description: THE taxi fares had gone up like ackack and one morning I found myself peering with unusual interest at the map on the F train wall, struck by the apparent near miss made by New York's transit system in bypassing La Guardia Airport. I studied it intensely. Nothing could be certain, of course because the subway mapsin order to produce their misleadingly straight, clean, multicolored linesso distort everything that, much like 16thcentury charts of the Western Hemisphere, they are pretty to look at but fairly useless for navigation. Lousy, in fact, unless you believe Central Park forms a perfect square.

title: The initial question: why did science move to the West?; Science and Civilisation in China
description: The Republic of Kenya has but a short official past. Last December Kenyans proudly celebrated the seventh anniversary of their independence. There were merry fireworks, and a workaday NASA rocket as well, launched by a party of Italian engineers to carry into orbit an American xray detector, now neatly girdling the earth every couple of hours. That space launch took off from its artificial island platform, offshore from the old port of Malindi, on the sunbaked coast of Kenya, just north of Mombasa on the equator.

title: The Nation
description: A spate of adssuch as those Illustrated at the righthave been popping up all over the newspapers these days. They aren't, as one might at first glance have supposed, comeons placed by underground travel agents for seats on slightly suspect charter flights. They were placed by many of the world's leading airlines and are the opening shots in a rate war which, according to one airline official, may usher in a totally new concept in transAtlantic transportation.

title: Murphy and Gibson Again Gain Final of Long Island Amateur Golf Tourney
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., June 19, The Long Island amateur golf tournament has a repeat final for the second time in its 48year history because Bob Mur, phy, the defending champion, land Alan Gilison, twotime run, nerup, today reached the 36hole last round at the Garden City Country Club.

title: Study Said to Show Bomb Lulls Were Meant to Placate Public
description: WASHINGTON, June 18 (AP) The Washington Post reported tonight that secret Pentagon papers showed that the Johnson Administration's strategists had little expectation that the pauses in the bombing of North Vietnam in 1965 and 1968 would produce peace talks.

title: THOMAS GOMEZ, ACTOR, 65, DIES
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., June 19 (UPI)  Thomas Gomez, veteran character actor, died at St. John's Hospital yesterday after three weeks in a coma. He was 65 years old.

title: Stein in Duryea's District To Press Housing Drive
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., June 19Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein, Democrat of Manhattan, campaigning for better housing in the urban centers, toured the district of Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea Jr., Republican of Montauk, today.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Coast Fireman's Family Gets $10,722 Settlement
description: LOS ANGELES, June 19 (UPI)The City Council has agreed to pay the widow and teenage son of Fireman William Martin $10,722.15 because his 35 years of occupational exposure to fireand smoke had contributed to his death of lung cancer.

title: SUFFOLK TRAILER TO AID CONSUMERS
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., June 19Since it first began operations last January, an average of nearly 300 complaints of consumer fraud have been pouring in each month to the Suffolk District Attorney's Consumer Frauds Bureau.

title: The Prisoner of Sex
description: To the Editor:

title: N.C. A. A. Track Coaches Vote To Keep Foreigners Pointless
Margaret Chew Becomes Bride Of D. C. Will 3d
description: RADNOR, Pa., June 19Miss Margaret Lloyd Chew, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Thompson Chew, was married here this afternoon to Daniel Carl Will 3d, son of Mr. Will Jr. of Moorestown, N. J., and Mrs. Jacquelyn Little of West Chester. The Rev. Richard W. Hess of St. David's Episcopal Church in Wayne performed the ceremony in the garden at Maidstone, the Chew home.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Light Pollution From a Growing Tucson Threatens Astronomy Capital of the World
description: TUCSON, Ariz For city dwellers whose eyes have grown accustomed to an artificial aurora overhead at night the starflecked blackness of the southern Arizona sky Is both astonishing and a little frightening. On a clear night here, you can almost see beyond forever.

title: Wan of Rutgers Receives Trophy as a Top Athlete
description: Rutgers Univergity's star, Tom Ulan, the World University Games 400meter champion and National Collegiate indoor 440 titleholder, has received the Donald Leslie Coursen Trophy as the outstanding senior athlete.

title: Houston Dentist Arrested In $2Million Stock Theft
description: HOUSTON, June 19 (UPI)Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation arrested Dr. Jack Blankfield, 50yearsold dentist, today in Houston and charged him with possession of $2million worth of stolen stock.

title: A Revolutionary Romance at Pennsylvania's Ephrata Cloister
description: EPHRATA, Pa.As dusk settles over the Ephrata Cloister's amphitheater, a chorus of monks wearing white, Capuchinstyle robes files out of the wooded darkness. (They represent members of a Protestant colony that flourished here in the 18th century and included both male and female celibate groups living on the same grounds.) A British officer, wounded in the Battle of Brandywine in 1777, stumbles into the compound. Then Sister Anna appears. She helps to tend his woundsand falls in love with him.

title: The Capt in Who Commanded Lieutenant Caney
description: FORT MCPHERSON, GA.ONE of the men made a drawing of a mangy old alley cat with a bandage on his tail sitting on a full garbage can. We had it silkscreened onto sweatshirts, one for each man. Above the picture was our nickname, Charlie Cats, and, below, the formal name, Company C, First Battalion, 20th Infantry Regiment. No one outside the company knew we were getting them, and it was really something when we all turned out in the sweatshirts, bloused fatigue pants and boots for the battalion organization day.

title: Five days a chapter for 38 chapters
description: This book is about a Canadian English professor named Henry Farquharson who spends a year teaching in Nigeria at the university in Ibadan. He goes there with a cheerless trim workable wife who pushes him away from her before he has orgasm, and their 2yearold boy. In spite of his absolutely rotten marriage, frozen psyche and the cornpanionship of the most witless people who can ever have assembled on a university compound, this unexceptional 37yearold man manages to get along. The novel is written in the form of a diary (five days on the average per chapter, 38 chapters) and we get a good detailed account of Farquharson's movements, his trips to the market, visits to the neighbors, afternoons at the club, his marital bickerings, his dull lascivious sex life with Canadian girl whom he shares with a depressed American medic, and so on.

title: Sky Marshals May Be Cut
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) Gen. Benjamin O. Davis, director of civil aviation security, says ground security at airports is beginning to get the detailed, attention it requires and an eventual 75 per cent cut in the 200man sky marshal force is possible.

title: Knudson Posts 68 for 207 To Win Ontario Golf by Shot
description: TORONTO, June 19 (Canadian Press)George Knudson of Toronto posted a 68 today to win the Ontario open golf championship with a threeround score of 207, six under par.

title: A Communal Pilgrimage Along Canada's Highways
description: HITCHHIKING across Canada never really occurred to me until the day before I decided to do it. All during last August had been planning my escape route from New York City and its oppressive summer heat. California was my destination and although Canada did seem the most interesting way to get there (I had been across the United States before), I was trying to decide between driving or taking the reputedly excellent transcontinental train.

title: Black Postal Employe Obtains Court Order Staying Dismissal
description: A Federal District Court judge has granted a black woman's request for a temporary restraining order and thereby prevented the United States Postal Service from dismissing her.

title: A Silent Alarm Is Helping Foil Robberies in Independent Cabs
description: A group of independent taxicab ownerdrivers here are experimenting with a new electronic system to enable them to flash a silent alarm to their headquarters in an emergency.

title: Seton Hall Names Law Dean
description: NEWARK, June 19John F. X Irving, executive director of the Illinois Law Enforcement Commission, was named today as the new dean of the Seton Hall University Law School. Mr. Irving, 43 years old, succeeds John P. Loftus, who retired last month after 10 years as dean,

title: HUME'S SLOOP WINS SHIELDS Y.R.A. RACE
description: GREEENWICH, Conn., June 19Thomas Hume sailed his Shields Class sloop, Pantomime, to victory by 43 seconds and seven boat lengths today on Long Island Sound off Belle Haven Club. It was a 6.5mile race for Yacht Racing Association fleets based East of Rye.

title: The Nation
description: The Pentagon's own best account of how the United States tricked itself into a war it could not win began to appear serially in The New York Times last week....

title: Lyn??a Brooks Wed To T. A. Crowley
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., June 19  The Union Church of Pocantico Hills here was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Lynda. Lee Brooks and Thomas Adam Crowley. The Rev. Marshall L. Smith performed the ceremony after which a reception was given at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert D. Brooks.

title: LIQUORI RETAINS TITLE WITH 3:57.6
description: SEATTLE, June 19At a psychological peak, Marty Liquori shattered 4 minutes for the third time this year en route to a third consecutive National Collegiate outdoor mile title today.

title: Barbizon Streak Triumphs In Patriot Stakes on a Foul
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 19 (AP)Mrs. H. J. Udouj's Barbizon Streak, 16th in the Kentucky Derby, was awarded first place today in the $29,525 added Patriot Stakes at Liberty Ball Park.

title: Julie Steiner Is Wed
description: KATONAH, N. Y., June 19 Miss Julie Steiner was married here this evening to Jay Wesley Chrisman. State Supreme Court Justice Theodore R. Kupferman of the Appellate Division performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Alfred Steiner. The bridegroom's parents are Dr. and Mrs. Robert A. Chrisman of Bloomington, Ill.

title: Maria Franco Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, June 19Miss Maria Victoria Walbridge Franco, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ernesto FrancoHolguin, was married here this afternoon to Charles Lee Granquist Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Granquist of North Hadley, Mass.

title: SO. AFRICAN BLACKS AND WHITES COMPETE
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 19 (UPI)Black and white athletes from South Africa competed against each other for the first time today in southern Africa.

title: Television
description: AT 42, the man for whom the actual was supremewhose cameras have led viewers into a joyfilled delivery room to witness the beginning of a life, into the grim confines of a hospital ward where a life was coming to a lonely end, into a Queens factory echoing with the deadend boredom of the assembly linehas turned away from the documentary to create the dramas of his imagination.

title: Letters on War Documents
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. COLLEGIANS WIN IN TRACK
description: DUBLIN, June 19 (UPI)The combined Harvard and Yale track and field team ended its European tour with an easy victory over Dublin University College today, scoring 123 points to 59 for the Irish athletes.

title: The World
description: BERLINThe steadily closergrowing alliance with the Soviet Union is decisive for the entire development of the German Democratic Republic.

title: Merion Brings Back That 1930 Grand Slam for Bobby Jones's Former Caddie
description: ARDMORE, Pa., June 19Beyond him, down the hill and behind the creek that caresses the 1 1 th green, the pin with the orange wicker basket atop it looked the same as it did 41 years ago.

title: Mrs. Estes Has Son
description: Mrs. Richard M. Estes of 1010 Fifth Avenue on June 1 in the Lenox Hill Hospital. Mrs. Estes is the former Miss Pamela Jane Graine, daughter of Mrs. Murray R. Graine of New York and the late Mr. Graine. The child, whose father is a lawyer, is named William Jonathan.

title: Westbury Poloists Pitted Against Bethpage Today
description: Westbury will meet Bethpage in a Metropolitan League polo game at Bethpage State Park Polo Field this afternoon. Bethpage, which defeated Aiken in their initial meeting on June 6, leads the threeteam league.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Letters on War Documents
Giants Win on Mays's Hit
LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Bankruptcy Anniversary
description: On the first anniversary of its bankruptcy, after a year in which the Penn Central Transportation Company has made little visible progress toward its reorganization, the railroad and its trustees find themselves on a collision course with labor and want Congress in their corner.

title: Undistinguished work by a distinguished journalist
description: Arthur Krock's Memoirs, published in 1968 after his retirement as Washington correspondent for The New York Times, was a thick, well documented, often fascinating volume that became one of the year's leading bestsellers. Its success seemed a fitting climax to a 60year career during which Krock won four Pulitzer Prizes and personally knew 12 Presidents. Now Krock, 85 years of age and increasingly displeased with the state of the nation, has brought forth a new volume in which he attempts to examine what he sees as the decline and fall of American democracy.

title: Toledo Gets Mat Tourney
description: Toledo University will be the site of the Amateur Athletic Union's second annual national Junior Olympic freestyle wrestling championships July 16 and 17.

title: 2Man Golf Team for U.S.
description: TUCSON, Ariz., June 19 (AP) A twoman team will represent the United States in the World amateur golf championship, Vic Kelly, the chairman or the National Collegiate golf committee, announced today, The tournament is scheduled Aug. 19 to 22 in Bogota, Co.! lombia.

title: The Finding of Insulin 50 Years Ago Recalled
description: TORONTO, June 18It was 50 years ago that two Canadian researchers, probing deep in the bellies of dogs, found insulina discovery that is regarded as one of the great landmarks in the history of medicine.

title: NEW BRUNSWICK FIGHTS POLLUTION
description: FREDERICTON, New Brunswick  With the help of the Canadian Government and authorities in Maine, New Brunswick is slowly coming to grips with the old but increasingly grave problem of pollution of the Saint John River.

title: Susan D. Wiemann Bride of Law Student
description: MANHASSET, L. I., June 19 Miss Susan Dolores Wiemann, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George F. Wiemann 3d, was married here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church to Dennis William Carroll Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Carroll of Bladensburg, Md. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Frank N. Johnston who was assisted by the Rev. Robert L. Brown.

title: Mrs. Lucy Devens Wed To George D. Aldrich
description: BOSTON, June 19Mrs. Lucy A. Devens of South Norwalk, Conn., was married here today to her cousin, George Davenport Aldrich. Both are grandchildren of the late Nelson W. Aldrich, United States Senator for Rhode Island from 1881 to 1911, and cousins of Governor Rockefeller.

title: Miss Laurie M. Carmody Is Married
description: WOODBURY, Conn., June 19Miss Laurie Merriman Carmody, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Guerin B. Carmody of Woodbury and Weekapaug, R. I., was married here today to Alfred C. C. M. Hoeberechts, son of Mr. and Mrs. A. M. J. HoeberechtsJanssen of Maastricht, the Netherlands. The ceremony was performed in St. Teresa of Avila Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Anthony J. Sima.

title: Dance
description: DANCE is a localized rapture. Let me explain. As a drama critic I get enormous pleasure from. watching the development (or no pleasure but at least interest from the possible nondevelopment) of the various drama companies all over the world. But I can never know it all.

title: 5,000 Youths Attend a RegistertoVote Rally in Park
description: Against a backdrop of large banners reacting When You Got the Vote, You've Got to Use ItSo Use It! 5,000 youths in Central Park yesterday roared their approval of speeches and messages denouncing the war in Vietnam.

title: Towns Building Airports to Lure Jobs
description: LA CROSSE, Kan., June 19Just outside of town here, there is a rectangularshaped, 23acre parcel of land cloaked by a thick mantle of wild prairie grass. It looks no different from the flat, green and monotonous Kansas plains that stretch endlessly on all sides.

title: Letters on War Documents
description: To the Editor:

title: Sandra Meyer, To Be the Bride Of James Buchet
description: ST. JAMES, L. I., June 19 The engagement of Miss Sandra Louise Meyer to James Buchet was announced today at a cocktail party given by Mr. and Mrs. Corwin H. Meyer, parents of the future bride, at their home here. Mr. Buchet is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jean Henri Buchet of Paris and St. James.

title: ARABS BEGIN TRIPS TO OCCUPIED LAND
description: JERICHO Israelioccupied Jordan June 15The first parties of an expected 100,000 Arab summer tourists passed through Israeli border posts today.

title: Bronx Subway Holdup Fails
description: A man attempting to hold up a change booth at the 180th Street station of the IRT Third Avenue el in the Bronx was shot and grazed in the head by a stakeout team of Transit Au. thority patrolmen yesterday afternoon. The suspect. was identified as James Hall, 18 years old, of 132 West. 17th Street.. He was treated at Fordham Hospital and later charged with attempted robbery.

title: How the Fed Weathered A Fateful Week
description: WASHINGTON  It was just a year ago this weekend that the United States Federal Reserve System became for the first time, by most interpretationswhat central banks were largely invented to become: A lender of last resort.

title: Miss Bittner Jersey Bride
description: MOUNTAIN LAKES, N. J. June 19In the Community Church here today, Miss Deborah Lou Bittner and Davenport West 3d, members of the class of 72 at Westminster College, were married by the Rev. Dr. Loral W, Pancake.

title: Sunday Times of London Prints Article on Series
description: LONDON, Sunday, June 10 The Sunday Times of London published in this morning's issue a summary and analysis of The New York Times reports on the Pentagon's secret study of American involvement in the Vietnam war,

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Colombia Fans Await Renewal Of CubaU.S. Feud in Baseball
description: CALI, Colombia, June 19The fastestselling tickets, with the 15sport, 33nation sixth PanAmerican Games here six weeks away, are for baseball.

title: Child to the Auslanders
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., June 19A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Richard Auslander June 3 at the Harkness Pavilion of the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. Mr. Auslander is director of institutional research of Merkin & Co., members of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Lewis Bust to Smithsonian
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP)  A bronze bust of John L. Lewis was presented to the Smithsonian Institution last Wednesday by I. W. Abel, president of the United Steelworkers on behalf of the industrial union department of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrail Organizations.

title: The 15th Man ho Was Asked To Direct MSSH (An Did) Makes a Peculiar Western
description: IT is 4:30 on a Friday afternoon in late December, and the Canadian darkness has fallen like a stone. Water pours down Robert Altman's Mephistophelean beard, and an incongruously thin string of love beads circles his massive neck. At 2 A.M. the preceding night he lurched to bed, a last glass of Scotch in one hand, a last joint of marijuana in the other. But the indulgences of the night have no claim over the day. He was the first man on the set in the winter darkness of 7 A.M. He will be the last man to leave in the slippery frozen twilight.

title: Miss Moore To Be Bride
description: Miss Eleanor Montgomery Moore, a descendant of Lynford Lardner, Keeper of the Seal under William Penn for the territory that later became the State of Pennsylvanvania, and Carter Nicholas, a descendant of Dr. Benjamin Rush, signer of the Declaration of Independence, plan to be married on Sept. 18 in the Brick Presbyterian Church.

title: Gerulaitis, 16, Seeks Men's Net Title
description: The long legged, towheaded youngster who played as Pancho Gonzales's doubles partner in Madison Square Garden two years ago is a bigger boy now and giving the opposition fits in Eastern men's tennis.

title: BOXING INQUIRY HALTED BY RULES
description: MADRID, June 19 (UPI)The European Amateur Boxing Union (E.A.B.U.) averted today an investigation of drugged boxers and, in doing so, assured continuation of the finals of the European Championships.

title: Edmund Olson Of F. B. I. Weds Beverly Knight
description: BAL HARBOR, Fla., June 19  Miss Beverly Hoover Knight, whose father, James Landon Knight, is chairman of The Miami Herald Publishing Company and chairman and chief executive of the Knight newspapers, was married here this evening to Edmund Eugene Olson. His father, John Benjamin Olson, is general manager of The Detroit Free Press and a director of Knight Newspapers.

title: Faisal Starts Visit to Cairo For Discussions With Saciat
description: CAIRO JUNE 19  King Faisal of Saudi Arabia arrived in Cairo today for a sevenday visit that will include talks with President Anwar elSadat on political problems facing the Persian Gulf sheikdoms as a rewait of a British withdrawal from the region this year.

title: F.T.C. INVESTIGATES POOL SALES HERE
description: The regional director of the Federal Trade Commission announced yesterday that his office here was looking into possibly deceptive swimmingpool advertising and sales techniques in the metropolitan area.

title: The Last Word: Beside the Bell Jar
description: On February 11, 1963, a 30yearold American poet separated from her husband and living with her children in a cold London flat, gassed herself and passed into myth. Eight months later ten of her last poems, written at a speed of two or three a day, written, she said, at about four in the morning. that still blue, almost eternal hour before the baby's cry before the glassy music of the milkman, settling his bottles, appeared on two pages of Encounter magazine and caused sensation. In 1965 her husband brought out a posthumous collection, Arid. Two more are on the way.

title: MRS. H. L. GANTVOORT
description: Mrs. Mary Gretchen Morris Gantvoort, a former dramatic soprano in concert, oratorio and opera, died Friday in Leroy Hospital. She was 78 years old and lived at 25024 Road, Little Neck, Queens.

title: DISTRICT OARSMEN IN PANAM TRIALS
description: Oarsmen from the Metropolitan area will compete in three regattas next weekend.

title: DOCTORS SEE HOPE IN A NEW TB DRUG
description: After an eightmonth clinical trial doctors at the Harlem Hospital Center have reported that they had had more success with a new drug, rifampin, in the treatment of tuberculosis than with any other drug in the last 20 years.

title: Weissbuch ReElected
description: The Eastern Professional Tennis Association has reelected Bill Weissbuch as president. Charles Lundgreen was chosen first vice president, George Bacso second vice president, Hank Fenton treasurer and Bruce Funk secretary.

title: R. F. Bloomfield Marries Miss Hofmann
description: RYE, N. Y., June 19Miss Mary E. Hofmann, daughter of Mrs. Herbert A. Hofmann and the late Mr. Hofmann, who was president of Loew's Hotels, was married here this afternoon to Robert Franklin Bloomfield, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lionel N. Bloomfield.

title: An End to Ballyhoo...
description: The national political convention, like the state fair and the World Series, is a native American ceremonial. Its constituent elements have entered the folklore and the languagethe keynote speaker, the call of the roll of the states, the favorite son, the dark horse, the spontaneous demonstration of grown men and women funny hats shuffling through the aisles as the grand organ booms, the interminable speeches of the obscure and the notorious seeking to vie with the famous, the arrival of the nominee and his acceptance speech.

title: Television
description: THE performing arts on television are a problem. The experience of a live performance cannot be duplicated by simply setting up a camera in the theater and letting it roll. Obviously, special techniques are required, and then too much tends to get lost in translation.

title: Public outrage and private injustice
description: America is a psychopolitical circus, a surreal arena where private aches slide into social protest,, everyone politicizes his gripes and people keep turning into factions. Proceedings of the Rabble, Mark Mirsky's second novel, is a vision of the nation on parade, smartly waving banners for racial harmony and a clean environment. But Mirsky's Americans march into the wildest territories of the self, those psychic arenas where noble causes die.

title: Reader's Report
description: A bit of a mishmash thisin the classic Fanny Hurst manneron the estrangement of parents from children. (For those who have read Fanny Hurst, no further clarification is necessary. For those who haven't, none is possible.) Bigtime criminal lawyer Marvin Hirsch has to defend a pretty middleclass ghoul named Buffie Cameron against the charge of having murdered an elderly widow. Motive: robbery. The kicker here is that Buffie was just as alienated from her own folks in Idaho as Counselor Hirsch is from his son Jonathan, the kind of kid who will walk out on a seder to visit Bethesda Fountain. Now, how about that?

title: Article 3  No Title
description: OMAHA, June 19 (AP)Action Getter, a 4yearold chestnut colt owned by E. V. Benjamin 3d and J. J. Bones Jr., of New Orleans, won the $56,425 Cornhusker Handicap at AkSarBen today.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThere is an AliceinWonderland quality about the hearings before the Senate Banking Committee on the Government's plan to try to rescue the nearbankrupt Lockheed Aircraft Corporation. The Administration wants Congress to approve a guarantee for $250million in bank loans to Lockheed so that the company can meet its payroll and pay other bills until money starts coming in from the sale of its Tristar airbus.

title: 2 Army Coaches Among Entrants In Service Meet
description: Two assistant fencing coaches at the United States Military Academy will compete in the Championship of the Conseil Internationale du Sport Militaire, an international organization of athletes in military service, starting Friday in Ljungbyhed, Sweden.

title: MESKILL TO VETO FISCAL PACKAGE
description: HARTFORD, June 19Gov, Thomas J. Meskill said today that he would veto the latest Democratic financial package, heightening the chances, that Connecticut would be forced to operate without a budget at the end of this month.

title: Slight Increase in U. S. Travel to Europe Expected This Year Despite Recession
description: Travel experts expect lingering psychological effects of the 1970 recession to limit expansion of transAtlantic travel this year to about 5 or 6 per cent, one of the smallest gains in a decade.

title: The Commercial Atom: Unfulfilled Hopes
description: In an address dedicating a Radiation Machinery Company nuclear facility two years ago, the Atomic Energy Commission's chairman, Dr. Glenn T. Seaborg, hailed it as a milestone in the commercialization of woodplastic technology. He referred to the plant as impressive and as a noteworthy symbol of those industrial facilities that make use of the peaceful atom.

title: Globetrotters Will Play In Monticello on July 13
description: The Harlem Globetrotters will appear at Monticello, N. Y., against the New Jersey Reds on July 13 in a benefit performance for the United States Olympic basketball team.

title: Swedes Hire ExN.H.L. Man
description: STOCKHOLM, June 19 (UPI)  The Swedish Ice Hockey Association said today that Bill Harris, a former National Hockey League player, had signed as the Swedish National team coach and manager Harris played for the Toronto Maple Leafs and later established a hockey school for junior players.

title: Al Unser Leads Balloting for Driverof Year Award
description: Al Unser of Albuquerque, N. M., the winner of the Indianapolis 500 and the Milwaukee 150.mile races on successive weekends, has been voted top man in the second phase of the 1971 Martini & Rossi driver of the year award contest. He received a majority of ballots cast by a blueribbon panel of the nation's automotive sports writers.

title: Murchisons Thrive on Anonymity
description: DALLASIf one picks up the telephone here and dials the Dallas Cowboys football team, an operator will answer brightly, Good morning, Dallas Cowboys.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Kathy Gelb and Dana de Windt, 71 Graduates of Bradley, Wed
description: CLEVELAND, June 19Miss Kathy Lee Gelb and Dana de Windt were married here this evening by Rabbi Myron Silverman in the Suburban Temple in Beachwood.

title: Mullaney Well Sought After
description: (UPI)  Joe Mullaney, deposed coach of the Los Angeles Lakers, said today he was considering coaching offers from the Utah Stars and Kentucky Colonels of the American Basketball Association and from some colleges.

title: A.DA. to Oversee Conventions in 72 For Fair Process
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 Americans for Democratic Action announced today the formation of a study group to oversee democratic processes in the 1972 nominating conventions.

title: CATHOLICS DISPERSED AT BELFAST PARADE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Juns 19 (Reuters)  British troops today opened fire with rubber bullets on a crowd of 400 Roman Catholics who tried to storm barricades separating them from a Protestant parade. An Army spokesmen said the crowd had been dispersed without serious incident.

title: L. I. Mycophagist Looks Hard for Dinner
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., June 19Mrs. Margaret Morris IS a mycophagist.

title: Moscow Road
description: To the Editor:

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: SIMONS, AN AMATEUR, LEADS U. S. OPEN BY 2 STROKES;
BUSINESS LETTER
description: Summer rally, anyone?

title: Suffolk to Buy Montauk Tract, but Rejects Others
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., June 19 The Suffolk County LegislaH ture approved acquisition this week of 1,240 acres in Montauk for a new park, but voted against purchasing four other large tracts for conservation and future parks. The Montauk tract will cost $4million.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Books: Housing
description: More and more the American landscape is dotted with a new type of clustered housing called the condominium. Some look like town houses; some resemble apartments. Generally, home seekers have found them easier to finance than cooperatives because of a subtle legal difference.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  For several years now, the mayors of the nation's major cities have met in a misery loves company atmosphere and turned out litany of despair about the urban crisis and a flock of high in the sky resolutions for more Federal assistance.

title: Dorothy Reynolds Bride Of Thomas Brotherton
description: RICHMOND, June 19Miss Dorothy Harrison Reynolds, daughter of David Parham Reynolds, executive vice president and general manager of the Reynolds Metal Company, and Mrs. Reynolds was married here this afternoon to Thomas Kemper Brotherton Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Brotherton of Charleston, W. Va.

title: Headliners
description: I've been a saloon singer all my life and it's appropriate that started quietly and I end quietly. It was Frank Sinatra speaking a charity performance in Los Angeles last week and, for those who disbelieved his April announcement of retirement, he added, Yes, I'm serious about my decision. Then, with feet apart and head tilted, the old crooner ran through a medley of his past hits, including one that seemed to sum up his glittering, though sometimes stormy, 30year career: The record shows... I took the blows... and did my way. Wild applause and final curtain for the man whom many in showbiz still call the chairman of the board. Mr. Sinatra, now 55, says he wants to do some writing and teaching and meet some girls and build a house some place.

title: EAST GERMANS SAID TO HARASS U.S. BOAT
description: BOSTON, June 19 (AP)An East German fishing vessel repeatedly harassed a Gloucester fishing boat this afternoon, the Coast Guard reported.

title: Nuptials Held for Miss Wickenden
description: MARION, Mass., June 19In the Wickenden Chapel at the Tabor Academy here this afternoon, Miss Meredith Wickenden, daughter of James W. Wickenden, headmaster of the academy, and Mrs. Wickenden, was married to Marshall Edwin Birkins Jr., a Tabor alumnus and son of Mr. and Mrs. Birkins of Glen Head, L. I. The Episcopal ceremony was performed by the Rev. Charles D. Lake, brotherinlaw of the bride.

title: Handicapped Artist Hailed
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) Mary Kathleen McGraw of Cleveland, an artist was named handicapped Professional Woman of the Year today by the President's committeae on Employment of the Handicapped and the Pilot Club International. Miss McGraw, who has been paralyzed by polio since the was a child, is director of an art studio at Highland View Hospital, a Cleveland rehabilitation center.

title: The dream worlds we make to hide in
description: It is well past time we claimed this mad transplanted Englishman as ours. With his new novel Paul West calls due the debt, and we are welchers indeed if we respond with less than applause  prolonged, amazed applause. If West's earlier novels published here (Alley Jaggers, I'm Expecting to Live Quite Soon) were lovely lessons to the reader in how to see and feel, Caliban's Filibuster offers the Ph.D. in passionate intellection; if the earlier books were lessons to the writer in how to be funny, vicious, cold as frozen snake, loving as a mother, all in the most controlled lyrical prose, then Caliban's Filibuster is quite plainly something like a master craftsman's masterpiece.

title: Stream Arouses Kentucky Mine Fight
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., June 19One of the few virgin streams in eastern Kentucky is the subject of a major struggle involving conservationists, the University of Kentucky, the state government, the courts and private coal stripmining interests.

title: Green thoughts in a green shade
description: Asparagus come to us from the garden in the form of spears, stiff and fibrous. Artichokes surround their fleshy hearts with palisades of sharp, leathery leaves. It remains for the cook cut and steam these armored vegetables into submission. For soups, the cook scrapes, macerates, blends and strains them down to their essence. This is hard work, especially for this artichoke pure. But all that toil produces the purest texture and taste. It annihilates formand leaves, in the poet Andrew Marvell's phrase, a green thought in a green shade.

title: Education; Black Colleges:; Should I Throw In the Towel?
description: I am asking as a black college presidentIs there conspiracy in America to allow black higher education to starve, to be murdered, burled and forgotten? Should I throw in the towel?

title: Criminals At Large
description: In any mystery story by Ellery Queen, the ingenuity of the plot is the thing. Every Queen book is built around a puzzleoften an unbelievable puzzle in an impossible situation, to be surebut all of us gladly play the game. Ellery's puzzles are fun to unravel, and that alone kept the two authors, Frederic Dannay and Manfred B. Lee (Lee, alas, died last April), in business for many years. For certainly the writing hasn't.

title: ROCKEFELLER SIGNS BILL ON NARCOTICS
description: ALBANY, June 19Governor Rockefeller announced today that he had given final approval to the establishment of court units to deal exclusively with felony narcotics cases in New York City.

title: Nixon Plan Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) Representative John B. Anderson of Illinois, chairman of the House Republican Conference, today described President Nixon's revenuesharing proposal as unfair to lowincome communities and said he would propose a compromise measure on Monday.

title: BIG SHINTO SHRINE FACING PROBLEMS
description: ISE, Japan, June 14Ise is the heart's home of every Japanese. The high priest searched for words as he tried to define the meaning of the Grand Shrine at Ise to the ordinary Japanese.

title: Yale Names 2 Women, One a Black Lawyer, to Board of Trustees
description: NEW HAVEN, June 19Yale University announced today the election of two women one of them blackas the first female members of the Yale Corporation since the university's founding 270 years ago.

title: Nuptials Held for Susan Howard
description: RYE, N. Y., June 19The marriage of Miss Susan Reynolds Howard to Edwin Bradley Bruce 2d took place in the Rye Presbyterian Church this afternoon. The Rev. Dr. Joseph P. Bishop performed the ceremony.

title: Angels Turn Back Royals
NEGRO PRESS WINS PRAISE AT PARLEY
description: ATLANTA, June 19Mayor Carl B. Stokes of Cleveland has told a national organization of black newspaper publishers that the most fundamental factor in the development of my career as a young politician was The Cleveland Call and Post, a black weekly.

title: Poland Under Gierek
description: A halfyear after the disturbances that ended Wladyslaw Gomulka's political career and brought Edward Gierek to the fore, Poland gives the impression of a country in a stage of arrested development.

title: Ford Madox Ford
description: To the Editor:

title: Jane Parker Is Wed To Mitchell Maslin
description: Miss Jane Parker and Mitchell Maslin were married last night in the Terrace Room of the Plaza by Rabbi Ronald Sobel.

title: Bridge
description: FOR the connoisseur of bridge hands, finding a deal with unique quality is a rare event. But the one shown in the diagram seems to represent a firstandonly in four different ways.

title: He never succeeded at success
description: In July, 1896, William Jennings Bryan, 36 years old, unregarded former Congressman (two terms) from Nebraska gave a speech to the Democratic Convention in Chicago which ended with some of the most famous sentences in American political literature. When he spoke, with appropriate gestures, of the crown of thorns and the cross of gold, he brought down the houseas he thought he probably would. Forthwith he was nominated by the party for the Presidency of the United States. Coming from nowhere he became, in a moment of time, a reasonably wellfixed star in our political firmament and so remained for the rest of his lifea peerless leader, the Great Commoner.

title: The kreuzers Have Son
description: TRUMBULL, Conn., June 19A son was born on June 7 to Mr. and Mrs. Justin L. Kreuzer in the Bridgeport Hospital. Mrs. Kreuzer, the former Miss Brenda Furman, is a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Matthew R. Furman of New York, where Dr. Furman practices internal medicine.

title: Vincent Takes Senior Title
description: In a match that lasted nearly four hours. Tony Vincent defeated Al Doyle, 7.6, 4.6, 64, for the Eastern senior claycourt tennis championship at the New York Tennis Club in the Bronx yesterday. Cal MacCracken and Vic Elmaleh won the doubles from Tont Hirsh and Dave Ross, 63, 64.

title: Public Members Join Swedish Bank Boards
description: STOCKHOLM  Anyone who is enthusiastic about, or fearful of; the idea of placing public members on corporate boards of directors can draw encouragement from the twomonthold Swedish system of requiring such members on commercial bank boards.

title: LE GRAND STEEPLE DRAWS TOP FIELD
description: PARIS, June 19  Fifteen top steeplechasers are expected to go to the starting line tomorrow for the $150,000 Grand Steeplechase De Paris, the richest and perhaps toughest race for jumpers in the world.

title: Miss Toppin Has Nuptials
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., June 19  Miss Elizabeth Livingston Toppin and Morris Woodruff Kellogg were married this afternoon in the Universalist Church by the Rev. Dr. Wallace Grant Fiske.

title: Stamps
description: TWO newrate international postal cards had their firstday sale in New York on June 10, each a revision of an earlier postal card and each concerned with America as a vacationland and a place to visit. The New York first day was linked to a West Berlin stamp show, LUPOSTA, at which the American Moon Landing exhibit, first shown at Philympia, the 1970 London international stamp show, was on display. Both New York firstday cancellations and postal cards with LUPOSTA cancellations are available from Postmaster, New York, N. Y. 10001. Instructions on how to obtain the cards are given below.

title: BEEMAN CAPTURES ETCHELLS22 SAIL
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 19John Beeman's Cool Zephyr captured Etchells22 Class honors today as 60 boats sailed with the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club in the Cow Bay, area, Long Island Sound Y.R.A. competition.

title: Sniper Fire and Bombings Erupt As Jacksonville Strife Persists
description: JACKSONVILE, Fla., June 19 (UPI)Sniper fire and firebombings erupted again in this racially tense seaport tonight after. the funeral Dr a slain Negro youth whose death trigIgered four nights of violence, resulting in 274 arrests and I$350,000 in property damage.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: MAJOR BANKS held to their 5 per cent prime rate, despite a move by First Pennsylvania to 5% per cent and the Bank of California to 6 per cent.... An S.E.C. exacainer recommended that Arthur Lipper 3d and the brokerage firm that bears his name be suspended from the securities business for a year, as a result of transactions they conducted for I.O.S.

title: Maye Is Reelected To Head Firemen, Defeating 3 Rivals
description: Michael J. Maye was elected yesterday to a second twoyear term as president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association.

title: TVCOMPUTER AID TO BUYERS IS SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, June 19A national computer system providing consumers with quick, cheap information on products by cable television was proposed today by a group of consumer advocates and computer experts.

title: Germans, Beset by Auto, Give Mass Transit a Push
description: BONN, June 19West German city governments, worried by the automobile and its effect on urban life, hope to give new life to public transport.

description: To THE EDITOR:

description: To the Editor:

title: Politically Active U.A.W. Aide Faces Ouster Drive
description: LOS ANGELES, June 19Rank and file disenchantment with the political liberalism of the United Automobile Workers is threatening the leadership of the union's Western regional director.

title: Shelley Hamlin, on 76, Wins Women's College Golf Title
description: ATHENS, Ga., June 19 CAP)Shelley Hamlin of Stanford took the lead on the ninth hole today and went on to win the women's national intercollegiate golf championship.

title: Janet Eberlin Is Bride
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., June 19Miss Janet Eberlin was married here at noon today to Daniel Lawrence Thomson. Msgr. Thomas S. Moriarty performed the ceremony and celebrated the nutial mass in Holy Family Roman Catholic Church, Mr. and Mrs. Monroe M. Eberlin of New Rochelle are the bride's parents, and Mr. and Mrs. Daniel W. Thomson of Scarsdale, the bridegroom's parents. Mr. Eberlin is a principal in the firm of Eberlin & Eberlin, consulting engineers in New York, and the bridegroom's father is president of D. W. Thomson, Inc., paving contractors in Larchmonth.

title: Miss Pennink Married on L.I.
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., June 12Miss Suzanne Moore Pennink, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Karel B. Pennink of New York, was married hem this afternoon to Bruce Clinton Ream, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Marshall Ream Jr. of New Canaan, Conn,

title: The Traveling Salesman, an American Image
description: WRENS, Ga.  Although there are days when he regards his vocation as the world's most rewarding, there are nights when A. G. Moore wonders why he ever became a traveling salesmanand his thoughts trouble him.

title: Ruling Appealed in Mississippi In Fight for OneMan Districts
description: JACKSON, Miss., June 19 Civil rights lawyers are seeking to overturn a ruling by threejudge Federal court here this week that Hinds County should proceed with a large election of legislators this year instead of using singlemember districts.

title: Miss Goldman Victor
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., June 19 Barbara Goldman of Fort Lee and Pat Shoolman of Fairport, N. Y., captured singles titles in the New Jersey girls tennis tournament yesterday at the Englewood Field Club. Miss Goldman defeated Cindy Sutter of Greenwich, Conn., 62, 63, for the 16yearsandunder title. Miss Shoolman won the 14's final from Linda Siegelman of Roslyn Heights, Queens, by the same scores.

title: Floating Lab Analyzes Pollution in Wantagh Basin
description: WANTAGH, L. I., June 19  It looks like a spy ship. Equipped with two 225horsepower engines, field monocular and binocular microscopes, gassampling devices and temperature and saline recording gadgets, the 27foot blueandwhite former police patrol boat can be seen most weekdays In the dark waters of the Wantagh Marina Basin.

title: SECRECY BACKED
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 19 The White House asserted today that one compelling reason for its vigorous legal action against The New York Times and The. Washington Post was its belief that the Government cannot operate its foreign policy in the best interests of the American people if it cannot deal with foreign powers in a confidential way.

title: Briton's Stable Is No. 1 in Jump Races
description: If Jonathan Sheppard had become a trainer in England and dared to complain to the handicapper about weights assigned to his horses, there would have been a family argument. Instead, he came to the United States, where he can complain as loud and as long as he wants. In England it was different. His father is the senior handicapper of that country's Jockey Club, ruling body of the turf.

title: Golf in Bermuda Is Pleasant Torture
description: THERE is one experience that can shatter the joy of golf in Bermuda. It is that first experience of putting on a genuine Bermuda grass green. For Bermuda grass is mean and spiteful in the extreme. It conforms to no natural law, and one's initial encounter with it is frustrating, tormenting, exasperating, humiliating and depressing (in roughly that order). You learn to putt on Bermuda greens in much the same way that tidal wave victims learn about water.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: EVANGELISTS MEET IN THE HOLY LAND
description: JERUSALEM,June 19More than 1,000 evangelical Christians from the United States and 31 other countries met in Jerusalem this week to proclaim their faith in the imminent second coming of Christ.

title: Bucks to Play A.B.A. Chaps
description: DALLAS, June 19 (UPI) The Texas Chaparrals of the American Basketball Association will meet the National Basketball Association champions, the Milwaukee Bucks, Sept. 21 in a preseason game here.

title: The Nation
description: For the last several years, Southerners have been complaining bitterly that the courts, the Federal Government and the laws have been forcing them to integrate their schools while doing nothing about continued segregation of Northern schools. Last week, figures released by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare gave the South new ammunition to bolster its arguments.

title: Union at Yale Ratifies Pact, Ending a 51Day Walkout
description: NEW HAVEN, June 19 Service employes overwhelmingly ratified a contract with Yale University today, ending a 51day strikethe longest in Yale's history.

title: William Dean Howells
description: I am comparatively a dead cult with my statues cut down and the grass growing over me in the pale moonlight, William Dean Howells remarked near the end of his long career, and this selfdisparaging estimate has proven to be sadly prophetic. Fifty years after his death, Howells is held in that affectionate contempt which America reserves for its men of letters: he is the exclusive property of academics. Perhaps unfairly, he has become a charming avuncular figure, a synonym for cultural mildness, a fixture of American literary history. Our condescension is undisguised: we acknowledge Howells's influence, catalogue his virtues, his good workhis generous sponsorship of Frank Norris and Stephen Crane, among countless other writers but deny him resonance.

title: Mary Carroll Bride Of Jonathan M. Ray
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., June 19  Miss Mary Ely Carroll and Jonathan Matthew Ray were married here this afternoon by the Rev. Phil Porter Jr. in St. Mark's Episcopal Church.

title: The Death He Foresaw Comes to a G.I.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam June 19 (UPI)  It was not yet dawn, but the 20yearold G.I. was already awake, apprehensive lest a particular morning had come It was recalled later that he had been saying for several weeks that he woke up each morning thinking it was his last.

title: Aide Says Nixon Tax Talk Left Incorrect Impression
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 19The White House acknowledged today that President Nixon left a misleading impression yesterday when he said that enactment of his general revenuesharing plan by Congress would, in time, lead to reduction of 30 per cent in local property taxes.

title: Letters on War Documents
description: To the Editor:

title: PANEL WILL RULE
description: United States District Judge Murray I. Gurfein refused yesterday to enjoin The New York Times from publishing further articles based upon a secret Pentagon study of the origins of the Vietnam war.

title: WISCONSIN V.F.W. OUSTS PEACE POST
description: MADISON, Wis. June 19 A local Veterans of Foreign Wars Post has been suspended for conducting activities against the Vietnam war. Its officers say they will wage court fight against the suspension.

title: DONDE TOPS CLASS IN IRA. REGATTA
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 19William E. John Jr. gained his third International Class victory of the season, and second straight, with Donde today in the season's 10th Yacht Racing Association championship regatta, conducted by Sheldrake Yacht Club.

title: The Nation
description: PUBLIC: Q. Mr. President... Representative Laird of Wisconsin declared that the Administration is preparing to move the Vietnam war into the North. Is there any substance to this claim?

title: Reader's Report
description: The melodramatic and sinister overtones of carnival life are played out once again in this pulpstyle chiller. The geek bites the heads off snakes and chickens; the skill games are all rigged; and the peep shows get away with murder The final huggermugger seems anoptional postscript to the wprkaday details of carnival operation that are the novel's edifying mainstay.

title: Cubs Rout Cards, 71
Matto Grosso II Scores by a Neck in $40,600 Longfellow on Monmouth Grass
MOYER OUTPOINTS ARGENTINE RIVAL
description: STATELINE, Nev., June 19 (AP)Denny Moyer utilized his experience to pound out a unanimous 12round decision tonight over Jose Chirino of Argentina.

title: U.S. Suit Over an Integrated Housing Project Distresses a Suburb of St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, June 19By the dinner hour, nearly everybody in suburban Blackjack had heard the news, but few were happy about it,

title: It Meant a Pay Loss, but They Married Their Bosses Anyway
description: WASHINGTONOnce Lola Pierotti earned $24,000 a year and worked long hours as an administrative assistant on Capitol Hill. Now she works longer hours and has even more responsibility but no pay. What happened? Was she demoted? No, she just married the boss.

title: Coins
description: The Republic of Liberia, the oldest African democracy, will issue frosted proof coin sets for the first time this year. These specimens will be struck at the United States Mint. The relief of the monies will have a soft finish and an attractive background of mirrorlike luster.

title: Russian Finds Youth Scorns Blue Collar
description: MOSCOW, June 19A Leningrad industrialist complained today that although the working class was described as the leading force in Soviet society, most young people felt their lives were ruined if they had to become workers.

title: Education Group Elects
description: John W. Saunders, a member of the City Board of Education's committee on accountability and president of the Coalition for Political Representation, a black political organizaton in Southeast Queens, has been elected chairman of the board of trustees of the Public Education Association. The association is a nonprofit citizens organization devoted to the betterment of education.

title: IN THE NATION
description: On Sept. 28, 1964, campaigning hard against Barry Goldwater, President Lyndon B. Johnson told an audience at Manchester, N. H.:

title: Foreign Notes
description: To house a colossal gold and ivory statue of the goddess Athena, the ancient Greeks in 447 B.C. began construction of a temple on the Acropolis. By the time the building, the Parthenon, was finished many years later, it was regarded as perhaps the finest Doric temple of all.

title: Stars Sign Robbins, Combs
description: SALT LAKE CITY, June 19 (UPI)  Austin (Red) Robbins and Glen Combs, two of the starters in the Utah Stars drive for the American Basketball Association championship, signed today for the 197172 season.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Talk of wage and price controls, or at least of some additional form of governmental restraint on inflation, has revived with the reviving economy. There are a number of reasons.

title: the traveler's world
description: WAYCROSS, Ga.Rare indeed is the longsought attraction in the world of nature, tourism or theater that outruns its press clippings, and fortunate is the traveler who catches up with one of these rarities. Extra huzzahs, therefore, for Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge, a treasure of, the United States Government, and for Okefenokee Swamp Park, the creation of the people of nearby Waycross on 1,200 acres leased from the state of Georgia with the approval of the Federal Government. Everything they say about Okefenokee Swamp Park, tucked into the wildlife refuge at the northern tip of the great swamp, is true, except that when you get into the swamp and are surrounded by trees and water and 210 varieties Of birds and all kinds of croaking frogs and exotic plants, the reality proves more beautiful and exciting than the anticipation.

title: Wilson Elected Captain
description: Howie (Bud) Wilson of Pacific Palisades, Calif., has been elected captain of the 197172 Harvard track and field team. He is a sprinter.

title: LIGHT AIR DELAYS ANNAPOLIS START
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., June 19Light air and a foul current played havoc with the smaller boats today as the biennial Annapolis to Newport (R.I.) yacht race started with a fleet of 91.

title: Miss Nancy Brooks Mortimer Is Bride of J. R. Peter Wilson
description: SPRINGLAKE, N. J., June 19Miss Nancy Brooks Mortimer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Greenough Mortimer Jr. of Upper Montclair, was married here today to J. R. Peter Wilson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank P. Wilson of Franklin Lakes.

title: Marilene ViannaRibeiro Is Wed to Axel de Tristan
description: WASHINGTON, June 19In the Georgetown University Chapel here this afternoon, Miss Marilene ViennaRibeiro, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Amara Ribeiro of Rio de Janeiro, was married to Axel de Tristan, a 1964 graduate of the university's School of Foreign Service and son of Count Marc de Tristan of San Mateo, Calif., and the late Countess de Tristan, the former Jane Christenson.

title: Twist the Axe Wins
description: CLEVELAND, June 19 (AP)  Twist the Axe beat Spotted Kid by a nose today to win the $57,500 Ohio Derby at Thistledown.

title: Reader's Report
description: I Love You Truly on the living room piano, Japanese lanterns on the front porch, a Packard roadster in the garage, Fourth of July fireworks on the lawnand the scent of nostalgia heavy in the air. Lester Atwell's !impeccably blended essence of suburbia in the 1930's is part of the atmosphere in which there unfolds a story of growing up that touches on such universals as ingratitude, cupidity, love and betrayal. It gradually dawns on the reader as he is swept along by Mr. Atwell's novel that the author is sensitive to his characters without being sentimental about them. Paul Forrest, an orphan of high school age, leaves Detroit to live With a houseful of relatives in lower Westchester, a family of losers who have the high visibility of the Nolans of A Tree Grows in Brooklyn.

title: Letters on War Documents
description: To the Editor:

title: An art to bring awareness to the desperate everywhere
description: If AfroAmerican literature should take a sharp turn toward strictly racial themes, wrote Richard Wright, we will know that blacks are suffering old and ancient agonies at the hands of white Americans. If, on the other hand, AfroAmerican literature turns toward the common themes and burdens of literary expression which are the heritage of all men, we can assume that a humane attitude dominates American racial relationships. The assumption that the function of AfroAmerican literature is to educate white Americans, change white attitudes and shape white opinion is central to this argument in particular and to Wright's literary credo in general.

title: Evelyn D. Stern Is Wed
description: Miss Evelyn Diane Stern, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Kurt Stern of Fort Lee, N. J., was married yesterday to Warren Silver, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alex Silver of Presque Isle, Me. Rabbi Stephen Schfer performed the ceremony at the Essex House. The bride is a summa cum Laurie graduate of Jackson College of Tufts University and received a master's degree from the Harvard graduate school of education. The bridegroom, a graduate of Tufts University, attends the Washington College of Law at American University.

description: Three 25yearold men, including an English teacher at Public School 232, were arraigned in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of manufacturing and possessing quantities of amphetamines.

description: ROCHESTER, N. Y. (AP)Rochester's third baseman, Mike Ferraro, selected for the fourth straight year, heads the 1971 International Baseball League's All Star team, anInounced yesterday by George Sister Jr., president.

title: Vehicles Crossing Nassau Line Reach Total of a Million Daily
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 19It may not come as any great surprise to the harried Nassau County motorist, but it was disclosed this week that for the first time more than one million vehicles cross the county's borders daily.

title: Edward T. Ragsdale, 74, Dead; Former Vice President of Buick
description: FLINT, Mich., June 19 (AP)  Edward T. Ragsdale, former general manager of the Buick division of General Motors Corporation, died yesterday of heart attack at his home in Sarasota, Fla. He was 74 years old.

description: YONKERS, June 19Fresh Yankee, unhurried through a 1:03 1/5 first half, easily won tonight's $25,000 Volomite Trot before 25,454 fans at Yonkers Raceway.

description: FORT MONROE, Va., June 19 (AP)The Army has announced that it has dismissed war crimes charges brought against retired Lieut. Gen. Jonathan 0. Seaman by a young lieutenant who has since left the service as a conscientious objector,

title: Bomb Threat Delays Jet
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., June 19 (AP)An Eastern Airlines 727 hound from Miami to New York was delayed at Palm Beach International Airport tonight after company officials in Miami had received a telephoned report that a bomb was on hoard, a spokesman said. No bomb was found.

title: 15 Biggest Spenders Lost in House Races in the State
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 Outspending your political opponents on radio and television campaign advertising still does not assure an election victory, a Federal Communications Commission survey of New York Congressional races has indicated.

title: Less Rich Vie With Very Rich On Boards
description: I bet they did some soulsearching before they asked me, said Harold Weill, the outspoken lawyer who is usually identified as the executor of the Helena Rubinstein estate and director of the foundation bearing the cosmetic queen's name.

title: Science/Medicine
description: The first recorded birth last week of nontuplets (nine babies) to an Australian woman who had taken fertilityinducing drugs has once again thrown the spotlight on the promise and potential hazards of these miracle medications.

title: Outlook Bleak for Apartments on L. I.
description: Nassau and Suffolk Counties will need at least 128,000 new apartments by 1985, warns the NassauSuffolk Regional Planning Board. But Long Island's chances of producing what would amount to a 150 per cent increase in apartment dwellings to serve its expanding population in the next 15 years are extremely slim.

title: Eschatology and the apocalypse may be clues
description: In the spring of 1635 Richard Mather left England forever. The son of a poor yeoman, he had already risen first to schoolmaster, then minister in a small Lancashire town. But in Massachusetts he won lasting fame as the founder of a preeminent theological dynasty. Richard's son, Increase Mather (16391723) became pastor of Boston's Old North Church and President of Harvard College; he was the Bay Colony's agent in England from 1688 to 1692, where he secured Massachusetts second charter, then returned in time to play a role in the Salem witch crisis.

title: Eric Redman Weds Anne Mueller
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., June 19  Miss Anne Mygatt Mueller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl M. Mueller of Ridgewood and Nantucket, Mass., was married here this afternoon to Eric Redman, son of Mr. and Mrs. M. Chandler Redman of Seattle.

title: SERVICE SCHOOLS FIND MANY APPLY
description: WASHINGTON, June 19De spite the antiwar and antimili tary sentiments that have spread among the nation's youth, total applications from young men for the three service academies are at a peak.

title: Servicemen in Hospital Earn Diplomas in Bed
description: Many young servicemen who are confined in St. Al bans Naval Hospital in Queens, some of them wounded in Vietnam, are studying for high school degrees In what may be the country's most extensive bedside educational program.

title: White Sox Farm Out Eddy
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 19 (AP) The Chicago White Sox optioned Don Eddy, pitcher, to their Tucson team in the Pacific Coast League today to make room for Stan Perzanowski, recalled from Asheville yesterday with an 110 wonlost record in the Dixie Association.

title: CORNELL VICTOR IN I.R.A. REGATTA
description: SYRACUSE, June 19  Cornell's varsity crew won the national championship today by stealth, stamina and skills newly acquired. The Big Red eight, which had lost six of its eight prior races this season, sneaked up on the known powers like Washington, Navy and Pennsylvania, which ignored this crew in their planning for the sixboat final on Onondaga Lake this afternoon.

title: Recording
TWINS 21 VICTORS OVER WHITE SOX
Ever Do a DoubleTake?
description: ALL good performers know how to do doubletakes. Is it the mark of a truly superior performer that he knows how to make the audience do a doubletake? I've been thinking back over the doubletakes I've done during the season, some of them at actors whose work and personalities I thought I Anew through and through, some of them during performances that were likely to he the last performances that particular show ever played. You do snap to in the oddest circumstances.

title: Dog Fanciers Club Plans Trips to 3 Shows Abroad

title: The World
description: However strongly the leaders of Italy's center and left political parties protest, the importance of the country's local elections last weekRome province, Sicily and major southern towns swung sharply to the rightis such as to make necessary a thorough reappraisal of positions, alliances and alignments. This won't be agonizing since politics in Italy is no longer a contest of ideologies, merely a realistic juggling of forces.

title: VaticanMadrid Tension Is Renewed
description: MADRID, June 19The appointment of the Archbishop of Toledo to administer the newly vacant Archdiocese of Madrid has revived tensions between the Spanish Government and the Vatican.

title: Tentative Pact on School Plan Is Reached on Lower East Side
description: The City Parks Department and the Two Bridges community of the Lower East Side have agreed on a tentative solution to the neighborhood's long struggle to replace the aging and overcrowded Junior High School 65, at 46 Forsyth Street.

title: Stealing Cars Is a Growth Industry
description: AT exactly 10:15 on a rainy morning this spring, a stockily built, shorthaired man wearing khaki slacks and an olive seersucker sport coat walked with a slight swagger into the long, busy cinderblock work bay of an auto body Shop, in an industrial section of Queens. He was followed by five more men wearing dirty work clothes. To the man in charge, Jamaican named Mike, he said, Good morning. I'm Lieutenant Deutcsh from the Auto Squad. Mind if we look arolund? Mike slumped in the shoulders and said he didn't mind. It was plain that he did.
