description: BOSTON, June 20James Ramsey Ullman, the writer and mountain climber, died today of cancer in University Hospi tal. He was 63 years old and lived here.

title: Arts Abroad
description: TEHERANThe main sub ject of conversation in Iran is the forthcoming International Cultural Festival at Persepolis. We have been at it for the past 13 years, an aide to the Minister of Court told a vis itor.

title: Medical Truancy
description: New York City is now suffering a largely needless epidemic of measles. It could at any time experience equally unnecessary cases of diphtheria, polio and other preventable infectious diseases. The reason is that tens of thousands of children in this city have never had a full series of routine immunizations.

title: REBELS IN CHAD KILL 2 FRENCH SOLDIERS
description: FORT LAMY, Chad, June 20 (AP)Two more French sol diers have been killed in this vast landlocked African coun try. The deaths bring the un official toll to 34 French dead since the first French para troopers arrived in April, 1969, under a mutual defense treaty.

description: PITTSBURGH, June 20Steel mills were trimming their 1971 estimates last week.

description: HOUSTON, June 20 (Reuters)  A group of Soviet space ex perts arrived here from Moscow tonight for a week's talks on space cooperation between the Soviet Union and the United States.

description: WASHINGTON, June 20A Government policy aimed at a rapid rise in output and early return to full employment will generate only a little more in flation than a more cautious policy, partkularly in the long run, a new study sponsored by the Brookings Institution has concluded.

title: Shop Talk
description: What de you do if you like to cook and have al ways dreamed of having your own shop? You get together with a group of likeminded pals and open a store full of the sort of cooking and serving things you'd like in your own kitchen. That's what five friends, all with jobs in advertis ing or fashion have done. Let Em Eat, an at tractive, white walled boutique at 335 East Ninth Street, is the collaboration of Art Barclay, a photographer, Chip Clark, a lawyer in ad vertising; Kathleen Scupp, a stylist; Emelie Tolley, a fashion director; and Edgar Watkins, a freelance writer who used to do public relations for architects.

description: MEXICO CITY, June 20The World's top silver producers the United States Mexico, Can ada, Peru and Australia have agreed that it is to the advan tage of producers and consum ers to have adequate and stable prices in silver.

description: MOSCOW, June 20 (Reuters) The three astronauts aboard Salyut, the Soviet, orbital space laboratry, took a day off from their research program today to relax While, their craft logged its 1,000th earth orbit, Tass, the soviet press agency, reported.

description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, June 20 (AP)  Thirty  three persons were killed and 24 injured In the collision of a bus and truck near Afyion in western Turkey today, the police said.

title: The Baltic Conquest
description: The people of the Baltic statesLithuania, Latvia and Estoniahave been recalling a sad anniversary. It was in midJune, of 1940 that the Soviet Government of that time, headed by Stalin and Molotov, sent ultimata these thenindependent nations, all of which had binding nonaggression pacts with the Soviet Union.

title: Better Care Is Urged, But Not More Doctors
description: CHICAGO, June 20 (AP) The nation needs a better system of delivering medical care, particularly in poor and rural areas, rather than more doctors, says a medical educator.

description: RollsRoyce, Inc., has an nounced that George W. Lewis, president and a director of the company, has been appointed to the RollsRoyce Motor Car Division of RollsRoyce Motors Ltd., England.

title: French Bird Defeats 48 Rivals In Trysail Race to Block Island
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., June 20French Bird, one of the smallest eligible yachts entered in the Storm Trysail Club's Block Island Race Week, won the American Yacht Club's feeder race today from 48 other boats, the largest of six feeder races to this small island in Long Island Sound.

title: Whose Wimbledon? Laver, Seeking 5th Title, Is Favored, But List of Challengers Is Imposing
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 20 Laver to win Wimble don, says the seedings, the record, the betting and com mon sense. But a niggling doubt assails the mind. The greatest player of his genera tion is topseeded, an even fav orite against the, field and is gunning for his fifth title here over the decade during which he has reigned supreme as amateur and pro.

title: End Racism, Mrs. King Asks
description: BOSTON, June 20 (UPI) Mrs. Coretta Scott King called today for an end to racism in the United States and for new priorities for a new world. Mrs. King, widow of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, said that until America removes the last remnants of racism, she forfeits her position in the vanguard of world leadership. She spoke at the commence ment exercises at Northeastern University after receiving an honorary doctor of laws degree.

title: Books of The Times
description: The Crusades were one of the most pe culiar convulsions in history. Thousands upon thousands of people who had never been more than a few miles from home, narrowminded, securityoriented men and women, sold their few belongings and set out to walk from France to Jerusalem. Their immediate motive was a religious enthusiasm whipped up by a few spell binders like Peter the Hermit, who may have been the greatest revivalist orator of all time. Behind this was poverty, the monotony of an endless work day, a life almost as confining as a prison. The Cru sades offered a holiday sponsored by God himself, a church picnic to Paradise. The pilgrims were motivated by anger too. All the frus trations or their cramped lives were channeled into moral indignation at the Infidel, who was said to stable his horses in the Christian churches of the Holy Land. For the more so phisticated classes, the Crusades were a gold rush, a means of joining Jesus and Mam mon in holy part nership. Knights and soldiers could hew and hack with God's blessing, could bathe in blood by day and absolution by night. Rape was regarded as a mere byproduct or overflow of religious ardor. In the name of the spirit, man could be as bestial as he pleased. And he was, according to Zo Oldenbourg. In telling her story from the point of view of the poor, she has given us a worm's eye view of history.

description: WASHINGTON, June 20The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

description: MOSCOW, June 20Twenty three officials of the United States Government and of oil and other business concerns left Moscow today for a five day visit to the oil fields in Western Siberia, the first time the Soviet Union has permitted Americans to inspect the rich ?? area.

title: Applications to the Peace Corps And VISTA Up After 5 Years
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) For the first time in five years, applications to join the PeaceCorps are on the upsurge.1 But apparently the tight job market has little to do with the trend reversal.

title: ?? Harlem Bottle Club Reported Going Strong
description: The illegal Harlem bottle club where one New York policeman allegedly held a wedding reception is still go ing strong, according to resi dents of the area.

title: PALAFOX REGISTERS A 60, 6.1 TRIUMPH
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 20Tony Palafox, the for mer Mexican Davis Cup player, began the defense of his East ern men's calycourt tennis title today by routing Dick Elstein of Roslyn, 60, 6.1, in the sec ond round at the Port Washing ton Tennis Academy, whets he is a teaching pro.

title: Mrs. Lucille Stern Wed
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 20Mrs. Lucille Klau Stern and Dr. Charles Carothers, both of Cincinnati, were married here this afternoon by Rabbi Daniel Wolk. The ceremony took place at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam Oppenheim, brotherin law and sister of the bride. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. David W. Klau of New York and the late Mr. Klau. Dr. Carothers is the son of Mrs. Walter Simone and the late Thomas Carothers of Cincinnati. The bridegroom, a physician, and his wife both have been previously married and divorced.

title: MENENDEZ TOLOSA, SPANISH MINISTER
description: MADRID, June 20 (Reuters) Lieut. Gen. Camilo Menendez Tolosa, Army Minister in Gen eralissimo Francisco Franco's Cabinet from 1964 to 1969, died here last night. His age was 72.

title: 200 Menace 2 Suspects After Patrolman Is Shot
description: Three plainclothes police men rescued two suspects, one of whom allegedly had shot and wounded a police man with the patrolman's own revolver, from an angry crowd of 200 in Queens early yesterday.

title: Mitchell Creates New Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced today the creation of the position of deputy assistant for consumer and interagency affairs. Bruce B. Wilson, head of the depart ments consumer affairs sec tion will be appoined to the post.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: ORFORD, England, June 20In Akenfield, his classic study of an English village, Ronald Blythe wrote that to those coming from the out side world Akenfield seems a holy place  a little arable kingdom where flints are the jewels.  Its very sounds are formal, hieratic: larks, clocks, bees, tractor hummings.

title: Bilingual Teachers Possible
description: The city's public school sys tem may place a corps of 54 bilingual teachers, recruited from schools in Puerto Rico, in elementary school positions this fall, the Board of Educa tion announced yesterday. The teachers, who were among 88 who took competitive examina tions in April in Puerto Rico, were eligible for appointment this fall, the board said.

title: Chess: Hubner Resignation in Play Against Petrosian a Puzzler
description: The quarterfinal candi dates' match played in Seville, Spain, between Tigran Petro sian of the Soviet Union, a former world champion, and Robert Hubner of West Ger many, a relative newcomer, would have attracted far more attention than it did if it had not been overshadowed by Bobby Fischer's doing in Vancouver.

title: Group to Study State Tax

He said the committee would review property tax proced ures and their effect on local taxing districts. Mr. Levitt, who will serve as chairman, said he expected the commit tee's findings ultimately to result in legislative proposals.

title: Disunity and Frustration Beset African Unity Parley
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, June 20William OforiAtta, Foreign Minister of Ghana, peered over his spectacles at his audience of fellow African diplomats and said: We know we are not serious. South Africa knows we are not seri ous, too.

description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 20 All over Latin America, the Japanese are coming. Bankers, traders, miners and manufac turers are moving into business and investment areas that until recently were the province of American or European, com panies.

title: The Classified Minds
description: CONWAY, Mass.I suppose I should take an ironical satisfaction in the attempt of the Attorney General to silence The Times, The Times having so recently silenced me. But I don't and can't. When a drama critic, or what passes for one, concocts a review to kill a play nothing is at issue but the worth of the play and the compe tence of the critic.

description: MALAGA, N.J., June 20 Frederick Storrier Jackson, proprietor of the Scotland Run Antique Shop here and a brother of the late Charles Jackson, the author of Lost Weekend, died Friday in Bridgeton Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived here. A brother, Herbert, survives.

description: HANOI, North Vietnam June 20 (Agence france. presse) North Vietnam and Rumania in a joint communiqu today Condemned the United, States for attempting to prolong, in tensity and extend the ?? in Indochina.

title: San Juan Fiesta Here Draws Throngs
description: With a tropical amalgam of the sacred and the secular, thousands of the city's Spanish speaking citizens celebrated the festival of San Juan Bautista on Randalls Island yesterday.

title: WEST 111100 VICTOR IN N.B.A.A.B.A. GAME
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 20 (AP) The West AllStars, led by Cazzie Russell, Earl Monroe, Jimmy Jones and Willie Wise, posted a 111100 victory over the East today in the first Mar tin Luther. King Jr. benefit bas ketball game involving players from the National and Ameri can Basketball Associations.

title: Rossellini Caps a Quest With Filming of Science
description: For more than a year Roberto Rossellini has been commuting between Rome and Houston. In Houston he has been working with scientists at Rice University on Science, a 10to12 hour film for television, which will deal with man's knowledge today about cos mology, biology, and tech nology. Mr. Rossellini just began shooting, beginning with the universe, but it will be another two years before he is finished. In the mean time, both science and Mr. Rossellini keep changing.

title: L.I. Woman Drowns in Lake
description: LAKE RONKONKOMA, L.I., June 20The body of Mrs. Carol Cunningham, 24 years old, of 168 West First Street here, was recovered by the police at about noon today 150 yards from a beach off Eastern Avenue. Mrs. Cunningham drowned when she and a friend decided to go for a swim in the lake last night, the police said. She swam out to deep water and disappeared.

title: Anniversaries
description: GLASSNappy 25th to MY PlxIe. It seems like Yesterday that we were joined. I love you.

title: Crafts by South Dakota's Elderly Poor
description: When George Whyte, a VISTA volunteer from Iowa, went around in three counties of South Dakota last fall, picking up forms from a man power survey, he could not help but notice how many of the lowincome elderly had hand skills.

title: Democratic Governors Pursue Unity
description: OMAHA, June 20In public, the words they used were united and useful, free wheeling discussions and meaningful and harmoni ous.

title: West Virginia Conservationists Challenging Strip Miners
description: CHARLESTOWN, W. Va., June 18New strategies to ar rest the scalping of the green hills of Appalachia by surface coal miners are being planned by conservationists in West Vir ginia.

title: SAM WEINTRAUB
description: ROSLYN, L. I., June 20Sam Weintraub, retired leather goods manufacturer, died yesterday of a heart attack at the home of his daughter, Mrs. Ida Kittay, 121 Tara Drive. He was 73 years old.

title: State Teachers' Union Votes for Unity
description: Delegates of the New York State Federation of Teachers voted yesterday to rename and restructure their union to be come a more vigorous and unit ed statewide organization for teachers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rohatyn Quits BigBoard Post, Urging Closer Watch
description: Wall Street's ability to ward off another financial crisis has been challenged by Felix G. Ro hatyn, a key figure in last year's efforts to cope with the distress of the securities industry.

title: SARA RUDNER, DUNN DANCE ONE THING
description: It would be difficult to ima gine a first concert of more appealing physical charm than that presented Saturday even ing at 61 Crosby Street by Sara Rudner and Douglas Dunn. Their joint recital, One Thing Leads to Another, consisted of four parts cochoreographed and distinct in feeling. In de sign it was classically laid out with first and third character sections and second and fourth white, or dancing, portions.

title: ESTHER MARROW IN SONG RECITAL
description: When Esther Marrow made her first solo appearances in New York two years ago at the Village Gate and, the Village Vanguard, she made a strong impression with the color and shading in her vibrant voice and the sinuous manner in which she accented her songs as she moved about the stage.

title: Advertising:
description: Reflecting perhaps the somber mood of the world, the American Advertising Federation, which has had past conventions in such in ternationally known fun spots as Portland, Ore., and Mil waukee, opened its 1971 edi tion yesterday in Honolulu.

title: Ilisa Jan Elson, Michael D. Stern Marry in Miami
description: MIAMI, June 20Miss Ilisa Jan Elson and Michael David Stern were married here this afternoon in Temple Beth Am. Rabbi Herbert Baumgard performed the ceremony.

title: RUTH REYNOLDS, JOURNALIST, DIES
description: Ruth Reynolds, who wrote the Justice articles in The Sunday News here for 20 years until her retirement in 1970, died yesterday in the Mary Manning Walsh Home, after a long illness. She was 66 years old and lived at 3563 80th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: EXL.I. RIGHTS AIDE HELD IN HOMICIDE
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., June 20 James Graydon, a former of ficial of local civilrights groups, was charged with homicide this morning following a gun battle outside a social club that he manages.

title: Indians Using an Ancient Cure To Give a More Youthful Look
description: NEW DELHI, June 20  A few months ago, V.V. Giri, the 76yearold President of India, went for a 14day rejuvena tion course at an Ayurvedic clinic in Kerala state and emerged looking 10 years younger.

title: Report Buoys Mine Owner
description: HYDEN, Ky. June 20Stan ley Finley, a coowner of the Finley Coal Company, said to day that he felt some of the heat had been taken off him by a House subcommittee re port that also blamed the United States Bureau of Mines for an explosion that killed 38 men in his mine last December. The report by the House Gen eral Labor subcommittee said the Bureau of Mines had not conducted adequate inspections of the mine.

title: 3 Climbers Die in Wyoming
description: MOOSE, Wyo., June 20 (AP)  Three mountain climbers skidded and tumbled through a hole in a snowfield into a stream and drowned, Forest Service officials reported today. The three, all from Idaho Falls, died yesterday as they were descending from 11,500foot Symmetry Spire in Grand Teton National Park. They were iden tified as Robert Deal, 28 years old; Wayne Creek, 36, and Louis Ybarrondo, 9.

title: Boy Injured by Firecracker
description: HAVERSTRAW, N. Y., June 20 (UPI)A 14yearold Rock land County boy is in fair condition in Ramapo General Hospital here after losing part of his hand when a firecracker exploded yesterday. The police said John Dillon and a com panion were in a small boat along the shore of the Hudson River when a group of teen agers approached them. One tossed a brick with a fire cracker tied to it into the boat. When young Dillon went to throw the brick away, the firecracker exploded.

title: Ft. Knox Medical Officers Ask Pullout by Year's End
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., June 20 (AP)A group representing 38 medical officers at Fort Knox published a statement today de manding the withdrawal of all American military personnel and advisers from Vietnam by the end of this year.

title: East German Fishing Boat Denies Harassing Charge
description: BOSTON, June 20 (AP)The captain of an East German fish ing trawler accused of harassing a Gloucester fishing boat denied the accusation today in a radio message to the Coast Guard.

title: Explosions Damage Paint Factory in West Virginia
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., June 20 (UPI)A series of explosions wrecked a section of a Chemetron Corporation paint factory today, shortly after firemen evacuated all production employes while fighting a small blaze.

title: Environmental Council Acts On Imperiled Florida, Area
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) The Council on Environ mental Quality took steps today to minimize environmental damage to an area of Florida disrupted by the CrossFlorida Barge Canal, now suspended.

title: Louisiana Area Is Jammed After Rock Show Is Barred
description: MCCREA, La., June 20 (UPI) Thousands of young people jammed the roads to south central Louisiana today trying to reach a Celebration of Life rock festival that local officials said could not be held. Inside the grounds, more than 2,000 youths stood their ground in the hope of a favorable court ruling tomorrow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bologna Triumphs OverWestHam,21; Cosmos 31 Victors
description: JERSEY CITY, N. J., June 20 Bologna and West Ham en tertained 9,000 soccer fans at Roosevelt Stadium today, with the Italian team gaining a 21 victory over the Londoners in the feature game of a double header.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 20Louise Gonnerman of River Edge, N. J., retained her Eastern women's clay tennis champion ship today by defeating Marilyn Aschner of Holliswood, Queens, 63, 64, in the final at the Orienta Beach Club. Last Sun day Miss Gonnerman, who ranks No. 2 in the East, won the New York State title.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 following are the votes of delegations from New York, New Jersey and, Connecticut on the major roll calls in Congress during the Week ended yester day.

title: McGovern Predicts Defeat Of Nixon Over the Economy
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI) Senator George Mc Govern, Democrat of South Dakota, said today that un employment and other eco nomic,.conditions could cause the defeat of President Nixon next year.

title: 20 Police Facing Charges Over Harlem Bottle Club
description: Twenty New York policemen including an inspector, a dep uty inspector, a captain, two lieutenants and a sergeant have been charged by the de partment with allegedly failing to act against an illegal Harlem club where one patrolman was said to have held his wedding reception.

title: WELFARE CLIENTS TO WORK FOR CITY UNDER NEW RULES
description: Human Resources Adminis trator Jule M. Sugarman said yesterday that about 50,000 employable New York welfare recipients would have to work, for the city to continue getting public assistance under new State welfare regulations effec tive July 1.

title: Reactions Focus on Security Rules
description: The controversy over the legal, ethical and political im plications of the publication of secret documents on the United States involvement in Vietnam continued yesterday as present and former government of ficials described their reactions to the papers in speeches and interviews across the country.

title: Yanks Routed
description: BALTIMORE, June 20  The world champion Baltimore Orioles completed a 13game homestand today in Memorial Stadium by beating the New York Yankees, 104, on six un earned runs.

title: Bombings in Columbus, Ga.
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., June 20 (UPI)Policemen and firemen battled firebomb attacks on whiteowned stores late tonight in the second night of violence touched off by the dismissal of seven black policemen. The au thorities said the fires had been quickly extinguished and the police reported no injuries or arrests.

title: DR. JOHN CUNNINGHAM
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., June 20 Dr. John C. Cunningham; chairman of the ophtalmology department of the College of Medicine of the University of Vermont, died yesterday. He was 61 years old.

title: IRVING HAND DEAD; TRADE JOURNALS AIDE
description: BRONXVILLE, N .Y., June 20 Irving E. Hand, who retired in 1969 as New York regional vice president of Chilton Com pany, publishers of trade jour nals, died today in Lawrence Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at the Stoneleigh Apartments here.

title: Peking Denounces Accord On Okinawa as a Fraud
description: TOKYO, Monday, June 21 (AP)  Peking's official press agency, Hsinhua, said today that an agreement between Japan and the United States for the return of Okinawa to Japan was a fraud that strengthened United States military bases in Okinawa an der new circumstances.

title: ISRAEL COMBATING WAVE OF STRIKES
description: JERUSALEM, June 20Five ministers reported separately to the Cabinet today on efforts successful for the moment to suppress a wave of strikes and labor agitation in Israeli hospitals, electricity plants and other vital public services.

title: Caramoor, Style Intact, Opens 26th Year
description: KATONAH, N. Y., June 20 Of the many outdoor music festivals that spring up like weeds once summer is upon us, that of Caramoor is one of the few that makes a persistent effort to present something different from what we have been hearing indoors all the rest of the year. Caramoor's extraordi nary mansion and gardens, which are owned by the Wal ter and Lucie Rosen Founda tion, are used creatively to determine and enhance the works performed there, and the remote, depersonalized air of the larger festivals is rarely felt here.

title: B52'S AGAIN RAID INFILTRATION AREA JUST BELOW DMZ
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, June 21United States B52 bombers yesterday con tinued intensive raids against North Vietnamese infiltration routes just below the demili tarized zone where they are reported to have dropped more than 700 tons of bombs in the last week.

title: News Analysis
description: The question of how to shrink the city payroll to eliminate nearly 15,000 jobs has been the subject of considerable contro versy within the Lindsay ad ministration.

title: Defections by Physicians Threaten A.M.A. Power
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 20 Widescale defections of doc tors are sharply affecting mem bership in the American Medi cal Association. The develop ment threatens to undermine seriously the financial and po litical power of the nation's strongest health lobby.

title: CATHOLIC FORUM ASSAILS ABORTION
description: ST. PAUL, June 20  The National Wanderer Forum, an annual gathering of conserva tive Roman Catholics, ended its 1971 session today by vigor ously opposing Government involvement in population con trol.

title: London Tells of Efforts For Exchange on Rhodesia
description: LONDON, June 20 (Reuters) The Foreign Office said today that diplomatic contacts with Rhodesia were continuing in a move to determine whether a basis existed for settlement of the Rhodesian independence dispute.

title: Fedayeen Seeking to Reassert Their Power in Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, June 19 An Arab commando grenade shakes the British Embassy. A commando leaflet threatens Death to traitors! A member of the commando Central Com mittee proclaims, We will continue the struggle!

title: 10 Iraqis Leave for Soviet
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, June 20 (Reuters)A 10member dele gation from Iraq's ruling Baath party left for Moscow today for a onemonth visit at the invi tation of the Soviet Communist party.

title: The Most Precious Freedom
description: WASHINGTON There are some holding power of government who heed false prophets. They have for gotten that the most precious freedom secured to the Individual by our Con stitution is the privacy of his mind, the freedom of his thought and the sanctity of his conscience.

title: Personal Finance
description: The average consumer must allot more than 10 per cent of his income to pay for his comings and goings. It may be in the form of buying and maintaining cars, along with repairs, parts, new tires and such items. Part of it goes to buses, subways or commuting trains.

title: Rally in Prospect Park Asks That All Ages Protest War
description: A Brooklyn peace organiza tion held a rally in Prospect Park yesterday afternoon to protest the war in Vietnam and to show other Americans that in the pursuit of peace there could be no generation gap.

title: Bayh's Funding Questioned
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP) The Republican National Committee's newsletter, Mon day, asked today where Sena tor Birth Bayh o Indiana was getting the money to finance his undeclared campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination. A spokesman for the Senator replied that his campaign committee would, at the proper time, file the finan cial disclosure required by Fed eral law.

title: 10 Hurt in Boat Collision
description: HOLLAND, Mich., June 20 (UPI)  Ten persons were lightly injured today when two cabin cruisers collided near the Holland Channel ?? Lake Mich igan.

title: East Pakistan Is Reopened to Newsmen
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June 20 The Pakistani Government, announced last night that for eign newsmen, who have been barred from East Pakistan since March 25 except as partici pants in Governmentconducted tours, are to be readmitted without restrictions.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A sudden rain lashed the city, driving dozens of men and women up the steps of Madison Square Garden cover. Two stylishly dressed young women holding sodden Sunday newspaper overhead continued on into the building to be pursued by another vicious squall, a ragged, darkbearded young man shrieking, You perverts, you sexstarved perverts. Startled, they turned to see him shake a fist at them. By his side, a small woman carried sign reading, Halfwits who lead dull, boring lives get their sexual kicks from bullfights. The young women looked at each other, shrugged, and went inside to watch El Cordobes and two other matadors stab six bulls to death.

title: DR. GILBERT A. BICKEL
description: LONG BEACH, L. I., June 20 Dr. Gilbert A. Bickel, a den tist with offices in Rockville Centre, died yesterday in Long Beach Hospital at the age of 67. His home was at 108 Lyn brook Avenue, Point Lookout.

title: Suburbs Gaining on Manhattan in Retailing
description: In the view of some of its most prominent merchants, Manhattan may be becoming a desert by some glittering oases.

title: Daughter of Dr. King Makes Stage Debut
description: ATLANTA, June 20 (AP) Yolanda King, 15  year  old daughter of the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., made her stage debut last night in an interracial production of The Owl and the Pussycat.

title: AIR FORCE CHARGES OFFICER WITH THEFT
description: TRAVIS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., June 20 (UPI)An Air Force major has been charged with stealing electronic equip ment from transport planes he flew between the United States and Vietnam.

title: OUSTED CAIRO AIDES TO LOSE PROPERTIES
description: CAIRO, June 20 (Reuters) The public prosecutor, Mustafa Fahmy, today ordered the seizure of the properties of seven former officials, includ ing former Vice President Aly Sabry, accused, of involvement in the recent plot to overthrow President Anwar elSadat.

title: The Vietnam Papers
description: On Nov. 25, 1964, some three weeks after President Johnson's election, The Times observed editorially that another Vietnam reassessment is under way  [and] if there is to be a new policy now, if an Asian war to be converted into an American war, the country has a right to insist that it be told what has changed so profoundly in the last two months to justify it. The country was not told.

title: 3 Judges Will Rule on Secret Papers
description: The court struggle between the Justice Department and The New York Times over publica tion of secret information will move to the Federal Court of Appeals today. With lawyers for both sides operating on an accelerated legal timetable, the case is likely to reach the Su preme Court by the end, of the week.

title: A Milan Court Sends Joe Adonis Into Exile
description: MILAN, Italy, June 20, (AP) Joe Adonis, onetime re puted gambling leader in the United States, is to be ex iled for four years to an Adriatic hill town because of his suspected gangland con nections.

title: POT D'OR CAPTURES LE GRAND STEEPLE
description: PARIS, June 20Pot d'Or, a 5yearold stallion owned by Robert Weill, a French textile manufacturer, today outclassed his 14 rivals to win the $150, 000 Grand Steeplechase de Paris.

title: Governor Signs 3 Transportation Bills
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday that he had signed three major transporta tion bills providing for mass transit to Kennedy Internation al Airport, the rebuilding of the West Side Highway, and the reserving of land in New burgh for a jetport.

title: Philharmonic Plays Familiar Program At Queens Concert
description: The second of the New York Philharmonic's three sets of community concerts, planned in cooperation with the New York City Central Labor Coun cil, was a decided hit at its first stop, the Electric Industry Center Auditorium in Flushing, Queens. The program was war horsy butt effective, the acous tics in the hall dry but clean, the audience talkative but re freshingly enthusiastic.

title: India Border Curfew
description: NEW DELHI, June 20 (AP) Meghalaya state imposed a monthlong evening curfew on its 300mile heavily forestedborder with East Pakistan to day in what was termed a move to protect life, property and communications and to guard against infiltration of Pakistani spies.

title: High Explosive Missing From Jersey Box Car
description: KENVIL, N. J., June 20 An unknown quantity of a high explosive that ignites spontaneously unless kept wet may have been stolen from a railroad car here, the police warned tonight.

title: All Safe in 747 Mishap
description: TOKYO, June 20 (Reuters) A Northwest  Orient Airlines Boeing747 ran off the runway when seven of its tires burst during takeoff from Tokyo In ternational Airport today, but all 218 passengers and crew members escaped injuries, the police said. The plane was bound for San Francisco.

title: General Host Sets $68Million In a Tender Offer for Cudahy
description: The General Host Corpora tion announced yesterday a cash tender offer of $68.34 million for all the shares of the Cudahy Company, the large meatprocessing concern.

title: The Great Whaling Disaster
description: More than a century ago, Herman Melville wrote: The moot point is, whether Leviathan can long endure so wide a chase and so remorseless a havoc; whether he must not at last be exterminated from the waters.

title: 25 Hurt at House Party As Deck Patio Collapses
description: GARNERVILLE, N.Y., June 20 Twentyfive persons were in jured, many of them seriously, when a deck patio collapsed last night during an outdoor cookout at a private home here, the police said.

title: JAMES W. COLBERT Sr.
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 20 James W. Colbert Sr., for mer New York manager and assistant Eastern sales man ager of Owens Illinois Glass Company, died here today at the age of 77. He lived at 14 North Chatsworth Avenue.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., June 20 In the renewal of a sharp rivalry Lisa Rosenblum of Long Island City, Queens, beat Donna Stockton of Garden City, L. I., 63, 64, today in the final of the New Jersey State tennis championship for girls 18 years and under.

title: Kenneth Sayle, Realty Broker, Weds Miss Susan B. Sackheim
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., June 20Miss Susan Barbara Sack heim, a granddaughter of Maxwell B. Sackheim of Largo, Fla., a cofounder of the Bookofthe Month Club, was married here this after noon to Kenneth Ted Sayle.

title: DUTCH GRAND PRIX CAPTURED BY ICKX
description: ZANDVOORT, the Nether lands, June 20Jacky Ickx of Belgium won the waterlogged and oilslicked Dutch Grand Prix in his Ferrari today by 7.99 seconds from Pedro Rodriguez of Mexico, in a B.R.M.

title: JAMES L. CLEVENGER
description: LITTLE SILVER, N.J. June 20 James Logan Clevenger, who retired in 1930 as editor and publisher of The Perth Amboy News now The NewsTribune, died today in Riverview Hospi tal, Red Bank. He was 92 years old and lived at 215 Pinckney Road.

title: Racial Unrest Hits Jacksonville Despite Effort to Ease Tensions
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., June 20A week ago, Jacksonville was congratulating itself be cause of a glowing article about it in Harper's magazine, the first favorable publicity the city had had in a long time.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., June 20 Rolf Carlsen, Peter Bethge and Paul Capron took the top three spots in Star Class races on Hempstead Harbor today for the second day in a row.

title: Turkish Leader Moves to Bring Last of Nation's Opium Farms Under Control
description: ANKARA, Turkey, June 16 Premier Nihat Erim, who is seeking to end all cultivation of opium poppies in Turkey eventually, is also taking more energetic measures than any of his predecessors to bring ex isting poppy farmers under control and to halt the smug gling that supplies over three quarters of the heroin entering the United States.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Film: Lelouch's 'Crook':Kidnapping Furnishes the Central Action
description: Although he has done good work since, Claude Lelouch is chiefly remembered for "A Man and a Woman," a bittersweet, fashionably romantic Clairol commercial of a movie that must rank with the Zeffirelli "Romeo and Juliet" as among the most overrated films of the 1960's.His new movie, "The Crook," which opened yesterday at the Paris Theater, as you might guess, radically different subject matter and a superficially different tone. But in such essentially spiritual matters as camera position, editing and the whole range of technique, "The Crook" suggests nothing so much as a hard-edged "A Man and a Woman," with analogous self-indulgence, misdirected visual rhetoric and inexpressive stylistic excesses.Lelouch's crook (Jean-Louis Trintignant) is a former lawyer and current escaped convict who, with his ex-wife (Christine Lelouch) and trusty pal (Charles Gerard), masterminds a kidnapping scheme of picturesque but mostly unnecessary complexity. Their plan is to kidnap a little boy (Vincent Roziere) and to hold him for a million dollars ransomnot from his poor parents but from the huge bank his father works for.The scheme works marvelously. The bank takes the bait, pays the money, and in return earns much more than a million dollars worth of goodwill from the sentimental savers of Paris. The crook collects his ransom, and the kid has the time of his life, thinking he has been off on one big out-of-season Christmas party, and all goes well until . . .I won't reveal any more of the plot, but even the central event described in the barest outline may seem a bit too speculatively fancy for efficiencyand in its execution, in the incredibly elaborate scheme of the actual kidnapping, it becomes not so much a crime as a display of hopefully decorative, generally superfluous ideas.To a degree "The Crook" means to parody itself and its genre. The guns are never loaded, or are loaded, as nearly as I can tell, with blanks. No one is killed, no one is hurt, and those who go to jail seem to break out again with ease. Prefacing the film and concluding it, and rather messing up its middle with a bit of cyclical coincidence, is a segment of a movie musical called "Le Voyou" (the French title of this movie), which is meant to make fun of the molls-and-machine-gun syndrome in the crime film but which also is an overtly theatrical reading of the real-life theatrics in front of the screen.But the action in front of the screen has enough trouble with eyewash of its ownfrom the portentous close-ups of unimportant characters to the through-the-wind-shield photography (a Lelouch specialty) of the principalsnot to need any at second-hand. For all its fussily bright precision and its knowingness about methods, seeing "The Crook" is like seeing the genre, and what the genre understands of life, in a distorting mirror.All the performances are more reasonable than the roles call for. I especially liked the delicately beautiful Christine Lelouch (the director's wife) as the type of the modern moll, and Daniele Delorme as an aging career girl who is at first forced to harbor the crook, and then finds herself valuing his company.

title: Pirates Sweep on Stargell's 2 Clouts
description: Some reasons why the Pittsburgh Pirates are leading the. National League's Eastern Division.

title: Sandra Palmer Wins by Stroke With 70 for 211 in Heritage Golf
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., June 20 (AP)Sandra Palmer rolled in a 15foot birdie putt on the 18th green today to win the first Ladies Professional Golf Association Heritage open with a threeround total of 211.

title: Oil Men Dread Coming Daysin Venezuela
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 20 Time was when foreign oil men here looked forward each year to June 24 and July 5, Venezuela's big pa triotic holidays. It meant two more days at the beach or golf course. Their only concerns then were the weather and the traffic.

title: OX RIDGE HONORS TO THE SENATOR
Two Win $23,331 for $2
description: CHARLES TOWN, W. Va., June 20 (AP)Two fans won $23,331 each on $2 bets yester day at Shenandoah Downs in the biggest twoway payoff since Big Exacta betting was introduced here in 1969.

title: Miss Rhodes Is Wed Here
description: Miss Katharine Lee Rhodes, a former administrative as sistant to the Harkness Fel lowship of the Commonwealth Fund of New York, was mar ried here yesterday to Laurie J. Clancy of Melbourne, Aus tralia, who has been studying at Yale on a Harkness Fellowship.

title: FRED SCHILLING
description: Fred Schilling, a founder and former president of the Franklin Square (L. I.) National Bank, now part of the Franklin Na tional Bank, and founder of the Schilling Hardware Store in Franklin Square, died Saturday in St. Petersburg, Fla., where he retired in 1949. His age was 84.

title: Nicklaus and Trevino Tie
description: Jack Nicklaus and Lee Tre vino tied for first in the United States Open golf cham pionship yesterday with 72 hole scores of par 280 and will meet in an 18hole play off today at the Merion Golf Club, Ardmore, Pa. Jim Simons, an amateur, finished in a threeway tie for fifth at 283. (Details on Page 19.)

title: Black Leaders in Cairo, ., Vow to Continue Boycott
description: CAIRO, ., June 20 (UPI) Black leaders in this economi cally and racially troubled river port said today that their black solidarity day for sur vival was a success and vowed to continue a 27month old boycott of whiteowned businesses.

title: Rocket Tests Atmosphere
description: WALLOPS ISLAND, Va., June 20 (UPI)An instrumentfilled rocket was fired 235 miles intol space today and then brought back at 15,000 miles an hour in an attempt to measure the structure and composition of the earth's atmosphere. The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said initial data indicated that all mission ob jectives were achieved.

title: Playoff: The Hustler vs. the Pro
description: ARDMORE, Pa., June 20 Outside, on the 18th green, Jack Nicklaus was preparing to putt. If ho made it, he would win the United States Open golf tournament. If he twoputted, he would enter an 18hole playoff tomorrow with Lee Trevino, who was sitting on a white wooden bench in the Merion Golf Club locker room, sipping a beer and ignoring a nearby TV set.

title: Marlene Hess Married To Dennis Friedland
description: Miss Marlene Hess, daugh ter of Leon Hess, chairman of the executive committee of the Amerada Hess Cor poration, and Mrs. Hess, was married here yesterday to Dennis Friedland, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman E. Friedland of New York.

title: TEXTILE PARLEYS WIND UP IN KOREA
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 20The United States and South Korea ended unsuccess fully today sixday negotia tions for restrictions on Kore an exports of wool and manmadetextile products to the American market without reaching an agreement.

title: Kazuko Hirabayashi Company Performs The Stone Garden'
description: For some years the trend toward a thirdstream dance style that combines the vocabu lary of both classic ballet and modern dance has been ap parent. A new twist in this area was provided Saturday night by the Kazuko Hirabay ashi Dance Theater at Japan House, 333 East 47th Street.

title: EXECUTIVE IS NAMED FOR WELFARE BOARD
description: ALBANY, June 20  George W. Chesbro, a career welfare executive, has been appointed executive secretary for the State Board of Social Welfare.

title: Workers' Use of Drugs Widespread in Nation
description: DETROIT, June 20  A middleaged worker at the Cadillac plant here goes daily into the men's room during his breaks, knots a piece of surgical tubing around his arm, cooks a dose of heroin in a bottle cap with a match and shoots the melted liquid into a vein. Then he goes back to his job.

title: Dance: Alicia Alonso's Cuban Troupe
description: MONTREAL, June 20The Ballet Nacional de Cuba, led by the famed Cuban ballerina Alicia Alonso, is on a tour of Canada that ends next week in Quebec. Since it seems that Miss Alonso, for merly a much beloved star of the American Ballet Thea ter, will never again be al lowed to dance in the United States before her retirement, an amazing number of Ameri can balletgoers have made the pilgrimage to Montreal.

title: SOVIET AIDE GETS ASYLUM IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, June 20Anatoly Fedoseyev, a Soviet space ex pert who defected last month during a visit to the Paris Air Show, is in Britain and has been given permission to stay, Government officials announced today.

title: Miss Schapiro Wed To M. W. Yogman
description: CARMEL, N. Y., June 20 Miss Judith B. Schapiro and Michael W. Yogman were married here this afternoon on the grounds of Dream wold, an inn. Rabbi Abraham M. Feinerman performed the ceremony.

title: Continuing Rise Expected In Bond Prices This Week
description: The credit markets at the moment are in a manic phase. Bond prices are going to rise and interest rates will decline sharply.

title: Mets Split Pair With Phils;
description: The New York Mets divided a doubleheader with the Phila delphia Phillies yesterday and, in the process, treated 51,134 persons in Shea Stadium to one of the most memorable finishes in their 10year history of memorable finishes.

title: Timbuktu: A Nice Place to Live, but
description: TIMBUKTU, Mali, June 8 Four hundred years ago this sunbaked West African town was a thriving commercial and cultural center, with shopi full of jewelry and silk, an Islamic university, and a population of 100,000.

title: F.T.C. Terms Prices of Cereal Inflated
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)A Federal Trade Com mission study has concluded that breakfast cereal prices have been inflated 15 to 25 per cent by very high profits and advertising expenditures.

title: MURPHYIS IS VICTOR IN ISLAND GOLF
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., June 20 Bobby Murphy successfully defended his Long Island amateur golf championship to day and Alan Gilison became a threetime runnerup for the title. The 22yearold Murphy putted his way to a 7and6 victory over Gilison in the final that lasted 30 of a scheduled 36 holes.

title: Partial Rail Strike Irks Frenchmen
description: PARIS, June 20A railway strike in France that began 10 days ago has snarled vacation plans, angered commuters, slowed the movement of food to markets and caused the gov ernment some economic prob lems.

title: Westbury and Bethpage Tie in League Polo, 66
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., June 20 Westbury and Bethpage played to a 66 overtime tie in Metropolitan Polo League match at Bethpage Park today.

title: 8th Victim of Mass Slaying Dies of Wounds in Detroit
description: DETROIT, June 20 (UPI)  Robert Gardner, 28 years old, the tenant of the inner city flat where seven persons were slain last Monday in a reputed narco tics war, died today of wounds.

title: Coast Guard Shift Urged
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., June 20 (AP)The Reserve Officers As sociation ended its threeday national convention yesterday by calling for the Coast Guard to be transferred to the De fense Department. The Coast Guard is a military organiza tion, and its missions have a direct and major bearing on national defense, said the res olution. The Coast Guard is in the Transportation Department.

title: A Hollerin' Farmer Defeats a Yodeler In Carolina Contest
description: SPIVEY'S CORNER, N. C., June 20 (UPI)  North Caro lina's countrystyle hollerin' and Europe's yodeling may have had similar functions, but judges at the National Hollerin' Contest preferred the homegrown com munication.

title: Pressure of Final Round Saps Simons's Title Bid
description: ARDMORE, Pa., June 20 A weary Jim Simons, the 21 yearold amateur who led the United States Open after three rounds, blamed his final round 76 today on pressure that built up so much it tired me out.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Jews in 25 Countries Aided During 1970
description: The Joint Distribution Com mittee, a major American agency aiding needy Jews overseas, reported that it al located more than $23million last year to aid 300,000 Jews in 25 countries.

title: GEORGES BESSON, 88, FRENCH ART CRITIC
description: PARIS, June 20 (Reuters)  Georges Besson, the art critic, died today at the age of 88. He was on the staffs of the maga zine Lettres Frangaises and the Communist newspaper l'Hu manit.

title: Cancer Grants Announced
description: The board of directors of the American Cancer Society announced yesterday $13,446, 767 in grants for research and clinical investigations. The grants will go to 353 institu tions and professionals in an effort to improve diagnosis and treatment.

title: Policemen Protect Swimmers at ones Beach
description: JONES BEACH, L.I., June 20  Helicopters, motor launches and uniformed po licemen filled in here today for lifeguards Who have not shown up for work since the beach season opened.

title: TV : Boston's WGBH Possesses Rare Enthusiasm
description: It happened in Boston, the New Faces revue was in sisting way back in 1952. As far as television is concerned, it still is happening in Bos ton. Or at least that is the distinct impression anyone is likely to get after a super whirlwind tour of station WGBH.

title: ORBAN U.S. WINNER IN SABER FENCEOFF
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 20 (AP)Alex Orban of the New York Athletic Club won a threeway fenceoff last night to take the saber title in the United States fencing cham pionships.

title: In Indiana, Time Exerts a Special Tyranny
description: VEVAY, Ind., June 20 When a popular resident of Switzerland County died last week, many people wanted to attend the funeral.

title: 3 ACTORS HONOR CITY WITH POETRY
description: By now everybody must know that Aline MacMahon, Stephen Elliott and Paul Shyre are im portant citizens of the American theater. They also read beauti fully. A small but appreciative audience had ample evidence of this Saturday night at Alice Tully Hall.

title: Leaders Equal ParSimons Ends at 283
description: ARDMORE, Pa., June 20Lee Trevino spurted on the last nine holes today and ended in a tie for first with Jack Nicklaus at par 280 in the United States Open golf championship today. The 1968 Open champion shot a 69, although a bogey 5 at Merion's 18th hole allowed the title to slip from Trevino's grasp.

title: AILEEN TRIUMPHS IN Y.R.A. REGATTA
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., June 20 Cornelius Shields Jr., with his International Class sloop, Aileen, reversed the order of yesterday's finish by beating William E. John Jr., skipper of Donde, by 2 minutes 29 sec onds and about 250 yards after 11.5 miles on Long Island Sound today in the season's 11th Yacht Racing Association championship regatta.

title: Jet Collision Kills Reservist
description: ROME, Ga., June 20 (AP) A Naval Reserve pilot was killed but another ejected safe ly today when two singleseat A4L Skyhawk jets collided near here. The Naval authori ties identified the dead pilot as Lieut Fred R. Boardman, 32 years old, of Miami, a com mericial pilot for Eastern Air Lines. Lieut Comdr. John E. Owens Jr., 35, also of Miami, ejected from his plane and was reported in good condition, a Navy spokesman said. The jets, based in Atlanta, were on routine tactical training mis sion in the northeast Georgia area.

title: Albatross Takes Pace
description: MONTREAL, June 20 (AP) Albatross paced the mile in 1:57 2/5 today to win the $75, 000 Prix d'Ete at Blue Bonnets Raceway by 4 lengths. It was the 3yearold's fifth straight victory this season.

title: PAUL KARRER DIES; NOBEL CHEMIST, 82
description: GENEVA, June 20Dr. Paul Karrer, a Nobel Prizewinning chemist and a pioneer in vita min research, died Friday in Zurich. He was 82 years old.

title: Offtrack Betting on Belmont Races Will Start Today at 12 Offices in City
description: Offtrack betting in the city, limited primarily to harness racing until now, expands its operations today to include thoroughbred races at Belmont Park. Starting at 8 A.M. wag ers will be accepted at the Off track Betting Corporation's 12 offices for win betting only on all nine races.

title: HENRY D. GEMMELL
description: CEDAR GROVE, N. J., June 20Henry D. Gemmell, presi dent of the Book Warehouse and Totowa Chamber of Com merce, died today of a heart ailment in Mountainside Hospi tal, Montclair. He was 46 years old and lived at 61 Pine Drive.

title: Shibul Takes Race
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., June 20 David James's new sloop Shibui from the Douglaston Yacht Squadron won the Bay side Yacht Club's 18th annual pointtopoint overnight cruis ing race today.

title: Ontario Wins Rugby Title
description: TORONTO, June 20 (Canadian Press)Ontario defeated British Columbia, 2717, yesterday to win the Canadian rugby cham pionship. It was the first time in 10 years of tournament play that Ontario had beaten its Western rival.

title: ROSS DEFEATS KAHN IN JERSEY NET FINAL
description: KEARNY, N. J., June 20 Steve Ross of Brooklyn won the New Jersey State men's tennis championship for the second straight year by defeat ing Bob Kahn of New York, 63, 60, 60, at the Arlington Players Club today.

title: Amex Realigns Its Units; 3 Major Divisions Result
description: The American Stock Ex change announced yesterday a major restructuring of its ad ministrative organization, re sulting in the consolidation in to three divisions of the present 13 divisions and 32 depart ments.

title: Pope's Speech Disrupted
description: ROME, June 20 (UPI)Dis ciples of a Frenchman who says he is the real Pope staged a noisy demonstration in St. Pe ter's Square today in an at tempt to disrupt a speech by Pope Paul VI. The demonstra tors, supporters of a defrocked French priest, Michel Collin, who calls himself Pope Clement XV, shouted and clapped hands during the Pope's address. How ever, the Pope ignored them and did not interrupt his speech.

title: Ann Liese Bronfenbrenner Is Wed
description: ITHACA, N. Y., June 20 Miss Ann Liese Bronfenbren ner and Dr. Morris J. Stam bler were married here this morning in the garden of the Big Red Barn of Cornell Uni versity by Rabbi Michael Sternfield.

title: National City Bank's Role Slums Decried by Nader
description: WASHINGTON, June 20An investigating team sponsored by Ralph Nader accuses the First National City Bank of New York today of accelerating the deterioration of the poorer neighborhoods of New York City by taking more money out of themin the form of in dividuals' bank depositsthan it was willing to lend back.

title: A.E.C. Will Ease Secrecy On Making Uranium Fuel
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) The Atomic Energy Commis sion said today that it would make available secret technol ogy on how to make enriched uranium fuel to a limited num ber of United Statesowned companies.

title: Fund Request of F.B.I. Backed by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON June 21 (UPI)The Hodge Appropria tions Committee, refusing to be swayed by rising criticism of the Federal Bureau of Investige tion, issued today its annual recommendation that the bureau be granted all the money it requested.

title: Mrs. Hart's 78 Wins Medal In Metropolitan Title Golf
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 21 Mrs. A. Sherburne Hart of Baltusrol won the qualifying medal in the 68th annual Wo men's Metropolitan Golf Asso ciation championship today. Mrs. Hart, the defending cham pion, shot 36, 4278 at the 6,083yard, par74 Stanwich club's course.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Military Goods Sent To Pakistan Despite Ban
description: WASHINGTON, June 21A freighter flying the flag of Pakistan was preparing today to sail from New York for Karachi with a cargo of United States military equipment for Pakistan, apparently in violation of the Administra tion's officially proclaimed ban on such shipments.

title: London's Shops Part Oriental Bazaar, Part Lower East Side
description: LONDONFashion is fugitive, and so are the places where it happens. Carna by Street is dead, and Safeway and Orange Julius have come to King's Road.

title: Jewish Agency Reconstituted
description: JERUSALEM, June 21 (Reu ters) Jewish delegates from 27 countries today signed an agreement for the reconstitu tion of the Jewish Agency for Israel, separating it from the World Zionist Organization. The reconstituted Jewish Agency will be responsible for activities within Israel while the World Zionist Organization will Conduct its activties outside Is rael.

title: Dissident Files Suit
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) Mr. Vestal, the Local team sters leader from Tennessee said today that he would run for national president of the union against Mr. Fitzsimmons.

title: MARKET PLUNGES TO 4MONTH LOW
description: The stock market plunged through its expected support level yesterday and closed at its low for the day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MILTON BASSIN GETS YORK COLLEGE POST
description: The Board of Higher Educa tion last night appointed Milton G. Bassin as the new president of York College in South Ja maica, Queens, the newest of the fouryear colleges in the City University system.

title: BIANCHI TO OPPOSE KLEIN IN SUFFOLK
description: PATCHOGUE, L. I., June 21 Following weeks of hesita tion and division, Suffolk County Democrats tonight des ignated I. William Bianchi Jr., a Bellport orchid grower, as their candidate for County Ex ecutive this fall.

title: A School for Meditation Teachers
description: AMHERST, Mass., June 21 Maharishi Mahesh, the peripa tetic Indian yogi who has made believers out of the Beatles, Mia Farrow and now, even the Dow Chemical Company, set up shop here today to train a thou sand or so new teachers of transcendental meditation.

title: Velasquez Rides Proliferation to 3Length Succes in Nassau country Stake
description: The inflow of money from the offtrack betting machines created hardly a ripple in the activity at Belmont Park yester day. The attendance figures were, off, but the betting handle was up.

title: Roa of Cuba Visits Kosygin
description: MOSCOW, June 21 (AP)  Foreign Minister Ral Roa of Cuba called on Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin today. Tess, the So viet press agency, said Mr. Roa, Mr. Kosygin and Foreign Min ister Andrei A. Gromyko dis cussed SovietCuban questions as well as international matters of interest to both countries.

title: Former Patrolman Jailed
description: A suspended New York City patrolman who pleaded guilty last April in Bronx Supreme Court to a charge of coercion was sentenced yesterday to three months in prison. Walter Hart, 28 years old, of 3215 Olinville Avenue, the Bronx, was arrested last Nov. 27 in a Bronx bar after he allegedly accepted a $300 payment from a narcotics addict whom he had threatened with felony charges.

title: Hope on Jobs for Relief Clients Seen Despite Economic Outlook
description: Louis L. Levine, the state's Industrial Commissioner, ex pressed optimism yesterday about prospects for finding jobs for employable welfare recipients despite a generally gloomy employment picture.

title: AFRICAN LEADERS APPEAL FOR UNITY
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, June 21The eighth summit conferenoe of the Organization of African Unity began today in Africa Hall with repeated pleas that the organization overcome disagreement Within its ranks.

title: SAUL CARSON DEAD; U.N. NEWS REPORTER
description: Saul Carson, United Nations correspondent for the Jewish Telegraph Agency from 1953 until his retirement in 1969, died Sunday, in Deerfield Park, Fla., after a short illness. He was 76 years old.

title: Gareer Spanned 4 Decades
description: For more than 45 years, Carl Rose's neat, printed signature appeared in the corner of draw ings, cartoons and illustrations in scores of magazines and banksfrom The New Yorker to American Legion, from Ben nett Cerf's anthologies of other people's jokes to articles in The Neth. York Times Magazines.

title: FRANK WOLK
description: Frank Wolk, a retired whole sale meat dealer who was a governor of the Brooklyn Jewish Center, died Sunday in Carson C. Peck Memorial Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 77 years old and lived at 370 Ocean Park way, Brooklyn.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MESKILL WARNS OF JOBS CUTBACK
description: HARTFORD, June 21Gov. Thomas J. Meskill said tonight he would have to cut state spending by $120million if a balanced budget was not en acted by July 1.

title: S.E.C. SUIT ACCUSES RUSCO ON PROXIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The Securities and Exchaage Commission asked the Federal District. Court in New York to day to enjoin Rusco Industries, Inc., and its president, Jack Catain Jr., from violating the antifraud and proxy provisions of United States securities laws.

title: Hashish Found Snagged In Lobster Pot's Lines
description: An amateur lobster fisher man from Queens made an unexpected catch in the At lantic Oceana package of hashish snagged an one of his lobster pot lines.

title: Belmont Offtrack Bets Total $90,511 on First Day
description: Regular offtrack betting on thoroughbred racing came out of the starting gate at a pre dictably slow gallop here yes terday.

title: HOMER J. MERCHANT
description: Homer J. Merchant, who re tired in February as vice presi dent for industry affairs of United Air Lines, died on Sun day at his home in Napa, Calif., after a heart attack. He was 66 years old.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, June 21The metic ulous report of the Citizens Research Foundation on political spending in 1968 has disclosed, above all, a stag gering increase front 1964. Total costs were up 50 per cent, from $200 to $300 million; the cost of electing a President and Vice President rose 67 per cent from $60 to $100 million. By comparison, the nation emerged with Dwight Eisenhower twenty years ago for the bargain price of $11,6 Million.

title: BRUMFIELD TAKES 4 AT LIBERTY BELL
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 21 Morris Wexler's Zoom Loom carried Donald Brumfield to his fourth triumph of the day in capturing the feature race at Liberty Bell race track today by a neck over John E. Kim ble's Compatriot.

title: DR. GEORGE A. IRLAND
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., June 21 Dr. George A. Irland, professor emeritus of electrical engineer ing at Bucknell University, died today of a heart attack at his home here. He was 77 years old.

title: Mackell Reelection Is Seen Assured
description: Backed by three parties, Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell was virtual ly assured of reelection today, the first day for the circulation of designating petitions for the Sept. 14 primary.

title: Indians Recall Infielder
description: CLEVELAND, June 21 (AP) The Cleveland Indians yester day sent Rick Austin, a pitcher, to Wichita of the American As sociation and called up Kurt Bevacqua, an infielder, from that farm club. Bevacqua was acquired from the Cincinnati Reds' farm system in the trade last month that sent Buddy Bradford to the Reds.

title: METS TROUNCED BY PIRATES, 60
description: PITTSBURGH, June 21  While Dock Ellis was scatter ing eight hits, Willie Stargell, the majors' leading homerun hitter, cracked his 25th to help the Pittsburgh Pirates whip the Mets, 60, tonight.

title: Crawford Bout Set Back
description: LOS ANGELES, June 21 (AP) Frankie Crawford's 10round featherweight bout with Vicente Saldivar has been set back from July 1 to July 15 to give Craw ford's bruised ribs time to heal, the Olympic Auditorium matchmaker, Don Chargin, said today.

title: HOMEBUILDING UNIT IS FORMED BY TRW
description: TRW Inc., has formed a sub sidiary, the Community Tech nology Corporation, to enter the residential  construction field. The new concern will sup ply structural materials to homebuilders and will engage in the research and develop ment of materials and manufac turing processes.

title: Japanese Approve Curbs
description: TOKYO, June 21 (Reuters) Japan's textile industry today formally approved details of its program of voluntary re straints on textile exports to the United States. The re straints are to begin July 1.

title: Market Place: A Plan to Help Small Investors
description: Isn't it time that the ma jor brokerage houses permit ted the small investor the op portunity to buy and sell se curities without paying for the services of a commission agent?

title: Fair Vote in Vietnam
description: Even with the most scrupulous selfrestraint, the huge American military, diplomatic, intelligence and propa ganda establishment in Saigon could not help but be a looming presence in the background of the forthcoming Vietnamese national elections. Unfortunately, there is some reason to believe that the American influence in Saigon may not be either neutral or selfrestrained. The logic of the Nixon Administration's Vietnamization policy makes American officialdom naturally sympathetic to the electoral cause of this country's political ally, President Thieu.

title: Soviet Trial of 9 Kishinev Jews Reported to Start
description: MOSCOW, June 21 (UPI)  Jewish sources said that nine Soviet Jews accused of anti state activities went on trial to day in the Moldavian capital of Kishinev.

title: 3 Officials of Taxi Union Defy Van Arsdale on Contract
description: High ranking officers of New York's Taxi Driver's Union de fied their president, Harry Van Arsdale, yesterday and de nounced a wage contract that he had supported.

title: Morales Defeats Graham In Wrestling at Garden
description: When Pedro Morales and Luke Graham started slugging with their fists, the referee, Ed ward Gersh stopped their wrestling exhibition at Madison square Garden last night be cause of a cut over Graham's left eye. Morales, 235 pounds, was declared victor after 15 minutes 6 seconds of the one falltoafinish match.

title: Mafia Figure Loses Bid For New Hijacking Trial
description: A Federal district judge in Brooklyn yesterday denied motion for a new trial for Carmine Persico, a reputed Mafia figure, and three defen dants, in a truck hijacking case that has been tried five times since 1961.

title: State Markets Unit Assesses Violators $13,975 in a Month
description: The State Department of Agriculture and Markets said yesterday it had collected 194 fines last month from stores and provisioners whose of fenses ranged from running un sanitary establishments to mis representing the size and grades of their products.

title: McDonnell Douglas Given Harpoon Missile Contract
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The McDonnell Douglas Cor poration was selected by the Navy today as prime contractor to develop the new Harpoon [missile system, intended to knock out enemy ships from more than 50 miles away.

title: Welfare Reform Survives First Test in House Vote
description: WASHINGTON, June 21The welfare reforM program backed by President Nixon and drafted by Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, survived an initial test on the House floor today but fell short of a convincing majority.

title: U.S. Witness Testifies to Agony Over Hudson County Kickbacks
description: NEWARK, June 21A key Witness for the Government in its prosecution of eight Hudson County and Jersey City officials ion corruption charges testified toddy about his agony at hav ing been a part of the alleged kickback conspiracy as well as a bagman in the operation and his additional agony at being a witness against his former associates.

title: Court, 63, Says Jury Trial Is Not Required for Youths
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 The Supreme Court ruled 6 to 3 today that juveniles do not have a constitutional right to a trial by jury.

title: Jaycees Elect Hawaiian
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 21 (AP)The new president of the national Jaycees is Ronald Au, 35 years old, of Honolulu. He was elected at the 51st annual Jaycee convention in Portland, winning over five other candi dates.

title: Mack Truck Offices Picketed
description: Announcing their intention to stepup harassment of United States concerns dealing with the Soviet Union, eight members of the Jewish Defense League staged a sit in yester day for little more than an hour at the Empire State Building headquarters of Mack Truck Co., Inc. Mack announced last week a multimillion dollar plant in the Soviet Union. The defense league has, for several months, protested treatment of Jews in the Soviet Union.

title: Showdown on Welfare
description: The welfare reform bill which passed the House last year only to founder in the Senate just before adjourn ment is once again nearing a showdown vote. The bill now before the House is a compromise laboriously arrived at in the Ways and Means Committee between liberals and the Nixon Administration, with moderate conservatives led by Chairman Mills of Arkansas serving as the brokers. This compromise is not entirely satisfac tory to any of the contending factions, but it deserves support as the best vehicle for constructive change.

title: Mullaney Named Pilot Of Colonels in A.B.A.
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., June 21 (UPI)Joe Mullaney, coach of the Los Angeles Lakers for the last two seasons, was named today to replace Frank Ramsey as coach of the Ken, tucky Colonels in the Ameri can Basketball Association.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Fall at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly com petitive sale today of these shortterm securities:

title: Supreme Court to Weigh Mitchell's Wiretap View
description: WASHINGTON, June 21The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether the Government may engage in electronic sur veillance of people and groups it suspects of being subversive without first getting the ap proval, of the courts.

title: Trevino Calls Followers His Army of Lee's Fleas
description: Once, when Lee Trevino hit one of his long tee shots, the golf ball appeared headed for a bunker.

title: Carl Rose, Cartoonist, Is Dead at 68
description: ROWAYTON, Conn., June 21 Carl Rose, the cartoonist and illustrator, died at his home here, yesterday after a long ill nese, He was 68 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Men's Hats On to Saleswoman
description: When a pert young woman makes a sales call to the men's hat buyer of a depart ment or specialty store, the odds are that she'll be re ceived. And When she carries a line of unusual headwear designed specifically for the youth market, the odds are that she'll get a hearing.

title: 2 Paul Sills Shows to Close
description: The two Paul Sills produc tions, Story Theater and Metamorphoses, which have been given in repertory at the Ambassador Theater, will close on July 3. Story Theater will have been given 243 times and Metamorphoses 35 perform ances. Next season the shows will he done at the Eisenhower Theater in the John F. Kennedy Center in Washington. Also closing is Daniel Berrigan's The Trial of the Catonsville Nine, at the Lyceum Theater, on Saturday after 159 per formances.

title: SPECIAL CREDIT IN ARTS IS SOUGHT
description: In mathematics and the sci ences gifted students can move into advanced courses when they get to college. Why should they not have similar privileges in music and art?

title: Ford to Begin Making Pinto Engines in U.S.
description: DETROIT, June 21  The Ford Motor Company will spend $100million expanding its Lima, Ohio, engine plant to turn out fourcylinder engines by late 1973.

title: MSGR. G. M. PINNA, 64, VATICAN AIDE, DIES
description: ROME, June 21Msgr. Gio vanni Mania Pinna, who held the high position of Secretary of the Commission for the Re form of the Roman Curia died yesterday in a clinic here at the age of 64.

title: $250MILLON DRAWN BY U.S. FROM I.M.F.
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 The Treasury, Department an nouneed today a United States .drawing of $250million from the International Monetary Fund, partly as a consequence of the recent international mon etary turmoil.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Commodities: Drop in Silver Futures Spurs Bigest Loss in SilverCoin Options Since Trading Began
description: Silver futures prices dropped on the Commodity Exchange here yesterday after advancing in the previous session.

title: Policeman Shot by Prowler In Apartment Backyard
description: A 38yearold policeman was shot in a hand and foot early today in an exchange of shots with a prowler in the backyard of an apartment house on up per Broadway.

title: Chaplains' Role Questioned Because They Support War
description: Despite widespread church opposition to the Vietnam war, support for the United States war effort remains strong among many military chaplains. The chaplaincy, largely as a result, is under renewed fire by critics seek ing an end to the institution of clergymen in uniform.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal In Ginzburg Obscenity Case
description: The United States Supreme Court Yesterday denied Ralph Ginzburg, the publisher, a hear ing on a threeyear prison sen tence arising from an obscenity conviction.

title: Wyoming Guide Is Freed In ArtistRancher Death
description: CODY, Wyo., Juno 21  A jury of nine women and three men upheld today Park Coun ty's record of never a having convicted anyone of first degree murder by bringing in a not guilty verdict in the case. of Anson Eddy. Mr. Eddy was charged with the ambush shoot ing of artistdude rancher Rob ert E. Meyers.

title: NASA Hopes for Satellites To Track Other Satellites
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The space agency has called for preliminary design studies for satellites that would keep track of and handle data from other satellites.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Washington: For the Record
description: June 21, 1971 THE PRESIDENT Activities. The President and Mrs. Nixon celebrated their 31st wedding anniver sary in Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: Kissinger to Visit London
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 21 (Reuters)Henry A. Kis singer, President Nixon's for eign policy adviser, will go to London later this week for talks with the British Cabinet Secre tary, Sir Burke Trend, the White House announced today. Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary said that there would be an exchange of views of the operation of the Na tional Security Council and the comparable machinery in Lon don.

title: Governor Vetoes Two Measures Liberalizing Pension Benefits
description: ALBANY, June 21  Gover nor, Rockefeller, following the hard line taken by the recently adjourned Legislature on public employe pension bills, vetoed today a measure that would have extended the period of time during which policemen and firemen could elect to join halfpay retirement plans after 20 years of service.

title: HIRAM A. TAFT DIES; EXSHIP CAPTAIN, 72
description: Hiram A. Taft, a former captain in the Maritime Serv ice who recently retired as an analyst for Hornblower & WeeksHemphill Noyes, stock brokers, died Saturday in Long Island College Hospital, Brook lyn. He was 72 years old and lived at 204 Columbia Heights, Brooklyn.

title: Soviet Asking to See Defector in Britain
description: LONDON June 2 (AP)  The Soviet Union asked today to talk with a Soviet defector, de scribed as an expert in space travel, who is under the pro tection of British secret agents.

title: Sports of The Times
description: SEATTLE, June 21The voice broke in soft and cool above the sensitive guitar strings of Phil Upchurch.

title: 8 Drown in Idaho Reiervoir
description: OAKLEY, Idaho, June 21. (UPI)Eight persons, among them a husband and wife and their two children, drowned yesterday afternoon when their 14foot powerboat sank in lower Goose Creek Reservoir. The Sheriff's department found the bodies of Mrs. Annette Goodine and her 8yearold daughter. Other dead were identified as Mrs. Goodine's husband, Andy, and their son, James Shepherd, Charles Qualls, Harold Dibble and Raymond Moore.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Russians Fly Moonship Simulators at Texas Center
description: HOUSTON, June 21 (UN) Soviet and American space experts, exchanged technical papers on docking systems today and then the Russians took the controls of space craft simulators used to train United States moonlanding crews.

title: Yanks Meet Tigers Twice Here Today
description: The New York Yankees, back from a 13game trip during which they won seven games, will meet the Detroit Tigers in a double header at Yankee Stadium starting at 1 P.M. today.

title: Mansfield Offers Amendment For a Pullout Within 9 Months
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Senator Mike Mansfield, the Ma jority Leader, unexpectedly in troduced today an amendment to the Selective Service bill calling on the President to with draw all American forces from Indochina within nine months.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Excerpts From Ruling Denying Injunction Against Washington Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Following are excerpts from a transcript of the oral ruling today by Judge Gerhard A. Gesell refusing to grant an injunction against publication of classified Pentagon docu ments in The Washington Post:

title: Clear Verdict on Namibia
description: The decision of the International Court of Justice was crisp and clear: The continued presence of South Africa in SouthWest Africa being illegal, South Africa is under the obligation to withdraw its administration from Namibia [SouthWest Africa] immediately and thus put an end to its occupation of the territory.

title: HONG KONG ASKED TO CURB TEXTILES
description: HONG KONG, June 21 (UPI) American officials urged Hong Kong textile representatives to day to curb voluntarily their exports of noncotton goods to the United States. These talks followed similar bargaining by the Americans with other Asian trade partnersbargaining that apparently has produced little results.

title: Savings Deposits Reported
description: The 16 largest savings banks in New York City gained $71 million in deposits in the first half of June, the Savings Banks Association of New York State reported yesterday. While this gain was well ahead of the $10.6 million net inflow in the similar period last year, it rep resented a somewhat slower rate of gain than was charac teristic earlier in 1971.

title: A War on Waste?
description: In his war against what he considers wasteful expendi ture, President Nixon has repeatedly vetoed or impounded large sums appropriated by Congress for urban renewal and community development. Last year he allowed a new authorization of $1 billion for water and sewer lines to become law without his signature because he recog nized that a veto would be overridden. But his proposed budget contains no request for any money to carry out this authorization.

title: Pan Am Loss Continues;
description: Operations of Pan American World Airways, Inc., continued to show substantial deficits for the month of May and the first five months of this year, the company reported yesterday. A spokesman for the airline said that traffic so far this month showed little improve ment.

title: Ross Wins Two Matches In Eastern Clay Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., June 21Steve Ross of Brook lyn, who won the New Jersey title yesterday, went into ac tion and won two matches to reach the fourth round of the Eastern men's claycourt tennis championship today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: Mitchell Explains Position
