description: PHILADELPHIA, June 21 (Al) It is essential that the Amer ican public get full information on the Vietnam war, but this in formation should be made pub lic only at the appropriate time and in appropriate circum stances, Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today.

title: The War: The Record and the U.S.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.The publica tion by The New York Times of the secret documents about U.S. Govern ment decisions on the Vietnam War provides fuel for two great debates: one over what the United States did in the 1960's, and the other over what The Times did this June. Let me enter into that second debate.

title: Music: Met Musicians Aid Recitalist
description: Musicians of the Metropoli tan Opera Orchestra gave what amounted to a com munal show at Carnegie Re cital Hall on Sunday night, although the event was nominally a viola recital by Midhat Serbagi, a member of the orchestra.

title: Merger News
description: The PerkinElmer Corporation announced yesterday it has agreed in principle to acquire METCO, Inc., Westbury, L. I., a manufacturer of thermal and electricflame and plasmaspray equipment for applying metals and ceramics on metals and other materials, for stock worth about $42million. The agreement is subject to the preparation and execution of a definitive agree ment, the approval of the boards of both companies and the ap proval of METCO shareholders. PerkinElmer will exchange about 980,000 of its common shares for METCO. Perkin Elmer closed yesetrday on the New York Stock Exchange at 44, down 1.

title: LEESONA AND AIKNAN END LICENSING SUIT
description: The Leesona Corporation and Collins & Aikman Corporation announced yesterday that they had agreed to settle the lawsuit on licensing that has been pend ing in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of New York.

title: L.I. Bias Charged
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., June 21The New York State advi sory committee to the United States Commission on Civil Rights today heard experts from Nassau and Suffolk Counties de scribe what Franklin H. Wil liams, committee chairman, fi nally termed a pattern of dis crimination in hiring on Fed eral construction contracts on Long Island.

title: Selective Budget Cutting
description: The city budget is rounding toward final passage after long wrangling among all the politicians at City Hall and Albany. The end product will be something that involves too much spending for too little service, coupled with new municipal taxes onerous enough to hasten the departure of additional wealthy and middleincome families from the city.

title: WORLD COURT SAYS SOUTH AFRICA ERRS
description: THE HAGUE, June 21The International Court of Justice said in an advisory ruling to day that South Africa Was oc cupying SouthWest Africa il legally and that it should end its administration of the terri tory at once.

title: Italian Bishops Call on Public To Combat Decline in Morality
description: ROME, June 21  The Ital ian bishops conference ap pealed today to this country's government authorities, educa tors and public to react ef fectively against the rise in crime and the decline in public morality.

title: New Orders of Durables Turned Upward for May
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 New orders for durable goods, an important leading indi cator of the economy, rose in May after declining in the two preceding months, the Com merce Department reported to day on the basis of preliminary figures.

title: Commemorative Ceremony Held for 2 Slain Policemen
description: A commemorative ceremony was held yesterday in the 32d Precinct station house for Wav erly M. Jones and Joseph A. Piagentini, the two policemen who were slain one month ago.

title: Rumania to finance Columbia Professor
description: Rumania will pay the salary of a visiting professor of Ru manian and Southeast European studies at Columbia University beginning with the spring se mester of 1972.

title: New York G.I. Killed
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Pvt. Jeffrey D. Schumacher of Fairport, N. Y., of the Army, had been killed in action in Southeast Asia.

title: Roundup: McLain Losing at 30 Pace
description: Dennis McLain of the Wash ington Senatora may be head ed for another 30game sea son. But this year, the total would represent losses, not victories.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 22, 1971 GENERAL ASSEMBLY Special Committee on Colo nialism11 A.M.

title: Boulez Tests Open House Concert Idea in Vienna
description: VIENNA. June 21Pierre Boulez ended the Vienna Music Festival last night by ltesting his open house idea in the packed hall of the Vienna Konzerthaus.

title: JAPAN SET TO BACK G.M. AND ISUZU TIE
description: TOKYO, June 19 (Reuters) The Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today it would authorize a capital transaction between Isuzu Motors, Ltd., and the General Motors Corporation if Isuzu filed a formal application with the Ministry.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: GERMAN BID ASKED FOR SOVIET PLANT
description: MOSCOW, June 21 (Reuters) The Soviet Union has asked a West German company, Kloeckner HumboldtDeutz, for a tender to help build a Rus sian truckengine plant capable of producing 50,000 units a year, a company representative said today.

title: U.S. PULLOUT RATE DROPS IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 21 (UPI)American troop strength in Vietnam dropped last week by 2,300 men to a total of 244,900, the United States command announced to day.

title: Anticorruption Man Heads Upper West Side Police
description: Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday chose an of ficial from his anticorruption investigating team to take com mand of a unit he broke Up Sunday because of alleged in ability to locate an illegal Har lem bottle club.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Pollution FundsGain inHouse
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP)  The House Appropriations Committee approved today $28 million for an Environmental Protection Agency pollution re search center in Cincinnati. Construction is to begin within a few months, with completion due in 1975.

title: Inco Talking With Japanese On Nickel Deal in Indonesia
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., dis closed yesterday in Toronto that it was discussing with Japanese concerns a possible joint financing of nickel de velopment of Indonesia.

title: Laird Says Civilian Aides to Johnson Directed Spying by Army
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI)High civilian authorities in the Johnson Administration, not Pentagon officials, directed the Army to spy on private citizens, Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird said in Con gressional testimony released today.

title: Shop Talk
description: The Greek myths never die. They've been the inspira tion for a rash of women's jewelry for over a decade. Now a young American artist living in Italy has translated some of them into belt buckles and pendants for men.

title: Message of Street Theater Is Strong
description: The city's budgetary dif ficulties have made it plain that this summer will not be the street theater's happiest season, but advocates of the art have not lost their en thusiasm for taking theater to the people.

title: John S. Sumner, Foe of Vice, Dies
description: John S. Sumner, who as ex ecutive secretary of the Society for the Suppression of Vice waged war against the forces of evil in New York City, died ofprieumonia Sunday at the Floral Park (L.I.) Nursing Home He was 94 years old and at 87 Hawthorne Place, Manhasset, L. I.

title: BANK OPTIMISTIC ON CITY ECONOMY
description: Budgettime rhetoric not withstanding, New York City's economic health is improving, according to the First National City Bank. The bank's current newsletter cites a growing tax base, higherthanaverage per capita income and increased employment opportunities.

title: 3 LARGE U.S. AIRLINES BACK FEWER FLIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 21  The three major transcontinen tal airlines announced today that they had agreed to trim their schedules as much as 38 per cent on specific routes to cut costs and fill the planes that have been running more than half empty for over a year.

title: Letter From Head of Pentagon Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Following is the text of a letter on Jan. 15, 1969, from Leslie H. Gelb, head of the task force that wrote the Pentagon study on the Viet nam war, to the then Secre tary of Defense Clark M. Clifford, on the group's final report:

title: Death of a Youth In Jersey Linked To a Satanic Cult
description: VINELAND, N. J., June 21 Involvement in a Satan cult was described by the police to day as the reason behind the death of a young man found floating in a sand pit pond last Friday with his hands and feet taped together.

title: Business Boycott Urged
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 21  A South West African liberation group today urged governments with economic interests in the terri tory to halt their business transactions there because of the World Court decision.

title: King, Faisal in Alexandria
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, June 21 (Reuters)Big crowds wel comed King Faisal of Saudi Arabia and President Anwar elSadat when they arrived here today from Cairo for a three day visit.

title: Green Berets Save Woman
description: GORHAM, N.H., June 21 (AP) A group of Green Berets on maneuvers in New Hampshire's White Mountains rescued, today a Canadian woman who had fallen 50 feet from a ledge. The woman, Joan Murphy, 23 years old, of Norway House, Mani toba, was in a hospital in Han over in satisfactory condition.

title: Utility Reports Gains
description: The Mountain States Telea phone and Telegraph Company reported yesterday revenues had risen to $197,600,000 in the quarter ended May 31 from $176,800,000 a year earlier. Net income increased to $27, 431,598, or 56 cants a share, from $25,350, 612, or 51 cents a share, in the corresponding period of 1970.

title: Geoff Boycott Gets Century 10th Time in Test Cricket
description: LONDON, June 21 (Reuters) Geoff Boycott scored 100 runs for the 10th time in cricket test matches as the rainplagued second test be tween Pakistan and England headed toward a draw on the fourth day at Lord's Cricket ground today.

title: NADER AND OTHERS HIT LOCKHEED AID
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, and three economists testified today before the Sen ate Banking and Currency Com mittee that the nation would be better off with the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation bankrupt than with the enactment of a footinthedoor bill to save the aviation and defense giant from collapse.

title: Libby Holman Is Dead at 65;
description: STAMFORD, Conn., June 21 Mrs. Libby Holman Reyn olds Schanker, widow of a Reynolds tobacco heir,, and famous on Broadway in the late 1920's and early 1930's as Libby Holman, the blues singer, died here on Friday. She was 65 years old.

title: Apollo 15 Undamaged
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., June 21 (UPI)  Detailed systems checks showed today that Apollo 15 escaped damage from last week's thunder storms, and engineers planned to resume an important flight readiness test tomorrow at 10 A.M. The launching to the moon is set for July 26.

title: HERPES TREATMENT CALLED FAVORABLE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 21 A research team from Baylor College of Medicine reported here today that it had obtained favorable preliminary results with a new treatment that re duced individual occurrences of herpes simplex, he viral infec tion most commonly known as cold sores gar fever blisters.

title: Boston Gas Increase
description: BOSTON, June 21 (AP)The Massachusetts Department of Public Utilities approved today rate increases totaling about $3.8million for the Boston Gas Company. The average monthly residential increase will be about 25 cents for nonheating customers and $2.14 for people who heat with gas. The new rates are to take effect July 1.

title: Freeze on Land in Alaska Is Extended by Morton
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP)  Secretary of Interior Rogers C. B. Morton announced today a new extension of the freeze imposed for the last two and a half years on Fed eral lands in Alaska.

title: School Board Here Files Writ To Assure Students of Rights
description: Seven provisions protecting the right of high school stu dents to distribute almost any type of publication on school property were agreed to yes terday by the Board of Edu cation in a stipulation filed in Federal District Court in Man hattan.

title: Philip Predicts a Mess In Market's Farm Rules
description: LONDON, June 21Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, in ?? today in the Com mon Market controversy di viding Britain.

title: Court Upholds Conviction Of ExAide to McCormack
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) Acting in brief orders, the Supreme Court let stand today the perjury conviction of Mar tin Sweig, onetime adminis trative assistant to John W. McCormack, former Speaker of the House of Representatives.

title: HENRY J. MADER
description: POINT PLEASANT, N.J., June 21  Henry J. Mader, stockbroker with F. L duPont, Glore Forgan & Co., died yes terday at his home, 1118 Tren ton Avenue. His age was 65.

title: Fearing New Trouble, Ulster to Mark 50th Anniversary of Partition Quietly Today
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land, June 21The 50th an niversary of separate gov ernment in Northern Ireland is to be marked in subdued fashion tomorrow for fear of giving offense and provok ing violence.

title: Man in the News
description: The reputation for incor ruptibility of William Thomas Bonacum, the new com mander of the embattled Fifth Division in Upper Man hattan, extends through the Police Department all the way to his home in Amity vine, L. I.

title: THANT GETS TESTS AFTER DIZZY SPELL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 21  Secretary General Thant suffered a dizzy spell in his office Saturday and is now undergoing medical tests.

title: Medal Winner Links His Bravery to Marijuana
description: DETROIT, June 21 (AP)A Metal of Honor winner says he was stoned on marijuana the night he fought off two waves of Vietcong soldiers and won America's highest military honor.

title: Campbell of Navy Takes SingleHanded Sall Honors
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 21 Bill Campbell of Navy won in dividual honors today in the Intercollegiate Yacht Racing Association North American singlehanded championships in Chesapeake Bay.

title: Books of The Times
description: EXTRATERRITORIAL. Papers on Litarature and the Language Rovolution. By George Steiner. 210 pages. Atheneum. $7.95.

title: Notes on People
description: For years the United States has put up its Ambassador to the United Nations in a swanky suite at the Waldorf Astoria Towers, and since 1963, the hotel has been try ing to raise the rent from $33,000 a year to $55,000.

title: B52's Pound Enemy
description: SAIGON, Tuesday, June 22 (AP)American 852's report edly dropped 60 tons of explo sives around Fire Base Fuller yesterday in an attempt to smash a North Vietnamese force that assaulted the moun taintop outpost.

title: Welfare Recipients Rose To 14.4 Million in March
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The number of Americans on welfare rose 235,000 in March for another new monthly rec ord of 14.4 million, the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare said today.

title: The Quick Decline and Fall of Walter Ulbricht
description: BERLIN, June 19The era of Walter Ulbricht as the head of the East German Com munist system came to a defin itive end last week.

title: The War: The Record and the U.S.
description: AUSTIN, TexMr. Reston's column of June 13, 1971, says this:

title: Copper Tube Prices Cut
description: The Phelps Dodge Tube Company, a unit of the Phelps Dodge Corporation, announced yesterday that it had reduced its published list prices by about 5 per cent for copper water tube and related prod ucts, including copper tube for refrigeration and aircondi tioning. The action was taken to reflect competitive market conditions, the company said.

title: Nassau G.O.P. Picking Slates, And Incumbents Are Favored
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., June 21Nassau County Republican incumbents were nominated to night at the party's annual con vention here.

title: 4 Transport Aides Named
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) Secretary of Transportation John A. Volpe appointed four new members to the Urban Transportation Advisory Coun cil today. They are Louis J. Gambaccini, director of rail transportation for the Port of New York Authority; Paul Mc Gowan, Washington lawyer; C. S. Harding Mott, president of Charles Stewart Mott Founda tion, and Bruce W. Wyman, General Electric official.

title: Inflation Panel Urged
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) Senator charles McC. Ma thias, Republican of Maryland, urged today the formation of a new commission to advise the President on how to fight in flation. He said economy was still out of Control.

title: Gussie Moran Started It All
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 21 (AP) Teddy Tinling, the British dress designer who started making tennis outfits fashion able with Gussie Moran's laceembroidered panties back in 1949, is still at it.

title: House Groups Votes to Bar I.L.O Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 The House Appropriations Com Mitten approved today a bill specifically withholding United States dues to the International Labor Organization.

title: APPEAL REJECTED ON STOCK TOUTING
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The Supreme Court refused today to hear the appeal of an editor convicted of touting stock in his publication for pay.

title: Carolina Black Legislators. Back Welfare Reform Bill
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 21 Southern black legislators are organizing support for the wel fare reform bill now in Con gress as a first step in the right direction.

title: Vorster Rejects Opinion
description: PRETORIA South Africa, June 21Prime Minister Vors ter in a broadcast tonight re jected the World Court's opin ion on southWest Africa as an international political ven detta against South Africa.

title: 4 FROM MET STUDIO SING MUSICAL HITS
description: Vienna to Broadway was the promise of the final Tully Hall sampler on Sunday eve ning, and including intermedi ate stops in Paris and London, it was fulfilled in rollicking fashion by four vivaciously gifted members of the Metro politan Opera Studio. With Marshall Williamson lending a strong directional hand from the piano, Gail Nelson, soprano, Theresa TreadyayCarroll, mez zo Henry Price, tenor and Wayne Turnage, baritone, turned in solo and ensemble stints of easy zestful expertise.

title: Negro Slain by White Detective in Columbus, Ga.; Racial Tensions Deepening
description: COLUMBUS, Ga., June 21A 20yearold black man was shot to death here today by a white detective. Police officials said this evening that the slaying was not related to racial strife that disrupted this Army town over the weekend.

title: Britain and Market Gain In Shaping a Compromise
description: LUXEMBOURG, Tuesday, June 22Britain's efforts to join the European Economic Community advanced signifi cantly yesterday as the shape of a compromise began to emerge on the two most diffi cult issues remaining in the negotiations.

title: Arms Cache Found In Home Is Linked To ExC.I.A. Aide
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 21 (AP)The police say that a col lection of weapons and explo sives seized in a raid on two homes yesterday belongs to a former employe of the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: U.S. Ship Cuts Lobster Lines
description: BOSTON (AP)  The Wiley Fox, a Providence,. R. I., lobster fishing boat which has recently had trouble with foreign ves sels going through her lobster lines; told the Coast Guard to day an American ship damaged her traps this morning. The Coast Guard identified the other boat as the Delores out of Alliance, N. C.

title: 8 JUDGES TO SIT
description: A threejudge panel of the United States Court of Appeals here extended yesterday the re straining order against publica tion by The New York Times of material drawn from a classi fied Pentagon study of the Viet nam war to permit all eight members of the court to hear the case at 2 P.M. today.

title: Quake Hits Coast Area
description: LOS ANGELES, June. 21 (AP) A moderate earthquake shook parts of the Los Angeles area at 9.01 A.M. today. There were no reports of major damage. The quake registered 3.9 on the Richter scale and was centered in the San Fernando Valley.

title: Trevino's 68 Defeats Nick 3 Strobes in Open Playoff
description: ARDMORE, Pa., June 21, Lee Trevino threw a rubbber snake hi jest at Jack Nicklaus on the first tee today moments before they started their play off round. Then in earnest; the merry Texan tossed a two underpar 68 at his noted, ?? to beat him by three strokes for the United States Open golf title, The two had tied yesterday after the regulation 72 holes with scores of 280.

title: Illegal Liquor Clubs Reported To Flourish Everywhere in City
description: In the basements of apart ment buildings, in brownstones, behind storefronts, in every section of the city from Har lem to the East Side to Green wich Village, there are illegal bottle clube and afterhours clubs.

title: Trevino Wins Golf Open
description: Lee Trevino won the United States Open golf champion ship yesterday when he shot a twounderpar 68 and de feated Jack Nicklaus by three strokes in an 18hole playoff. (Details; on Page 23.)

title: COURT REJECTS PLEA TO ENJOIN NEW HAVEN
description: Judge John P. Fullam of the Federal District Court in Phila delphia, yesterday refused to grant an order enjoining the New Haven Railroad from ob taining a preferential lien against the Penn Central Rail road's Grand. Central Terminal properties.

title: Dr. Patricia Acquaviva Is Married
description: GREENSBURG, Pa., June 21Dr. Patricia Acquaviva, a resident physician at Harbor General Hospital in Torrance, Calif., and Harold Gabow, a doctoral candidate in com puter science at Stanford University, were married here this afternoon at the Seton Hill College Chapel.

title: Borrowing in May Declined In Commercial Paper Market
description: Berrowing in the commercial paper market declined $433 million during May after taking normal seasonal variations into account, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. The bank said that the drop was primarily a result Of a $361million drop, in bor rowing by major finance com panies that sell their unsecured corporation notes directly to in vestors.

title: President of I.O.S. Accuses 6 Seeking To Regain Control
description: GENEVA, Tuesday, June 22 Six former executives of Inves tors Overseas Services who are seeking to regain control of the mutualfund complex are ac cused by the present manage ment of having used company funds for personal gain.

title: 4 Cubans Serving Sentences
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., June 21 (AP)Four young Cuban fishermen convicted of violating United States terri torial waters have begun, serv ing sixmonth sentences in a Federal prison at Eglin Air Force Base. The four were also fined $10,000 each.

title: Southerner Is Named Head of Tax Service
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 21 (UPI)  President Nixon today named Johnnie M. Waltersi, a South Carolina tax expert now serving as an Assistant United States At torney General, to be Com missioner of the Internal Revenue Service.

title: AT LEAST ONE KILLED IN CABLE CAR PLUNGE
description: ELECTRON, Wash., June 21 (UPI) A cable car carrying 25 to 30 men from work at a power plant broke loose from its line today, spilling them down a 75foot cliff on the side of Mount Ranier. At least one Man was killed and 15 others injured.

title: British RecordChanger Maker Charged Here With Smuggling
description: A Federal grand jury indicted the world's largest manufac turer of record changers, yes terday on a charge of smug gling more than $1million worth of equipment into the United States.

title: American's Traffic Lags
description: The chairman of American Airlines, George A. Spater, an nounced yesterday that con tinued softness in the carrier's traffic could result in an omis sion of the thirdquarter divi dend on its common stock. In the first five months this year, the company operated at a $27.7million net loss.

title: Torch Singer in Hit Musicals
description: Libby Holman's flaring star dom as a Broadway torch singer was virtually snuffed out by personal tragedy that shadowed the rest of her life.

title: Court Declines to Act On a Mississippi Case
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP)  The Supreme Court declined unanimously today to press for the division of Hinds County, Miss., into singlemember legislative dis tricts.

title: MobileHome Plant Set
description: SYRACUSE, Ind., June 21 (UPI)Liberty Homes, Inc., an nounced plans today to build a plant at Leola, Pa., its eighth manufacturing facility. The company, a manufacturer of mobile homes, said production at the plant was scheduled to begin this fall.

title: Canada's Business Community Views New Tax Plan Favorably
description: TORONTO, June 21  De spite the introduction of Ameri canstyle capital gains taxation, the Canadian business and fi nancial community has taken a generally favorable view of the tax program the Government announced Friday.

title: Mill Told to Help Blacks Gain in Jobs
description: The United States Court of Appeals yesterday ordered the Bethlehem Steel Company and the United Steelworkers of America to permit black employes to transfer from hotter and dirtier jobs in the plant to higherpaying and cleaner jobs with no loss in seniority or pay.

title: Three Are Held in Killing Of Youth Near Chinatown
description: Three Chinese youths were arrested last night in connec tion with the fatal shooting of 19yearold Wing Sung Lee near the Manhattan Bridge Sunday might.

title: MARY GRACE DE LUCCIA
description: Mary Grace De Luccia, whose fight against illness was applauded at her graduation Saturday from Mount St. Mary on  the  Hudson, Newburgh, N.Y., died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital. She was 19 years old and lived at 116 Edgecliff Terrace, Yonkers, with her parents. Dr. and Mrs. Victor C. De Luccia.

title: A Camp for Handicapped Damaged and Ransacked
description: SPRING VALLEY, N.Y., June 21Weekend maraud ers on a thieving and vandal izing spree at nearby Camp Carola for indigent crippled children topped off their ef forts by taking all the toys, doll carrrages ana tricycles.

title: Odessa Woman Faces Trial
description: MOSCOW, June 21 (AP)  Reliable sources said today that a Jewish woman who wanted to emigrate to Israel would go on trial this week charged with distributing antiSoviet litera ture.

title: U.S. Reports a 0.5% Rise in Consumer Price Index Here in May
description: The Consumer Price Index in the New York metropolitan area rose by 0.5 per cent in May, the same increase as registered in the country as a whole, the Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported yesterday.

title: Keystone Hilliard Choice to Win Another Round in Trot. Series
description: YONKERS, June 21  Key stone Hilliard, the. 3yearold colt who won one of the two preliminary divisions in the Hilltop Trotting Series at Yon kers Raceway last week,, is the early favorite to capture an other $15,000 segment here to morrow night.

title: Gonzales Beats Orantes in 5 Sets at Wimbledon;
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 21Defying his 43 years, Pan cho Gonzales came back to Wimbledon's center court just one more time today and carved out a remarkable triumph over one of the best young tennis players in Europe.

title: Short Interest Declines On Big Board for Month
description: Short interest on the New York Stock Exchange, a widely watched technical ingredient in the stockmarket outlook, fell 168,151 shares in the month ended June 15, the Big Board reported yes terday. The decline was the second in two months and, according to some technical analysts, represented a nega tive factor in the outlook for share prices.

title: OBSERVER
description: Oh boy! thought Dick Straight upon waking up and smelling the honeysuckle that was growing on the fence under his open bedroom win dow. It is summertime again, and school is out, and I will go out and have some fun.

title: VIOLIN JAZZMEN PLAY LEE WORKS
description: One of the floating fascinn tions in the New York jazz world is Bill Lee and His New York Bass Violin Choir. Float ing because they turn up here and there on onenight stands playing, excerpts from any of the four folk operas that Mr. Lee has created. Fascinating because the choir is made up of seven of the best bass violin ists in New YorkRichard Davis, Ron Carter, Milt Hinton, Sam Jones, Lisle Atkinson, Mi chael Fleming and Mr. Lee and because Mr. Lee is a mar velously protean performer.

title: MAY PRICES ROSE AT TWICE THE RATE OF FIRST 4 MONTHS
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 Consumer prices rose in May at a rate twice as fast as in the first four months of the year, the Labor Department re ported today.

title: Swiss Weigh Offer
description: GENEVA, June 21The Swiss Government said today that the links it wanted with the Com mon Market should provide for more than free trade in indus trial goods.

title: Eastern Will Abandon Changes in Air Shuttle
description: Eastern Airlines announced yesterday that it would aban don on July 1 the changes it made last February in serv ice on its BostonNew York Washington air shuttle service.

title: Lindsay Tax Request Cut $127Million by Conferees
description: The City Council and Board of Estimate agreed yesterday to eliminate $127million from Mayor Lindsay's proposed $525million tax package and to lop about $50million off his proposed expense budget, coun cil and board members indicat ed yesterday.

title: Nefer Is a Fine Mummy But Not a New Discovery
description: CAIRO, June 21 (UPI)The director of the American Re search Center in Cairo said to day that a 4,500yearold mum my that has caused public excitement is the most perfect mummy: ever discovered but added that it was found some time ago.

title: Negro Fund Gets Esso Gift
description: The Esso Education Founda tion announced yesterday that it had contributed $75,000 to the United Negro College Fund. The foundation said $25,000 was for general distribution to the 36 accredited private liberal arts colleges that are members of the fund and the remaining $50,000 was for projects to be carried out by the fund's Department of Institutional Services.

title: RULING FOR POST
description: WASHINGTON, June 21A Federal district judge ruled today that The Washington Post could resume publishing a series of articles on United States involvement in the Viet nam war, but the Circuit Court of Appeals quickly ordered delay until 5 P.M. tomorrow.

title: AMEX PRICES FALL AS TRADING RISES
description: The American Stock Ex change closed sharply lower yesterday in slightly stepped up trading.

title: Vandalism Keeps Some Out of Pools
description: Towel sand swimming trunks under his arm, 13 yearold Jose Perez wistfully yesterday afternoon through an iron grill at the waterless and empty Crotona Park swimming pool in the East Bronx.

title: ARMY INQUIRIES SET ON VIETNAM DEATHS
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (AP) The Army announced today that a grand jury type of in vestigation had been ordered for Brig. Gen. John W. Donald son, charged with the murder of six Vietnamese civilians.

title: Benson Shoots 67 To Lead by Stroke In Westchester Golf
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., June 21Bobby Benson, a 5foot 9inch professional from Aspe tuck in Fairfield County, shot nothing but pars and birdies today and scored a 5underpar 34, 3367 in the first round of the 49th annual Westchester open golf tournament.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The return of the sque teague, or northern weakfish, to Rhode Island's Narragan sett Bay is a happy event for lighttackle anglers and re calls the days when these handsome fish were plentiful all along the northeast Atlan tic coast.

title: Equity and Producers Hopeful On a Pact by Sunday Deadline
description: With the threeyear contract between Actors Equity Associa tion and the League of New York Theaters scheduled to ex pire Sunday midnight, negotia tors met yesterday for several hours in an effort to formulate a new agreement.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Di Giorgio Corporation in San Francisco has elected Robert Di Giorgio as chairman and chief executive officer. He succeeds J. S. Di Gorgio who will continue as a director and chairman of the executive committee. Robert C. McCracken will be president.

title: STRIKING BUS DRIVERS FIGHT MANILA POLICE
description: MANILA, June 21  Student activists and jeepney drivers striking to protest, a proposed increase in oil prices barricad ed several key avenues of the city this morning and fought with homemade bombs against policemen who had come to re move the roadblocks.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, June 21The Supreme Court took the following actions today.

title: 28 Held in Protest on Minority Hiring
description: Twentyeight men were ar rested yesterday at a school construction site where they were demonstrating for the em ployment of more blacks and Puerto Ricans on such jobs.

title: Allies Pressing U.S. to Ease NATO Embargo on Sale of Strategic Goods to Red Nations
description: PARIS, June 20The United States is coming under increas ing pressure from Britain and its other allies to ease the NATO embargo on the sale of strategic goods to Commu nist countries.

title: Excerpts From the Government Brief
description: Following are excerpts from the Government brief sub mitted yesterday to the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, seeking to prevent publication by The New York Times of further articles in its series on Viet nam:

title: Bridge sometime It Pays to Stumble Into a Small Slam Contract
description: Every beginner learns that the partnership hands need 3334 high card points to jus tify a small slam effort if the distribution is balanced. But players of some experience do not always attend to this precept.

title: BELL ISSUE STEMS CORPORATE RALLY
description: A rally in the corporate bond market collided yesterday with a new $150million Bell Tele phone offering that provided investora with a 7.80 per cent yieldonetenth of a percentage point less than similar bonds were yielding on Friday. The rally lost.

title: CEREAL MEN DENY COMPETITION LAGS
description: WASHINGTON, June 21 (UPI) Major cereal companies said today that they were cooperat ing with a Government study that indicated high advertising costs drove up the price of their products by 15 to 25 per cent. The study also indicated that there was little or no price competition among brands. This the companies disputed.

title: Advertising: Frankfurt and Mattel Link Up
description: Stephen O. Frankfurt, who reached the heights in the agency business, is starting a new career at age 39.

title: Gen. Daniel Needham, 80, Led Massachusetts Guard
description: NEWTON, Mass., June 21 (UPI)Gen. Daniel Needham, former head of the Massachu setts National Guard and Mas sachusetts Commissioner of Public Safety, died yesterday at NewtonWellesley Hospital. His age was 80.

title: Ailing Mass Murder Suspect May Be Sent to San Quentin
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., June 21 (UPI)  The authorities are considering the transfer of the ailing mass murder suspect, Juan V. Corona, to San Quen tin prison because of its facili ties for treating heart ailments and other illnesses.

title: WINS Newscaster Is Reinstated After Six Months
description: A WINS radio newscaster, who was dismissed last Decem ber for quoting on the air an epithet used by former Soviet Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev about President Nixon, has been reinstated after arbitration and returned to work Friday night.

title: Emilie Hahn, an Instructor Of Music, Dies Here at 80
description: Emilie Hahn, a music teacher who studied with Emile Jaques Dalcroze, Swiss musician and educator, and helped introduce his method of music education in this country, died Sunday in St. Luke's Hospital after short illness. She was 80 years old and lived at 891 Amsterdam Avenue.

title: Reform Rabbi Asks MixedMarriage Ban
description: ST. LOUIS, June 21The head of the rabbinic body of American Reform Judaism called on the Reform rabbinate today not to officiate at any mixed marriage involving Jews and nonJews.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 21 (UPI)The A.E.C. today post poned indefinitely an under ground nuclear blast designed to test a device for recovering natural gas. The blast was put off because there was a slight flow of water into the hole into which the nuclear device was to be lowered.

title: Astronaut Tells of E. S. P. Tests
description: DURHAM, N. C., June 21 (AP) Capt. Edgar D. Mitchell Jr., the, astronaut, said today that four persons on earth parti cipated in the extrasensory perception experiment he con ducted during the Apollo 14 flight to the moon early in February.

title: Calley Prosecutor Testifies Army Blocked His Bid to Call Medina as Witness
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., June 21Aubrey M. Daniel 3d, the young Virginian who success fully prosecuted First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. for the massacre at Mylai, testified to day that the Army had blocked his attempt to call as a Govern ment witness Capt. Ernest L. Medina, who is about to stand trial here for overall respon sibility in the incident.

title: NIXON ADDRESSES TEAMSTER BOARD
description: KEY BISCAYNE,. Fla., June 21  President Nixon moved quickly today, to bolster his re lationship with the new leader ship of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters fol lowing James R. Hoffa's formal resignation as president of the union.

title: I.B.M. IS EXPANDING SOME MAINTENANCE
description: The International Business Machines Corporation an nounced yesterday that it would expand maintenance support of its teleprocessing systems and would make ad justments in some maintenance charges and terms for I.B.M. data processing equipment.

title: Eastern Lines Push Railroad Rate Rise
description: The Eastern railroads are try ing once more to convince the Western and Southern railroads that the industry should seek Interstate Commerce Commis sion authority for higher freight ratesthis time in the neigh borhood of about 2 per cent.

title: Anniversaries
description: WOODHappy Anniversary to Baby Blue Eyes, I year + I equals more than 2 years of happiness with you. With anticipa tory ?? I'll try for 3. Devotedly, D.

title: CHRYSLER MAKES MITSUBISHI DEAL
description: TOKYO, June 22Chrysler and Mitsubishi today an nounced detailed plans for a capital tieup in the Mitsubishi Motors Corporation following final Government and Bank of Japan approval of their joint project last week.

title: DROP CONTINUES IN STOCK MARKET
description: The stock market stumbled around yesterday like a boxer trying to stay alive for the next round.

title: KOLTON SUPPORTS NEW REGULATION
description: Paul Kolton, president of the American Stock Exchange, called yesterday for the crea tion of a new regulatory frame work for the securities indus try.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 1  No Title
Globe Relates '68 Decision
description: BOSTON, June 22 (UPI) The Boston Globe reported to day that the concluding part of the classified Pentagon study on the Vietnam War says that President Lyndon B. Johnson had decided to support South Vietnam but to reduce Ameri can troops in a policy that Pres ident Nixon later termed viet ntimization.

title: EXPLOSIVES FOUND NEAR SOVIET ESTATE
description: GLEN COVE, L.I., June 22 An explosive device was found this morning at the base of the stone wall near the en trance to the Soviet Union's estate here. It was ?? by the Nassau County police before it could do any damage.

title: ELLSBERG IS TO MAKE STATEMENT SHORTLY
description: BOSTON, June 22 (AP)The Boston Globe said today that Daniel Ellsberg, who was linked last week with the disclosure of secret Pentagon documents on Vietnam, to newspapers, plans to make a statement on his part in the matter.

title: Merger News
description: AmericanStandard, Inc., an nounced yesterday it had agreed to sell its land and shelter sub sidiary the Wm. Lyon Develop ment Company, to a group of investors headed by William Lyon, the founder and presi dent of the subsidiary, for 1$44.7million. The purchasing group, the WL Corporation, ex pects to complete its financing before the closing date of the transaction on Oct. 15 1971. AmericanStan dard purchased the Wm. Lyon Development Company in 1968.

title: JOSEPH P. WALSH, 68, A SINCLAIR COUNSEL
description: Joseph P. Walsh, who re tired in 1967 as general coun sel of the Sinclair Oil Com pany, died Monday of a sud den illness at his home, 18230 Wexford Terrace, in the Ja maica Heights section of Queens. He was 68 years old.

title: CALIFORNIA WINS WELFARE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The Federal Government has removed a threat to cut off $684million in welfare funds for California, but the state faces the possibility of another such cut.

title: Nixon Will Visit Indiana And Chicago This Week
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI) President Nixon will visit In diana and Chicago later this week to combine speechmak ing and a ceremony honoring the birthplace of his mother, Hannah Milhouse Nixon, the White House said today.

title: I.L.O. AIDE CONFIDENT DESPITE DUES ISSUE
description: GENEVA, June 22C. Wil fred Jenks, Director General of the International Labor Organi zation, said today that the United Nations agency was not going down the drain because of the failure of the United States to pay its dues.

title: Merrill Lynch Expected To Offer Issue Today
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fen ner & Smith Inc., the broker age house giant is expected to make the first public offer ing of its common stock this morning after final consulta tion with the three independ ent banking concerns retained as advisers.

title: Scholar Disputes Key to Trumbull Oil
description: Who's the man wearing the hat in The Declaration of In dependence, John Trumbull's famous painting of the na tion's founding fathers?

title: SORCERY COMPLETES NEWPORT RACE FIRST
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 22 James French Baldwin's 61foot sloop, Sorcery, was the first yacht to finish the biennial An napolistoNewport yacht race tonight. Sorcery crossed the finish line at 9:50 P.M. Her elapsed time for the 473 mile race was 77 hours 50 minutes 21 seconds and her corrected time was 68 hours 18 minutes.

title: Adoptive Parents Awarded Baby Lenore
description: MIAMI, June 22The custody of Baby Lenore was awarded here today to her adoptive Parents, Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas DeMartino, who fled with The child to Florida after New York courts ordered them to sur render the child.

title: Sports of The Times
description: He had on a blue suit, a blue shirt and a blue striped tie, as if anticipating a blue Monday.

title: JAMES N. GEHRIG, FORMER L.I. JUDGE
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., June 22 James N. Gehrig, a former Nassau County District Attor ney and the first fulltime Children's Court judge in the county, died today in Mercy Hospital, Rockville Centre. He was 83 years old and lived at 75 St. Paul's Place.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: HAVEN'T YOU ALWAYS WANTED TO KNOW how Christian Science heals? For information about nearest church services Call (212) 7657770Advt.

title: U.S. Warns Schools in South on Integration Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The Department of Health Edu cation and Welfare told the first 39 of some 80 Southern and Border State school dis tricts today that they must comply with the Supreme Court's tough new decision on school desegregation to qualify for Federal assistance.

title: EXI.O.S. EXECUTIVES CALL VESCO LOOTER
description: A group of six former exec utives of Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., who are seeking proxies for the June 30 an nual meeting, yesterday again charged deliberate looting of the mutualfund complex by Robert L. Vesco, present I.O.S. chairman, and by the concern of which he is also chairman, the International Controls Corp oration.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Frank J. Quayle Is Dead at 79; Fire Commissioner in the '40's
description: Frank J. Quayle, an oldline Democratic politician in Brook lyn who served as Sheriff of Kings County, Postmaster of Brooklyn and City Fire Com missioner, died yesterday in Long Island. College Hospital, Brooklyn and city Fire Com and lived at 9101 Shore Road, Broolyn.

title: No Stampede for That Gown
description: It was possible yesterday to buy a reasonably accurate facsimile of the sleeveless, Vnecked dress Tricia Nixon wore at her White House wedding June 12 to Edward Finch Cox, but prospective brides weren't exactly, knock ing down the doors.

title: Roberts Says Four Parties Back Him for Prosecutor
description: District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx said yes terday thta he had received en dorsements from four political parties, virtually assuring him of reelection this fall to a full, fouryear term.

title: Rates Raised in Montreal
description: MONTREAL, June 22 (Reu ters)The Montreal Trust Company and the Royal Trust Company both said today they are increasing to 8 per cent from 7.5 per cent the interest rate on their fiveyear guairan teed investment certificates. The companies said the action reflects strong demand for mortgage funds.

title: HART BEATS FULLMER FOR 20TH STRAIGHT
description: PHILADELPHIA, Tune 22 (AP) Eugene (Cyclone) Hart gained a unanimous decision over Don Fullmer in a 10round battle tonight to notch his 20th con secutive professional victory in his climb up the middleweight ladder.

title: Job Action in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 22 (AP) Most school bus drivers and custodians, did not work today, in protest's against budget cuts by the Board of Education that eliminated jobs and summer school. A spokesman said that nine of the city's 250 school bus drivers reported for work this morning. Some 3,800 cus todial workers and bus drivers were involved in the oneday walkout.

title: VENEZUELA GETS OILBILL WARNING
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 22The foreign petroleum in dustry, producer of 98 per cent of this country's crude oil, warned today that pending leg islation here to control its op erations could undermine Ven ezuela's position as one of the world's major suppliers of fuel.

title: ROCK SHOW DISPUTE IN LOUISIANA ENDS
description: McCREA, La., June 22 (AP)  Local officials and promoters of the Celebration Life rock festival reached a compro mise agreement on health and Sanitation regulations today and the start of the event was scheduled for tomorrow eve ning.

title: EDWARD J. SINCLAIR
description: SUFFERN, N. Y., June 22 Edward J. Sinclair, a former sports writer, died today at his home here. He was 50 years old.

title: Economic Analysis
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., June 22 A dense fog moved in shortly after the opening of a monetary conference, sponsored here this week by the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston and soon be came a fog of battle. To the historic list of great antagonists the Medes and the Persians, the Guelphs and the Ghibellines the Montagues and the Capuletseco nomics has now added the mone tarists and the fiscalists, other wise known as the Friedman ites and the Keynesians. They were at each other's throats throughout this conference in efforts to explain how changes in the money supply and inter est rates are linked to consumer spending and the economy gen erally.

title: DR. GEORGE MILLER, TUFTS OFFICIAL, 87
description: MEDFORD, Mass., June 22 (AP)  Dr. George S. Miller, dean emeritus of administration and former head of the Depart ment of Government of Tufts University, died last evening. He was 87 years old.

title: Ballet: Cuban Repertory
description: MONTREAL, June 22  What is to be expected of a ballet company from Cuba? The Ballet National de Cuba is now on its first North American tour, or rather its first Canadian tour, because it would be far too corrupt ing for us in the United States to have these dancers come south of the Canadian border. We may be so struck by the way they dance Swan Lake that as a nation we may spontaneously demand Fidel Castro as President or as the next Johnny Carson.

title: FOG BIG WINNER AT BLOCK ISLAND
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., June 22 Fog, that Machiavellian denizen of Block Island wa ters, played more tricks today on most of the 182 yachts try ing to race around the island. As a result, three classes were not able to complete the course.

title: SENATE BACKS A VIETNAM PULLOUT IN 9 MONTHS IF P.O.W.'S ARE FREED
FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISLeonid I. Brezhnev, Secre tary General of the Soviet Communist party, is coming to France on a proto colbreaking official Visit this autumn. Mr. Brezhnev, who holds no govern mental office, will nevertheless be treated here as if he were a Chief of state by decision Of this recognized capital of international decorum.

title: Whelan Is Linked to $1.25Million
description: NEWARK, June 22  A Florida bank official testified in Federal Court here today that Mayor Thomas J. Whelan of Jersey City and City Coun cil President Thomas M. Fla herty deposited in his bank $1.25million in cash and muni cipal bearer bonds in nameless numbered accounts between 1968 and 1970.

title: MRS. HART POSTS 5AND4 TRIUMPH
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 22 Mrs. A. Sherburne Hart of Baltusrol led the field into the second round of the 68th an nual Women's Metropolitan Golf Association championship to day.

title: Advertising:
description: Hanno Fuchs, for the last six months president ,:and creative director of Richard K. Manoff, Inc., has quit the; agency. The board direc tors yesterday replaced hint in the presidency with Rus sell K. chaffer, who has been executive vice president and chief operating officer.

title: Article 6  No Title
Kennedy Administration Role
description: BOSTON, June 22 (AP)The Boston Globe said today that it was making public for the first time the role of the Kennedy Administration in the escalation of the war.

title: New San Jose Bomb Scare
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., June 22 (AP)A pipe bomb hidden in a purse failed to go off at a City Council meeting last night and was removed by the police after about 400 persons had been evacuated. Three other council meetings had been dis rupted by bomb threats in the last year. No bombs were found after the threats.

title: KENNEDY REPORTS ON PAKISTAN ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, June 22A spokesman for Senator Edward M. Kennedy said today the State Department had in formed the Senator that two freighters now sailing from New York to Karachi were carrying ammunition for the Pakistani armed forces.

title: Abetting Repression
description: Responding to public and Congressional shock and anger over the Pakistan Government's savage repression of Bengalis seeking autonomy in East Pakistan, the State Department sent a letter to the Senate Foreign Rela tions Committee last April 23, saying:

title: Frances Conkey Wed to Physician
description: JENKINTOWN, Pa., June 22 Miss Frances Hudson Con key, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert B. Conkey of Chest nut Hill, Philadelphia, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Peter Grier Trafton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Willis A. Trafton Jr. of Auburn, Me. The Rev. David Johnson, a Presbyterian minister, per formed the ceremony on the terrace adjoining the Abing ton Friends Meeting.

title: Critics Assert A.S.P.C.A. Here Is Guilty of Cruelty to Animals
description: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, the primary caretaker for stray animals in the city for more than 100 years, has become the target of mounting criticism, demonstrations and even proposed legal action from members of humane organiza tions who charge that some of the society's practices are in humane and some of its em ployes are cruel to animals.

title: The F.B.I. Reconsiders
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has cleared the good name and professional record of former agent John F. Shaw by removing from his resignation the damaging official judgment that he left with prejudice. In addi tion, the bureau agreed to pay Mr. Shaw $13,000 in back wages. This vindication, apart from erasing an injustice, assumes special significance because Mr. Shaw had been the victim of personal reprisals on the part of F.B.I. director J. Edgar Hoover.

title: 1968: L.B.J. and Rostow in White House
description: WASHINGTONI am grateful to The Times for affording me this op portunity to explain why I think the action of the paper in Publishing se lected portions of the highly classified Gelb study was contrary to the na tional interest.

title: $8.56Billion City Budget is Adopted; No Immediate Layoffs Are Involved
description: An $8.56billion city budget half a billion dollars short of What Mayor Lindsay had called a survival budget  was adopted last night.

title: REVIEW OF REPORT PROPOSED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 22The Government offered today to begin an interagency review of the secret Pentagon study of American involvement in Viet nam to determine how much of it could be declassified.

title: Overseas Mail Rule Stiffened
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)  Sealed letters from abroad may be opened to search for narcotics or other contraband under the terms of new mail regulations announced today.

title: Article 7  No Title
Lawyer Is a Good Man, Charlie Brown
description: At night he is Charlie Brown, the befuddled, inse cure 5yearold on the stage of the Golden Theater. During the day he is Dean Stolber, a 26yearold lawyer in the of fices of United Artists.

title: CHARLES KELLY, 80, CRIMINAL LAWYER
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., June 22 Charles Patrick Bernard Kelly, a lawyer and criminologist, died yesterday at Heritage Village. He was 80 years old and had homes here and in New York.

title: HOUSE APPROVES WELFARE REFORM BY 288132 VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The House approved tonight a sweeping revision of the na tion's muchcriticized welfare system that will bring most of it under Federal control and establish for the first time a national income for poor fam illies.

title: Blacks Score Small Business Loan Agency
description: A growing number of black businessmen in the New York area are increasingly critical of the Federal Small Business Administration, despite a sig nificant increase in loans to businessmen from minority groups in recent years.

title: Venezuela's Reserves Gain
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 22 (UPI)Venezuela's central bank reported today the coun try's international reserves at $1.2billion, the highest in the last 15 years. The bank esti mated reserves could pass the $1.3billion mark by the end of the year, which would be the highest total since 1956, the year in which foreign oil com panies made extra large pay ments to the state for their concession.

title: New Talks Are Set in Newark Newspaper Strike
description: NEWARK, June 22  The Evening News of Newark and the striking North Jersey News paper Guild agreed today to a Federal mediator's call for a negotiating session on Friday at 11 A.M. at the office here of the mediator, Joseph DeLor enzo.

title: Seoul Weighs Vietnam Pullout in '72
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  South Korea has informed the South Vietnamese Government it is thinking seriously of with drawing all of its nearly 50,000 troops from Vietnam over the next 18 months according to Nixon Administration and diplo matic sources.

title: Cricket Test Ends in Draw
description: LONDON, June 22 (Reuters) The second cricket test be tween England and Pakistan ended in a draw today. Eng lang had 241 runs for two wickets declared and 117 for no wicket to Pakistan's 148. The first test also was drawn.

title: Rembrandt Print Sold For $83,000 in London
description: LONDON, June 22, (Reu ters)The Rembrandt print, Christ Presented to the People: Ecce Homo, was sold here today for $83,000, a world auction record for a print. It was bought by a London dealer.

title: Summary of Major Provisions of Omnibus Welfare Bill Approved by the House
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Following are the major pro visions of the omnibus wel fare bill approved by the House today:

title: HAY FEVER FORCES RYUN OUT OF MILE
description: EUGENE, Ore., June 22 Marty Liquori and Jim Ryun will meet tomorrow afternoon, but for a boat trip not a mile race at the national Amateur Athletic Union outdoor track championships here.

title: LUXURY HOUSING CUT IN YORKVLLE PLAN
description: The city was reported yes terday to have dropped plans to include luxury housing in the mixedincome Ruppert Brewery Urban Renewal project in Yorkville.

title: Legislature in Pennsylvania Backs Local Voting at 18
description: HARRISBURG, pa., June 22 The legislature completed passage today of a bill to lower the voting age from 21 to 18 for all elections in the state.

title: O'Brien Asks Campaign Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP)  The Democratic National Chairman Lawrence F. O'Brien wrote today to all Democratic Senators, urging that Congress pass legislation to permit public financing of next year's Presi dential campaign.

title: Realty Equities Head Urged to Cut Pay
description: Morris Karp, president of the Realty Equities Corporation, which lost $13.2million in fiscal 1970, was urged by by a number of stockholders at the annual meeting yesterday to take a cut in salary.

title: BOLIVIAN TROOPS PLACED ON ALERT
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, June 22 (Reuters)Bolivia was under a state of emergency today with troops on alert to guard against a reported rightwing plot to overthrow President Juan Jose Torres.

title: Bridge: Significance of Vulnerability Tied to Bidding Competition
description: The significance of vulner ability during the bidding varies greatly according to circumstances. If one side is bidding without interruption to a contract it expects to make the vulnerability hardly matters. The more competi tive the auction, the more significant does the vulner ability become.

title: Tulsa Bank Raises Rate
description: The National Bank of Tulsa, Okla., a $350million institution that ranks 180th in size among banks in the country an nounced yesterday an increase in its prime lending rate to 6 per cent from 5 1/2 per cent effective immediately. At the same time the bank also raised the rates that it pays on some consumer thrift accounts.

title: TV Workshop Will Dramatize Reading Lessons for Children
description: The Children's Television Workshop, producer of Sesa me Street, yesterday unveiled its second experimental educa tional series designed to teach basic reading skills to children in the second, third, and fourth grades.

title: The Glory That Was Paris
description: The French talk a great deal about civilization. One may expect vandalism in New Yorkbut not in Paris. One expects the French to be civilized.

title: RAGAINI, AMATEUR, WINS OPEN BY SHOT At WESTCHESTER
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., June 22Dave Ragaini, a 29year old amateur golfer who sings commercial jingles for a living, stunned some of the area's best professional golfers today by winning the 49th annual West chester open championship on his home course at Wykagyl Country Club.

title: Brockport Gets Sports Head
description: CHAMPAIGN, III., June 22 (AP)Richard S. Youngber re signed as golf coach at the University of Illinois today to become director of athletics at Brockport, (N.Y.) State.

title: REALTY UNITS ACT TO SHIELD TENANTS
description: Seven realestate groups rep resenting virtually all owners of apartmeat houses in the city announced yesterday that they would take specific steps to prevent any harassment of ten ants as a result of the recent vacancy decontrol law.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 22 (AP) Unranked Eddie Linder scored an upset splitdecision victory over the No. 1 contender, Ismael Laguna of New York in a 10 round lightweight bout tonight.

title: ALCOA WILL CLOSE SMELTER POTLINE
description: The Aluminum Company of America announced yesterday that it would shut down a 25 000ton potline at its Alcoa. Tenn., smelter beginning July 3 to help keep the primary aluminum supply more closely in line with demand.

title: Chile Gets Poking Envoy
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 22 Lin Ping, the first arnbassador of Communist China to Chile; presented credentials today to President Salvador Allende Gos sens Chile is the second Latin American country, with Cuba, to have full diplomatic relations with Peking

title: LEOPOLD SNEIDER, 75, MANUFACTURER, DIES
description: Leopold J. Sneider, retired president of the Magid Com pany, handbag manufacturers, died in his sleep yesterday at his home, 19 East 88th Street. He was 75 years old.

title: Welfare RollCall
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) Following is the vote by which the House refused today, 234 to 187, to delete welfare reform from a Social Security bill. A vote for was a vote to delete.

title: Chemical Bank Loses Suit Involving Master Charge
description: More than 130,000 holders of Master Charge credit cards may be entitled to a gift of $100 from Chemical Bank as the re sult of a decision handed down last week in Federal Court here.

title: Governor Signs City Housing Loan Bill
description: ALBANY, June 22Governor Rockefeller today signed three bills creating a New York City Housing Development Corpora tion.

title: Rising Arrests Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (Reuters) The State Depart ment said today that Ameri cans were being jailed abroad on narcotics violations at an alarming rate and warned trav elers that severe sentences in primitive jails were often im posed.

title: Leichter to Seek Investigation by State Into Rents City Pays for Public DayCare Centers
description: Assemblyman Franz S. J. Leichter said yesterday that he would call for an investigation into the rents being paid by the city to landlords for public daycare centers.

title: Text of Mansfield's Pullout Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Following is the text of the Mansfield amendment to the Selective Service bill, as adopted today by the Senate:

title: CONFEREES VOTE 200,000 NEW JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)Republicans and Dem ocrats from the House and Senate worked out a com promise bill today creating 200,000 governmental jobs for the unembployed.

title: Washington Crew Wins PanAmSpot
description: SYRACUSE, June 22 The University of Washington crew, which had come East from Seattle last week undefeated only to lose the national col lege championship to Cornell, won a summer trip to South America today.

title: Boston Globe, Third to Publish Articles on Secret Study, Is Restrained by Court
description: BOSTON, June 22  The Boston Globe today became the third newspaper to publish ma terial drawn from the secret Pentagon study of the Vietnam war. The Justice Department immediately moved to bar the newspaper from publishing fur ther material on the ground that national security was jeop ardized.

title: PEFCO's First Major Loan Goes to Taiwan Power Co.
description: The Private Export Funding Corporation which was orga nized by a consortium of major American banks to promote the sale of big ticket exports from the United States an nounced yesterday its first major financing  a $27mil lion mediumterm loan to cover a portion of the cost of a $104 million nuclear power develop ment by the Taiwan Power Company.

title: AMERICAN ELECTRIC PLANS STOCK OFFER
description: The American Electric Power Company announced yesterday plans for selling 5.4 million shares of its authorized but un issued $6.50 par.value common stock.

title: Growing Old Theme of Women's Rally
description: A gentle and lyrical attack on the myth that growing old is terrible was mounted on West 57th Street yester day by a group of women artists, poets and writers who have formed a guerrilla theater to put on street theater demonstrations.

title: Lutz Conquers Froehling In Wimbledon Marathon
description: WIMBLEDON, England June 22 In his comeback year Frank Froehling 3rd was twice within a point of victory today in a fiveset 71game marathon fought over two days in shadow and sunlight against Bob Lutz.

title: Roundup: Control Pitcher Slips
description: Steve Renko Went wild last night. And the loss of con trol by the Montreal Expos' righthander contributed heav ily to a 40 victory by the At lanta Braves.

title: Sewage Plan For Boats Scored At U.S. Evironmental Hearing
description: Proposed Federal regulations that would require commercial and private boat owners to treat raw sewage before dump ing it into coastal and inter state waterways were criticized here yesterday.

title: Lilienthal Finds Source of Hope Housewives
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 22To David E. Lilienthal, whose pioneering experience with giant dams and nu clear energy has made him an expert on power, the United States stands on the threshold of a new political force that recalls the Populism of the 1890's. He would call the force housewife power.

title: Drug Said to Fight Mushroom Poison
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 22 Dr. Albert J. Finestone of Tem ple University Hospital has re ported on the swift recovery of a mushroom poisoning victim after what he believes is the first use in this country of a drug produced abroad.

title: Bishop Obtains Financing, Ending Chapter XI Phase
description: Bishop Industries, Inc., pro ducer of toiletries and beauty aids, announced yesterday the end of its proceedings under Chapter XI of the Federal Bank ruptcy Act. An arrangement, which provides for payment to the unsecured creditors of 20 per cent of their claims, was issued by Federal District Court in New Jersey.

title: Brinks Defendant Pleads Guilty and Gets 10 Years
description: BOSTON, June 22 (AP)A fourth defendant pleaded guilty today to the $1.1million Brink's armored robbery in 1969 and received a 10to15year sen tence in Walpole State Prison.

title: Homage Is Paid to Josquin des Prez
description: Musicologists, performing musicians, students and plain listeners are invading the Juil liard Theater and Alice Tully Hall this week to honor a com poser who died 450 years ago.

title: Foe Attacks Delta Village and Aid Force
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, June 23 (AP) Guerrilla forces swept through a village in the Mekong Delta early yesterday and then am bushed a Government relief force, reportedly inflicting heavy casualties.

title: Bill Would Growers
description: ANKARA, Turkey, June 22 (AP)  The Turkish Assembly, passed and sent to the Senate today a bill to license opium growers and to increase penal ties for illicit opium trading.

title: Post Offices to Accept Passport Applications
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (Reuters)Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Post master General Winton M. Blount signed an agreement today giving post offices across the country authority to accept applications for United States passports.

title: PRICES RETREAT IN BOND MARKETS
description: Bond prices staged a general retreat yesterday, responding to news of accelerating consumer price increases and a tendency for prospective buyers to hold back for still higher yields.

title: TV: Beyond the Reruns
description: It's officially summer and, in television, it's officially the season of old movies and reruns, though more alert viewers may have detected the blooming of that par ticular season a couple of months ago, Now audiences will be given a second, or even third, chance to revel in the delights they so as siduously managed to avoid the first time around.

title: 2 Soviet Diplomats Expelled by Britain On Spying Charge
description: LONDON, June 22  The British Government has or dered out of the country two Soviet diplomats detected in intelligence operations against the United Kingdom, the For eign Office announced today.

title: Market Place: Taking Look At Big Banks
description: Shortterm Money rates have been rising precipit ously since the beginning of April. As a result money market banks are about to go through an earnings wringer, after showing generally ex cellent firstquarter results.

title: Retroactive Pay To Relief Families Ordered Upstate
description: ALBANY, June 22In com pliance with a recent decision by the United States Supreme Court, the State Department of Social Services today ordered that about $13million in retro active welfare payments be given before Aug. 1 to an esti mated total of 80,000 families in upstate New York.

title: Greyhound Is Accused by U.S.;
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Government asked a Federal court today to find the Greyhound bus system in criminal contempt of court for allegedly disobeying a court order prohibiting it from en gaging in destructive practices against a small Western bus line.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today June 23, 1971
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Special Committee on Co lonialism3 P.M.

title: Laird Says Agreement Is Near With Turkey to Curb Drug Flow
description: WASHINGTON June 22 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird told a Senate panel today that the United States and Turkey were nearing an agree ment designed to end the illicit opium traffic from Turkey.

title: Victory for Welfare Reform
description: The decision of the House of Representatives to en dorse welfare reform is an important breakthrough on this embattled social front. By its action, the House has affirmed the sound principle that there should be a financial floor under every family in the nation. It has also recognized that there is not a sharp dividing line between the working poor and the unemployed who are on welfare. Because poverty is a complex condition, bene fits have to be graduated to reflect the changing circum stances of each family and to provide a mixture of help and workincentives.

title: CUBAN AIDE ENDS 11DAYSOVIET TRIP
description: MOSCOW, June 22  The Soviet Union and Cuba today made public a communiqu that was intended to show improved relations between the two countries but that was deliberately vague on Latin American policy.

title: Executive Changes
description: Revere Copper and Brass, Inc., announced yes terday the election of Fritz C. Hyde Jr. as vice chairman and William F. Collins as president. Mr. Hyde who has been president of the metals com pany since 1965, joined Revere in 1935. Mr. Collins, who has been executive vice presidentlegal and financial since 1967, has been associated with the company since 1952, when he became an assistant general counsel.

title: Article 5  No Title
General Denies Decision to Try Medina Was to Protect Army
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., June 22The commanding general of the Third Army denied today that the decision to court martial Capt. Ernest L. Medina had been dictated by any de sire to protect the Army's pub lic relations image.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Treasury, Reducing Tax, Allows Fast Depreciation
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The Treasury announced today that despite widespread crit icism, it was putting into effect a multibilliondollar tax re duction for business by liberal izing the deductions that may be taken for depreciation of equipment.

title: Houthakker Sees Easing Of Monetary Turbulence
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  A member of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers told Congress today that the outcome of the recent international monetary turmoil had been on the whole favorable. Hendrik S. Houthakker, who will be leav ing the council July 15, said, the international monetary situation, and the United States balanceofpayments position are not as bad as many believe them to be.

title: Josefita Arias of Panama; Consul General in 194041
description: PANAMA, June 22Josefita Arias, a former Consul General of Panama in New York and a sister of Dr. Arnulfo Arias, the ousted President, died last night in Panama City, She was 76 years old.

title: Zand, Jewish Scholar, Regains Soviet Permit for Emigration
description: MOSCOW, June 22Mikhail I. Zand, a Jewish scholar in Persian and Arab literature, has again received permission to emigrate with his family to Israel. A month ago the author ities canceled his exit papers because he had been in contact with foreign newsmen.

title: CURTIS AND EXHEAD SETTLE LITIGATION
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 22 (AP)Curtis Publications and Philip P. Kalodner, former presi dent and director of the Curtis Publishing Company, have set tled litigation that Curtis brought against Mr. Kalodner earlier this year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SILVER FUTURES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Silver futures prices rose yesterday in active trading on the Commodity Exchange here after dropping sharply the day before.

title: When the DinnerParty Host Is Chou Enlai
description: PEKING, June 21Dinner with Premier Chou Enlai is a gourmet delight. Even the table talk, centered on hard political issues, couldn't detract from the joy of eating numerous superbly prepared and served exotic dishes.

title: F.B.I. Men Visit Congressman on Papers He Holds
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  Two agents of the Federal Bu reau of Investigation inter viewed Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr. today about doc uments he has relating to the Vietnam war.

title: Behind Masks, Women's Lib
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn.As Suzanne Benton sees it, the masks she makes are one way of liberating women.

title: City Realty Tax Rise Is Lowest in 9 Years
description: The city budget adopted yesterday provided for the smallest increase in basic realestate taxes in nine years 8 cents for every $100 of assessed valuation.

title: Sunday Racing Canceled
description: STANTON, Del., June 22 (UPI) racing hit been canceled for the rest of the harnesstrack season at Brandywine Raceway. Howard Miller, track president, said to day the sevenday week was too great a physical burden on the horsemen and other track personnel.

title: RABBI CHIDES U.S. ON PLEAS FOR AID
description: ST. LOUIS, June 22An ex pert in Jewish political and social issues asserted today that Jewish pressures are of minimal influence on govern ment policy concerning Jewish problems the world over.

title: Mets Beat Pirates, 32;
description: PITTSBURGH, June 22  Cleon Jones impressed Manager Gil Hodges in a secret batting practice in the afternoon, and Nolan Ryan impressed all the city boys by outmilking Bob Veale in a pregame cowmilking contest.

title: BUYING POWER UP ALONG WITH PAY
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP)  The Government said today that most of the nation's workers gained in pay and pur chasing power last month, somewhat softening the impact of the year's sharpest rise in consumer prices.

title: Two Dodgers Out
description: LOS ANGELES, June 22 (AP) The Los Angeles Dodgers have lost their catcher, Duke Sims, and shortstop, Maury Wills, for a few days. Wills has a back injury and Sims a strained neck.

title: Paris Gets Authority to Limit Number of Medical Students
description: PARIS, June 22The Nation al Assembly approved early to day a bill authorizing the Gov ernment to set quotas on the number of medical students after the freshman year.

title: GOTTLIEB CHARGE UPHELD BY COURT
description: ALBANY, June 22A State Supreme Court justice has up held charges that a letter sent by a Democratic Assemblyman to his constituents at state ex pense was censored by work ers in the Republicancon trolled Assembly's mailroom.

title: 71 Construction Estimate Is Revised Upward by 3%
description: Contracts for construction work across the country in 1971 should reach a total of $76.7billion, according to a re vised forecast of building out lays.

title: MARKET REACHES PACT WITH BRITAIN
description: LUXEMBOURG, Wednesday, June 23Britain and the Euro pean Economic Community agreed early today on the terms for British membership in the sixnation trade bloc.

title: F.D.A. Proposes to Put Limit on the Use of Saccharin
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 The Food and Drug Adminis tration proposed today a limit on the use of saccharin, but it said this was unlikely to make any difference to most users of the artificial sweetener.

title: POLES DOWNGRADE MOCZAR IN REGIME
description: WARSAW, June 22Mieczy slaw Moczar, long regarded as a potential rival for the Com munist party leadership, was elected today to a watchdog position that seemed to signal his political downgrading.

title: B.& M. Says Its Operations Can Continue
description: WASHINGTON, June 22  The Interstate Commerce Com mission today asked the bank irupt Boston & Maine Railroad, land, connecting carriers as well as the B. & M. trustees, creditors, shippers and employes what ideas they had to assure continued operation of essential services over the 1,500mile line in view of its critical financial situation.

title: Who Elected The Times?
description: The public reaction to the publica tion of the Pentagon Papers has been overwhelmingly on the side of the newspapers, but there is a strong and vehement view that it is wrong, dan gerous and even criminal for a news paper to assume responsibility for publishing private official documents without the consent of the Govern ment.

title: Baseball Attendance Rises
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 22 (UPI)The National League an nounced today that attendance through June 20 stood at 6,825, 892, up nearly half a millon over the comparable period last year.

title: Senate RollCall Vote On Pullout Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI) Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate, 57 to 42, adopted an amendment to the draft extension bill sponsored by Senator Mike Mansfield stating as United States policy a staged withdrawal of Amer ican troops from Indochina coupled with the return of prisoners over a ninemonth period:

title: NEW TRIAL ORDERED ON STEEL TAX SUIT
description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ordered here yesterday a new trial involving a portion of a multimilliondollar tax refund suit filed by the United States Steel Corporation in 1965.

title: Union Wins Appeal on $1.7Million Fine
description: The United States Court of Appeals here yesterday re versed a decision imposing $1, 736,750 in fines against the Communications Workers of America, its Local 1101 and the local president, Howard Banker, as a result of a work stoppage last January.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FEDDERS SHOWS RECORD EARNINGS
description: The Fedders Corporation real ized the highest quarterly re sults in its history in the three months ended May 31, lifting sales and earnings to records for the nine months ended May, Salvatore Giordano, chairman and president, reported yester day.

title: Penn Central Liens Declared
description: NEW HAVEN, June 22 (AP) A Federal judge today de

title: Poland Releases American Given 5 Years for Spying
description: WARSAW, June 22 Adam Mueller, a Polishborn American sentenced last month to five years in jail for spying, was freed today and sent home.

title: SouthWest Africa Being Split Into Reserves for Different Races
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, June 22  The South African Government is carving up SouthWest Africa into a mosaic of a dozen or so reserves for whites, persons of mixed blood and various black tribes.

title: Excerpts From Arguments in Court of Appeals Here in Government's Case Against The Times
