description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 29 (AP)  Enemy gun ners reportedly continued to shell several fire bases just south of the demilitarized zone and shot down a United States fighterbomber.

title: Notes on People
description: Mrs. Richard M. Nixon was decorated yesterday with the Grand Cross of the Order of the Sun, the highest honor bestowed by Peru.

title: TEAMSTERS ORDERED TO OPEN UNION RULE
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (AP) A Federal judge ordered the International Brotherhood of Teamsters today to give its two million members a wider voice in running union affairs.

title: Week's Fanny May Results Listed
description: WASHINGTON, June 29Mortgage yields rose slightly further at this week's auction of the Federal National Mort gage Association, the association announced today.

title: Nixon and Reagan in Accord on Legal Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June ??  The Nixon Administration and Gov. Ronald Reagan reached tonight an agreement to end their monthslong dispute over the California Rural Legal As sistance Project.

title: BENJAMIN MINTZ
description: Benjamin Mintz, a founder and president of the Trinity Bag and Paper Company, Inc., of this city, died Monday at his home. He was 85 years old and lived at 2 East 61st Street.

title: Bomb Disarmed at Casino
description: YORK BEACH, Me., June 29 (AP)Navy bomb disposal spe cialists today disarmed an ex plosive device containing 10 sticks of dynamite wired to a washing machine timer. The de vice had been discovered at the York Beach amusement casino.

title: Nun Is Told to Face Contempt Charges After Jury Silence
description: A Roman Catholic nun has been ordered to answer Gov ernment charges of contempt in Brooklyn Federal Court this morning. She had refused to testify yesterday before a grand jury that is believed to be linked in some way with the case of the Rev. Philip F. Ber rigan and others awaiting trial in Harrisburg, Pa.

title: U.S. Won't Curb Monitor
description: WASHINGTON, June 29  The Justice Department said today that it would not move to enjoin The Christian Science Monitor from continuing its series on the Vietnam war. The decision followed a brief dis cussion with the editors about the articles not yet published.

title: A Change or Two and It's a Bridal Outfit
description: Tradition? Everybody talks about the bride wanting tradition? I don't really know what they mean by that. To me, the important tradition is that the bride looks beau tiful. That doesn't mean she has to look the way brides looked 50 years ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have been following with great interest the case of the publication of the secret Pentagon documents on Vietnam. The sensitivity of the pub lished material is being debated. In my opinion, the most important Issue in this case is the way this information was obtained. Even if the publication of these historic documents would not severely damage the national in terest, the fraudulent manner of their acquisition creates a very dangerous precedent.

title: SENATE UNIT TO GIVE MINE ELECTION DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (AP)  The Senate Labor Subcom mittee said today that it would turn over to the Justice Depart ment for possible criminal prosecution its investigative records on the United Mine Workers of America election in 1969.

title: 10% IMPROVEMENT SEEN IN SPATE AIR
description: Henry L. Diamond, State Commissioner of Environment al Conservation, said yester day that there had been a 10 per cent improvement in the quality of air across the state in the last 12 months.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Roger Fisher, in his OpEd article of June 22, states, as if any reasonable man would agree, that there is no doubt but that the Government should be able to classify as Secret or Top Secret documents involving the con fidential planning of high military and political strategy. What a colossal conceit.

title: J. Frank Holahan Is Dead at 57; Bank Executive in Westchester
description: ARMONK, N. Y., June 29 J. Frank Holahan, senior vice president of the National Bank of Westchester, died at his home on Sunday. He was 57 years old and lived at 4 Long Pond Court, Windmill Farm.

title: RALLY SHATTERS STOCK LETHARGY
description: The stock market put to gether a surprisingly strong rally yesterday as volume showed a brisk rebound from Monday's sleepwalking session.

title: Suit in Pennsylvania Seeks Refunds on Income Taxes
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 29 (AP)Thacher Longstreth, the Republican candidate for Mayor of Philadelphia, filed a suit yesterday in Common wealth Court to force the state to return all funds collected under the state income tax that the State Supreme Court ruled unconstitutional last week.

title: Dance: Ballet Theater Opens a SixWeek Season
description: Dance's long hot summer is continuing with the Amer ican Ballet Theater, which last night opened a sixweek season at Lincoln Center's New York State Theater. Ballet Theater is always wel come. This season the reper tory looks even more diverse and arresting than; usual, and the company, led by Erik Bruhn, Carla Fracci and Natalia Makarova, is an ex ceptionally strong one.

title: Patman Explains Fee From Broker
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 (AP) A Wall Street firm paid $1,500 to Representative Wright Patman, the chairman of the House Banking and Currency Committee, to give a private talk at a dinner with its top customers and pros pects last week.

title: NIXON VETOES A WORKS PLAN; BARS TAX CUT
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 President Nixon will not seek a tax cut or major increase in spending to stimulate the econ omy and has ruled out the use of Federal controls to influence wages and prices, the Secretary of the Treasury announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The announcement of the treaty between the Soviet Union and the U.A.R. on May 27 came as a surprise to the public and to students of Soviet affairs, in spite of the clear lessons of history. The seriousness of this act is doubled by its appearance in the midst of two processes which are taking place in the area:

title: Volvo Plans Clean Engines
description: PARIS, June 29 (Reuters) The Swedish car manufacturer Volvo has signed an agreement with the French car makers Renault and Peugeot to produce a new range of car engines de signed to reduce pollution, it was announced today.

title: AFFILIATE SETS PULP MILL IN QUEBEC
description: An affiliate of the interna tional Telephone and Telegraph Corporation announced plans yesterday to build a $165mil lion pulp mill near Port Cartier, Quebec, in the heart of the eco nomically depressed eastern portion of the Canadian prov ince.

title: BURTON B. BRACER OF PHOTOCOPY FIRM
description: ROSLYN, L.I., June 29Bur ton B. Brager, senior vice presi dent and treasurer of Saxon Industries, Inc., died today at his home, 51 Pinewood Road here, after a short illness. He was 57 years old.

title: About Motor Sports
description: MONT TREMBLANT, Que bec, June 29  In the same way that one swallow does not make a summer, one de feat for Team McLaren does not make a Can Am series. Even Jackie Stewart recognized that his victory here on Sunday was primarily the result of a bad break suffered by Denis Hulme, the star driver of the McLaren factory team. Hulme was one of dozens of visitors to this resort who were shot down by a highflying 24 hour virus that caused a painful intestinal ailment. not make a Can Am series. Even Jackie Stewart recognized that his victory here on Sunday was primarily the result of a bad break suffered by Denis Hulme, the star driver of the McLaren factory team. Hulme was one of dozens of visitors to this resort who were shot down by a highflying 24 hour virus that caused a painful intestinal ailment.

title: U.S. Ignored Ho Chi Minh Pleas For Aid, Monitor Article Says
description: BOSTON, Wednesday, June 30 (AP)The Christian Science Monitor said today that the United States ignored eight direct appeals for aid fro mthe North Vietnamese Communist leader, Ho Chi Minh, in the first five winter months following the end of World War II.

title: Economic Negativism ...
description: After a long weekend of consultation with his top economic advisers, President Nixon has, regrettably, decided to stand firm on his present policies for reduc ing unemployment and checking inflation.

title: U. S. Gunship Fires on G.L's
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, June 30 (Reuters)  An American helicopter gunship accidentally fired rockets into United States troops Monday, wounding 12, a United States military spokes man said today. The incident happened just before dusk in dense woods 60 miles east of Saigon.

title: Draft Bill Altered Tentatively to Aid Current Freshmen
description: WASHINGTON, June 29 Senate and House conferees on the draft extension bill agreed tentatively today to permit men who were fresh men in college this year to retain their student defer ments, according to sources on the conference commit tee.

title: Joint Force Seizes 66 in 2Month Narcotics Drive
description: The leaders of a joint force of Federal, state and city nar cotics agents said yesterday that they had arrested 66 per sons in a twomonth drive against midlevel distributors of illegal drugs.

title: Merger News
description: PARIS, June 29  One of France's largest department store companies, Au Printemps (where, according to its slogan, you can buy anything with your eyes shut), is to be bought by a Swiss enterprise, further widening foreign participation in French retailing.

title: Merger News
description: LONDON, June 29The Cunard SteamShip Company, Ltd., the moneylosing opera tor of the Queen Elizabeth 2, may be taken over after years of speculation, as to its future.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Dr. Benjamin Miller Dies at 63; Wrote on Medicine for Layman
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 29 (AP)Dr. Benjamin F. Miller, author of Complete, Medical Guide and other medical books for the layman died here yes terday at the age of 63.

title: CBWLHayden Planning A Public Stock Offering
description: CBWLHayden, Stone, Inc., a leading brokerage house, dis closed plans yesterday to go public with a onemillionshare offering of its common stock.

title: Chase, New Band, Makes City Debut
description: Bill Chase, whose trumpet was the power that drove Woody Herman's Herd for several years, has formed an eightpiece group of his own, of which half consists of trumpets that follow his own virtuoso style of playing and the other half of a rock rhythm sectionorgan, gui tar, bass and drums, all elec trified except the drums.

title: Merger News
description: The Hilton Hotels Corpora tion is again increasing its in terest in the International Leisure Corporation, this time to 71 per cent, through yester day's signed preliminary agree ment to purchase 1,355,580 shares from Kirk Kerkorian's Tracy Investment Company. The price for the International Leisure common stock will be the greater of either $13.50 a share, making a total of $18,300,330, or an amount not to exceed $18.24 a share, for a total of $24,725, 780. This will be derived from a multiple of 15 times Inter national Leisure's consolidated net per share for the year end ing Dec. 31, 1971, based on the present 0,577,699 shares out standing.

title: SILVER FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: In heavy trading, silver fu tures prices again dropped sharply yesterday on the Com modity Exchange here.

title: U.S. WOULD WELCOME 5POWER ARMS TALKS
description: GENEVA, June 29  The United States said today that it would welcome disarmament talks in which all nuclear pow ers participated.

title: Saigon Generals Doubt Foe Gains Strength Near DMZ
description: DONGHA, South Vietnam, June 29Two South Vietna mese generals today countered reports of a mounting enemy offensive just south of the de militarized zone by saying there actually were fewer Com munist troops in the area than in previous years.

title: 180 Diplomats and Scientists Convene on Malta to Discuss Peace on the Oceans
description: ATTARD, Malta, June 29 Law and order on the high seas was the principal theme of the opening here today of the sec ond Pacem in Maribus confer ence.
